title: Technicien de Services Antiparasitaires/Pest Control Specialist
description:
Spécialiste en lutte antiparasitaire

 

Rentokil Canada Corporation fait partie de la famille d'entreprises Rentokil, le leader mondial de la lutte antiparasitaire dans plus de 80 pays.  Nous croyons que la réussite de notre entreprise repose sur la possibilité d'offrir aux membres de notre équipe un cheminement de carrière avec un potentiel de croissance et de rémunération. Nous soutenons le développement professionnel et les objectifs personnels de notre équipe motivée par un environnement qui offre une formation continue, des incitations financières à l'excellence et des récompenses supplémentaires pour la croissance du volume d'affaires de Rentokil Canada Corporation. 

 

Description du poste 

 

Les spécialistes de la lutte antiparasitaire de Rentokil Canada Corporation utiliseront les connaissances complètes fournies par leur formation pour assurer un environnement sans parasites là où nos clients vivent et travaillent. Le titulaire de ce poste travaille en étroite collaboration avec chaque client afin d'évaluer ses besoins, d'identifier les problèmes spécifiques de parasites, de choisir et de fournir les services appropriés pour protéger l'endroit et maximiser la satisfaction du client.

 

Responsabilités et fonctions essentielles

 

  • Lutte antiparasitaire - Effectuer des inspections pour déterminer la source de l'activité parasitaire. Sélectionner et élaborer une solution de produits et de services pour remédier à la présence de parasites. Effectuer des traitements antiparasitaires et installer des produits pour créer un environnement sans parasites. Conduire et entretenir les véhicules et l'équipement de service. 
  • Expérience client – Établir des relations avec les clients par un comportement amical, serviable et courtois lors des visites de service. Écouter les besoins des clients, proposer des solutions aux problèmes de parasites et recommander les services appropriés pour résoudre les problèmes des clients.  Identifier et informer les clients des offres de services supplémentaires qui leur apporteront de la valeur. 
  • Apprentissage continu – Se familiariser avec la gamme de produits et de services offerts par Rentokil Canada Corporation grâce à une formation rémunérée. Se tenir au courant des derniers développements, tendances, technologies et règlements dans l'industrie de la lutte antiparasitaire. Participer à la formation fournie par l'employeur sur les nouvelles méthodes, les nouveaux produits et services de la gamme de solutions de lutte antiparasitaire de Rentokil Canada Corporation. Obtenir et maintenir les licences/certificats requis par les règlements fédéraux, provinciaux et locaux financés par Rentokil Canada Corporation.

 

Exigences du poste

 

  • Réussir la vérification des antécédents avant l'embauche
  • Posséder un permis de conduire valide et se soumettre à une vérification du dossier de conduite d'un véhicule à moteur.  
  • Disponible pour travailler du lundi au vendredi et le samedi au besoin

 

Éducation et expérience 

  • Diplôme d'études secondaires ou équivalent
  • Expérience en contact avec la clientèle souhaitée

Autres compétences, qualités et aptitudes 

 

  • Souci du détail avéré
  • Compétences avérées en communication verbale et écrite 
  • Ouvert à l'apprentissage et à l'acquisition de connaissances dans le domaine de la lutte antiparasitaire
  • À l'aise dans des conditions de travail autogérées après une période de formation

 

Pourquoi choisir Rentokil ?

 

Une carrière chez Rentokil est exactement cela - une trajectoire professionnelle pleine d'opportunités.  Nous sommes fiers d'être une équipe de classe mondiale qui récompense les performances élevées.  Nous offrons un salaire compétitif sur un calendrier de rémunération bihebdomadaire et beaucoup de nos rôles offrent des incitations basées sur la performance et la fourniture d'une expérience client exceptionnelle.

 

Vous trouverez ci-dessous des informations sur ce que Rentokil Amérique du Nord a à offrir.  Tous les collègues à temps plein ont droit aux avantages suivants et les collègues à temps partiel ont droit à la plupart des avantages lorsqu'ils satisfont à certains critères.

 

  • Développement professionnel et personnel :
    • Une solide formation rémunérée et un parcours de développement professionnel
    • Possibilité d'évoluer - Nous aimons promouvoir les employés !
    • Avantages fantastiques en matière de remboursement des frais de scolarité et programmes de bourses d'études (pour les collègues à temps plein).
  • Bien-être:
    • Excellents avantages en matière de santé, y compris une assurance médicale, dentaire, oculaire et de la vie.
    • Une assurance invalidité de courte durée exceptionnelle payée par l'entreprise
    • Accès à l'assurance invalidité de longue durée
    • Programme d'aide aux employés qui offre des services tels que des services de conseil gratuits et d'autres avantages
    • Congé de maladie payé par l'entreprise 
  • Épargne et retraite :
    • Plan d'épargne-retraite avec des contributions de contrepartie de l'entreprise très compétitives
    • Option de club d'épargne de fonds de vacances avec fonds de contrepartie de l'entreprise
    • Rabais pour les employés (comprend de nombreuses offres, y compris le service cellulaire/mobile, (et plus)  
  • Équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée :
    • Jours de vacances et jours de maladie
    • Jours fériés payés par l'entreprise et jours fériés flottants.

 

Nous recherchons des personnes qui souhaitent faire la différence là où nos clients vivent et travaillent. Est-ce vous?

 

Rentokil Canada Corporartion est un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances et encourage les femmes, les Autochtones, les personnes handicapées et les membres des minorités visibles à poser leur candidature. Rentokil Steritech s'est engagé à fournir des aménagements aux candidats handicapés tout au long du processus de recrutement, conformément à la Loi de 2005 sur l'accessibilité pour les personnes handicapées de l'Ontario (LAPHO). Assurez-vous de nous informer si vous avez besoin d'une adaptation à n'importe quelle étape du processus de recrutement.

 

Pest Control Specialist

 

Rentokil Canada Corporation is a member of the Rentokil family of companies, the global leader in Pest Control across more than 80 countries.  At Rentokil Canada Corporation, we believe providing our team members a career path with growth and earning potential is essential to our success as an organization. We support our self-motivated team’s professional development and personal goals with an environment that provides ongoing training, financial incentives for excellence, and additional rewards for growing the volume of Rentokil Canada Corporation business.

 

Role Summary

 

Rentokil Canada Corporation’s Pest Control Specialists will use the comprehensive knowledge provided by their training to ensure a pest-free environment where our customers live and work. This position works closely with each customer to assess their needs, identify the specific pest issues, select and deliver the appropriate services to protect the location, and maximize customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

 

  • Pest Control - Conduct inspections to determine the source of pest activity. Select and build a solution of products and services to remedy pest presence. Perform pest treatments and install products to create a pest-free environment. Operate and maintain service vehicles and equipment.
  • Customer Experience – Build customer relationships through friendly, helpful, and courteous behavior during service visits. Listen to customer needs and offer solutions to pest issues and recommend appropriate services to resolve customer concerns.  Identify and alert customers of additional service offerings that will provide value to the customer.
  • Continuous Learning – Become knowledgeable in the array of available Rentokil Canada Corporation products and services through provided, paid training. Stay current on the latest developments, trends, technology, and regulations in the pest control industry. Participate in employer-provided training on new methods, products, and services in the Rentokil Canada Corporation range of pest control solutions. Obtain and maintain licenses/certificates required by federal, provincial, and local regulations funded by Rentokil Canada Corporation

 

Position Requirements

  • Successfully meet pre-employment background screen
  • Possess a valid driver’s license and undergo motor vehicle driving record check
  • Available to work Monday-Friday and Saturdays as needed

Education & Experience

  • High school diploma or GED
  • Customer-facing experience preferred

Other Skills, Attributes, and Abilities

  • Demonstrated attention to detail
  • Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills
  • Open to learning and becoming knowledgeable in the area of pest control
  • Comfortable with self-directed working conditions after a training period

 

Why Choose Rentokil?

 

A career with Rentokil is exactly that - a professional trajectory filled with opportunity.  We pride ourselves on being a world class team that rewards high performance.  We offer competitive pay on a bi-weekly pay schedule and many of our roles offer incentives based on performance and providing exceptional customer experience.

 

Below you'll find information about some of what Rentokil North America has to offer.  All Full-Time Colleagues qualify for the following and Part-Time Colleagues qualify for most benefits when they meet certain criteria.

 

  • Professional and Personal Growth:
    • Robust Paid Training & Professional Development Path
    • Opportunity to grow - We love to promote from within!
    • Fantastic Tuition Reimbursement benefits & Scholarship Programs (for FT Colleagues)

 

  • Wellness:
    • Excellent Health benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
    • Outstanding Company-Paid Short Term Disability
    • Access to Long-Term Disability Insurance
    • Employee Assistance Program that offers services such as free counseling services and other benefits
    • Company-paid sick time

 

  • Savings & Retirement:
    • Retirement Savings plan with highly-competitive company-matching contributions
    • Holiday Savings Club option with company-matching funds
    • Employee Discounts (includes many offerings, including cellular/mobile service, (and more)

 

  • Work-Life Balance:
    • Vacation Days & sick days
    • Company-Paid Holidays & Floating Holidays

 

We are looking for individuals who want to make a difference where our customers live and work.  Is that you? 

Qualifications

Want to hear Colleague feedback on what it's like to be on our team? Check us out on Glassdoor! Glassdoor - Rentokil North America

title: Service Technician - Pest Control
description:
Do you describe yourself as someone who enjoys paying attention to details? Are you looking to build your career in an exciting new industry and passionate about customer service? If so, we are looking for people just like you.

We have a fast-growing company in Coquitlam that is looking for Pest Control Specialists whose looking for talent to work in Vancouver or Abbotsford. Your goal as a Pest Control Specialist is to protect people by creating and maintaining a pest-free environment.

Schedule:

8-hour shifts
Monday to Friday depending on the service schedule.


Advantages
World-class training of the latest industry best practices
Incentives for excellent customer retention and upselling to current customers
Great benefits - Medical, Dental, and Vision, Employer-matched RRSP
Paid vacation, holidays, and personal days
Company vehicle & uniforms provided
Short and long-term disability
Life Insurance

Responsibilities
Provide superior pest management services to our clients
Conduct inspections to determine the source of activity and provide written explanations and recommendations
Assist in sales of products and additional services to current customers
Stay current on the latest developments, trends, and regulations in the pest control industry
Operate and maintain service vehicle and equipment
On-call weekend shifts on occasion.

Qualifications
High school diploma and/or College diploma
At least 2 years of customer service experience
Strong attention to detail and willingness to learn
Available to work Monday-Friday and Saturdays as needed
Ability to obtain and maintain licenses/certificates as required by Federal, provincial and local regulations
Must pass pre-employment background screen
Must possess a valid driver’s license and provide a current drivers' abstract

Summary
Three easy ways to apply:

1. E-mail resume to Sky: sky.shergill@randstad.ca
2. Apply online: http://www.randstad.ca


Randstad Canada is committed to building a diverse workforce reflective of the diversity of Canada. As a result, we promote employment equity and encourage candidates, especially those who identify as a woman, an Aboriginal person, a person with a disability or a member of a visible minority group, and any others who may contribute to the diversification of our workforce, to apply.

For all feedback on equity and accommodation needs, please contact your local Randstad Canada Branch.

Randstad Canada is committed to fostering a workforce reflective of all peoples of Canada. As a result, we are committed to developing and implementing strategies to increase the equity, diversity and inclusion within the workplace by examining our internal policies, practices, and systems throughout the entire lifecycle of our workforce, including its recruitment, retention and advancement for all employees. In addition to our deep commitment to respecting human rights, we are dedicated to positive actions to affect change to ensure everyone has full participation in the workforce free from any barriers, systemic or otherwise, especially equity-seeking groups who are usually underrepresented in Canada's workforce, including those who identify as women or non-binary/gender non-conforming; Indigenous or Aboriginal Peoples; persons with disabilities (visible or invisible) and; members of visible minorities, racialized groups and the LGBTQ2+ community.

Randstad Canada is committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible workplace for all its candidates and employees by supporting their accessibility and accommodation needs throughout the employment lifecycle. We ask that all job applications please identify any accommodation requirements by sending an email to

accessibility@randstad.ca

to ensure their ability to fully participate in the interview process.

title: Lawn Spray Technician
description:
We began with a single vision shared between 10 brothers. Originally, we opened our doors as Sunshine Grounds Care in 1987. As time passed and more brothers joined in the project, it became a widely recognized brand built on the principles of excellent workmanship, customer satisfaction, and real care. We abide by the simple values outlined in our company acronym "C.A.R.E.", which are: Customers first, Attitude, Respect, and Enjoy life in the process!

As Lawn & Ornamental Spray Technician, you are responsible for properly mixing and applying herbicides, fungicides, or insecticides to trees, lawns, shrubs, or ornamental plants. The spray technician is required to have a state license for pesticide application. This position is to contribute to the day-to-day operations of Ground Guys.  Exemplifying our code of values, you show respect and courtesy to all customers and employees.  

You are self-motivated, thrive in fast-moving environments, and can manage time to effectively meet deadlines. You have proven communication skills with supervisors, employees, and customers and can effectively manage a variety of situations on a day-to-day basis.


Specific Requirements:

  • The spray technician is required to have a state license for pesticide application.  Also includes a test on proper use and disposal of pesticides.
  • Maintains required chemical application records and standards.
  • Responsible for mixing chemicals and water in sprayer tanks and applying the pesticides in the needed amount, which may depend on weather conditions and application variables. 
  • Responsible for operating motors or machinery on some spray equipment, as well as may need to use a variety of vehicles for transportation over larger areas. 
  • Responsible for cleaning and servicing their vehicle, all tools, and machinery. 
  • Analyzes and reports through our systems daily.

title: Weed Identification and Vegetation Management Technician (Herbicide Applicator)
description:
Company Description

Intricate Vegetation is hiring a Weed Identification and Vegetation Management Technician based out of our Sherwood Park office. This position is a seasonal position that will run from May to September 2022, with the potential to work through to October.

The principal role of the Weed Identification and Vegetation Management Technician will be the weed identification and the removal/controlling of selected vegetation on oilfield leases, pipelines, and right-of-ways, mentoring junior staff, as well as maintaining accurate records while ensuring a high commitment to safety, top performance, and quality service.

Job Description

Key Responsibilities

  • Identification and reporting of prohibited and noxious weeds
  • Vegetation control including herbicide spraying application and/or manual removal
  • Assess each client site to determine a custom vegetation control plan/approach to best meet our clients’ specific needs
  • Prepare accurate reports and maintain records using tablets
  • Mentor and provide onsite leadership to junior field technicians; provide on-the-job training to junior staff in areas of safety, vegetation control, weed identification, and herbicide application, etc.
  • Work closely with operations to establish clear understanding of workers’ responsibilities, performance expectations, and specific duties
  • Demonstrate leadership and active participation in all phases of health, safety and environmental management systems
  • Conduct pre-job hazard identification surveys prior to commencement of work
  • Repair and maintain equipment as required

Expectations

  • In depth knowledge of Weed Control Act and prohibited and noxious weeds in Alberta
  • Highly motivated to provide mentorship and help foster a company culture that encourages top performance and promotes a healthy and safe workplace
  • Participate in all required training courses as required
  • Ability to commit to seasonal shift work (May to September with the potential to stay on until October) with a flexible work schedule and variable hours
  • Ability to work overtime as required
  • Ability to travel for the purposes of work
Qualifications

Experience

  • Must have current Alberta Industrial Applicator Certification
  • Minimum experience of two (2) years 
  • Supervisory experience is an asset
  • First Aid and H2S required, other site-specific safety tickets considered an asset
  • Must have a minimum class five (5) drivers license with clean drivers abstract
  • Must be 21 years of age or older
  • Must be able to pass Drug and Alcohol test in compliance with our Drug & Alcohol Policy

Physical Requirements

  • Long shifts working outdoors according to weather conditions
  • Required to drive to and around work sites
  • Potential exposure to work site hazards while performing HSE related tasks
  • Must be able to lift up to 50lbs

title: Fumigator
description:
Company Description

About SGS:

Make an impact with SGS! With more than 97,000 employees and 2,600 offices and laboratories across the world, SGS is a silent force working hard behind the scenes to deliver quality and integrity to businesses across nine industries. As the world’s leader in providing inspection, verification, testing and certification services, Forbes ranked the SGS Group as one of the world’s top multinationals and one of the world’s most innovative companies. The Dow Jones Sustainability Index has also recognized the SGS Group for its sustainability processes. In Canada, SGS employs over 2,000 team members across 70 locations.

Job Description

This position will perform a variety of container, tarp and vessel fumigations in a safe manner following SGS guidelines and SOP’s.

•    Performing container fumigations, pre-shipment and quarantine
•    Generating documents for vessel and quarantined container fumigations
•    Accomplish inspection requirements according to the scope of job
•    Establish constant communication with operations
•    Keep full and accurate logs
•    Follow safety procedures
•    Maintain a professional manner while performing his/her duties
•    Delivers samples to laboratory for analysis
•    Support any other duties that may be assigned by his/her supervisor
•    Follow all requirements according to any government regulations pertaining to fumigation services.
•    May be assigned and coordinate special or ad hoc projects as needed (i.e. training for grain grading, lab analysis, H&S related tasks such as field risk assessments, etc)
 

Qualifications

  • Must obtain a valid training and licenses in the following: Pesticide Applicator Licence, Confined Space Training Level 1, First Aid Level 1, WHMIS, and Transportation of Dangerous Goods.
  • Must be able to read, understand and follow work instructions in a safe, accurate and timely manner.
  • Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. 
  • Detail orientated and has the ability to take accurate notes.
  • Candidates must be proficient in using various type of computer software (Word, Excel, etc.).
  • Proven ability to manage and coordinate multiple projects in a fast-paced, highly professional environment.
  • Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills including grammar and composition.
  • Ability to work well with others & independently.
  • Proven time management skills and a strong attention to detail.
  • Works well under pressure.
  • Extended hours may be required from time to time.
  • Possess and maintains a valid driver’s license.
  • Travel to other SGS locations may be required from time to time.
  • Ensures full compliance with the company’s Health & Safety, Code of Integrity, and Professional Conduct policies.

 



Additional Information

  • Our Company operates on a 24/7 basis. The position requires to work on rotating shifts ranging from 8 - 12 hours in length on a schedule of days, afternoons, nights and weekends. 
  • This position requires you to have a valid driver’s license along with a vehicle to transport samples. 

SGS Canada is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to achieving greater accessibility by providing accommodation for people with disabilities during our hiring process. Accommodations are available on request for qualified candidates during each stage of the recruitment process.

Please note that candidates applying for Canadian job openings should be authorized to work in Canada.

description:
EcoTick Solutions is Hiring!

We at eco tick solutions have an incredible opportunity for the right candidates to work at our Eco friendly Natural yard spray company! We are seeking two  Lawn Spray Technicians to join our team. We work in residential areas, commercial properties and cottages.

As a team we share a common purpose in providing an essential service that improves the lives of our community. We are providing a new solution to chemical spraying and helping to save the planet one lawn at a time! We believe that our employees play an important role in making this happen and we are proud of our role in helping to save the environment and we want you to be too,

  • Be flexible and accept that change will happen in the day.
  • Superior listening skills.
  • Must be able to work well with office staff and technicians.
  • Self motivated and able to work independently with minimal direct supervision.

title: PESTICIDE SPECIALIST (6-Month Contract)
description:
Job Description:

Exciting things are happening at the City of Brampton. Take a look at what employees are working on related to our Term of Council Priorities moving us forward towards The Brampton 2040 Vision.

 

 

PESTICIDE SPECIALIST (6-Month Contract)

 

 

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

 

Reporting to the Supervisor, Horticulture, assists in the administration of the contracted weed spray program and uses various means to control insects, diseases, weeds and rodents in parks and on turf, trees and shrubs.

 

  • Assists with the administration of the contracted weed spray program; informs contractors of areas to be sprayed, oversees work performed; contributes to specifications and variances in conjunction with Foreperson.
  • Schedules City staff to monitor contracted sprays and to post warning signs; records and verifies hours worked.
  • Performs Pest Management i.e. insect and disease control for trees and shrubs, turf weed control and parkland rodent control.
  • Acts on public complaints, recommendations from supervisory and other parks staff.
  • Inspects site, determines ownership, recommends, selects and implements application/control methods and equipment. Informs initiator of follow-up action.
  • Trains employees in safe, effective use of pesticides; prepares course materials, schedules classes; conducts sessions.
  • Fertilizes trees and maintains list of trees requiring fertilizing, calculates rates and amounts to apply, operates sprayer, mixes and injects fertilizer.
  • Maintains up-to-date knowledge of pest management developments, and recommends changes in policies, procedures, or products/equipment.
  • Participates in Chemical Review Committee; provides input regarding chemical-related legislation, recommendations, etc.
  • Assists in the co-ordination of pesticide projects: maintains adequate inventory of pesticides and distributes to staff; schedules projects and estimates requirements for upcoming season. Co-ordinates pesticide exposure testing for staff.
  • Performs snow removal and maintenance; plows, salts and sands, walkways, parking lots, etc.
  • Performs additional similar and related duties as assigned.

 

SELECTION CRITERIA:

 

  • Completion of Grade 12 or equivalent
  • Over two (2) years and up to four (4) years experience in an urban forestry or horticulture environment
  • Landscape Exterminator Licence from the Ministry of Environment
  • Industrial Vegetation Exterminator Licence for pesticides from the Ministry of Environment
  • A valid non-probationary Ontario class DZ licence
  • Knowledge of common plant diseases, pests and agricultural chemicals.
  • Ability to work outside in all weather conditions
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills with an emphasis on customer service
  • Ability to work independently or as part of a team

   

** Various tests and/or exams may be administered as part of the selection criteria.

 

 

Job status:  Contract
Job Type:     Union

Hourly rate: $31.95

 

Applications must be received by July 1, 2022

 

Alternate formats will be provided upon request.  

   

 

If this opportunity matches your interest and experience, please apply online by clicking the button above, by July 1, 2022  and complete the attached questionnaire. We thank all applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted. The successful candidate(s) will be required, as a condition of employment, to execute a written employment agreement. A Criminal Record Search will be required of the successful candidate at their own expense to verify the absence of a criminal record for which a pardon has not been granted.

 

Preference will be given to students that have a permanent residency in Brampton.

 

As part of the application process, applicants will be invited to complete a self identification survey. The survey is voluntary. Participation in the survey will have no impact on hiring decisions.   All information collected is confidential and will not be shared with the hiring manager. The surveys will be anonymized and will be kept separate from applicant or employee files, such that the individuals who completed the surveys will not be identifiable.   The results of the survey will assist in the analysis of disaggregated metrics for organizational planning purposes and our commitment to advance and foster diversity, equity, and inclusion. The City may use anonymized data to produce aggregate reports for internal or external use.

 

Please be advised, the City of Brampton uses email to communicate with their applicants for open job competitions. It is the applicantâ€™s responsibility to include an updated email address that is checked daily and accepts emails from unknown users. As we send time sensitive correspondence via email (i.e. testing bookings, interview dates), it is imperative that applicants check their email regularly. If we do not hear back from applicants, we will assume that you are no longer interested in the Job Competition and your application will be removed from the Competition.

 

The City of Brampton is an equal opportunity employer.   We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments.   If you are contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise the Human Resources Division of any accommodations needed to ensure you have access to a fair and equitable process. Any information received relating to accommodation will be addressed confidentially.

title: Seasonal Pest Control Specialist
description:
Seasonal Pest Control Specialist

 

Rentokil Canada Corporation is a member of the Rentokil family of companies, the global leader in Pest Control across more than 80 countries.  At Rentokil Canada Corporation, we believe providing our team members a career path with growth and earning potential is essential to our success as an organization. We support our self-motivated team’s professional development and personal goals with an environment that provides ongoing training, financial incentives for excellence, and additional rewards for growing the volume of Rentokil Canada Corporation business.

 

Role Summary

 

Rentokil Canada Corporation’s Pest Control Specialists will use the comprehensive knowledge provided by their training to ensure a pest-free environment where our customers live and work. This position works closely with each customer to assess their needs, identify the specific pest issues, select and deliver the appropriate services to protect the location, and maximize customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

  • Pest Control - Conduct inspections to determine the source of pest activity. Select and build a solution of products and services to remedy pest presence. Perform pest treatments and install products to create a pest-free environment. Operate and maintain service vehicles and equipment.
  • Customer Experience – Build customer relationships through friendly, helpful, and courteous behavior during service visits. Listen to customer needs, offer solutions to pest issues, and recommend appropriate services to resolve customer concerns. Identify and alert customers of additional service offerings that will provide value to the customer.
  • Continuous Learning – Become knowledgeable in the array of available Rentokil Canada Corporation products and services through provided, paid training. Stay current on the latest developments, trends, technology, and regulations in the pest control industry. Participate in employer-provided training on new methods, products, and services in the Rentokil Canada Corporation range of pest control solutions. Obtain and maintain licenses/certificates required by federal, provincial, and local regulations funded by Rentokil Canada Corporation

Position Requirements

  • Successfully meet pre-employment background screen
  • Possess a valid driver’s license and undergo motor vehicle driving record check
  • Available to work Monday-Friday and Saturdays as needed

Education & Experience

  • High school diploma or GED
  • Customer-facing experience preferred

Other Skills, Attributes, and Abilities

  • Demonstrated attention to detail
  • Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills
  • Open to learning and becoming knowledgeable in the area of pest control
  • Comfortable with self-directed working conditions after a training period

Why Choose Rentokil?

 

A career with Rentokil is exactly that - a professional trajectory filled with opportunity.  We pride ourselves on being a world class team that rewards high performance.  We offer competitive pay on a bi-weekly pay schedule and many of our roles offer incentives based on performance and providing exceptional customer experience.

 

Below you will find information about some of what Rentokil North America has to offer.  All Full-Time Colleagues qualify for the following and Part-Time Colleagues qualify for most benefits when they meet certain criteria.

 

Professional and Personal Growth:

  • Robust Paid Training & Professional Development Path
  • Opportunity to grow - We love to promote from within!

We are looking for individuals who want to make a difference where our customers live and work.  Is that you? 

Qualifications

Want to hear Colleague feedback on what it's like to be on our team? Check us out on Glassdoor! Glassdoor - Rentokil North America

 

 

Rentokil Canada Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and encourages women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities to apply for positions. Rentokil Canada Corporation is committed to provide accommodations to applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Please ensure to inform us if you require accommodation during any stage of the recruitment process.

title: Fumigator
description:
Description

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES
Inspect and fumigate vessels, silos and containers.
Provide clear concise reports in a timely manner.
Assist in daily / weekly activities, inventory management, paperwork, calibration of equipment, etc.
Fumigation equipment retrieval in various ports and commerce's.
Maintain a professional manner while performing his/her duties.
Support any other duties that may be assigned by his/her supervisor.
Achieve client satisfaction by maintaining production and specified turnaround targets.
Follow all requirements according to any government regulations pertaining to fumigation services.
May be assigned and coordinate special or ad hoc projects as needed (i.e. training for grain grading, lab analysis, H&S related tasks such as field risk assessments, etc.)
Other duties related to the above, as assigned
Carrying out all responsibilities in a supportive manner with total adherence to: The Company's Health, Safety and Environmental Policies and Procedures, Quality Management System, Compliance and Ethics Policies, Vision, Mission and Strategy, and exercises good judgment, common sense, and diplomacy.

3. SUPERVISION RECEIVED
The position reports directly to the General Manager - Fumigation Canada, regardless of reporting lines, the position will cooperate with Branch, Operations, Area, and Regional departments in dealing with assigned responsibilities.

Qualifications

Must be willing to train and pass the Pesticide Applicator License, Confined Space Training Level 1, First Aid Level 1, WHMIS, and Transportation of Dangerous Goods.
Must be reliable.
Able to do significant travel within Canada.
Able to work at heights and climb.
Must be able to read, understand and follow work instructions in a safe, accurate and timely manner.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.

title: Pest Control Specialist - Rentokil (Canada)
description:
Pest Control Specialist

 

Rentokil Canada Corporation is a member of the Rentokil family of companies, the global leader in Pest Control across more than 80 countries.  At Rentokil Canada Corporation, we believe providing our team members a career path with growth and earning potential is essential to our success as an organization. We support our self-motivated team’s professional development and personal goals with an environment that provides ongoing training, financial incentives for excellence, and additional rewards for growing the volume of Rentokil Canada Corporation business.

 

Role Summary

 

Rentokil Canada Corporation’s Pest Control Specialists will use the comprehensive knowledge provided by their training to ensure a pest-free environment where our customers live and work. This position works closely with each customer to assess their needs, identify the specific pest issues, select and deliver the appropriate services to protect the location, and maximize customer satisfaction.

Responsibilities

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

 

  • Pest Control - Conduct inspections to determine the source of pest activity. Select and build a solution of products and services to remedy pest presence. Perform pest treatments and install products to create a pest-free environment. Operate and maintain service vehicles and equipment.
  • Customer Experience – Build customer relationships through friendly, helpful, and courteous behavior during service visits. Listen to customer needs and offer solutions to pest issues and recommend appropriate services to resolve customer concerns.  Identify and alert customers of additional service offerings that will provide value to the customer.
  • Continuous Learning – Become knowledgeable in the array of available Rentokil Canada Corporation products and services through provided, paid training. Stay current on the latest developments, trends, technology, and regulations in the pest control industry. Participate in employer-provided training on new methods, products, and services in the Rentokil Canada Corporation range of pest control solutions. Obtain and maintain licenses/certificates required by federal, provincial, and local regulations funded by Rentokil Canada Corporation

 

Position Requirements

  • Successfully meet pre-employment background screen
  • Possess a valid driver’s license and undergo motor vehicle driving record check
  • Available to work Monday-Friday and Saturdays as needed

Education & Experience

  • High school diploma or GED
  • Customer-facing experience preferred

Other Skills, Attributes, and Abilities

  • Demonstrated attention to detail
  • Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills
  • Open to learning and becoming knowledgeable in the area of pest control
  • Comfortable with self-directed working conditions after a training period

 

Why Choose Rentokil?

 

A career with Rentokil is exactly that - a professional trajectory filled with opportunity.  We pride ourselves on being a world class team that rewards high performance.  We offer competitive pay on a bi-weekly pay schedule and many of our roles offer incentives based on performance and providing exceptional customer experience.

 

Below you'll find information about some of what Rentokil North America has to offer.  All Full-Time Colleagues qualify for the following and Part-Time Colleagues qualify for most benefits when they meet certain criteria.

 

  • Professional and Personal Growth:
    • Robust Paid Training & Professional Development Path
    • Opportunity to grow - We love to promote from within!
    • Fantastic Tuition Reimbursement benefits & Scholarship Programs (for FT Colleagues)

 

  • Wellness:
    • Excellent Health benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance
    • Outstanding Company-Paid Short Term Disability
    • Access to Long-Term Disability Insurance
    • Employee Assistance Program that offers services such as free counseling services and other benefits
    • Company-paid sick time

 

  • Savings & Retirement:
    • Retirement Savings plan with highly-competitive company-matching contributions
    • Holiday Savings Club option with company-matching funds
    • Employee Discounts (includes many offerings, including cellular/mobile service, (and more)

 

  • Work-Life Balance:
    • Vacation Days & sick days
    • Company-Paid Holidays & Floating Holidays

 

We are looking for individuals who want to make a difference where our customers live and work.  Is that you?

title: Technicien de Services Antiparasitaires/Pest Control Specialist
description:
Overview

 

Spécialiste en lutte antiparasitaire

 

Rentokil Canada Corporation fait partie de la famille d'entreprises Rentokil, le leader mondial de la lutte antiparasitaire dans plus de 80 pays.  Nous croyons que la réussite de notre entreprise repose sur la possibilité d'offrir aux membres de notre équipe un cheminement de carrière avec un potentiel de croissance et de rémunération. Nous soutenons le développement professionnel et les objectifs personnels de notre équipe motivée par un environnement qui offre une formation continue, des incitations financières à l'excellence et des récompenses supplémentaires pour la croissance du volume d'affaires de Rentokil Canada Corporation. 

 

Description du poste 

 

Les spécialistes de la lutte antiparasitaire de Rentokil Canada Corporation utiliseront les connaissances complètes fournies par leur formation pour assurer un environnement sans parasites là où nos clients vivent et travaillent. Le titulaire de ce poste travaille en étroite collaboration avec chaque client afin d'évaluer ses besoins, d'identifier les problèmes spécifiques de parasites, de choisir et de fournir les services appropriés pour protéger l'endroit et maximiser la satisfaction du client.

 

Responsabilités et fonctions essentielles

 

  • Lutte antiparasitaire - Effectuer des inspections pour déterminer la source de l'activité parasitaire. Sélectionner et élaborer une solution de produits et de services pour remédier à la présence de parasites. Effectuer des traitements antiparasitaires et installer des produits pour créer un environnement sans parasites. Conduire et entretenir les véhicules et l'équipement de service. 
  • Expérience client – Établir des relations avec les clients par un comportement amical, serviable et courtois lors des visites de service. Écouter les besoins des clients, proposer des solutions aux problèmes de parasites et recommander les services appropriés pour résoudre les problèmes des clients.  Identifier et informer les clients des offres de services supplémentaires qui leur apporteront de la valeur. 
  • Apprentissage continu – Se familiariser avec la gamme de produits et de services offerts par Rentokil Canada Corporation grâce à une formation rémunérée. Se tenir au courant des derniers développements, tendances, technologies et règlements dans l'industrie de la lutte antiparasitaire. Participer à la formation fournie par l'employeur sur les nouvelles méthodes, les nouveaux produits et services de la gamme de solutions de lutte antiparasitaire de Rentokil Canada Corporation. Obtenir et maintenir les licences/certificats requis par les règlements fédéraux, provinciaux et locaux financés par Rentokil Canada Corporation.

 

Exigences du poste

 

  • Réussir la vérification des antécédents avant l'embauche
  • Posséder un permis de conduire valide et se soumettre à une vérification du dossier de conduite d'un véhicule à moteur.  
  • Disponible pour travailler du lundi au vendredi et le samedi au besoin

 

Éducation et expérience 

  • Diplôme d'études secondaires ou équivalent
  • Expérience en contact avec la clientèle souhaitée

Autres compétences, qualités et aptitudes 

 

  • Souci du détail avéré
  • Compétences avérées en communication verbale et écrite 
  • Ouvert à l'apprentissage et à l'acquisition de connaissances dans le domaine de la lutte antiparasitaire
  • À l'aise dans des conditions de travail autogérées après une période de formation

 

Pourquoi choisir Rentokil ?

 

Une carrière chez Rentokil est exactement cela - une trajectoire professionnelle pleine d'opportunités.  Nous sommes fiers d'être une équipe de classe mondiale qui récompense les performances élevées.  Nous offrons un salaire compétitif sur un calendrier de rémunération bihebdomadaire et beaucoup de nos rôles offrent des incitations basées sur la performance et la fourniture d'une expérience client exceptionnelle.

 

Vous trouverez ci-dessous des informations sur ce que Rentokil Amérique du Nord a à offrir.  Tous les collègues à temps plein ont droit aux avantages suivants et les collègues à temps partiel ont droit à la plupart des avantages lorsqu'ils satisfont à certains critères.

 

  • Développement professionnel et personnel :
    • Une solide formation rémunérée et un parcours de développement professionnel
    • Possibilité d'évoluer - Nous aimons promouvoir les employés !
    • Avantages fantastiques en matière de remboursement des frais de scolarité et programmes de bourses d'études (pour les collègues à temps plein).
  • Bien-être:
    • Excellents avantages en matière de santé, y compris une assurance médicale, dentaire, oculaire et de la vie.
    • Une assurance invalidité de courte durée exceptionnelle payée par l'entreprise
    • Accès à l'assurance invalidité de longue durée
    • Programme d'aide aux employés qui offre des services tels que des services de conseil gratuits et d'autres avantages
    • Congé de maladie payé par l'entreprise 
  • Épargne et retraite :
    • Plan d'épargne-retraite avec des contributions de contrepartie de l'entreprise très compétitives
    • Option de club d'épargne de fonds de vacances avec fonds de contrepartie de l'entreprise
    • Rabais pour les employés (comprend de nombreuses offres, y compris le service cellulaire/mobile, (et plus)  
  • Équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée :
    • Jours de vacances et jours de maladie
    • Jours fériés payés par l'entreprise et jours fériés flottants.

 

Nous recherchons des personnes qui souhaitent faire la différence là où nos clients vivent et travaillent. Est-ce vous?

 

Rentokil Canada Corporartion est un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances et encourage les femmes, les Autochtones, les personnes handicapées et les membres des minorités visibles à poser leur candidature. Rentokil Steritech s'est engagé à fournir des aménagements aux candidats handicapés tout au long du processus de recrutement, conformément à la Loi de 2005 sur l'accessibilité pour les personnes handicapées de l'Ontario (LAPHO). Assurez-vous de nous informer si vous avez besoin d'une adaptation à n'importe quelle étape du processus de recrutement.

title: Controller - Hospitality
description:
Hospitality Controller

Built on a foundation of integrity, innovation, excellence and an enduring commitment to community, Argus Properties is one of British Columbia's great companies. Based in Kelowna, and celebrating its 50th year, Argus owns, manages and develops a multi-disciplined real estate portfolio, including industrial, retail, office, residential and hotel properties.

The hospitality division has partnerships with many of the world’s most recognized hotel brands, such as Hilton and Marriott. The hospitality division manages Argus’ five hotels and two Marinas; the Four Points by Sheraton, Hampton Inn & Suites, Hotel Resort - Hotel Eldorado, Manteo Resort, Home2 Suites by Hilton, and the Okanagan and Manteo Marina.

The Hospitality Controller will lead and manage the hospitality accounting team. Reporting directly to the Director of Finance, this position is responsible for the daily accounting transactions, and responsible for the success of the hospitality accounting team. You will also be responsible for reviewing and providing continuous improvement of controls and processes, while ensuring successful month and year-end reporting. You will be working with the Director of Hospitality to develop processes, budgets, and maintain accountability across the platform.

The Hospitality Controller has the ability to manage a team in empowering, and accomplishing projects while resolving day-to-day issues that may arise. This person is professional, highly organized and very detail oriented. The ideal candidate has the ability to prioritize and complete work efficiently in a timely manner, and possesses strong problem solving skills, with the ability to analyze, provide analytical reasoning and clear communication to other departments.

Job Responsibilities
  • In charge of all daily accounting activities and internal control procedures;
  • Responsible in overseeing team to produce budgets and reconciliations for the hospitality division on a timely basis;
  • Lead and manage a team of 5 accountants, plus coordinate with hotel on-site accounting staff;
  • Provide mentorship and training to the team;
  • Monthly internal financial reporting including expense analysis, payroll, and consolidated financials;
  • Responsible for preparation of annual financial working papers for all companies; ensure financials and corporate tax returns are completed on time;
  • Review and approve GST returns;
  • Review and approve online payments;
  • Work with, and take direction from the Senior Leadership Team;
  • All other accounting related duties.

Qualifications
  • Certified Hospitality Accountant Executive;
  • 5 years’ experience in a senior hospitality position;
  • CPA designation
  • Prior hospitality experience with multiple brands;
  • Knowledge of Aptech’s PVNG an asset;
  • Experience with Squirrel, and Opera (PMS)
  • Experience leading a team;
  • Strong work ethic; able to work productively, equally with minimum supervision and cooperatively and collaboratively in a team.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Canada’s leading manufacturer and distributor of specialty raw materials in Canada has retained our services to source a Corporate Controller. They have multiple plants and distribution centers in Canada and are experiencing immense growth during and prior to Covid.


MANDATE:

Reporting to the CFO, the Corporate Controller is responsible for the company's financial processes, ensures adherence with financial and budgetary controls, policies and procedures and coordinates year-end audits annual budgeting and corporate tax compliance.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Directs the preparation and consolidation of all internal and external financial reporting required for a mid to large size company
  • Plans, directs and coordinates accounting functions such as month-end and year-end closing processes and tax filings
  • Reviews and approves monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements, corporate tax returns, and monitors cash flow
  • Oversees corporate and sales tax compliance, government audits and tax planning, including monitoring corporate tax structure and strategy to ensure tax optimization
  • Oversees the preparation of consolidated cash flow forecasts, cash management and treasury functions, and review of cash flow and budgets
  • Coordinates year-end audits with external auditors and bank authorities, as well as filing of statutory reports
  • Coordinates the corporate-wide budgeting process
  • Ensures compliance with accounting standards and regulatory requirements
  • Assesses current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvements and implementing new processes
  • Evaluates accounting and internal controls, in collaboration with the internal auditor
  • Developing strong relationships with bankers, vendors, and external customers to manage projects, ensuring smooth operations of the company
  • Reviews financial results with operational management
  • Works with senior management on due diligence in connection with potential corporate acquisitions
  • Works with operation to ensure compliance with corporate inventory Management policies
  • Participates in ERP system upgrades, as required


KEY REQUIREMENTS:


  • The successful candidate must have a CPA/CMA/CA designation with 5+ years of proven Corporate Controller experience with a privately owned company.
  • Experience with large scale ERPs such as JDE, SAP, etc.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to interface with internal and external stakeholders as well as interact with all levels of company personnel is a must.
  • Oversight of Head Office consolidation of financial reports
  • Managing revenue from $150 Million and up
  • Experience with Canada financials as well as understanding of internationally recognized Financial standards such as IFRS, GAAP, ASPE etc



IDEAL PERSONALITY:


You are an engaging LEADER and an effective communicator, capable of articulating concepts to enhance the knowledge of others. You incorporate an appropriate balance of risk management and business needs. You bring clarity & focus to your work. You are able to identify issues requiring escalation. You build strong partnerships to ensure goals are achieved. You are an autonomous self-starter with increased effectiveness for adverse benchmarks.

title: Controller
description:
SeasonedPros.ca is Canada's Recruiter for Seasoned Professionals. We provide executive recruiting services, management recruiting, mentors and advisors for organizations of all sizes. With one free profile, be eligible for project, part-time, full-time, advisory, mentorship and volunteering opportunities and receive content specifically tailored for you. Our client, a Nova Scotia based transportation company offering flatbed, dry van, container, rail operations and a full-service warehouse operation, is hiring a Corporate Controller for a 12-15 month contract starting June 1, 2022. This company is a best-in-class carrier utilizing industry leading technology, is Recognized as an Employer of Choice by the THRSCA and offers a hybrid office and work-from-home environment in HRM, Nova Scotia with an emphasis on appropriate communication and use of technology.

• Managing the process for business planning, budgeting, and forecasting.

• Liaise with external auditors at year-end and be the point of contact for all audit related activities.

• Lead the annual forecasting process with other members of senior management team, including operations, sales, finance, safety, and recruiting.

• Prepare month-end key performance indicator reports related to sales, profitability, and cash management.

• Participate in strategy sessions with senior leadership group.

• Work with department managers to identify and implement technology solutions to drive operational efficiency.

• File monthly HST and quarterly Carbon tax reporting.


The ideal candidate will possess:

• Undergraduate degree in business or finance plus CPA, CMA or CA designation

• Advanced skills with MS Excel and MS suite of products

• Experience with Truckmate would be an asset but not required

• 3-5 years experience overseeing the entire accounting function in an organization

• Experience with contribution margin accounting is an asset

• Experience in the transportation industry is an asset

• A continuous improvement focus, with a track record of opportunity identification and implementation

• Excellent communication skills

title: Controller
description:
Established in Vancouver, Canada in 2008, ToursByLocals is the provider of choice for private tours around the world. With a presence in 190 countries, ToursByLocals enriches the travel experience by connecting travelers with our network of almost 4500 guide partners. We’ve been selected in 2019 and 2020 as one of BC’s Top Employers and Canada's Top Small and Medium Employer.


Mission

The Controller oversees the accounting and financial operations of the company. Delivers accurate and timely information to drive operational, tactical and strategic decisions, and makes key recommendations on decisions relating to budgeting, reporting, investing and risk management.



Responsibilities


  • Planning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functions and cash management.
  • Managing the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data necessary for an accurate accounting of consolidated business results.
  • Coordinating and preparing internal and external financial statements.
  • Coordinating activities of external auditors.
  • Providing management with information vital to the decision-making process.
  • Managing the budget process.
  • Assessing current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvement and implementing new processes.
  • Evaluating accounting and internal control systems.
  • Evaluating the effectiveness of accounting software and supporting databases, as needed.
  • Developing and monitoring business performance metrics.
  • Overseeing regulatory reporting, frequently including tax planning and compliance.
  • Provide leadership, support and direction to Accounting team members in all aspects of their role. Facilitate opportunities for Accounting team members to develop and grow in their skills and responsibilities.



Knowledge/Education


  • Bachelor's degree in accounting or business administration, or equivalent business experience and 7+ years of progressively responsible experience for a major company or division of a large corporation. CPA designation.
  • Familiar with Quickbooks.
  • Skilled with Excel and MS Office




Experience


  • Proven working experience as a controller.
  • 7+ years of accounting and finance experience.
  • Full-cycle accounting experience, including month-end process and financial statement creation.
  • Experience working in a multi-currency and multinational organization.
  • Experience with implementing internal controls.
  • Experience managing a team of accountants.
  • Deep understanding of GAAP and ASPE principles.


What we offer

In addition to an excellent compensation package, we offer extended Health and Dental insurance for you and your family (with Sun Life), flexible work location (you can work from home or from our office located in Downtown Vancouver), flexible paid time off, life insurance and flexible schedules.

title: CORPORATE CONTROLLER
description:
Do you want to work for a company that is an industry leader? Are you hungry to advance into a Controller role that includes not only finance, but also strategic thinking and leadership? We believe in exceptional performance, integrity of work and above all trust. If you do as well, look no further. CANNEPP Boiler Room Technologies is looking for a Corporate to join our growing team!


  • Monday to Friday
  • Full-time
  • Permanent


WHO WE ARE


CANNEPP is all about boilers. We’re all about big boilers and small boilers and everything in between. If there is a conversation about boilers we want to be a part of it. If there is a project involving boilers we want to be involved. If there is a facility that already has boilers we want to be a member of the team having responsibility for them. If there is a problem with boilers we want to be part of the solution. If boilers need to be repaired we want to fix them. If boilers need to be installed we want to be part of the construction team. If boilers need to be more efficient we want to modify or replace them.


At CANNEPP, we believe industry leadership is established through exceptional performance, integrity of work and above all trust. We take tremendous pride in being the single source in British Columbia, Yukon and the Northwest Territories with comprehensive boiler room applications and solutions.


  • We will educate and train our employees and others who share in our passion and vision. 
  • We will provide leadership when it comes to participation and membership in like-minded associations and organizations. 
  • We will build relationships with manufacturers, suppliers, designers, facility owners/operators and contractors. 
  • We will be committed to the highest standards of safety, ethics and performance. 
  • We will be forward thinking and creative when it comes to leading edge technology and best business practices. 
  • We will pursue excellence. 


THE ROLE YOU PLAY


The Corporate Controller is responsible for directing, coordinating, and maintaining the financial and accounting functions at CANNEPP Boiler Room Technologies, driving operational efficiency strategies and improvements. The Corporate Controller also provides strategic financial and accounting oversight and leadership, including managing and directing all accounting, finance, treasury, risk management and administrative functions, to ensure accurate financial reporting and maximum business value to shareholders.


Accounting and Finance


  • Plan, direct and coordinate accounting policies, operations, procedures and internal controls across all divisions of the company, designing and implementing new processes, as needed
  • Ensure management and shareholders are provided with meaningful information to optimize profitability
  • Perform full cycle accounting, overseeing A/P, A/R, G/L and Payroll and all areas of operations
  • Ensure the accounting of revenues and expenses are performed in an accurate, efficient and timely manner
  • Monitor day-to-day banking and maintain company cash-flows
  • Oversee company’s credit facilities, managing credit requirements and costs
  • Maintain strong relationships with creditor and bankers
  • Oversee regulatory reporting, including tax planning, compliance, and corporate year end
  • Coordinate and prepare internal and external financial reports and financial statements
  • Manage the interaction with external auditors and accountants including maintaining a strong relationship and coordinating activities and information exchange
  • Oversee the setting of budgets for all capital projects
  • Oversee the regular forecasting of capital project budgets and issuance of reports to key stakeholders
  • Maintain inventory system, reviewing, analyzing and verifying inventory and WIP
  • Develop activity based or standard costing around inventory, as needed
  • Manage capital asset budgets and work with management to set asset optimization strategies
  • Collaborate with management and staff to establish pricing strategies


Strategic Planning 


  • Partner with management and ownership to refine business strategies, increasing profitability and operational efficiencies
  • Provide input into the strategic direction of the company and its short term and long-term business plans, including supervising and preparing comprehensive current and long-term (3-5 year) financial plans and budgets
  • Collaborate with management in building the business by evaluating the feasibility of projects that are supported by a sound business case
  • Analyze the profitability of company divisions and provide recommendations for improvement
  • Develop and monitor business performance metrics (KPIs)
  • Guide financial decisions by establishing, monitoring, and enforcing policies and procedures
  • Lead and supervise team members on accounting, reporting, internal controls, budgeting and other financial matters
  • Provide counsel to leadership team on all business and financial matters

Risk Management


  • Identify and manage business risks and insurance requirements
  • Coordinate with corporate lawyers to manage legal actions including legal disputes, corporate minute book, and corporate filings
  • Collaborate with management in contract negotiations and contract development, generating meetings and agendas, creating agreements and legal contracts as necessary
  • Evaluate the effectiveness of accounting software and supporting databases, collaborating with management on technology decisions, and overseeing financial systems implementation and upgrades


Human Resources


  • Manage direct reports including providing supervision over their duties and coordinating performance reviews


WHAT YOU WILL BRING

  • Completion of Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Accounting or Finance and CPA designation
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience as a manager in a financial related field, with knowledge in accounting procedures including full cycle accounting and financials and employment standards
  • Strong technical skills and proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Sage Business Vision and Google Suite
  • Adept at building and leading strong teams
  • Ability to communicate effectively at all levels, maintaining effective and collaborative relationships
  • Possess excellent quantitative skills with high attention to detail
  • Be open to change, adapting to changing conditions, processes, and systems
  • Positive attitude and ability to work with minimal supervision

WHAT WE OFFER


We are a people-first company and take pride in the culture we have built over our 30 years in business.


We offer:


  • Flexibility in work arrangements
  • A competitive salary range (dependent on experience) at $100,000 to $115,000 per year
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards package includes a competitive benefits package, three-weeks’ vacation to start
  • Extensive training, a variety of work, opportunities to grow skills and experience, and career advancement opportunities within the company
  • A work environment that promotes learning, growth, collaboration, and fun


If this role speaks to you, please apply today! We look forward to hearing from you. 


We thank all those who apply. Only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Would you like to join Canadian operations of an internationally listed company that offers excellent work life balance and hybrid WFH/in office work pattern? Are you interested in leading an established accounting team and playing a key role in their development and execution of deadlines?


We are recruiting on behalf of a mature, stable mid-size company located in the West GTA and easily accessible from major highways. They are currently seeking an experienced Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA-CA or CPA) with Controllership or similar experience.


Key responsibilities and oversight:

  • Oversee an established team responsible for various accounting functions/operations
  • Ensure an accurate and timely completion of consolidated month end, quarter end and year end deliverables
  • Develop strong internal and external relationships including training, coaching and development of staff
  • Lead the annual planning and budgeting processes and ongoing evaluation of key performance metrics
  • Co-ordinate the annual external audit process and quarterly reviews
  • Monitor technical accounting changes and, when appropriate, adjust reporting/accounting processes accordingly
  • Partner with Department Managers to develop and maintain internal controls across the company
  • Support growth initiatives through productive operational relationships


The company is offering an excellent compensation package for this level including an attractive base salary, annual bonus program, long term incentives and RSP matching. Full remuneration details will be disclosed to all candidates under consideration.


The successful candidate will possess the following:

  • Designated Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA-CA or CPA), qualified at a major accounting firm
  • 6+ years of progressive relevant post designation experience including a minimum of 4 years directly supervising others
  • Practical knowledge of accounting/reporting in an IFRS or USGAAP environment is an asset
  • Proven experience working with a major ERP system is preferred
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills


All interested candidates should submit their résumé for consideration by applying directly to this posting or via email at careers@cdnconsultants.ca -- one of our consultants will contact you directly. We welcome the résumé of any CPA-CA or CPA currently seeking new opportunities.


Why partner with us?

Canadian Accounting Consultants is a specialized recruiting firm focused exclusively on the placement of CPAs in the Greater Toronto Area. With over 10 years in business and a team of experienced recruitment professionals, we are the preferred firm for Chartered Professional Accountants looking to for valuable career advice and progressive opportunities with top employers. Your Partner in Search Success ®


Stay informed of all postings by following our company page on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/company/canadian-accounting-consultants

title: Corporate Controller
description:
About the Role:

We are looking for a Corporate Controller to expand our growing Finance Team! Reporting to the VP Finance, you will be responsible for overseeing the Finance and Accounting functions of the organization while working closely with our other departments, as well as analyzing and reporting on the financial performance of an expanding global organization.


Success in the role requires someone with strong month and year end process experience, solid leadership skills to lead and mentor a growing team, and a capable communicator that can help make complex financial information understandable to non-financial stakeholders.


About Nettwerk

Nettwerk Music Group is a full-service artist development and music intellectual property brand builder with a history spanning over 35 years. Nettwerk operates a global organization with offices in major cities around the world and an infrastructure to match. At Nettwerk we pride ourselves on our ability to anticipate shifts in consumer behavior and to effectively leverage technology in order to place great music in the hands of fans. We’re looking for inspired, skilled and energetic people to help us deliver on that promise.


We work with over 180 clients across a variety of genres, with an overarching philosophy to help inspiring artists grow their careers and realize their creative vision.


Role Responsibilities:

  • Lead, support, and assist the finance team on a day-to-day basis, including mentoring more junior staff and growing the team to meet the growing needs of the business;
  • Managing the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data necessary for an accurate accounting of consolidated business results on a monthly and annual basis;
  • Planning, directing, and coordinating all accounting operational functions;
  • Coordinate and prepare internal and external financial statements;
  • Managing the year end audit process including communications with auditors and delegating to the Finance team;
  • Prepare and review information needed for Canadian and US annual tax compliance;
  • Assist in evaluating tax planning opportunities and transfer pricing policies;
  • Assess current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvement, and implementing new processes;
  • Assist in establishing and maintaining best in class accounting internal control systems;
  • Manage the annual budgeting process by working across the organization; monitor performance to budget to ensure corporate fiscal responsibility;
  • Develop, implement & manage financial and cash strategies, monitor, and forecast cash balances;
  • Ensure that the company complies with all legal and regulatory requirements;
  • Assist with the preparation of applications to government and private sector corporate funding programs (cultural properties development grants);
  • Coordinate insurance needs
  • Assist the VP Finance with scaling the department, including:
  • Manage the transition of function currency for the parent company;
  • Research, and implement automation of certain manual transactional procedures – including leveraging the capabilities of NetSuite


What you Bring:

  • Strong leadership skills and abilities to encourage and provide mentorship to the team;
  • Excellent communication skills and experience working with multi-department leads;
  • Experience building financial budgets (internal/external stakeholders) and an attention to detail that ensures assumptions are supported.
  • Communicate openly and actively with the management team to evaluate business needs, eliminate obstacles, provide resources, and reset direction;
  • A commitment to learn, apply, champion, and enrich Nettwerk's Values, Business and People Leadership principles;
  • An ability to set best practices standards for processes, and controls to achieve efficiencies where possible;
  • The ability to set clear objectives, add value to the company as a whole, and inspire the team to reach their highest potential;
  • A proactive and entrepreneurial sense of urgency and ability to prioritize important work.


Proven and best-in-class skills, education, and/or applicable certifications in:

  • Chartered Professional Accountant - CPA designation
  • Knowledge of US generally accepted accounting principles (US GAAP)
  • Expert Excel skills and knowledge of MS office products
  • Strong knowledge of NetSuite and its FP&A tools
  • Proven, recent experience in a similar controllership type of role
  • A deep understanding for the music industry considered an asset
  • Strong business and strategic acumen, technical and communication skills


Please send a cover letter and resume to jobs @ nettwerk.com, with the subject line: Controller Role. We thank all applicants; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Nettwerk is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Controller
description:
Colpitts Developments Ltd., based in Fredericton, is a well established real estate development company specializing in property management, acquisitions and new construction of residential and commercial properties. Our company continues to grow and has a need for a leader for our accounting team. We are looking for a self motivated, highly organized individual to fill the role of Controller with our company.

The position will report to the Chief Financial Officer and will be responsible for financial reporting, management of cash flow, budgeting, and supervision of financial support staff.

The successful candidate will be a dynamic individual who possesses a strong accounting background with exceptional organizational, interpersonal, communication and leadership skills and can work effectively in a team environment. The candidate should also have excellent computer skills and a proven track record of achieving deadlines and management of multiple projects.

A person with a professional accounting designation or candidates with commensurate work experience will be ideal candidates for this position.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
HYBRID Working Schedule

About Us

STRIVE is a Vancouver based recruitment firm offering recruitment solutions in the specialist areas of Accounting Finance, Construction, Corporate Administration and Operations. We are passionate about recruitment at STRIVE and commit to offering an upfront, genuine and consultative approach to everything we do-which is a big reason as to why we have been successful.

THE ROLE

STRIVE have partnered with a leading real-estate investment company as they look to recruit a Corporate Controller. They are a growing business that have made $3b+ of acquisitions in the last 5 years.

They are seeking a Corporate Controller for the Vancouver office. This is a really exciting role for someone who has a keen interest in Real Estate.

As the Corporate Controller you will be responsible for the corporate accounting and reporting function to support strategic growth plans. In this role, you will lead a high performing team with duties that include corporate reporting, financial reporting, and leading the audit process.

Responsibilities
  • Detailed reviews of monthly corporate financial statements packages on both legal entity and consolidated levels including variance analysis, and balance sheet account reconciliations
  • Oversee the production of corporate accounting reports, analysis and audits (internal and external)
  • Accountability for institutional reporting requirements
  • Manage the year-end process including co-ordination with external accounting firms, preparation of working papers, tax workbooks, and other requirements
  • Complete the annual and forecasted corporate entity budgets
  • Preparation of monthly and quarterly strategic meeting presentations and materials by the finance team
  • Development and implementation of corporate accounting policies and procedures
  • Investigation and resolution of variances in reporting, internal controls, and general accounting
  • Analyze business processes and identify weaknesses and opportunities for improvement. Provide and implement recommendations
  • Finance Business Partner – analyze and explain key performance metrics to senior leadership team. Utilize financial data and analysis to support key decision-making processes
  • Treasury management for the corporate entities
  • Review quarterly lender reporting for the corporate entities and assist with the management of the property level lender compliance
  • Collaborate with other departments to understand new transactions impacting the corporate entities

Skills & Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in related field and a CPA designation
  • 3+ years’ experience in a leadership role within accounting and finance
  • Well-rounded financial reporting experience - IFRS and US GAAP
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple demands and tight deadlines
  • Strong analytical, and problem-solving abilities
  • Strong leadership and people management skills
