title: Controller
description:
We are looking for a Controller to join our fund!

Looking for a satisfying opportunity to do well by doing good? Amplitude is a rapidly scaling investment company that is building Canada’s most promising healthcare companies in Precision Medicine. We have offices in Montreal, Toronto, and Vancouver and are seeking double-bottom line driven individuals to join us on our mission.

We are seeking an individual who can start as a Controller, working with our VP of Finance, to support our current and future funds as well as working to start new companies. You will be expected to become deeply involved in the operation of the Funds throughout the investment cycle.

We are an energetic, diverse team and we consider each other family, guaranteeing a work environment where every day is rewarding, with new challenges and learning opportunities.


Responsibilities

  • Manage Amplitude’s accounting records and account payables with our third-party bookkeepers
  • Assist in month-end, quarterly and year-end process and reporting for Amplitude portfolio companies
  • Oversee document management
  • Document processes to strengthen financial controls
  • Build, monitor and report annual and five-year budget
  • Support Amplitude investment team during financial due diligence;
  • Assist newly created portfolio companies in establishing their finance functions
  • Work in conjunction with other Amplitude team members in implementing legal, tax, accounting and governance structures to accelerate companies’ ability to raise Series A financing


Required experience

  • 5-7 years minimum of relevant work experience performing and supporting accounting functions; ideally for a high-velocity startup company or an investment fund, or experience in a Big 4 accounting firm or large corporation setting
  • Solid understanding of basic accounting principles
  • Strong skills with MS Excel and online tools
  • A CPA designation
  • Experience with Xero or a similar cloud accounting platform.
  • A genuine interest in venture capital and/or healthcare.

 

Bonus points if you have:

  • 1-2 years of work experience in venture capital, investment banking, management consulting, healthcare delivery, healthcare start-up, or a large healthcare company.
  • Experience working at / with biotechnology companies
  • Experience in fund accounting
  • Bilingual (English and French)

 

This position will be a perfect fit if you have/are:

  • Outstanding computer skills - must be highly proficient in Excel, PowerPoint and must be able to quickly learn internal Amplitude data management systems
  • Ability to work under pressure, manage time effectively, deal with abstract concepts and multi-task.
  • Collaborative nature, highly motivated person that seeks out additional responsibility and productivity improvements
  • Organized, thorough, and detail oriented
  • Ability to prepare financial forecasts and pro-forma financial statements.
  • Good oral and written communication skills and demonstrated ability to produce and deliver clear and concise oral and written presentations.

 

Compensation / Location / Start Date:

  • Highly competitive compensation
  • Comprehensive healthcare benefits
  • Based in one of Montreal, Toronto, or Vancouver (can be virtual)
  • Flexible start date

 

Up for the challenge?

Send your resume, and a short summary of why you want to work with us to jobs@amplitudevc.com.


Amplitude is committed to building a diverse team. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, including but not limited to race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, and age.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Req #2115

 Friday, May 6, 2022


ONroute Corporate Controller

Looking for an experienced Corporate Controller who thrives working in a collaborative, fast-paced, hospitality industry. Reporting to the VP Finance, the Corporate Controller will manage and direct the organization’s Finance and Accounting functions for all entities within the corporate group. This includes directing and maintaining accounting records and systems, managing, and coordinating the preparation of consolidated financial statements, including financial analysis and management reporting, and reporting to Lenders (Covenants) and other external stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Oversee daily operations of Finance Department, including setting priorities and ensuring all key department objectives are delivered in a timely manner.
  • Direct and coordinate the Group’s financial reporting activities, annual financial statements and supporting schedules for all entities within the corporate group.
  • Direct and coordinate monthly Management financial reporting activities, including analysis and commentary.
  • Monitor, analyze and communicate operating results against budgets and prior reporting periods.
  • Direct and coordinate external financial audit engagements for all entities within the corporate group.
  • Direct and coordinate all tax compliance, reporting and governance activities, including HST, Income Tax and engagement with CRA
  • Coordinate and direct all other lender, government and regulatory audits.
  • Work with Treasury Manager to support covenant calculations and projections, as well as compliance certifications.
  • Manage Finance project initiatives, using best practices for project management, including process improvements, financial analysis of corporate investment initiatives (including capital investments), as well as financial evaluation of product and market development investment opportunities.
  • Ensure compliance with all federal, provincial, and other regulatory bodies for all corporate jurisdictions.
  • Actively support, collaborate, and liaise with the Procurement and Operations teams
  • Review key financial processes and evaluate the effectiveness of internal controls and business procedures identifying and implementing recommendations for improvement.

Qualifications

  • 5+ years related experience in a similar role [required]
  • Previous experience working in a fast-paced QSR, medium-sized private equity owned (an asset)
  • Bachelors’ degree in accounting or related financial discipline - required
  • Recognized professional accounting designation required – CPA (CA, CMA, CGA)
  • Excellent leadership, communication, problem-solving and organizational skills are essential
  • Advanced knowledge in Microsoft applications
  • A proven, systematic and organized approach to multi-tasking
  • Experience in NetSuite would be an asset

ONroute is committed to providing accessible hiring and employment practices that comply with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (the "AODA") and the Human Rights Code of Ontario. If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter or on the electronic application form.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Future Electronics is a worldwide leader in the electronic components distribution industry. Headquartered in Montreal and operating in 169 locations in 44 countries around the world, Future Electronics has earned an impressive reputation for providing outstanding service and developing efficient, comprehensive global supply chain solutions.


Position Overview

Working very closely with the CFO and Executive VP, the Corporate Controller will be responsible for the implementation and execution of corporate strategies and initiatives in the day-to-day operations regarding information systems capabilities, procedures and policies for Accounting, Budgeting and Financial Analysis.


Responsibilities

  • Establish, maintain and enforce accounting policies and procedures that conform to financial accounting standards
  • Lead the worldwide audit process
  • Implement and insure the effectiveness of internal controls
  • Ensure the timely and accurate reporting of all financial data and financial reports required by senior management
  • Ensure the operating efficiencies of administrative departments such as Accounting, Payroll and Accounts Payable
  • Prepare financial statements
  • Ensure the accuracy and efficiency of the various information systems used to process transactions or manage the business
  • Prepare all special analysis required by the Executive VP & CFO
  • Responsible for the annual budget and quarterly forecast process
  • Involved in tax planning and tax issues with the Executive VP & CFO and the VP – Worldwide Taxation
  • Participate in the development, implementation and application of the company’s policies including but not limited to travel expenses, car allowances, commission plans and cost control measures
  • Manage and analyze operations using the activity-based costing approach
  • Drive special projects as needed
  • Manage the financial analysis and the due diligence process relating to potential acquisition
  • Participate in the Canadian and US pension plan committees


Qualifications and Experience

  • Minimum 20 years’ experience
  • Multinational company experience
  • Chartered accountant professional designation (CPA)
  • Possess in-depth knowledge of all accounting, finance and treasury functions
  • Knowledge of MS Office


Competencies (Skills & Behaviors)

  • Detail-oriented
  • Highly analytical yet practical
  • Multi-tasker
  • Possess a sense of urgency
  • Takes initiative
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Solid communicator

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Role Overview:


Reporting to the Director, Finance, in the Vancouver office, the Corporate Controller will be responsible the financial reporting, budgeting, and internal controls of for the Company. This position will play a key role in the development and execution of the Company’s financial reporting requirements under IFRS under the TSX, NYSE, and ASX, and be based in the Vancouver office.



Position Responsibilities (including but not limited to):


  • Provide accurate, timely financial and project reporting under IFRS as required under the public Company requirements per the TSX, NYSE, and ASX.
  • Co-ordinate the timely preparation and filing of the consolidated financial statements, note disclosures, MD&A, and legal entity financial statements.
  • Be responsible for Corporate and Project budget to actual analysis and preparation of the monthly reporting package.
  • Ensure strong financial governance through the adherence and compliance of internal controls, and maintain a strong internal control environment under SOX.
  • Assist with the annual Budget process and work with departments to ensure alignment.
  • Define and lead fit for purpose process improvements and coordinating the implementation of any changes identified.
  • Manage cashflow and treasury function of the Company.
  • Manage tax planning and liaise with tax advisors on strategy and opportunities for improvement.
  • Assist and coach team members on accounting, transactions, reorganizations, and the preparation of financial reports as required.



Education & Experience:


  • CPA Accounting Designation, or equivalent, and post-secondary degree in relevant field.
  • 6+ years of progressive finance and accounting experience.
  • Strong accounting expertise in IFRS and experience working in a SOX compliant environment.
  • Proven team leadership, able to work with team members at all levels to meet deliverable deadlines.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel), Quickbooks, and SAP BusinessByDesign an asset.
  • Excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to adapt quickly in a fast paced environment and flexible to take on a multitude of tasks.
  • Mining industry or large capital project experience is required

title: Controller
description:
Financial Controller

Come join our small but mighty team in our brand new commercial bakery, located in Toronto. We are looking for a self-starter, organized and tenacious individual who wants an opportunity to expand their career in leadership for food production industry.


Financial and Accounting Duties:

  • Manages and builds financial planning, budgets, audits, government assistance and all other financial obligations to ensure allocated funds are spent appropriately
  • Subject matter expert in SAP/HANA, our inventory management system and able to utilize system consistently and to its full capacity
  • Conducts investigations for financial expenditure, clerical errors, extra charges etc.
  • Develop and implement cost-saving, compensation and process improvement strategies for finance/accounting for long-term gains
  • Submit final approvals for all compensation strategies
  • Report various financial donations, initiatives, policies, internal decisions and procedures to CFO
  • Directs the development of the budget process for all departments with CFO, and monitors the results of the implementation
  • Establishes and maintains relationships with all managers to ensure collective goals of cost savings and downtime are reached
  • Monitors the local legislative climate, interpreting the impact of legislation on the business and operating to comply with laws and regulations
  • Directs and maintains positive employee relations within department
  • Oversees accounts receivables and payables and steps in to assist when required
  • Establishes and monitors goals and objectives for the business
  • Conducts cash flow, bank balances, expense reports, cheque requests, donor receipts, cheque batches, payroll deposits, priority payables and other financial requirements
  • Conducts various year-end and month-end activities such as schedules for reviews, audits, write-off memos, payroll, balance sheets, journal entries and debt covenants in long term debt financing
  • Completes cash-on-hand summary, accounts receivables analysis, and management-fees spreadsheets
  • Responds to government queries and external agencies
  • Engage in weekly team meetings to review accounting processes
  • Payments for various taxes such as provincial sales and service, non-residence, and property.
  • Bank positions adjustments and bank reconciliations
  • Update monthly tax expenses, depreciation expenses and budgeted capital expenditures.
  • Other duties as required


Teamwork and Leadership

  • Supervises, coaches, and motivates team
  • Reviews departments’ working hours and Time & Attendance weekly for submission to payroll
  • Approves or denies any employee initiated time off requests and coordinates with Human Resources and Accounting Administrator for processing
  • Responsible for overseeing labour trends, performance management and hiring practices while working alongside human resources when required
  • Directs management development plans and provides on-going feedback to achieve desired business results
  • Leads by example for all safety standards, food safety standards, compliance measures, respect in the workplace and other facets of corrective action
  • Train management on new and legacy initiatives to effectively run office protocols accurately


Qualifications

  • Minimum of 6+ years of experience and a Bachelors Degree in Accounting or equivalent
  • Minimum 2+ years of managerial experience
  • Must have exceptional experience using SAP/HANA
  • Background in food manufacturing or other highly regulated industry a strong asset
  • Demonstrated ability to working through problems effectively and efficiently
  • Strong initiative to pursue opportunities as they are identified
  • Talent for conveying information and ideas clearly and objectively
  • Ability to develop relationships
  • Highly organized, able to manage time effectively and is comfortable working with tight deadlines
  • High degree of flexibility and ability to deal with a growing and changing environment
  • Great working knowledge of Excel
  • Accounting designation an asset
  • Previous experience working with HACCP and GFSI (SQF or BRC) is an asset
  • Proficient with computers and various software packages
  • Strong attention to detail and a quick learner

title: Regulatory Reporting Controller
description:
Job Description:

Bank of America is one of the world's largest financial institutions, serving individual consumers, small and middle market businesses and large corporations with a full range of banking, investing, asset management and other financial and risk-management products and services. Following the acquisition of Merrill Lynch on January 1, 2009, Bank of America is among the world's leading wealth management companies and is a global leader in corporate and investment banking and trading across a broad range of asset classes serving corporations, governments, institutions and individuals around the world. In Canada, Bank of America has a strong market position on which to continue to build, as well as a clear commitment to the market.

Job Description

This position will be reporting to the Director, Senior Legal Entity Controller.

Responsibilities

Specific areas of responsibilities include, but not limited to:
  • Responsible for completing the monthly, quarterly and annual regulatory reports for IIROC & OSFI
  • Complete daily & weekly capital reporting
  • Perform variance analysis and prepare monthly reports for senior management
  • Responsible for maintaining an effective control framework over respective functions
  • Development of in-depth knowledge/expertise of both broker dealer and foreign bank branch regulatory rules and interpretations
  • Participate/assist with regulator queries
  • Participate in various audits – external, regulatory, corporate, compliance
  • Prepare and/or assist in month-end journal entry processing
  • Preparation of monthly reconciliation of assigned balance sheet accounts and investigate/remediate issues
  • Complete ad-hoc reporting/analysis or projects
Qualifications
  • Recognized accounting designation
  • Previous financial services industry/capital markets knowledge preferred
  • Must have a combination of strong quantitative/analytical skills, attention to detail and client focus
  • Strategic and creative thinking; distinguished written and oral communications skills
  • Assertiveness, initiative, leadership, strong work ethic, team focus
  • Ability to learn quickly and take on new responsibilities
  • Ability to work well under pressure
  • Well organized/able to meet deadlines
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word essential
What Bank Of America Offers

Bank of America embodies a culture that extends from how we think, to how we behave, and to how we measure performance. By achieving excellence - in everything we do, every time we do it - we deliver the full value of Bank of America for our clients, our shareholders and our employees.

Bank of America places a high value on talent and on maintaining a culture defined by meritocracy. For these reasons, it is deeply committed to professional development, opportunity and accountability at all levels of the organization.

Bank of America is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Bank of America encourages applications from all qualified individuals. Applicants with disabilities may notify us of any accommodations needed to support your participation in the recruitment process. We wish to thank all applicants for their interest and effort in applying. Please be aware that only candidates selected for interviews will be contacted for this position.

title: Corporate Controller
company: TALINKO - Recrutement de Cadres | Executive Search
description:
About GROUPE ALLIÉES

Our client, Le GROUPE ALLIÉES, is looking for a recognized CPA professional to join their management team as Corporate Controller.

This privately owned manufacturing company in the metal transformation sector counts among its client's world-class companies such as Volvo, Lion Electric, Schneider, Michelin, Micro Bird (Girardin), and Novabus, among others.

In operation for more than 80 years, it has nearly 200 employees, supporting 4 business units and 2 trademarks: Entreprises Alliées, North Star Métal, Métal Sigma, JR Inox, ITOUCH, et Luminaires Alliées. The two main business units are in Saint-Jean-sur-Richelieu and Ville St-Laurent.

In addition to being a leader in its field, the company has an ambitious growth plan that would lead it to multiply its size and notoriety in various sectors through an integrator and gas pedal vision. The company is also pursuing growth opportunities through strategic acquisitions.

You will have the chance to join this dynamic, ambitious, innovative, and high-performance company.

Culture and Values

Le GROUPE ALLIÉES offers an exceptional work environment based on listening, sharing knowledge, and valuing individual and collective success.

The management team is committed to consolidating the growth of the group around strong values centred on teamwork, respect, dedication, development, and the importance of the human being. It is with great pride that the Group and its employees contribute to supporting its clients in the realization of their projects

The company is "family-friendly" and ensures a good work-life balance. It also offers a unique learning opportunity to its team with customized training, and to evolve in a pleasant work environment.

Brief Description

Reporting to the Executive Director of Finance, the Corporate Controller will be responsible for various mandates such as the processing of financial statements throughout the year, financial auditing, cost price analysis, supervision of various processes, financial reporting, and improvement of existing work methods.

Main Tasks And Responsibilities

Please note that the position requires occasional travel to Ville Saint-Laurent but is based primarily in St-Jean-sur-Richelieu. More specifically, the Corporate Controller will be responsible for the following activities:
  • Produce monthly financial statements for the entire Group
  • Prepare and present the monthly and annual financial statements of the company to the management team
  • Ensure effective control procedures and monitoring of results (dashboards and performance indicators)
  • Perform the complete accounting cycle for the company, its management company, and its trust
  • Ensure the preparation of the annual budget and financial forecasts for the (4) Group companies
  • Provide cost analysis for the Group's companies and actively participate in the improvement of the processes and systems in place
  • Promote and implement performance indicators (KPI) and participate in the analysis of potential acquisitions
  • Maximize the use of technology to ensure the simplification and improvement of processes
Required Qualifications

Training
  • Degree in business administration
  • Recognized accounting designation (CPA)
Professional Experience
  • 5 to 10 years of experience
  • Experience in a manufacturing company
  • Experience in costing/project cost tracking
  • Experience with ERP systems (asset)
  • Experience in an accounting firm (asset)
Skills
  • Good expertise in accounting, financial statements, and auditing
  • Ability to work with various systems
  • Proficiency in Windows and MS Office environment
Abilities
  • Professional proactivity
  • Collaborative team player
  • Willing to progress
  • Good communicator in both written and oral form
Among the challenges of the position
  • Contribute to the growth of the company
  • Multi-site environment
  • Improvement of technological processes
  • Strategic succession position with access to career opportunities more quickly
Why join GROUPE ALLIÉES
  • Working for a group of organizations with over 80 years of experience
  • Very competitive salary conditions & innovative fringe benefits
  • Fast-growing company in a weatherproof industry
  • Dynamic and passionate management team
  • Strategic feeder position with access to faster career opportunities
  • Recognition for loyal and dedicated employees
  • Ongoing training and skills development
  • Family-friendly jobs with a good work-life balance
  • Values promoted by the company
  • Safe, pleasant, and diversified work environment
Follow TALINKO on LinkedInand visit our Website

Only the people selected for an interview will be contacted. We support the principle of employment equity.

TALINKO is a recruitment firm of middle and senior executives also offering support in the recruitment of members of the board of directors or advisory committee. We operate in different business sectors.

title: Responsable Comptabilité / Accounting Manager
description:
Directement rattaché(e) à la Directrice administrative et financière, vous serez en charge de superviser et coordonner toutes les tâches relatives à la comptabilité et la paie. Vous aurez sous votre responsabilité 2 personnes qui vous reporteront directement. Vous serez également en étroite collaboration avec le responsable du contrôle de gestion.


MISSIONS :


Missions comptables :

  • S’assurer de la bonne tenue comptable des entités de la Division en contribuant plus particulièrement aux activités suivantes :
  • Superviser l’enregistrement des opérations comptables ;
  • Planifier et contrôler les règlement fournisseurs ;
  • Coordonner l’émission des factures clients et assurer un suivi des encaissements ;
  • Planifier les tâches associées et la production des états financiers.
  • Suivre les réalisations de trésorerie, préparer le reporting mensuel siège et établir les prévisions.
  • Préparer et traiter les déclarations de TPS et TVQ.
  • Préparer les états financiers internes trimestriels et en diffuser la diffusion au siège en France :
  • Vérifier la cohérence des postes de bilan et des comptes courants ;
  • Valider la bonne comptabilisation des écarts de change ;
  • Saisir dans le logiciel VISION les liasses fiscales.
  • Coordonner les activités avec les vérificateurs externes.
  • Préparer les informations et documents nécessaires à la préparation des déclarations fiscales.
  • Fournir à la Direction de l’information essentielle à la prise de décision.
  • Analyser les activités de comptabilité actuelles, offrir des recommandations afin de les améliorer et mettre en place de nouveaux processus.
  • Suivre les obligations réglementaires.


Missions paie :

  • Superviser les activités reliées au traitement de la paie pour tous les collaborateurs locaux et expatriés de nos filiales au Canada selon le calendrier de paie :
  • Actualisation et suivi des différentes banques (vacances, maladie, temps cumulé, etc.) et assurer leur intégrité dans le système de paie ;
  • Vérifier les déductions de paie et avantages sociaux ;
  • Valider les terminaisons d’employés tout en assurant leur conformité avec les législations fédérales et provinciales applicables ;
  • Les opérations relatives à la fermeture des dossiers du collaborateur en matière de rémunération (relevés d'emplois, versements de vacances et vérifications des derniers paiements).
  • Assurer la clôture mensuelle et annuelle du cycle comptable concernant la paie.
  • Agir à titre de personne-ressource pour toute question relative à la paie.
  • Produire des T4 et relevés 1 des collaborateurs.
  • Produire divers rapports requis (loi sur la formation au Québec, CCQ, REER, etc.).



FORMATION ET EXPERIENCE PROFESSIONNELLE :

  • Titulaire d’un baccalauréat (BAC) en comptabilité (comptabilité, contrôle), vous maitrisez parfaitement les principes comptables et de la paie Canadienne ;
  • Vous disposez d’au moins 10 ans d’expérience en comptabilité et au moins 7 ans d’expérience en paie ;
  • Expérience dans un rôle similaire avec gestion d’une équipe ;
  • Expérience dans le milieu de la construction/ingénierie, un fort atout ;
  • Expérience dans la gestion de plusieurs entités légales, des opérations inter-compagnies et multidevises.


COMPETENCES :

Compétences requises :

  • Sens de la rigueur et de l’analyse ;
  • Sens de l'organisation et de la gestion des priorités dans le respect des plannings qui vous sont imposés ;
  • Vous aimez travailler en équipe et communiquer ;
  • Vous aimez le contact avec l'opérationnel et faîtes preuve de dynamisme ;
  • Bonne maîtrise de la Suite Office (Word. PowerPoint et Excel) ;
  • Intérêt pour les systèmes d’Information.

Compétences recommandées :

  • Français courant et Anglais professionnel ;
  • Certification de l’Association canadienne de la paie, un fort atout ;
  • Connaissance de ADP, un fort atout.

title: Director Of Finance And Accounting
description:
We are looking for a passionate and driven Director of Finance to join our renewable energy powerhouse.


At Subterra, a part of the STS Group of Companies, we make green buildings simple. Our Account Managers are the experts who sell innovative EaaS (Energy as a Service) products to North America. They directly advise customers on everything from solution features and configurations, through to pricing structure and availability.


People leader - 10%

You are a leader, coach, and mentor for individuals within the finance and accounting function. You lead the professional development of this team, ensuring quality and accountability.


Financial Statements and Reporting - 30%

You are accountable for the consistent production of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements for Subterra, Turnkey, and STS consolidated. These statements in inform the monthly reporting package you are responsible for producing for management and investors. 


Cash Management - 25%

You are accountable for managing AR and AP systems to ensure sufficient cash is available to manage the business and service debt. 


Job Profitability Reporting - 15%

You oversee real-time job profitability reporting with project managers to identify budget variances and implement changes mid-project as needed.


Budgeting and Forecasting - 15%

You work with management to produce annual budgets and growth forecast models with the investment team to project operating estimates under various corporate development scenarios.


Tax Strategy and Filing - 5%

You support third-party accountants with preparation of annual taxes for Subterra, Turnkey, and STS consolidated. You advise management on tax strategy. 


Here’s our story; now tell us yours


Subterra’s (STS) vision is to create change in our communities through reducing green house gas emissions in the built environment. We partner with our clients and enable them to meet the challenges and opportunities of the future. We believe in delivering exceptional service to our clients, partners, residents and society at large so we can all contribute to building a better future!

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Reporting to the President, the Corporate Controller is responsible for leadership of the company’s accounting function across multiple legal entities and operational divisions. This will include the preparation of financial statements and reporting to senior management and stakeholders.  This role is also responsible for internal controls, budgeting, forecasting, financing, tax planning and risk management.

 

 

Key Responsibilities

 

  • Lead and mentor the accounting team including, recruitment, training, goal setting, performance review and appreciation.
  • Develop, document and implement effective internal controls to ensure the integrity of financial information
  • Review existing processes, procedures and reporting systems and implement best practices to improve on the quality of information reporting.
  • Lead and assist the team with financial reporting, tax compliance, intercompany reconciliations, AR, AP, payroll and all other accounting functions.
  • Ensure financial reports are prepared in accordance with Accounting Standards for Private Enterprises (ASPE).
  • Review and approve internally prepared monthly, quarterly and annual division and consolidated financial statements to ensure, complete and timely distribution to internal and external users.
  • Manage cash flow and short term investments.
  • Support the timely and accurate completion of annual operating forecasts, KPI’s and capital budgets.
  • Providing advice on strategic business initiatives and evaluate the accounting implications.
  • Manage relationships with external stakeholders including lenders, insurance brokers, external accountants and CRA.
  • Actively support the acquisition and management of financing for assets, develop activity and general operations.

 

 

Your Education, Skills and Experience

 

  • University Degree
  • CPA designation
  • 6+ years of relevant experience in accounting, finance and/or public accounting.
  • Work experience in real estate development, property management and hospitality.
  • Significant experience with MS Excel, Newstar, Jonas or similar software.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Enjoys working independently, in a team, and under pressure.
  • Easily adapts to changing circumstances and is an effective problem solver
  • Fosters a positive and rewarding environment by encourage and supporting others.

 

Compensation and benefits to working with us:

 

  • Year-round salary commensurate with experience
  • Company benefits program.
  • RRSP matching program.
  • Golf privileges at Deer Creek North, Deer Creek South, Salem Ridge, and Glen Cedars.
  • 50% off meals while working.
  • Friends and family discounts on green fees.
  • Learning, development, growth, and professional development strongly encouraged.

 

The Coughlan Group is an equal opportunity employer who is committed to equity and inclusion in our recruitment and hiring of qualified staff. We invite any candidates who represent the various diversity in our community to apply. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require accommodation at any stage of the process, please inform Human Resources should you have any accessibility or accommodation needs. We thank all applicants for their interest in this position, however, only qualified candidates will be contacted for an interview.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Mega Group Inc. is Canada's largest retail buying and support group of independent furniture, appliance and consumer electronics retailers. We are dedicated to providing programs that stimulate growth and promote success. Our vision is to be the essential supplier of retail services ensuring the continued success of the Independent Home Goods retail channel in Canada. As a Platinum Member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, we serve over 700 retail members across the country with offices located in Saskatoon and Boucherville.

 

We are proud to provide an employee-friendly work environment, where work-life balance is a priority. We value the talents and abilities of our employees and strive for an open, flexible, cooperative, and dynamic work environment.

 

We are seeking an Accounting Manager in our Saskatoon office. The incumbent’s primary responsibilities will be:

  • Design and deliver all financial reports required to evaluate achievement of corporate objectives and to evaluate corporate opportunities
  • Review and publish monthly financial statements, according to established timelines, including variance analysis to budget and prior year, and recommendations for corrective action
  • Assist in the development and implementation of policies and procedures (internal controls) relating to financial management, budgeting, and accounting
  • Oversee the daily functions of the accounting team including AP, AR, Payroll, Banking, Contract admin, GL maintenance, and promotional billings
  • Participate in the design of reporting tools and provide staff education on use of those tools
  • Understand the terms contained in vendor and all strategic partner agreements and ensures accurate system application
  • Coordinate the annual external audit, and any other audit engagements as required
  • Allocate the accounting team resources to best utilize the skills and competencies available to effectively complete functions/tasks required by the Company
  • Ensure the accounting system meets the department’s requirements/standards
  • Direct the timely distribution of supplier rebate programs
  • Support the Data Processing Team Lead in the development of the team ensuring high performance standards are met
  • Provides backup to the EDI Specialist, ensuring customer terms are accurately maintained in the system

 

Qualifications

  • A chartered professional accounting designation
  • A minimum of five (5) years supervisory experience in a senior accountancy role
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Strong leadership ability with the aptitude to share financial information with non-financial colleagues
  • Solid working knowledge of ASPE and relevant tax and regulatory laws
  • Ability to analyze complex data and reports
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong knowledge of Foreign Exchange transactions and available hedging tools
  • Builds collaborative relationships with internal and external customers
  • Financial reporting best practices acumen
  • Command of diverse accounting systems with proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (master of Excel)
  • Proven process improvement competency

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Russell Hendrix is looking for an experienced Accounting Manager join our Corporate Accounting team. You’ll be an integral part of the team’s operations, managing the AP department, and reporting directly to the Corporate Controller. This position requires a high attention to detail, the ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize, and experience in successfully leading teams.


What You’ll Do:

  • Manage AP department – ensure that invoices are entered on a timely basis, with proper approvals, and correctly coded; ensure that Russell Hendrix KPI’s are met as pertains to accuracy and processing time.
  • Manage COA’s for Traverse ERP platform.
  • Prepare weekly listing of outstanding Accounts Payable for CFO review.
  • Organize and prioritize weekly payment runs and assist in preparation of weekly and other periodic cash forecasts.
  • Analyze expenses and prepare accruals on a monthly basis.
  • Prepare monthly reconciliations of all intercompany transactions and resolve any discrepancies.
  • Prepare monthly reconciliations of balance sheet accounts for review by Corporate Controller.
  • Prepare monthly bank reconciliations for review by Corporate Controller.
  • Approve disbursements within the Russell Hendrix banking portals, ensuring compliance with Russell Hendrix internal control matrix; complete bank transfers on a weekly basis.
  • Handle all sales tax remittances and assist in streamlining current tax reporting structure.
  • Review and approve monthly commission and rebate journal entries; review and approve monthly and quarterly commission and rebate payments.
  • Work with AP team to document and automate tasks.
  • Assist with preparation of contractual reporting to lenders.
  • Administer all corporate credit cards; manage and review employee expense report submissions to ensure compliance with Russell Hendrix guidelines.
  • Support annual audit and bank audits as needed.
  • Ad hoc duties as required.


Required Skills/Experience:

  • You have at least 10 years of progressive, hands-on experience in a similar role.
  • You have at least 5 years experience supervising or managing transactional teams.
  • Successful completion of university or college degree with a focus on accounting.
  • You have distribution/manufacturing/logistics experience within a sales-driven organization.
  • You have intermediate Excel skills, comfortable with pivots, lookups, etc.
  • You have experience with banking portals.
  • You have experience with high volume of transactions.
  • You have experience with complex manual reconciliations.
  • You have experience with process improvements within a highly manual multi-entity environment with non-integrated ERP functionality.
  • You are a detail oriented and responsible individual with a proven track record of demonstrating initiative and proposing/implementing solutions to address issues.
  • You have demonstratable organizational and time management skills in dealing with changing priorities in a fast-paced environment while meeting reporting deadlines.
  • You have a proven ability to work with all levels of the organization to ensure that goals are met.
  • You are comfortable giving and receiving feedback.


What’s In It for You:

  • Extended health benefits
  • $400/year gym subsidy
  • Dynamic work environment
  • Excellent employee discount
  • Opportunity for growth


Get To Know Russell Hendrix!


With locations across Canada and over 70 years of experience, Russell Hendrix is the Leader in the commercial Food equipment industry. We are service focused Foodies who value integrity, teamwork, resourcefulness, and fairness. Check us out on Instagram: rhfoodequip or visit our website: www.russellhendrix.com.

Russell Hendrix is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Russell Hendrix is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

title: Corporate Controller, Manufacturing
description:
United Raw Pet Foods Inc., a fast-growing, leading manufacturer of quality raw pet foods in Canada and a subsidiary of the Dane Creek Capital Corp., is recruiting for an energetic, driven Corporate Controller, Manufacturing to manage the financial functions of our Canadian based multiple manufacturing facilities. The role includes the preparation of our consolidated financial statements, corporate reporting and the oversight and management of our plant accountants. The company’s head office location is in Mississauga, Ontario.


We are looking for a candidate that is a driven and personable leader with a “can-do” attitude. The ability to handle changing priorities with equanimity while maintaining open and effective communication are important attributes that you will need to be an effective member of our team.


We are currently recruiting for the following role:

Corporate Controller, Manufacturing


Job Role Summary

The Corporate Controller, Manufacturing is responsible for overseeing the plant accountants and managing the overall financial functions for manufacturing and operations. S/He will be responsible for directing and managing the company's accounting functions, including establishing and maintaining accounting principles, practices, and procedures as well as the preparation of financial statements and reporting to management and externally. S/He will be primarily involved in preparing the monthly, quarterly and annual closings and consolidations and will take the lead with respect to the divisions annual audit; preparing operational financial projections for budgetary purposes while providing day-to-day operational financial management; meeting corporate reporting requirements; managing, training, and evaluating manufacturing plant accountants in multiple locations. Some travel within Canada will be required.


Essential Functions

  • Manage the manufacturing divisions financial systems including budgetary processes and the preparation of its consolidated financial statements;
  • Overseeing all plant accountants and accounting operations for the manufacturing division.;
  • Provide timely and insightful financial operational support to the facilities General Managers;
  • Develop and maintain financial policies and procedures across all facilities;
  • Preparation of financial reports for management to support the reporting requirements for various company stakeholders;
  • Communicate with and maintain working relationships with banking institutions and auditors;
  • Lead the annual audit for the Company’s manufacturing division;
  • Provide feedback and recommendations to senior management regarding the infrastructure for the financial function;
  • Coordinate with other financial professionals throughout the organization to meet overall corporate requirements;


Qualifications

  • University degree and Canadian accounting designation (CPA) is required;
  • 5+ years of progression through financial positions with increasing responsibility;
  • Strong knowledge of ASPE;
  • Experience with external auditors and the audit process;
  • Experience in of the implementation of an ERP or similar system considered an asset;
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and expertise synthesizing and delivering financial analyses;
  • Proficient in technology, such as MS PowerPoint, Excel, Word, and QuickBooks;
  • Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and multi-task effectively;
  • Excellent organizational, time management and prioritization skills;
  • Demonstrates a positive work ethic, is self-motivated, has a strong attention to detail and is a team player;
  • A love of pets


Employment offers are conditional upon the satisfactory verification of a Canadian Criminal Record Check and Employment Reference Checks. Determination of the circumstances that constitute satisfactory verification is the sole discretion of United Raw Pet Foods Inc.


This opportunity will remain open until a suitable candidate is hired.

title: Development Accounting Manager
description:
Inspired HR is recruiting for a Development Accounting Manager on behalf of our client, Porte Communities.


THE TEAM:

There are countless reasons to consider a career with Porte. For starters, you’ll be part of an encouraging, supportive team with plenty of room for growth. You’ll enjoy perks like training and team building events throughout the year. Plus, there’s our roof top patio, Friday happy hour, a weekly fitness workout and more!


You’ll be an integral part of a family company, building on over 50 years of success, amazingly generous charitable work and progressive leadership in the real estate industry. At all times guided by the Porte Promises of: People-Focused, Committed to Excellence, Trustworthy and Community Builders.


Porte manages 700 plus rental units and over a million sq. ft. of commercial space. In addition to the income portfolio Porte has a healthy development pipeline of sites across Metro Vancouver. Please visit www.porte.ca to see our properties and projects!


JOB SUMMARY:

Reporting to the VP Finance and Accounting, the Development Accounting Manager performs duties for Porte Development Corporation, including full cycle accounting for development projects, cash flow preparation, receivable, accounts payable, data entry, bank deposits and month-end reporting duties.


JOB DUTIES:

  • Deliver and complete accurate multi-year draw requests to support cash management objectives.
  • Complete all time-sensitive deliverables accurately, including draw processing and deposit and sales reconciliations
  • Ensure closings are accounted for to properly recognize revenues
  • Ensure regulatory filings happen on schedule
  • Complete full-cycle accounting and month-end close
  • Communicate effectively and professionally with the internal customer group (development, marketing, sales, legal, customer care, corporate accounting)
  • Assists with the preparation of finance proposals.
  • Produces cash flow proformas for the development projects
  • Working with managers and staff, prepares an annual budget and monitors the budget against actual revenues and expenditures on an ongoing basis.
  • Reports on the operating budget, and on overall project budgets, and tracks and reports on budget variances.
  • Assists the preparation of the draw (loan) requests and follows up to ensure funding, with the contractor, lender, quantity surveyor and others.
  • Monitors and follows up with return of letters of credit and deposits.
  • Liaises with development team on proforma inputs


TEAMWORK AND SUPERVISION:

  • Participates as a member of the Accounting team and the Development team


QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Required training, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities:
  • Minimum 5 - 7 years development accounting experience.
  • Experience in both commercial and residential is preferred.
  • Strong writing and self review skills.
  • Strong technical and administrative skills.
  • Strong knowledge of Yardi Job Cost.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced environment.
  • High level of organization and attention to detail.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work well individually and in teams.
  • Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Technology savvy
  • Ability to write and communicate clear ideas


If you are interested in applying, please send us your cover letter and resume. No phone calls please. Due to the anticipated volume of applications, we will only be able to respond to those selected for an interview. Thank you for your interest in this opportunity with Porte Communities.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Description

The Company

Our Niagara area client has been in business for almost 100 years. They are a publicly traded corporation headquartered in the US with operations across the globe. They boast customers in over 100 countries across various industries.

The Role

The Corporate Controller reports to the CFO in the Canadian head office. The Corporate Controller has 9 direct reports and is responsible for all accounting, financial reporting, treasury, tax, payroll and cash management. You will have responsibility for the organization’s operations across the country including several distribution centres in Western, Central and Eastern Canada.

About You

You are a designated CPA CA with a minimum of 7-10 years’ experience in publicly traded companies with 7+ years in progressively senior management roles. Your background is predominately in global public distribution companies where you had responsibility for 200,000+ SKU’s. In this role, since you will interface with colleagues at all levels including the Canadian leadership team and executives in the US head office, exceptional written and verbal communication skills are mandatory.

Your Skills & Experience
  • CPA CA designation
  • Large public company experience
  • Previous experience managing a busy Finance team and overall oversight for the month-end close and financial reporting process
  • Past responsibility for accounting, reporting, tax, treasury, cash management and payroll
  • Past distribution experience, preferably in a multi-location environment with thousands of different product SKU's
  • Large ERP experience and advanced Excel skills
  • Knowledge of US GAAP
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
What’s in it for You?
  • Generous base salary
  • Annual bonus
  • Long term incentive plan
  • Full health and dental benefits
  • Healthcare spending account
  • Defined contribution pension plan
  • Company-paid CPA dues and tuition reimbursement plan
  • Team-oriented collaborative culture where hard work and excellence is always rewarded
  • Opportunity to be an integral member of the Canadian leadership team for a global multi-billion dollar publicly traded organization
  • Exciting opportunity with an established, financially stable, and profitable company with decades of market leadership in their industry
Requirements
  • Overall management, coaching and development of Finance team including 9 direct reports
  • Responsible for monitoring, and documenting all accounting policies and procedures
  • Oversee the accounting cycle of month-end, quarter-end and year-end financial reports and accurate close processes
  • Manages recording of fixed assets and depreciation in accordance with Company policy
  • Ensure all balance sheet accounts are reconciled on a monthly basis
  • Responsible for research, interpretation, and recommendations on complex/escalated accounting issues in collaboration with the CFO
  • Responsible for internal management reporting of all cost centers, branches, zones, and the Company overall
  • Responsible of all government and statutory reporting
  • Responsible for maintaining all banking relationships and treasury responsibilities including cash flow analysis and hedging requirements
  • Primary liaison with the Company’s internal audit department and independent auditors as required
  • Process improvements to improve profits and increase efficiencies
  • Regular collaboration with different departments across the organization
  • Primarily responsible for the establishment and monitoring of adequate internal controls to safeguard Company assets in compliance with corporate policy and adherence to Sarbanes Oxley requirements.
  • Provides leadership and oversight for day-to-day management of payroll, including employee benefits, wage and salary administration, policies and procedures, records maintenance, employee benefits, workers’ compensation, and employment law
  • Develops, interprets, and maintains all payroll policies and procedures, and ensures that all payroll practices are fully compliant

title: Accounting Manager
description:
About the Company

Our client is Canada's leading specialty footwear expert with over 27 national retail locations.


  • Employees: 250+
  • Revenue: Private
  • Ownership: Privately held
  • Reports into: CFO
  • Direct Reports: 4
  • Team: 11


Who you are:

The ideal candidate will have 5-7 years of progressive accounting/finance experience and have a passion for working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.


The impact you will have:

Due to continued growth and long-term vision, the company is looking to bring in an accounting professional to become a part of the finance leadership team. This individual will lead the accounting activities within the organization while working closely with the CFO and other senior leadership team members to execute strategic growth plans. The Accounting Manager is responsible for the day-to-day management of an Accounting Team consisting of 11 people, 4 of whom the Accounting Manager will be managing. In addition, the Accounting Manager will be responsible for various financial reporting, establishing controls, and month-end and year-end related activities.


What are we looking for?

  1. 5-7 years of progressive accounting/finance experience in a similar role.
  2. Ability to provide superior customer service and be able to successfully communicate ideas to the internal leadership and finance team.
  3. Excellent ability to organize and time management in order to tackle multiple tasks simultaneously.
  4. CPA Designation or equivalent education.
  5. Leadership Experience: Has demonstrated their ability to coach, develop and motivate a team to continuously improve



Egility is committed to creating and fostering culturally diverse, equitable, and inclusive organizations. In accordance with the Accessible Canada Act, 2019 and all applicable provincial accessibility standards, upon request, accommodation will be provided by both Egility and our client throughout the recruitment, selection, and/or assessment process to applicants with disabilities.


Due to high volume, we will only be contacting applicants who meet all of the minimum requirements listed in the job description. Only those applicants who align most closely with our minimum and preferred qualifications will be contacted for an interview. The Recruiting team at Egility will retain your application materials and may contact you regarding future opportunities.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Summary:

XTL Transport Inc., is looking for an Accounting Manager with a strong work ethic and a positive team attitude. The Accounting Manager is responsible for accurate and timely financial reporting, compliance, cash management and tax reporting. This position also requires occasional travel to Toronto and potentially other locations.


Qualifications:

·       Professional Accounting Designation (CPA) or working towards the CPA accounting designation is required

·       Accounting firm experience is an asset

·       Minimum of five years of progressive accounting experience, with a portion being at the supervisory level

·       Advanced Microsoft excel skills and experience/comfort in different ERP systems

·       A common knowledge of ASPE and IFRS is an asset

·       Experience with an asset heavy /Warehousing or Transport industry is an asset

·       Excellent time management, organizational and people skills

·       Basic knowledge of accounting systems, budgets, and internal control.


Responsibilities:

·       Managing period end and year-end accruals so that they accurately reflect the company’s position and trends

·       Preparing and reviewing operating statements on a period/monthly basis (3 main legal entities and growing)

·       Accurately reviewing bank reconciliations, continuity schedules, and some tax compliance returns

·       Maintaining a clean and functional general ledger system 

·       Assist in audits, assistance in preparation and review of audit work papers

·       Manage internal departmental relationships and external Audit relationships well

·       Helping coordinate a smooth budget process, and work with various budget templates

·       Training/supervising and maintaining strong relationships with the finance team

·       Review intercompany billing process on a monthly/quarterly basis.

·       Prepare detailed working papers for year-end audit in collaboration with the accounting team  

·       Help prepare quarterly & year-end financial statements including tax provision.

·       Assisting controller and CFO in ensuring compliance and implementation of strong accounting standards.

·       Participate in various process improvement and assist in implementation of internal controls

·       Participate in preparation of annual corporate tax returns

·       Perform ad hoc projects and analysis as requested/needed 


  • XTL OFFERS:

·       Fast paced team atmosphere with an inclusive environment

·       Great benefits including health, dental, and life insurance, and RRSP match program

·       Strong social and philanthropy committees to complement our community and entrepreneurial culture

·       XTL is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity in the workplace and equivalently considers applications from qualified women, men, visible minorities, aboriginal people and persons with disabilities. We welcome applications from all interested individuals; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

LOCATION:

Vaudreuil

START DATE:

As soon as possible

title: Controller Accounting Manager
description:
Construction Controller (General Contractor)

Job Description
  • Direct responsibility for maintenance and improvement of accounting systems, methods, procedures and internal controls.
  • Preparation of monthly work in progress reports, balance sheet, cash flow, and financial statements.
  • Supervision of all accounting functions such as accounts payable, accounts receivable and payroll including performance of these functions as required.
  • Maintenance of all personnel records and files.
  • Timely completion of year end documentation and the ability to work closely with the outside audit team. Including preparation of tax payments.
  • Manage workers compensation, company benefits and general liability insurance.
  • Manage overhead items such as telephones and computer systems.
Qualifications
  • Minimum 5 years of broad financial and construction involvement with either a General or Trade Contractor.
  • Bachelor’s degree in accounting or equivalent education and experience
  • Demonstrated organizational ability, communication skills and capability of self-direction
  • Knowledge of Jonas ERP would be an asset
Harbridge & Cross Limited is a medium sized employee owned General Contractor performing work through out the GTA.

title: Corporate Controller - Canada
description:
To view this page and job application in French, please change your language setting in the top right corner of the page (by clicking the global icon).

Pour afficher cette page et votre candidature en français, veuillez modifier votre paramètre de langue dans le coin supérieur droit de la page (en cliquant sur l'icône globale).

The Company is committed to fair and accessible employment recruiting practices that attract and retain employees with disabilities. This includes providing accessibility at all stages of the employment cycle.

If you are looking for a challenging and a rewarding career with a stable and reputable organization, this may be the ideal opportunity for you. This position is located at the Sonoco Canada Head Office in the City of Brantford, founded on the Grand River in South Western Ontario. As the Corporate Controller – Canada, you will be responsible for coordinating and maintaining the accounting and financial control system for all manufacturing and sales operations for nine (9) plants located across four (4) provinces. The Controller is a key financial resource and advisor supporting various Operating Divisions and oversees a team of two (2) members. The Controller contributes to an effective and profitable operation by supervising, designing, implementing, and assuring compliance with appropriate accounting and reporting procedures.

Specifically, What You'll Be Doing
  • Oversee and/or assist with corporate accounting and financial reporting activities such as Treasury functions, budgeting, re-forecasts, variance analyses, the intercompany reporting and settlement process, SEC reporting, and tax filings
  • Gain a thorough understanding of federal/provincial/municipal tax and other statutory reporting requirements and assist in ensuring proper compliance
  • Manage and monitor all internal and external audit requests
  • Provide guidance to Canada Divisions on matters related to accounting, ensuring Sonoco’s accounting and reporting standards and deadlines are met
  • Work with other members of Sonoco’s global finance team as well as outside advisors to coordinate intercompany transactions that impact the Canadian legal entities, such as receipt and payment of dividends and similar transactions
  • Manage a team of two (2) Accountants ensuring effective management and employee relations
  • Act as member of the Sonoco Canada Management Pension Committee and Board Member of Sonoco Canada Corporation, Sonoco Flexible Packaging Canada Corporation and Sonoco Plastics Canada ULC
  • As an officer/Board member of the Canadian legal entities, you will represent the companies in interactions with third party service provides, advisors, and banks and execute properly authorized contracts and other documents on behalf of the Canadian legal entities, such as corporate resolutions, tax returns, and other documents
We'd Love To Hear From You If You Have
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
  • CA/CMA/CPA/CGA designation
  • A minimum of 7-10 years progressive financial experience, preferably as a Controller or Financial Manager, in a multi-site manufacturing environment ideally with US/Canada cross-border operations
  • Exceptional planning and reporting skills with sound professional judgement and strong critical thinking
  • Strong ability to resolve issues and work well in a deadline-driven environment
  • Strong oral and written communication skills, initiative, and ability to multi-task
  • Experience coaching, mentoring and motivating staff and leading a finance team
  • Effective interpersonal skills to build solid working relationships with stakeholders
  • Extensive experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems such as Oracle, Coupa, Kronos and Workday would be an asset. Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills are required.
Sonoco values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. We strictly prohibit and do not tolerate discrimination against employees, applicants or any other covered persons because of: race; ancestry; place of origin; ethnic origin; citizenship; creed/religious beliefs; sex (including pregnancy); sexual orientation; gender identity; gender expression; age; record of offences; family status; marital status; receipt of public assistance and disability (or any other ground protected by applicable laws and legislation). Sonoco is committed to providing employment accommodations and accessibility at all stages of the employment cycle.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Company Description

For more than 30 years, Lorex has been a leader in the marketplace when it comes to innovative security technology for both home and commercial use. We achieve this by continuing to produce innovative monitoring solutions, all backed by cutting-edge technology and a dedicated team of forward thinkers. Using the latest technology and innovations, Lorex strives to produce solutions to both enhance security and fit your lifestyle.

Job Summary

The Accounting Manager is responsible for all areas relating to financial reporting. This position will be responsible for developing and maintaining accounting principles, practices and procedures to ensure accurate and timely financial reporting and statements. This position addresses tight deadlines and a multitude of accounting activities including general ledger preparation, reporting (financial, compliance, regulatory, tax), year-end audit preparation, and the support of budget and forecast activities.


Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of the financial reporting and general ledger structure.
  • Ensure an accurate and timely monthly, quarterly and year end close.
  • Ensure the timely reporting of all monthly financial, compliance, regulatory and tax information.
  • Ensure all key financial reconciliation are performed in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Supports budget and forecasting activities.
  • Collaborates with the other finance department members to support overall department goals and objectives.
  • Valuating, developing, and improving department controls, ERP systems, and procedures increase accuracy and efficiency.
  • Work closely with Accounting Group in overseas HQ to streamline the financial reporting and GAAP conversion process.
  • Advises staff regarding the handling of non-routine reporting transactions.
  • Work with the team to ensure a clean and timely year end audit.
  • Assist in development and implementation of new procedures and features to enhance the workflow of the department.
  • Provide training to new and existing staff as needed.
  • Support CFO with special projects and workflow process improvements.


Requirements:

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs)

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Accounting, Business, Finance or equivalent
  • Good knowledge of US / Canadian GAAP and IFRS
  • Knowledge or prior working experience with US tax including Federal, State & Sales tax is preferred
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills


Competency Profile

  • Self-motivated and ability to work to deadlines with good prioritization and time management skills
  • Ability to deliver high quality documentation paying attention to detail.


Background Experiences

  • 6+ years of progressive accounting experience with 3+ years being in a supervisory role
  • Prior working experience in public accounting firm or multinational companies is preferred
  • Qualified accountant (CPA / CA / CMA or equivalent) is preferred
  • Experience with SAP strongly preferred


Key Competencies:

Connects:

· Builds trust and establishes rapport with diverse colleagues and customers by listening, understanding their needs, and following through on commitments.

· Works effectively with people who have different perspectives, backgrounds and abilities while encouraging constructive dialogue and being sensitive and receptive to diverse views and opinions.

· Builds mutually beneficial working relationships to foster a positive and inclusive culture and engages with internal and external customers and stakeholders representing a variety of interests.


Teamwork:

· Works with others to share expertise and achieve outcomes that benefit the organization.

· Demonstrates strong communication skills to others on the team through active listening, summarizing, facilitating and "bridge building".


Inspires:

· Creates a shared vision by soliciting and valuing diverse input obtained from each team member on the vision of their work and the team.

· Uses a broad range of communication strategies and methods to communicate vision with enthusiasm and clarity, and to inspire confidence and generate commitment.

· Helps the team to embrace different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds by modeling positive leadership behavior and encouraging full participation.


Self-Awareness:

· Proactively seeks and obtains ongoing feedback to help understand ones' own strengths and development areas to work more effectively with team/department managers/clients.

· Understands and is aware of one’s emotions and the impact these emotions may have on others.

· Reflects on feedback and lessons learned and uses acquired knowledge in working with team members to achieve personal and professional growth.


Delivers:

· Ensures the timely delivery of programs, projects, and services, effectively adapting to tight deadlines and sudden changes in priorities to accomplish objectives.

· Plans for possibilities and contingencies, identifying opportunities and problems to ensure that best results are achieved.

· Recognizes and makes best use of the diverse skills, abilities, experiences of team members to achieve best outcomes.


Transforms:

· Takes initiative and sustained action to ensure the successful implementation of change by shifting strategic focus and embracing new ideas and building on past knowledge and success.

· Fosters a team environment where all are encouraged to think creatively and new and diverse ideas and approaches are heard, valued and considered for implementation.

· Seeks performance feedback and opportunities to invest time and effort to learn and expand knowledge to improve performance.


Accountability:

· Takes responsibility for clarifying the expectations of others

· Acknowledges how personal decisions, actions and standards of performance influence work accomplishments

· Accepts responsibility for work accomplishments

· Recognizes changes required to achieve better results going forward.


Creativity/Innovation:

· Identifies and evaluates unique ways to improve the organization (cost reductions, use of resources, policies/procedures, products), generating useful new ideas, approaches or techniques.


Integrity:

· Adheres to ethical standards and integrates Lorex values, principles and standards into practices and business transactions.

· Creates honest, trusting and successful working relationships with others inside and outside the organization and conducts all affairs with personal and professional integrity.

· Promptly addresses issues about discrimination, harassment, and unfair treatment and does not allow personal assumptions, biases and/or complaints to impact any work-related decisions in the team.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
We are exclusively working on an exciting opportunity for a junior mining company that is keen to engage a Corporate Controller to the team.

Reporting to the CFO and to the CEO, and based in Toronto, the Corporate Controller is responsible for overseeing and leading all day-to-day activities related to accounting, financial reporting, treasury and tax in the corporate office. Directly accountable for the Company’s internal controls system, and works closely with operations finance; will be actively participating in the Company’s new ERP implementation.

This position is a key growth position and the incumbent can expect to be a key leader in the finance function as the Company grows.

Responsibilities
  • Lead the financial reporting process and oversee it's successful completion;
  • Lead and develop the finance team;
  • Maintain the relationship with external auditors and ensure compliance;
  • Responsible for the development and implementation of internal controls;
  • Ad-hoc projects as required by the CEO and CFO.
Qualifications And Skills Requirements
  • Professional accounting designation (CPA or international equivalent);
  • 7+ years experience in the Mining industry highly desired;
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills – Spanish would be considered a plus;
  • Ability to manage the long-term strategy of the company;
  • Experience in leading a team;
  • Strong systems experience and knowledge;
  • Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize work.
If interested in this Corporate Controller position, please get in touch with Eduardo Utiyama on Eduardo.utiyama@robertwalters.com

description:
Help make a difference for Canadians. CMHC’s aspiration is that by 2030, everyone in Canada has a home that they can afford and that meets their needs. All of our programs and activities support this singular goal.

Be part of an inclusive workplace. Diversity and Inclusion guides everything we do at CMHC. We’re taking  concrete actions to eradicate racism and advance equity within CMHC and the housing system.

Join the Accounting Operations Team under Andréane Rodrigue, where we support housing affordability through effective and efficient execution of financial transactions. Your skills and passion for leadership, accounting and process improvements will support the delivery of innovative solutions that enable better decision-making, financial performance and efficiently supports CMHC’s financial transactional needs.

Responsibilities
  • Manage invoicing, accounts receivables processing as well as customer and vendor set-up, updates and maintenance.
  • Manage daily bank reconciliation, electronic and cheque receipts and journal entries. Manage the preparation and reconciliation of lender reports. Manage inquiries related to lender reports and other transactions.
  • Manage timely invoice and payment processing, including payments to suppliers and employee reimbursement. Process refunds and other adjustments related to payments.
  • Coordinate and manage processes related to monthly closing of the general ledger. Oversee the reconciliation of several general ledger accounts.
  • Manage client expectations by providing excellent service and timely feedback.
  • Manage workflows to ensure process efficiency, service-level agreements are met and risks are mitigated.

  • Undergraduate degree in a related field such as accounting, finance, business administration, economics or commerce.

  • Strong oral and written communication skills, including the ability to explain financial information to a variety of audiences.
  • Ability to persuade and influence others and maintain effective working relationships.
  • Bilingualism (French and English).

  • Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Valsoft Corporation is looking for an experienced and dynamic Accounting Manager reporting to the Head of Finance of one of the business units.


This individual will coordinate and manage period-end close and ensure accurate financial reporting and analysis for a portfolio of acquired companies, as well as lead projects impacting their accounting and handle the more complex accounting issues.


Here is a little window into our company: Valsoft’s focus is to acquire and grow vertical software businesses that provide mission-critical solutions in their respective niche or market. Since 2015, we have acquired over 50 businesses; today, Valsoft has over 2000 employees across 20+ countries. This business model creates a rapid growth environment allowing the acquisition of new companies based on profitable vertical performance. Our motto is Be Humble Stay Hungry!


What your day will look like:


  • Supervise and review the work of local and offshored accounting analysts – 3+ resources (journal entries, reconciliations, reports – including for AR, AP, billings and accounting transactions)
  • Supervise and implement appropriate application of GAAP accounting standards including more complex accounting situations such as percentage of completion
  • Coordinate the preparation of month-end financials for all the companies within the business unit (12+ subsidiaries in portfolio)
  • Supervise and lead the year-end closing for the business unit, as well as contribute in the audit process in support to the corporate accounting team
  • Prepare monthly financial analysis on key P&L items to better understand financial performance and variances between actual, forecast and budget, and support the reporting team during the month-end close
  • Review reporting needs and produce ad-hoc reports for the business, in collaboration with the FP&A team;
  • Build and review workflows, implement processes to optimize efficiency of reporting and put in place internal controls
  • Train, coach and provide support to the team
  • Collaborate with the integration team during the acquisition of a company to ensure the adequate setup of the accounting books
  • Contribute to the standardization of accounting processes with other business units and assist in the implementation of best practices
  • Strive for continuous improvement activities as part of day-to-day efforts
  • Support the Head of Finance of the business unit with special projects


About you:


  • 5+ years of experience in a similar role, including at least 2 in team management
  • CPA designation required
  • Fast-learner and adaptable – time management skills and ability to meet deadlines
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of French considered an asset
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Excel
  • Superior analytical skills, detail oriented
  • Excellent organizational skills and time management
  • Ability to manage risks by ensuring that effective and efficient internal controls are in place without compromising operational efficiency and flexibility
  • Working knowledge of Sage Intacct ERP (or similar) considered an asset
  • Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident
  • Team player


Perks working at Valsoft include:


  • Attractive compensation package including potential bonus
  • Training /Tuition Reimbursement Program
  • Free catered daily lunches, unlimited fruit and snacks, coffee, tea, hot chocolate
  • Work-life balance with a flexible working schedule
  • Free parking for all employees
  • Ping Pong and Foosball
  • Room to grow based on performance
  • Unlimited vacation after 3 years
  • Annual gym discount
  • Monthly on-site barber
  • Lounging areas


At Valsoft there is room for career growth, and we want you to feel like part of the Valsoft family! Valsoft Is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of; disability, race, ancestry, place of origin, color, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status or family status. We thank all applicants for their interest however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
