title: Director Of Finance And Accounting
description:
We are looking for a passionate and driven Director of Finance to join our renewable energy powerhouse.


At Subterra, a part of the STS Group of Companies, we make green buildings simple. Our Account Managers are the experts who sell innovative EaaS (Energy as a Service) products to North America. They directly advise customers on everything from solution features and configurations, through to pricing structure and availability.


People leader - 10%

You are a leader, coach, and mentor for individuals within the finance and accounting function. You lead the professional development of this team, ensuring quality and accountability.


Financial Statements and Reporting - 30%

You are accountable for the consistent production of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements for Subterra, Turnkey, and STS consolidated. These statements in inform the monthly reporting package you are responsible for producing for management and investors. 


Cash Management - 25%

You are accountable for managing AR and AP systems to ensure sufficient cash is available to manage the business and service debt. 


Job Profitability Reporting - 15%

You oversee real-time job profitability reporting with project managers to identify budget variances and implement changes mid-project as needed.


Budgeting and Forecasting - 15%

You work with management to produce annual budgets and growth forecast models with the investment team to project operating estimates under various corporate development scenarios.


Tax Strategy and Filing - 5%

You support third-party accountants with preparation of annual taxes for Subterra, Turnkey, and STS consolidated. You advise management on tax strategy. 


Here’s our story; now tell us yours


Subterra’s (STS) vision is to create change in our communities through reducing green house gas emissions in the built environment. We partner with our clients and enable them to meet the challenges and opportunities of the future. We believe in delivering exceptional service to our clients, partners, residents and society at large so we can all contribute to building a better future!

title: Controller
description:
Crown Private Credit Partners Inc.

Toronto, ON


Job Posting: Controller


About Crown Private Credit Partners Inc.


Crown Private Credit Partners Inc. (“CPCP”) is a leading private credit manager focused on private debt opportunities across the credit spectrum. CPCP was formed following the recent carve-out of the private credit business from Crown Capital Partners Inc. (“Crown Capital”). CPCP’s management team led Crown Capital’s private credit business since it was established by Crown Life Insurance Company in 2000. Crown’s management team has a 20-year track record in the private debt industry and has achieved a gross IRR of 14+% over this period.


Position Summary


We are seeking a qualified individual to lead the accounting and finance function within our growing private credit management business. Reporting to the Managing Director, the individual will lead all accounting and financial reporting functions spanning the investment funds and all related entities within the group structure.


As a Controller, your main responsibilities will involve:

  • All accounting functions for investment funds and corporate entities within the group
  • Prepare monthly/quarterly/annual financial statements and note disclosures for all investment funds and corporate entities within the group
  • Preparation of quarterly Form 31-103F1 (working capital form)
  • Detailed oversight of the investment accounting and operating activities prepared and performed by our external fund administrator, where applicable
  • Involvement in preparing and distributing monthly fund NAVs and supplemental information provided to LP’s
  • Involvement in capital calls and distributions
  • Calculation of the funds’ management fees and performance fees
  • Manage the timely completion of all external audits
  • Preparation and filing of all relevant tax returns, T5013 partnership returns and GST filings
  • Involvement in the tax slip cycle, ensuring all clients’ slips are free from misstatement and are distributed in a timely manner
  • Prepare quarterly investor account statements and assist in preparation of the quarterly managers reports
  • Preparation, review and circulation of responses to regulatory filings, surveys and other correspondence
  • Involvement in all fund and corporate cash management activities
  • Assist on new fund launches
  • Build up a strong understanding of the unique characteristics of our funds and become a subject matter expert within the company on technical fund-related matters
  • Build and maintain excellent working relationships with external service providers, including our fund administrator, custodian, auditor, tax advisor, external legal counsel etc.
  • Identification and documentation of key internal controls and policy


Success Factors:

  • Professional attitude and demeanour to appropriately represent the team
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to collaborate and function in a team environment
  • Attention to detail
  • Strong organizational and time management skills
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative
  • Flexibility to adapt to a wide range of roles and responsibilities
  • Attitude of continuous learning and development to improve skills and knowledge


Your experience and qualifications will include:


  • CPA designation
  • A minimum of 7 years of industry related work experience with fund accounting and administration and/or audit experience with funds from public practice within financial services group
  • Exposure to various fund structures, specifically Mutual Fund Trusts and Limited Partnerships

title: Controller
description:
The Company

Tandem Networks Inc. has been providing leading edge construction and engineering services to the telecommunication industry since 2008. We offer a wide range of plant construction and engineering services to telecommunications service providers, including the design, engineering, construction and maintenance of hybrid fiber/coax networks. Tandem provides the intangible that customers appreciate, and our company is built upon strong working professionals who strive for success.


The Opportunity

Reporting to the President, and Director, the Controller will function as the key finance person in the organization. Your mission will be to become the right hand to the President & Director, taking on challenges large and small, while improving the quality of financial information and optimizing the accounting and tax processes. You’ll own the general ledger and take charge of the day-to-day accounting.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage the general ledger and perform month-end closing.
  • Complete bank and credit card reconciliations, WSIB and HST returns, AP/R and other day-to-day accounting tasks.
  • General and specialized payroll services (CCQ – Quebec).
  • Own the financial tracking and analysis of job costs, change orders and other budget items.
  • Administer projects contracts and subcontract documentation including current insurance, CNESST, CCQ and statutory declarations.
  • Produce detailed financial reports and analyses for internal and external stakeholders.
  • Prepare monthly and yearly financial statements.
  • Prepare monthly cash flow.
  • Responsible for monthly bank reconciliation.
  • Tax planning strategies and solutions.


Key Qualifications:

  • A degree or diploma in accounting, finance, business administration, or a closely related discipline.
  • 5+ years of progressive accounting experience.
  • In depth knowledge of the Quebec tax and payroll systems (CCQ).
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills in both English and French.
  • Working experience with Sage 50.
  • Proficient in MS Office Suite, advanced user level with MS Excel.
  • Superior interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Team-oriented, with the ability to develop good working relationships.
  • Strong continuous improvement orientation; eager and able to research and implement process optimization software and systems.
  • Organized, meticulous and detail-oriented.
  • Can-do attitude; problem-solver; trouble-shooter.


We thank all applicants for their interest. However, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


Tandem Networks Inc. respects the dignity and independence of people with disabilities and provides accommodations throughout the recruitment and hiring processes.

title: Controller
description:
About RTB LLP

 

RTB is a rapidly growing financial services firm located in Calgary, Alberta. We offer fractional CFO, controller, and bookkeeping services to small and medium sized enterprises as well as not-for-profit and charitable organizations. We leverage our 40+ years of financial, strategic, operational, and regulatory experience to assist technology companies to commercialize their product and grow their business for the long term, and if desired, assist in an exit – be it an M&A, RTO or IPO.


We are currently seeking individuals who have the experience in public company reporting to provide Senior Accounting and/or Controller services to our clients.

 

About the Role

 

As a fulltime employee of RTB, you will be required to provide financial, operational, strategic, and regulatory advice to various client companies. You may be required to supervise the Finance and Admin Unit.

This position will become an integral part of the client company’s management team and will work directly with the CFO. As the client’s Controller, this position will have primary responsibility for the client’s budget management, cost benefit analysis, forecasting cash and resource needs, recommending and implementing cost cutting or growth generating initiatives and securing new funding.


 ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

●     Assist in performing all tasks necessary to achieve the organization's mission and help execute staff succession and growth plans

●     Work with the CFO on the strategic vision including fostering and cultivating stakeholder relationships as well as assisting in the development and negotiation of contracts

●     Ensure adequate controls are installed and that substantiating documentation is approved and available such that all expenditures may pass independent and governmental audits

●     Provide the client company with an operating budget

●     Prepare quarterly and annual reports

●     Work with the client to ensure operational and strategic success through financial analysis support, and compliance with all contractual and ethical requirements. This includes: 1) interpreting legislative and programmatic rules and regulations to ensure compliance with all federal, provincial, and contractual guidelines, 2) ensuring that all government regulations and requirements are disseminated to appropriate personnel, and 3) monitoring compliance

●     Oversee the management and coordination of all fiscal reporting activities for the organization including financial statement preparation, investor relations communications, legal and regulatory matters, board communication relating to financial and administrative aspects of the company

●     Oversee all purchasing and payroll activity for staff

●     Develop and maintain systems of internal controls to safeguard financial assets of the client. Oversee the coordination and activities of independent auditors ensuring all audit issues are resolved, and all compliance issues are met, and the preparation of the annual financial statements is in accordance with IFRS and federal, provincial and other required supplementary schedules and information.

●     Monitor banking activities of the client

●     Ensure adequate cash flow to meet the client’s needs

●     Investigate cost-effective benefit plans and other fringe benefits which the organization may offer employees and potential employees with the goal of attracting and retaining qualified individuals

●     Oversee the production of reports including financial statements and cash flow / budget projections for use by Executive management, as well as the Audit/Finance Committee and Board of Directors

●     Oversee Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable and ensure a disaster recovery plan is in place

●     Oversee business insurance plans and health care coverage analysis.

●     Oversee the maintenance of the inventory of all fixed assets

●     Other activities and duties as required

 

REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES

●     Accounting designation

●     5 years of relevant experience

●     Public company experience desirable

●     Not-for-profit / charitable organization experience is desirable

●     A basic knowledge of current trends, developments, and theories in technology development, life cycle and adoption

●     Two years of direct service delivery experience working with technology innovators (preferred)

●     Good working knowledge of ASPE and IFRS and Internal Control processes

●     General office software, particularly the Microsoft Office Suite and QuickBooks / Simply accounting software. Navision and Jet reports experience desirable

●     Intermediate to advanced MS Excel and MS Office skills

●     Ability to foster and cultivate business relationships, opportunities and partnerships

●     Communicate effectively in both written and verbal form

title: Controller
description:
Baydo is an engineering-based land and real estate developer specializing in the design and construction of townhomes, apartment-style condominiums, and commercial developments and we are currently looking for a CPA Accountant to join our team.

 

Your responsibility will be managing multiple company's accounting functions, including establishing and maintaining internal controls, as well as the preparation of financial statements and reporting to senior management. You will also assist with the budgeting process and support the CFO with any special projects or ad hoc reporting. The position is full-time and can start immediately.

 

 

Key responsibilities:

·        Oversight of all accounting operations including the review of journal entries, payroll, accounts payable, accounts receivable and statutory reporting, providing advice and guidance on all accounting matters;

·        Establish and monitor internal controls to ensure that accounting activities are in accordance with legal and regulatory requirements as well as company policies and procedures;

·        Assist with the budgeting process and make enhancements where needed;

·        Prepare, analyze and present monthly, quarterly and annual operating results for each operation;

·        Prepare year-end working papers and work with the external auditors as required;

·        Provide strategic analysis as required to drive improved decision making;

Key requirements:

·        A university degree in accounting;

·        Must possess a Canadian CPA designation;

·        Minimum of 5 years of professional accounting experience;

·        Proficiency with MS office, Excel, and QuickBooks.

·        Excellent communication, interpersonal and organizational skills

 

We can offer an exciting work environment and a competitive compensation package commensurate with experience. Please forward or email your résumé in confidence to: 

careers@baydo.ca

title: Controller
description:
Research and Development Controller

Ottawa, ON


Introduction

We are currently looking for a Research and Development (R&D) Controller for our client, a global pharmaceutical company that specializes in introducing innovative products and technologies in nutrition, diagnostics, medical devices and branded generic pharmaceuticals. This is a full-time permanent position reporting directly to the Finance Director based in Ottawa, ON.


Responsibilities

  • Responsible for the full range of financial disciplines involving entity reporting; planning; and financial consolidation impacting R&D and Program Management.
  • Entity and financial planning include general ledger accounting, tax, and ensuring compliance with applicable accounting policies/procedures.
  • Key financial partner/counsel to the Research and Development Director and other senior staff including providing financial advice and input for program management.
  • Maintain a sustainable process to support actual reporting, program forecasts, and variance analysis.
  • Build and maintain dynamic financial forecasts to support monthly, annual, and long-range plan forecasts.
  • Standardized financial models will include details supporting a complete financial build-up, along with assumptions by program/spend categories by month and a full program timeline.
  • Participate and own the financial portion of the Program Management process.
  • Provide financial support for division business cases for new product introduction, current product portfolio positioning, and accelerated investment decisions.
  • Ensure adequate internal controls are established/maintained and compliance with established financial policies and procedures.


Requirements

  • B.A./B.S. in Finance or Accounting. An advanced degree (MBA, CPA and/or CMA) is desirable.
  • 7 or more years of diverse financial experience including operations support, financial planning and analysis, general accounting, internal control/audit, project accounting support, and ad hoc analysis.
  • 4 or more years in a managerial position or role in Finance.
  • Strong organization, interpersonal, communication, and management skills (persuasiveness and negotiation) are key.
  • A highly organized individual capable of interfacing with individuals in a variety of senior management positions/levels.
  • Must have the ability to balance the needs of the organization when conflicting goals may exist. Demonstrate the ability to evaluate the tasks at hand and prioritize appropriately.
  • Forward-thinking for effective strategic business planning a must.
  • Strong knowledge of accounting and finance principles with the ability to apply this knowledge to support business needs.
  • Ability to prioritize; strong organizational and planning skills; strong intellectual curiosity.
  • Must thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic company environment.
  • Strong financial modeling skills and business acumen, with the ability to drive projects from start to finish.


What We Offer

Why apply through Brunel? Finding the next step in your career can be a full-time job in itself. We manage the process for you: from submitting your resume to coordinating interviews to extending offers and assisting with onboarding. We’ll get you going while you get on with the job.


About Us

Brunel has a reputation for working with some of the best in the business. That’s what we continually strive for. Over 45 years, we’ve created a global network of interesting clients and talented individuals working together through a vast array of services.

title: Controller
description:
The Strongman Group owns and manages over $200 million of commercial real estate assets throughout Western Canada and Ontario and has several real estate investment companies under management. Total assets exceed 620,000 square feet with over 50 properties and over 120 tenants across Canada. The Strongman Group continues to diversify and expand its real estate holdings, including investing in other high-growth businesses.


Taylor Ryan is pleased to be partnering with The Strongman Group in their search for an Accounting professional to join the team.


As a member of the Accounting team, the Controller provides the Company with financial leadership by providing relevant information to executives and assures the timeliness and accuracy of the financial records and information for the various real estate investment companies under management. You will lead and manage a team of two Property Accountants and one Senior Accountant and report directly to the President.


Duties and Responsibilities

Accounting and financial reporting

  • Develop, implement and maintain financial and accounting policies and procedures and ensure compliance
  • Develop and maintain timely and accurate financial statements and reports
  • Review output from the Accounting team, including monthly reports, quarterly variance analysis, year-end files, financial statements and budgets to ensure accuracy and completion
  • Oversee the annual financial statement process; including the preparation of the year-end common area (“CAM”) reconciliations for all tenants, and ensuring information is accurately prepared and reviewed before all supporting information is provided to the external accountants for the timely preparation of the annual financial statements and tax filings and in accordance with the company’s reporting deadlines
  • Develop and maintain financial accounting systems and a system of internal controls by preparing and recommending policies and procedures for all accounting processes
  • Responsible for financial sections of investor updates;
  • Manage the cash position, cash flow and prepare regular cash flow forecasts;
  • Oversee and coordinate the property tax appeal and payment process assisted by the Accountant and in conjunction with the Company’s external property tax advisors;
  • Manage the accounting for the acquisition of or disposal of properties and investments


Treasury

  • Lead treasury process and electronic banking for various companies under management;
  • Actively monitor cash balances and reviews and approves banking transactions in accordance with the Company’s treasury and internal control processes;
  • Actively monitor mortgages, loans, and leases; and prepare a renewal schedule;
  • Maintain banking relationships and assist the President in the negotiation of mortgages, lines of credit and other financial services as required and appropriate


Budget and annual plan preparation

  • Oversee and lead the preparation of annual property budgets (both operations and capital budgets) working closely with the property management team. Leads the regular monitoring of budget to actual performance and communications with executives and stakeholders on progress;
  • Perform quarterly budget to actual analyses; advising management and stakeholders on company performance;


Property management and project management accounting

  • Provide the property management and leasing teams with accounting support as required;
  • Develop and lead the preparation of construction budgets for development projects. Provide accurate and timely reporting on the financial activity of individual projects;
  • Maintain financial records for each project in a manner that facilitates management reports and ensure that accurate and timely financial statements are prepared in accordance with agreements with lenders;



You will have at least six years of relevant real estate experience (property management - commercial/retail and construction development experience preferred), an accounting degree (CPA designation preferred), the ability to adapt in an entrepreneurial company environment and to take on new roles and varied responsibilities as needed. Previous experience in Sage 300 preferred. You can expect to find a fantastic work environment and the selected candidate will receive a competitive compensation package as well as excellent benefits. For more information and to be considered, please forward your resume to daniela@taylorryan.com.

title: Corporate Controller, Manufacturing
description:
United Raw Pet Foods Inc., a fast-growing, leading manufacturer of quality raw pet foods in Canada and a subsidiary of the Dane Creek Capital Corp., is recruiting for an energetic, driven Corporate Controller, Manufacturing to manage the financial functions of our Canadian based multiple manufacturing facilities. The role includes the preparation of our consolidated financial statements, corporate reporting and the oversight and management of our plant accountants. The company’s head office location is in Mississauga, Ontario.


We are looking for a candidate that is a driven and personable leader with a “can-do” attitude. The ability to handle changing priorities with equanimity while maintaining open and effective communication are important attributes that you will need to be an effective member of our team.


We are currently recruiting for the following role:

Corporate Controller, Manufacturing


Job Role Summary

The Corporate Controller, Manufacturing is responsible for overseeing the plant accountants and managing the overall financial functions for manufacturing and operations. S/He will be responsible for directing and managing the company's accounting functions, including establishing and maintaining accounting principles, practices, and procedures as well as the preparation of financial statements and reporting to management and externally. S/He will be primarily involved in preparing the monthly, quarterly and annual closings and consolidations and will take the lead with respect to the divisions annual audit; preparing operational financial projections for budgetary purposes while providing day-to-day operational financial management; meeting corporate reporting requirements; managing, training, and evaluating manufacturing plant accountants in multiple locations. Some travel within Canada will be required.


Essential Functions

  • Manage the manufacturing divisions financial systems including budgetary processes and the preparation of its consolidated financial statements;
  • Overseeing all plant accountants and accounting operations for the manufacturing division.;
  • Provide timely and insightful financial operational support to the facilities General Managers;
  • Develop and maintain financial policies and procedures across all facilities;
  • Preparation of financial reports for management to support the reporting requirements for various company stakeholders;
  • Communicate with and maintain working relationships with banking institutions and auditors;
  • Lead the annual audit for the Company’s manufacturing division;
  • Provide feedback and recommendations to senior management regarding the infrastructure for the financial function;
  • Coordinate with other financial professionals throughout the organization to meet overall corporate requirements;


Qualifications

  • University degree and Canadian accounting designation (CPA) is required;
  • 5+ years of progression through financial positions with increasing responsibility;
  • Strong knowledge of ASPE;
  • Experience with external auditors and the audit process;
  • Experience in of the implementation of an ERP or similar system considered an asset;
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills and expertise synthesizing and delivering financial analyses;
  • Proficient in technology, such as MS PowerPoint, Excel, Word, and QuickBooks;
  • Demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and multi-task effectively;
  • Excellent organizational, time management and prioritization skills;
  • Demonstrates a positive work ethic, is self-motivated, has a strong attention to detail and is a team player;
  • A love of pets


Employment offers are conditional upon the satisfactory verification of a Canadian Criminal Record Check and Employment Reference Checks. Determination of the circumstances that constitute satisfactory verification is the sole discretion of United Raw Pet Foods Inc.


This opportunity will remain open until a suitable candidate is hired.

title: Work package controller
description:
Leading societies to a low carbon future, Alstom develops and markets mobility solutions that provide the sustainable foundations for the future of transportation. Alstom’s products portfolio ranges from high-speed trains, metros, monorail, trams and e-buses to integrated systems, customized services, infrastructure, signalling and digital mobility solutions. With Bombardier Transportation joining Alstom on January 29, 2021, the new Group’s combined revenue amounted to €15.7 billion for the 12-month period ended March 31, 20201. Headquartered in France, Alstom is now present in 70 countries and employs 75,000 people. www.alstom.com

PURPOSE OF THE JOB
  • Co-pilot to project managers/ specifically project procurement manager (PPM) to ensure focus on the achievement of the financial goals of the project material budget. Provides all required financial information about the project’s material;
  • Support project managers in various decision making related to material purchase (such as: Buy America Act, Bid, escalation assessment). Monthly monitoring & support the material budget evolution process, support planning activities, support risk and opportunities management, and ensure that company accounting guidelines are respected;

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES :

Project Material calculations (30%)
  • Ensure alignment TAC approved and proposed. Ensure that material costs are aligned and integrated at appropriate time. Prepare action items to close the gap;
  • Updating Budget and Forecast figures of the project in Global FORE. Maintain detailed material budget file and ensure alignment with Global FORE;
  • Review and Analysis of Estimated-at-completion calculation of the project material for Budget, Forecast and Actual in Global FORE;
  • Month end review between Budget, Forecast and Actual figures including risks & opportunities.

Project material reporting (30%)
  • Perform on a quarterly basis TAC file. Overview BI data of the material file upload;
  • Prepare and present the TAC proposed from PPM review’s to Core team reviews;
  • Make financial situation transparent to the PPM as well as the Core team;
  • Lead and support PPM and Core Team in meetings to improve their targets / mitigate risks;
  • Challenge the PPM/ Core team to assure project’s material budget is respected

Accounting Specific responsibilities (10%)
  • Hedging activities in cooperation with the project controllers;
  • Assessment of financial impact of various procurement strategies;
  • Validation of escalation and surcharge invoices;
  • Ensure interco PO-SO is aligned Global FORE vs Material file;
  • Support on cost assessment on change orders.

Specific responsibilities to PPM, Project controllers and other Project Core Team members (30%)
  • Keep continuously updated on financial situation of project’s material and upcoming risks & opportunities on a biweekly basis;
  • Build and maintain successful cross functional relationships;
  • Assessment of financial impact of various procurement strategies;
  • Challenge/validate the purchase approvals;
  • Support during Buy America Act Audits;
  • Support cost assessment on Bids.

DESIRED PROFILE :
  • BAC in finance or accounting
  • CPA designation not mandatory
  • 5 years minimum experience
  • Project accounting experience, an asset
  • Entrepreneurial spirit, taste for operations
  • English mandatory, French an asset
  • Software: SAP, an asset

title: Controller
description:
Jowett Farms Corporation is a growing family-run company located within the beautiful town of Blumenort, Manitoba. Our state-of-the-art processing plant is the first of its kind in Canada. We credit our continuous growth to our focus on innovation, teambuilding, and leadership.


Jowett Farms provides an opportunity for you to grow your professional skills and gain recognition for your contributions to the company. We are committed to supporting our team through their challenges, successes, and growth. If you appreciate a diverse, up-beat, and hard-working team, our company may be the career you have been looking for.


What makes us great?

  • Comprehensive group insurance including health and dental
  • Internal advancement opportunities
  • A family like environment built on respect, goals, and communication
  • Training and Tuition reimbursement
  • Employee referral bonuses
  • Employee purchase discount program


We are excited to be adding a CONTROLLER to our team!


The Controller is a cross-functional leader within the organization responsible for the integration and continuous improvement of accounting policies and procedures within the company and for overall company accounting processes and functions as well as overseeing day-to-day operations of the administrative team. You will be an experienced and qualified financial expert with a proven ability to lead and organize a small team to achieve consistently high-quality results.


Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Supervise and provide support to administrative staff, including; network administration, customer service, accounts receivable, purchasing, human resources, and accounts payable roles.
  • Establish and monitor policies, procedures, and internal controls Prepare & submit government related documents, including business tax remittances
  • Coordinate monthly close process, including; recording journal entries, reconciliations and analyzing results
  • Monitor perpetual inventory system, ensuring accurate finished goods costs
  • Cash flow management, including bank reconciliations for multiple business units and accounts
  • Act as liaison to external accountant, insurance, bank, and financing contacts
  • Synchronize software applications to meet the needs of internal business process
  • Analyze financial reporting for product costing, pricing decisions, budget variances, etc.
  • Provide informed proposals to ensure accurate forecast and strategic planning
  • Prepare consolidated year end files for external audit
  • Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications:

  • Designated CPA or equivalent experience
  • Experienced in cost accounting, preferably manufacturing
  • Significant exposure to foreign exchange
  • General exposure to HR management, payroll, employee benefits administration, training and development
  • Ability to communicate and present complex findings and analysis in a non-technical fashion
  • 2 – 5 years financial analysis experience
  • Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain supportive work relationships
  • Proven problem solving & decision-making skills


If you would like to be considered for our team please provide a resume and cover letter with your wage expectancy to hr@jowettfarms.ca. No phone calls please

As much as we would like to have the opportunity to talk to everyone that applies, we only will be contacting those that we select to interview, and we thank you for your interest.

title: Controller
description:
We are seeking a hands-on CPA designated Controller, to fill a new position. This role reports to the CFO, and works closely with senior management in processing, development and monitor the financial operations of the company. Some of the responsibilities and qualifications are as follows:

Responsibilities:

· Full cycle accounting operations of the company, including preparation of monthly, quarterly,

and annually financial reports

· Train and manage the accounting team and ensure efficiency of function

· Manage revenue process, review all invoicing and accounts receivable and timing

· Maintain receivable ledger and follow up with collection action, as required

· Supervise and review all accounts receivable functions and work closely with A/R

Administrator

- Supervise and review all accounts payable functions; handle payable calls from suppliers and

schedule payment run reports and work closely with A/P Administrator

· Approval of Expense Claims including expenditure approval as listed on the “Altex Financial

Approval Matrix”

· Assist in the development of department budget and prepare annual forecast and budget

· Preparation of monthly financial statements complete with supporting working paper file detailing what makes up assets and liabilities. Review income and expense recognition for accurate recording and matching.

· Maintain sub-ledgers for accounts receivable/payable and job costing, payroll as well as the general ledger.

· Manage company cash flow to maintain finances within banking covenants.

· All banking functions, including monthly report, deposits, fund transfer, currency conversions, monthly reconciliations and manage EFT system and control use.

· Funding/Cash Management – document control and IT; maintain appropriate insurance coverage

· Job Costing – maintain accurate job costing process to ensure costs are properly charged to appropriate jobs; prepare work in process reports; report individual job results both on an ongoing basis as well as after completion for management information purposes

· Attend weekly production meetings

· Liaise with Tax Auditors

· Work with CFO and year end accountants to aid in finalizing statements and tax returns

· Other duties as may be required

Qualifications:

· CPA designation

· 3 to 5 years of manufacturing industry experience

· Proficient in Microsoft desktop, server applications, SharePoint and Sage 300/Timberline experience are requirements

· Strong interpersonal and communications skills (both verbal and written), along with superior analytical and accounting technical knowledge

· The ability to work independently and collaboratively

· The ability to multi-task and strong attention to detail

· Strong verbal and written communication skills

· Motivated, energetic, self-starter, ability to take control

· Uncompromising ethics along with excellent organizational skills

· Intelligent, sound judgement, common sense

· Ability to work well with people at all levels and from multiple cultures

· Must have excellent problem-solving techniques

· People Management – performance reviews, probation, job descriptions and qualification requirements and identify industry mandatory training requirements for each position; monitor absenteeism, discipline were necessary

· Able to bend, crouch and lift up to 23 kg (50 lbs.)

Salary: Based on qualification and years of experience.

Please reply with cover letter, resume and salary expectations.

*No recruitment agencies or telephone calls please.

title: Controller
description:
Description

Crossroads Christian Communications Inc. (CCCI) has an excellent opportunity to join our finance team in the full-time permanent position of Controller.

We are looking for a highly motivated individual to oversee and lead our finance team, primarily responsible for the accounting process and controls, reporting, and financial statements, while maintaining the integrity of the financial statements for CCCI and CCCI – USA.


The chosen candidate will be passionate about leading and developing people and Crossroads organizational purpose:

Revealing the transforming story of Jesus through inspiring and innovative media to anyone, anywhere, anytime.


Responsibilities

  • Ensure the completeness, accuracy, and timeliness of financial statements
  • Ensure compliance with financial policies, procedures, and internal controls
  • Manage all aspects of accounts payable and accounts receivable
  • Provide on-going Statement of Financial Position and Statement of Operations review with analysis
  • Manage cash flow requirements
  • Coordinate preparation of work papers for the annual external audit
  • Prepare annual financial statements for auditor with appropriate disclosure
  • Prepare annual filings
  • Participate with departments in annual budget preparation
  • Ensure proper fund accounting is maintained
  • Keep up to date with accounting standards and requirements for charities


Specific Duties

  • Manage CCCI Finance team on a daily basis
  • Review accounts payable invoices before payment and approve payments
  • Review month-end journal entries before posting
  • Preparation of monthly financial statement for CCCI and variance analysis
  • Ensure HST is being calculated and reported accurately
  • Annual budget preparation with Executive Finance Lead
  • Prepare T3010 annually and keep up to date with CRA requirements
  • Other duties as required


Working with us

Our team enjoys a collaborative and supportive work environment, with an emphasis on development and leadership.


We offer a competitive benefits program for you and your eligible dependents including Employee Family Assistance Plan (EFAP), paid time-off benefits, and group RSP matching.

We thank all applicants in advance, but only those selected for an interview opportunity will be contacted. Crossroads Christian Communications Inc. is an Employment Equity Employer.


Requirements

Qualifications and Experience:

  • Professional Accounting Designation – CPA
  • 7-10 years experience in controllership function
  • Experience in the charitable or not-for-profit sector would be considered an asset
  • Broad and in-depth knowledge of financial practices, policies and procedures including an appropriate concentration in operational planning and problem solving
  • Complete understanding of the audit process
  • Proficiency with financial systems, preferably ACCPAC
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Excellent communications skills, both written and verbal

title: Controller
description:
Job Posting – Controller

Job level: Management

Segment: Manufacturing



About Us

Muir Tapes and Adhesives (MTA) is a leading supplier to automotive and industrial manufacturers. MTA began as 3M’s original Canadian distributor, creating custom products for businesses needing specialty tapes and adhesives. Over the past 60 years, the company has grown and evolved into a leading tape converter, offering a variety of solutions to a wide range of customers, from key tier 2 automotive part suppliers, to unique industrial manufacturers. We are a customer centric organization, driven to succeed. We operate with a continuous improvement mindset and a culture of ONE TEAM working together to achieve greatness. Our sole mission is to help manufacturers make things better.

As we bring our company’s success to the next level, we need people who are natural leaders with strong knowledge and a continuous improvement mindset to join us on our mission in helping manufacturers make things better.


What you bring to our team

As the leader of the Finance team, you will be challenged daily to advise and provide meaningful analysis and reporting to the leadership team in decision-making and running the business. We are looking for a candidate who will thrive while overseeing and supporting the accounting department functions. This role offers a unique opportunity to work with the owner/President and senior management team, where you will use your expertise, strategic planning and accounting management to help scale the business to a new level.


What you’ll do:

In the role of the Controller you will be responsible for managing, overseeing and supporting the finance departments. You will be responsible to ensure the functions within the Finance department are running smoothly, in a timely manner, compliant and finding ways to improve the processes on this journey. Part of your responsibilities in making this happen include the following:

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Oversee accounts receivables, accounts payable, reconciliations, accrual and general journal entries ensuring that financial reports are accurate and delivered timely.
  • Prepare weekly cash reporting and forecasting
  • Complete month-end and year-end close process
  • Manage financial transactions, consolidation, and reporting
  • Prepare monthly financial reports for Leadership Team
  • Manage and comply with government reporting requirements and tax filings with the appropriate federal and provincial agencies
  • Manage CRA and other agency audits and inquires
  • Manage all external audit inquiries (quarterly / annual)
  • Support profitability analysis, including cost basis, variance analysis and KPIs
  • Assist in financial planning, forecasting
  • Identify technical accounting issues, research, summarize and implement solutions
  • Manage Capital Expenditure controls, forecasting and reporting
  • Work closely with department managers in analyzing operational activities and costs (eg. production efficiencies, bill of materials, maintenance spend, etc.)
  • Support strategic growth and planning through participation in company strategy discussions and planning, identifying key initiatives
  • Manage banking functions and maintain relationships.
  • Support the Payroll functions, if/when required
  • Perform ad hoc analysis and projects as requested

Position requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting/Finance. CPA preferred.
  • Minimum 3 years of working experience as an Accounting Manager, Assistant Controller or Controller
  • Proven knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting principles, practices, standards, laws and regulations
  • Working knowledge of EPICOR would be an asset
  • Work experience in manufacturing and distribution companies


Why MTA?

MTA has been awarded the Canadian Business Excellence award 3 years in a row. As an employer dedicated to employee growth and wellbeing, we offer a variety of generous benefits to support our team at work and in their personal life:


  • Generous salary and bonus plan with an OTE of 10 to 20% depending upon personal performance and company profitability
  • Full health and dental benefits Attractive vacation policy
  • Use your accounting knowledge and experience to be a valuable member of the Management team and "not just the accountant"
  • Team-oriented collaborative culture where hard work and excellence is always rewarded
  • Opportunity to be an integral part of a fast-paced exciting business with customers around the world
  • Exciting opportunity with a financially stable and profitable company with decades of market leadership in their industry

title: Controller
description:
WHISTLER WHILE YOU WORK! Have you been dreaming of combining your personal passions with your professional path? This may be the opportunity you’ve been looking for! Our client is emblematic of the Whistler lifestyle- fun, adventure, appreciating the natural beauty of the mountains. SWIM is seeking a new CONTROLLER on behalf of this exciting organization. If your attention is grabbed, keeping on reading- and hum a merry tune!

Who- the Company: Our client is a well-established, ever-evolving, and entrepreneurial organization with 100+ employees. The organization is innovative and evolving, and even though revenues decreased during the pandemic, profits increased! The company has a dynamic culture that truly lives by the old cliché of “work hard/play hard”. The corporate team are all serious about their careers, but when the work is done, they are happy to get outside to explore all that Whistler has to offer.

What- the Role: On behalf of our client, SWIM is seeking a new CONTROLLER. The Controller will manage 2 individuals and will report directly into the impressive CEO. Responsibilities are varied and include: process improvements within the accounting & finance function, multi-entity and full-cycle accounting, financial reporting, overseeing payroll, budgeting and forecasting, cashflow management, financial system optimization, etc. Most importantly, the Controller will provide business decision support to the senior leadership team and contribute to the company’s strategic direction, especially during times of change.

Who- the Candidate: We are seeking candidates who will embody the organization’s culture- people who are team players, fun-loving, dynamic, and spirited. Qualified candidates will have 7+ years relevant and progressive experience in accounting & finance. Must have proven leadership abilities, ideally with 2+ direct reports on an accounting team. CPA designation is highly preferred. The ability to be both hands-on and strategic is crucial in this well-rounded Controllership role.

Where: Ideally the Controller will live in Whistler or along the Sea-to-Sky corridor (Pemberton, Squamish, Lions Bay, Porteau, etc.) That said, we’re also open to candidates who live in the lower mainland or elsewhere in BC, as long as they can easily get to Whistler for meetings once (and sometimes twice) a week. Candidates will need to have a good home office set-up.

How Much: Compensation will be in-line with qualifications and experience level. Please discuss with SWIM!

When & How to Apply: Swim Recruiting has been engaged exclusively on this search. SWIM will present shortlisted candidates directly to the hiring CEO for review. If you are keen on exploring this opportunity with an exciting Whistler-based company, please do not hesitate to apply. If you already have a Recruiter at SWIM, please reach out soon. If you do not yet have a contact at Swim Recruiting, please hit 'APPLY NOW' to send us your resume. Thank you!

title: Controller
description:
General Summary

Our core focus at Skycomp is to provide a worry-free experience for our clients and to give back to our community. We are searching for a proactive candidate to undertake all aspects of financial management, including, regulatory and financial reporting, budget and forecasts preparation, as well as developing internal control policies and procedures.

The Controller is responsible for managing the finances efficiently and effectively, as well as and providing support through accurate financial information and analysis to move the company towards its mission and goals. The Controller will be expected to lead a team of 3, while overseeing the finance and human resources department.


Primary Responsibilities

 

·           Managing billing, accounts receivable, accounts payable, general ledger, cashflow, revenue recognition and inventory accounting

·           Planning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functions

·           Coordinating and preparing internal and external financial statements

·           Creating and managing the budgets and financial forecasts

·           Managing cash and preparing cash flow reports, projecting cash needs at bi-weekly intervals through the Profit First method

·           Managing tax and insurance filings (HST, GST, WSIB)

·           Submitting payroll and managing quarterly bonus payouts

·           Managing company benefits and RSP plans

·           Securing funding such as government grants and establish strategic partnerships in support of company objectives

·           Assessing current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvement and implementing new processes

·           Leading finance department initiatives, such as systems implementation, pricing/costing updates, and other departmental improvements, as needed

·           Evaluating accounting and internal control systems

·           Developing and monitoring business performance metrics

·           Mentoring and supporting administrative team members

·           Comfortable handling responsibilities beyond formal job duties outlined

 


Expected Results

 

Through proper execution of the above stated job responsibilities, a Controller will have a strong grasp on the company’s financial standings and be able to provide sound advice to the leadership team to help drive the company forward.

A successful Controller will be able to think strategically and make decisions effectively. They will develop, analyze and interpret statistical and accounting information to ensure profitability, capital expenditures, and performance against budget are within established guidelines. A Controller will be confident building and leading a team, as well as creating procedural documentation to be followed by all.


Credentials and Experience

 

·           Post-Secondary degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field

·           Accounting Designation (CPA, CMA preferred)

·           Strong proficiency with accounting/financial management software (QuickBooks), and Microsoft 365 (Excel, Word, Team, Outlook)

·           Exceptional communication, technology, analytical and management skills

·           Strong knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP)

·           Previous experience in the private or public sector preferred

 


Why Choose Skycomp?


Below are some of the additional perks Skycomp has to offer their valued team members:

·           A comprehensive health benefits plan for the employee and their family

·           A RRSP and/or TFSA matching program

·           Quarterly bonuses

·           Annual membership dues for CPA Ontario will be covered

·           Continued training and education

·           Various internal contests and rewards

·           Monthly team building events, outings and more!

 


Be sure to check out the following links for more information!

title: Controller
description:
About the Company:
Purileaf Brand Corporation is a privately held cannabis processing company located in Niagara Falls, Canada. An industry leader in manufacture of purified cannabinoids, Purileaf’s core business operations include manufacturing of pure input ingredients for Canadian cannabis companies and commercialization of functional cannabinoid containing products. In business since 2016, Purileaf has experienced rapid growth by implementing targeted investments in production, technology, sales, and marketing.
In summer of 2022 Purileaf will be completing construction and opening a new wing of it’s manufacturing facility to triple the manufacturing floor space. With this expansion Purileaf is poised to become one of the largest cannabinoid manufacturing facilities in the country. This expansion coincides with our need to double the manufacturing output on wholesale and retail products based on current rate of client acquisition and new product listings with provincial cannabis distributors.
We are looking for experienced Controller to help formalize and scale up book-keeping, accounting and reporting system. A successful candidate will be in charge of all aspects of financial management, including regulatory and financial reporting, budget and forecasts preparation, maintaining financial models, as well as developing internal control policies and procedures. Purileaf Financial Controller will be in charge of defining and building a culture of financial accountability within the organization to support significant growth of corporation going forward.

Primary Responsibilities:
• Implementing best practice accounting/reporting processes and tools
• Full cycle accounting, including accounts receivable and payable, payroll, general ledger
• Monthly and quarterly financial statement preparation and other management reporting, including metrics and KPI’s to aid in executive decision-making
• Cash forecasting and management
• Revenue recognition and inventory accounting
• Budgeting and budget-to-actual reporting and variance analysis
• Financial forecasts
• Coordination and leadership of financial audits and regulatory reviews
• Tax compliance, including GST/HST returns, Excise returns and corporate returns
• Offering recommendations for and implementing process improvements
• Assist in hiring, mentoring and supporting administrative/accounting team members
• Comfortable handling responsibilities beyond formal job duties outlined

Expected Results:
Through proper execution of the above stated job responsibilities, a Controller will have a strong grasp on the company’s financial standings and be able to provide sound advice to the leadership team to help drive the company forward.
A successful Controller will be able to think strategically and make decisions effectively. They will develop, analyze and interpret statistical and accounting information to ensure profitability, capital expenditures, and performance against budget are within established guidelines.
A Controller will be confident building and leading a team, as well as creating procedural documentation to be followed by all.

Credentials and Experience:
• Post-Secondary degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
• CPA designation
• Strong proficiency with accounting / financial management software (QuickBooks)
• Exceptional communication, technology, analytical and management skills
• 7+ years of experience in financial accounting and management, with preference to controllership experience

Why Purileaf Brands Corporation:
• A comprehensive health benefits plan for the employee and their family
• Performance based bonuses
• Annual membership dues for CPA Ontario will be covered
• Flexible on-site/off-site working schedule
• Regular company team building events, outings and more!

title: Controller
location: Regional Municipality of Waterloo, Ontario, Canada
description:
COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATION | FULL-TIME | REGION OF WATERLOO



Relationships – Empathy – Integrity – Passion – Accountability – Resourceful


OVERVIEW



Our client is a large multi-faceted and innovative non-profit organization in the Region of Waterloo that is focused on supporting vulnerable populations in the community. Through its complex service offering, this organization has an extensive portfolio including its foundation, real estate, and investments, combined with extensive funding from various governments.



We are partnering with this organization in search of a highly competent and innovative financial leader that will embrace the values of the organization. The Controller will approach this leadership role with passion, integrity and enthusiasm for innovation and continuous improvement.



ROLE OVERVIEW



The Controller is a key member of the leadership team who will assist the Director of Finance with planning, directing, and controlling the overall finances of the department to maximize synergies in achieving goals and objectives aligned with the mission and vision of the organization.



POSITION FOCUS



While balancing strategic and tactical goals, the Controller will be responsible for:



Financial Management and Administration:


  • Proactively manage and prepare accurate budgets, forecasts, and financial statements for the entities of the organization, consistent with funder and legislative requirements.
  • Direct and prepare timely, accurate, and useful operating/management and financial data, including exception reporting and variance analysis for all operations of the Agency, supported by appropriate documentation and audit trail.
  • Work with the leadership team to develop the Annual Service Plan and Agency Budget to meet operational needs and funder requirements.
  • Develop and deliver presentations and reports, including information related to service fees, capital reserve requirements, property taxes, budgets, and variance analysis.
  • Ensure timely and accurate processing of transaction processes and reconciliation of General Ledger accounts.
  • Support the leadership team and various committees by providing information, recommending process improvements, cost reductions, and resolutions for other issues.
  • Direct the development of technical specifications for new or amended Financial Information Systems with respect to internal control and data integrity requirements.
  • Review and manage all banking arrangements and business records for legal, tax, and operation purposes.
  • Direct the preparation of monthly and yearly CRA tax returns and audits by collaborating with external auditors and regulatory agencies.



Leadership and Supervision:


  • Guide the development of the organization's strategic and operational plans, including long- and short-term goals, policies and procedures.
  • Promote the mission and vision in alignment with anti-racism and anti-oppression policies.
  • Provide support to the Director of Finance in achieving goals and objectives of the organization.
  • In partnership with the Director of Finance and key leaders, develop budgets and financial targets in alignment with funder requirements.
  • Participates and supports the Board of Governors and Finance Committee of the Board, outlining and presenting key financial information.
  • Implement responsive and strength-based leadership strategies to promote a healthy organizational work culture.
  • Collaborate with the leadership team to provide operational leadership, communicate information, and increase organizational effectiveness.
  • Support the recruitment, training, supervision, and performance management of team members in collaboration with HR and other leaders.
  • Perform other duties as assigned.



QUALIFICATIONS & SKILL SETS



  • A graduate degree in business administration or related field with a CPA designation.
  • Three years of management experience, preferably in a leadership level.
  • Experience in a multi-disciplinary health/social service settings would be an asset.
  • A skilled and successful financial leader with the ability to analyze and synthesize information effectively and give directions to the team.
  • Ability to analyze financial data and prepare reports, statements, and projections.
  • Passionate and knowledgeable about anti-oppression and anti-racism.
  • Able to build authentic relationships and lead with continuous development in mind.
  • Strong interpersonal, analytical, organizational, and teamwork skills.



We believe that success stems from a team aligned with an organization's vision, mission and purpose. Through our partnerships, all stakeholders are focused on ensuring a commitment and responsibility toward anti-racism, anti-oppression, equity, diversity and inclusivity.



This is an amazing opportunity for a highly motivated individual who is passionate about numbers and the non-profit sector. To apply, please contact Wendy Yeung at wendy@podgroup.ca. We welcome an exploratory discussion with interested candidates.



For more amazing opportunities, check out our job board at https://podgroup.ca/career-search/.

title: Controller
description:
Description

Do you love building and maintaining financial projections and results? Do you have amazing skills in analyzing data and building clear and relevant reporting and dashboards? We’re looking for a Senior Finance Manager to help our expanding team. You will lead our Finance department and processes and work closely with the Operations and HR teams to provide best-in-class service to Evolving Web’s employees and clients. You will be responsible for making sure that internal finance operations are running smoothly. We’re a growing company and take on many types of projects, so there will be a wide variety of tasks for you to work on. This role is perfect for someone who loves strengthening interdepartmental and client relationships, building or improving existing processes, knows that there’s a solution to every problem (you just have to find it), and gets immense satisfaction from seeing a project through to completion.

Note that regular visits to the office are mandatory; we will only consider applicants within traveling distance of the greater Montreal area.

Every day may look a little different, but expect to:
  • Own all financial reporting, including weekly and month-end financial reporting and end-of-month client and contractor billing
  • Forecasting and reconciling projected payroll and expenses, including invoiving
  • Track freelance costs and expenses; partner with operations, resource management and account to manage agency capacity and labor utilization; analyze and report profitability monthly, as well as general revenue projection
  • Monitor financial performance of accounts within P&L, identify areas of concern and/or opportunities and partner with senior account leads to address
  • Conduct balance sheet reconciliations and follow up on outstanding issues on monthly basis
  • Manage monthly close for general ledger and make journal entries as necessary
  • Review and authorize agency expenditures
  • Retain awareness of the company’s financial position and act to prevent problems
  • Oversee the Evolving Web’s finance IT systems
  • Run year-end client reporting and close books annually
  • Adhere to, administer and enforce agency processes and financial policies
  • Manage and assist the bookkeeping tasks and monthly reconciliations of the finances
  • Maintaining all budget control reports for client budgets
  • Prepare for and meet with project managers for monthly customer invoicing
  • Preparing and presenting profitability analysis and reporting to the various teams
  • Assisting project managers in contract signatures, filing and archiving of all contractual documents and invoices
  • Assisting project managers in hours reports
  • Optimizing our current and future financial tools
  • Assisting with RFP process for any financial documentation
  • Creating and maintaining financial processes and procedures. Being in charge of documentation.
  • Facilitating the Finance team with procedural and workflow compliance
Requirements
  • 5-7 years of experience in a similar role
  • Expert Google sheets and G Suite
  • Up to date with Canadian and Quebec government regulations and requirements
  • Exceptional attention to detail and time management skills
  • Obsessed with list-making and organization
  • Able to communicate and collaborate effectively and enjoy interacting on the phone and in person
  • Able to step in to make decisions and take ownership of a task or project
  • Comfortable managing multiple projects, people and deadlines
  • Excited about learning about new technologies and applying them to your role
  • Experience working with multinational and diverse teams
  • Understand that finance is more than “just numbers”
  • You are curious, passionate, sincere, and empathetic. People always come first.
Our Perfect Candidate Also Has
  • Fluency in spoken and written English and French
  • Experience working in a technical agency or startup environment
  • Experience in helping a “small business” grow to a “medium-sized business”
  • Excel formulas as a love language
  • A love of cats and dogs
Benefits

What kind of person usually gets along easily with us?
  • Someone who feels better products come from a collaborative work process
  • Not afraid to voice your opinion but open to any input
  • Organized, consistent, and able to work on several projects concurrently
  • Creative and curious, you're not afraid of learning new tools or responsibilities
  • Strong team player, problem-solving and leadership skills
What You Get
  • A hybrid working position where you are trusted to do work that matters whichever way you work best
  • Work on important projects for public sector clients, such as Tourisme Quebec, Princeton University and the Government of Canada
  • Work as part of a multi-disciplinary spread across many countries
  • A culture of promotions from within, with a start-up atmosphere allowing for varied and rapid career development
  • Work with dedicated people in a fun and friendly environment
  • Competitive salary and health insurance
Evolving Web values diversity and is committed to assembling a team with a diverse set of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more diverse we are, the better we will be. Evolving Web is an equal opportunity employer. We support and encourage flexible working, including flexible hours and work from home.

Learn more about what it's like to work at Evolving Web and join us!

title: Controller
description:
About the Company

Our client acquires uranium projects in Australia, Canada, Argentina and the United States. They are seeking a Controller to manage the day to day accounting duties for 2 companies.


Why Work Here

  • Opportunity to shape the role as you see fit
  • Opportunity for growth within the company
  • High exposure to senior leadership


About the Opportunity

Financial reporting

  • Responsible for quarterly financial reporting including preparation of Consolidated Financial Statements and MD&A
  • Liaise with external audit firm for annual financial statements, quarterly reviews.
  • Preparation and filing of GST/HST returns, T2 corporate tax filings.

Finance administration

  • Process purchases and payments, including payroll, and procurement as needed.
  • Liaise with corporate secretary for option and warrant activity.
  • Ensure adequate controls are in place and adhered to.
  • Administer accounting filing system, email accounts, other administrative functions.
  • Budget, include complete understanding of commitments required for each project.
  • Other ad hoc requests by CEO and CFO.

Corporate development

  • Contribute to corporate presentation and marketing.
  • Create effective charts and metrics, ad hoc design.
  • Assist CEO to monitor the resource sector, trends, to position the Companies as a ‘thought leader’.
  • Assist in formulating plan of next steps for mineral projects, including financial operating models for possible production scenarios, etc.
  • Due diligence process on acquisitions.


About You

  • CPA
  • IFRS or US GAAP reporting experience
  • Ability to prepare a full set of financial statement and notes
  • Team management experience


Salary Range

$135,000 - $140,000/year


How to Apply

Click the “Apply Now” button and follow the instructions to submit your resume. Please know that we only accept documents in MS Word or Rich Text formats.

When referencing this job, quote #320881.

  • You must currently reside within the Greater Toronto Area and be permitted to work in Canada to be considered for this opportunity. A recruiter will be in touch with you if your profile meets our client’s requirements for this role.

title: Controller
description:
The Centre for International Governance Innovation (CIGI) is an independent, non-partisan think tank whose peer-reviewed research and trusted analysis influence policy makers to innovate. Our global network of multidisciplinary researchers and strategic partnerships provide policy solutions for the digital era. 

CIGI has an opening for a Controller. Reporting to the CFO and Director of Operations, this position is responsible for a wide range of accounting and financial processes for CIGI. The Controller will work closely with the management team to provide meaningful, timely and accurate financial reporting while ensuring excellent stewardship of the organization’s assets. This position has one direct report.

The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with excellent attention to details and the ability to build relationships across the organization.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage, monitor and backup all accounting functions including payroll, accounts payable and receivable, including HST.
  • Produce accurate internal and external reporting for decision making to all levels of the organization and various external stakeholders. Assist with various financial reports for presentation to Finance Committee and full Board of Directors. Respond to ad-hoc financial requests.
  • Assist with creation of annual budget and project budgets.
  • Cash management, including monitoring of CIGI’s cash flow (Canadian and US account) along with recommendations for withdrawals from various funds ensuring that money is only taken when necessary but avoiding the use of overdraft facility. 
  • Co-ordinate and manage field work of external audit as well as ad hoc audits by granting institutions, governments, etc.
  • Monthly investment reconciliations along with recording investment revenue and fees in the general ledger. 
  • Maintain overall integrity of the general ledger.
  • Prepare complete and accurate government filings eg. HST, EHT, CPP, EI, WSIB. 
  • Establish and manage financial policies and procedures to be followed throughout the organization.
  • Active participation in the management team. Establish positive, collaborative relationships across the organization.

 

Knowledge and Skills Required:

  • University degree, CPA at least 8 years of post-qualification experience.
  • Demonstrated experience in financial management, experience working with not-for-profits.
  • Demonstrated leadership and project management skills.
  • Strong strategic focus, with a demonstrated aptitude for continuous learning and innovative thinking.
  • Strong communication skills with stakeholders at all levels, and ability to resolve complex financial and project-related issues.
  • Demonstrated analytical and organizational skills with high attention to detail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • The ability to prioritize, multi-task and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Understanding of international affairs and academic or government work environment an asset.


Interested applicants are invited to send a cover letter and resume along with salary expectations to careers@cigionline.org by May 24, 2022. We appreciate all candidates’ applications but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.


CIGI is committed to providing an inclusive, equitable and accessible environment. Our goal is to attract and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, including Aboriginal peoples, persons with disabilities and members of visible minorities. We are committed to providing accommodation to applicants throughout the recruitment and hiring process.

title: Controller
description:
COMPANY

New Metric Media is an award-winning production company focused on creating brand defining, memorable and authentic content for global audiences. The company is behind the hit Hulu/Crave original comedy LETTERKENNY, the Netflix/CityTV premium drama series BAD BLOOD and the Roku/Crave original comedy CHILDREN RUIN EVERYTHING. New Metric is also recognized as a leader in brand marketing for its success with Letterkenny and Bad Blood’s off-screen extensions, including beer, collectible merchandise as well as Letterkenny LIVE!, a North American theatre tour with the stars of the series.


ROLE

Due to exponential growth, New Metric Media is seeking a Controller with strong technical accounting skills and reporting experience who thrives in an entrepreneurial, fast-paced environment. The Controller will report to the VP Finance and manage the Corporate Accountant on the team. The Controller will wear multiple hats given the evolving nature of the organization and be willing to roll up their sleeves to get the job done! Your days will not just be about making sure the debits equal the credits, the Controller will partner with the VP Finance on key projects and help structure the accounting function to best meet the accounting and reporting requirements of a high growth organization. The Controller will also partner with colleagues in all other departments and interact with third parties, including the CRA, outside accountants, and other vendors.


RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manage the accounting and reporting for all legal entities in the corporate structure, from the initial setup of new entities and chart of accounts in the accounting system (currently using QuickBooks) to maintaining the GL, reviewing journal entries, reconciling/analyzing key balance sheet and P&L accounts.
  • Assess existing internal controls and update policies and procedures to ensure consistent and “best in practice” policies are in place companywide.
  • Work with the VP Finance on the following key projects within the first 12-18 months:
  • Establish uniform chart of accounts across all entities.
  • Research and evaluate accounting system options for likely upgrade from QuickBooks and manage the full migration to a new accounting system.
  • Manage the process of elevating our year end financial reporting from Notice to Reader to audited financial statements.
  • Establish the process and execution of consolidated financial statement reporting that consists of the parent company and 12-15 roll up entities, initially via Excel, but over time utilizing the accounting system.
  • Develop standard and ad hoc management reports required by senior management
  • Manage year end close including account reconciliations, analyses, accruals and adjusting entries for each legal entity in preparation for sending files to outside tax accountant.
  • Manage the daily accounting activity performed by the corporate accountant with the capability to assist or step in as a backup, when needed, for the following tasks: Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, Payroll and Treasury.
  • Assist with budgets and forecasts.
  • Liaise with outside accountants, including year end financial statements, tax returns, special projects, etc.
  • Ensure compliance with accounting standards and regulatory reporting requirements.


QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in Business
  • CPA designation required. Minimum of 7-9 years of direct experience in a financial reporting role preparing consolidated financial statements for multiple entities.
  • Strong technical accounting and consolidation skills, knowledge of accounting theory and practices, GAAP, and IFRS.
  • Preference given to candidates with experience in the media, production, and distribution industry.
  • Expert MS Excel skills required (pivot tables, v-lookups, conditional formulas, creating models, financial reports).
  • Advanced proficiency with QuickBooks required.
  • Previous experience managing a new accounting system implementation is a plus.
  • Experience working in a multi-currency environment is a plus.
  • Highly organized with the ability to manage multiple demands and still meet deadlines.
  • Outstanding problem-solving skills, strategic thinking, and proactive approach.
  • Impeccable attention to detail.
  • Demonstrated ability to thrive in an entrepreneurial work environment.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a natural ability to interact effectively with staff and external contacts.
  • Outstanding problem-solving skills, strategic thinking, and proactive approach.
