title: Controller - Contrôleur
description:
English Below...


PIP Canada, qui fait partie d'une organisation mondiale dont le siège social canadien est situé à Laval (Québec), est un important fournisseur de protection des mains et d'équipement de protection individuelle (EPI) pour les marchés industriels et de la construction. PIP® est l'acronyme de Protective Industrial Products, ce qui signifie que nous sommes engagés à aider à protéger les travailleurs essentiels chaque jour. Aujourd'hui, en tant qu'entreprise mondiale d'EPI dont le chiffre d'affaires s'élève à un milliard de dollars, nous sommes dans une position unique qui nous permet d'offrir à nos employés de nombreuses possibilités de mener une carrière diversifiée et enrichissante, tout en sachant que nos produits d'EPI contribuent à protéger les travailleurs contre les blessures.

 

C'est dans cette optique et cette vision que nous sommes actuellement à la recherche d'un contrôleur qui travaillera à partir de notre siège social canadien à Laval, au Québec. Le contrôleur tient à jour et contrôle le grand livre et est responsable de l'enregistrement exact des transactions conformément aux politiques locales et à celles de l'entreprise. Ce rôle comprendra un travail d’analyse et une revue approfondie des données financières.

 

Sous la direction du vice-président Finances pour le Canada, ce poste clé du service de comptabilité supervise les activités du service en mettant l'accent sur la production des états financiers et de rapports dans les temps voulus. Le contrôleur supervise et fait la revue des activités des membres de l'équipe qui sont responsables de l'enregistrement des transactions quotidiennes.

 

Responsabilités:

−     Diriger les opérations comptables quotidiennes de PIP Canada Ltée sous la direction du VP Finances de PIP Canada Ltée;

−     Gérer tous les aspects du processus de fin de mois dans le respect des délais de l'entreprise, incluant la production d'états financiers, divers calendriers de rapports et l'analyse d'informations provenant de plusieurs sources de données;

−     S'assurer que les résultats communiqués soient conformes aux NCECF et aux politiques de l'entreprise;

−     Préparer certaines écritures de journal et passer en revue les écritures de journal des membres de l'équipe;

−     Passer en revue et tenir à jour les rapprochements des comptes de bilan;

−     Vérifier l'exactitude des transactions du grand livre, des comptes créditeurs et de la paie;

−     S'assurer que les transactions soient comptabilisées, documentées, revues et appuyées conformément aux politiques comptables de l'entreprise;

−     S'assurer que des contrôles financiers internes adéquats soient implémentés et suivis;

−     Tenir à jour les comptes du grand livre, y compris l'analyse des principaux comptes de régularisation, de prépaiements (et l'amortissement adéquat) et autres comptes importants;

−     Gérer le plan comptable dans le logiciel local de planification des ressources de l'entreprise (ERP) et assurer la coordination avec le service de planification et analyse financières (FP&A), le cas échéant;

−     Contribuer aux prévisions et à la préparation du budget annuel.

−     Responsable de l'audit annuel et de la préparation du rapport financier annuel: travailler avec les auditeurs externes lors des audits de fin d'année;

−     Fournir des analyses des résultats réels par rapport au budget et travailler en étroite collaboration avec les chefs de service pour répondre aux questions et connaître les dépenses de leur service;

−     Élaborer et implémenter des systèmes efficaces de collecte, d'analyse, de vérification et de communication des données financières de façon plus efficiente;

−     Observer les procédures et les processus comptables et fournir des recommandations au vice-président Finances concernant les améliorations et les efficiences opérationnelles;

−     Implémenter des procédures comptables, des politiques financières et des processus d'amélioration continue;

−     Diriger l'attribution des tâches et des responsabilités quotidiennes et aider le vice-président Finances sur d'autres aspects liés à l'équipe;

−     Gérer et encadrer les membres plus débutants de l'équipe pour assurer une croissance adéquate;

−     Gérer des projets ad hoc au besoin.

 

Expérience et exigences:

−     Baccalauréat en comptabilité ou en finance;

−     Minimum de 7 ans d'expérience progressive en comptabilité, dont une partie importante dans un rôle de supervision. Une expérience dans une organisation internationale serait un atout;

−     Le bilinguisme est essentiel;

−     Excellentes habiletés de communication verbale et écrite et capacité à travailler à tous les niveaux d'une organisation;

−     Solides habiletés de leadership et détermination à diriger et à obtenir des résultats;

−     Valoriser et maintenir la confidentialité;

−     Flexibilité et capacité à s'adapter à l'évolution des besoins de l'entreprise dans un environnement où les délais sont serrés;

−     Habiletés approfondies en Microsoft Excel. Expérience avec d'autres systèmes financiers.


//ENG//


PIP Canada, part of a global organization with its Canadian head office located in Laval, QC is a leading provider of hand protection and personal protective equipment (PPE) to Industrial and Construction markets. PIP® stands for Protective Industrial Products meaning we are committed to helping protect essential workers every day. Today, as a $1 billion global PPE company, we are in a unique position to offer employees ample opportunities for a diverse and rewarding career while knowing that our PPE products help keep workers safe from injury.

 

It is with this view and vision that we are currently seeking a Controller, working out of our Canadian Headquarters in Laval, QC. The Controller maintains and controls the General Ledger and is responsible for the accurate recording of business transactions in accordance with both local and corporate policies. This role will include analytical work and a thorough review of financial records.

 

Taking direction from the VP Finance for Canada, this key position in the Accounting Department oversees the department’s functions with a focus on ensuring the timely and accurate delivery of financial statements and reporting. The hands-on Controller oversees / reviews activities of team members who are responsible for recording of day-to-day transactions.

 

Responsibilities:

−     Lead the day-to-day accounting operations of PIP Canada Ltd. and report up to the PIP Canada Ltd. VP Finance.

−     Manage all aspects of the month-end close process in adherence with corporate timelines, including production of financial statements, various reporting schedules, and analyzing information from several data sources.

−     Ensure that reported results comply with ASPE and corporate policies.

−     Prepare certain journal entries, as well as review team member journal entries.

−     Review and maintain balance sheet account reconciliations.

−     Review general ledger, accounts payable, and payroll transactions for accuracy.

−     Ensure transactions are recorded, documented, reviewed, and supported in accordance with corporate accounting policies.

−     Observe accounting processes and procedures, and provide recommendations to VP Finance regarding operational improvements and efficiencies.

−     Implement accounting procedures, financial policies, and continuous improvement.

−     Lead assignment of day-to-day tasks and responsibilities and assist VP Finance with other team related matters.

−     Manage and mentor more junior team members to ensure appropriate growth.

−     Handle ad-hoc projects as needed.

 

Experience and requirements:

−     Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance.

−     7+ years of progressive accounting experience with a significant portion of it being in a supervisory role. Experience in a global organization a plus.

−     Bilingual is a must.

−     Excellent verbal and written communication with ability to work across all levels of an organization.

−     Strong leadership skills with a dedication to driving and achieving results.

−     Values and maintains confidentiality.

−     Flexible and able to adjust to evolving business-needs in a deadline-driven environment.

−     Advanced Microsoft Excel skills. Experience with other financial systems.

title: Controller
description:
Our client employer in Lindsay Ontario is looking for a Controller with at least 5 years of experience in a controller role to join their team in a full-time permanent position!


As a key member of the management team, the Controller will provide financial management guidance and related analyses to support operational, managerial and strategic decision making.


The Controller will demonstrate financial management excellence by effectively communicating key financial issues with company stakeholders while also having a continuous improvement mindset toward the finance function.


This is a hands-on position with oversight and management of the finance and accounting department, including timely and efficient execution of accounting activities, oversight of internal controls and account reconciliations, development of annual budgets, provision of accurate costing information, timely and accurate reporting, and provision of key performance indicators for the business.


Excellent compensation package for the right candidate including salary commensurate with skills and experience, bonus, comprehensive benefits including RSP's and vacation!


Responsibilities include:

Leadership

  • Supporting employees’ personal and professional development through a demonstrated commitment to coaching and other development activities.
  • Develop and manage relationships with internal and external stakeholders
  • Inspires and engages with operational and functional managers to understand and achieve Business Unit objectives.

Financial planning and reporting

  • Lead the development and compilation of financial plans, budgets and subsequent performance monitoring quarterly and annually, or as needed
  • Oversee the provision of daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual information for operational, managerial and strategic decision making
  • Develop short and long-term financial plans in alignment with Mariposa Dairy Ltd.’s strategic plan

Financial function oversight and controls

  • Ensure records and systems are accurate, timely and maintained in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles
  • Develop and communicate accounting and financial management policies/processes, internal controls, delegation of authority guidelines and ensure compliance with these policies and controls
  • Ensure cash management is optimized and resources are spent in accordance with senior executive guidance
  • Oversee the timely reconciliation of bank deposits and customer account relief, bank and credit card accounts, reconciliation of balance sheet accounts
  • Establish efficient month-end practices to expedite monthly management reporting

Costing and pricing

  • Approve cost standards for the ERP system and provide accurate BOM’s for maximum costing to customers
  • Oversee the systematic and continuous review of cost variances and develop action plans to improve results

Banking and Finance

  • Monitor and maintain compliance with bank covenants

Compliance and reporting to external entities

  • Ensure compliance with local, provincial, and federal reporting requirements and other external agencies (Insurance, Stats Can, etc.)

Technology and systems

  • Participate and inform IT managed services provided by external service providers
  • Report on progress and development on a regular basis
  • Manages the ERP and NAV systems


Required Skills:

  • University Degree in Commerce or Business Administration
  • 5 years in a related field
  • CPA Designation
  • Extensive experience with ERP, accounting systems, budgeting processes, internal controls, business planning and asset management
  • Knowledge of GAAP, federal and provincial financial regulations.
  • Experience in negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management
  • Demonstrate effective oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to collaborate, build and maintain strong working relationships with staff, departmental peers, leadership, key business partners, and government agencies
  • High level of proficiency with Microsoft Office productivity suite
  • Microsoft Dynamics / NAVISION knowledge preferred


If you have the skills and experience necessary to excel in this role, send your resume to: jayne@grandriverpersonnel.ca


Grand River Personnel is committed to promoting accessibility for Ontarians with disabilities and complying with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, and makes accommodations available for applicants with disabilities in its recruitment processes.

title: Controller
description:
Are you a CPA-designated, hands-on Controller who has experience in a start-up environment with IFRS experience, and open to new opportunities in Toronto? Do you have experience implementing internal controls, strong technical accounting knowledge, and comfort overseeing the month-end process?


Do you have proven experience leading and motivating a team, diverse experience in a smaller-company environment, being involved with HR, payroll, and other departments?


If this role describes you and your experience well, this may be a great Controller ole for you to consider!


Reporting to the CFO, your duties and responsibilities will include;


• Establishing, monitoring, and enforcing policies and procedures as well as internal controls

• Oversee all accounts, ledgers, and reporting systems ensuring compliance with appropriate IFRS standards and regulatory requirements

• Monitor and confirm financial condition by conducting audits; providing information to external auditors

• Consistently analyze financial data and present financial reports in an accurate and timely manner

• Monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statement preparation

• Assist leadership in the annual budgeting and planning process; administer and review all financial plans and compare to actual results with a view to identify, explain, and correct variances as appropriate

• Prepare and manage organizational cash flow on a daily basis

• Prepare budgets by establishing schedules; collecting, analyzing, and consolidating financial data; recommending plans

• Prepare and submit Executive payroll, remittances, etc. for Canada and U.S.

• Complete operational requirements for planning, monitoring, and appraising job results assigned to staff; coaching, counseling, and disciplining staff


ADVANTAGES


- Excellent base salary offering

- The opportunity to work for a fast-growing start-up

- On-site parking

- Hybrid model


QUALIFICATIONS


• CPA designated

• Big 4 audit experience is highly desired

• Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills

• Strength with MS Excel and financial modeling

• M&A experience is an asset


If this seems like a great Controller opportunity for you to consider, please apply directly and email kristina@davidson@randstad.ca & bryan.hewitt@randstad.ca with your resume!

title: Controller
description:
Tla’amin Management Services is the business arm of the Tla’amin Nation. TMS has over 20 years of experience in conducting business, particularly in land development, forestry, aquaculture, retail, hospitality, and tourism.

TMS’ mandate is to generate revenue streams to foster the economic and social betterment of Tla’amin people. They are committed to establishing a strong economic foundation and providing effective management of the assets and resources.

At present they are looking for a Controller to lead their day-to-day finance operations and supervise a small team. The primary functional responsibilities include full cycle accounting, budgeting process, and grants administration and oversight of the payroll, accounts payable and accounts receivable. The Controller is accountable to ensure that TMSLP finance systems and policies are in place and effectively support the business operations, financial audits and mitigate risk.

The Controller is involved and supports presentations to the Board and FARM Committee and works closely with the TMSLP management team.

Responsibilities:

· Full oversight of the financial statements and budgets for five business entities

· Mentor, coach, support, and train team of three administration and accounting staff

· Take care of all government grant reporting and new applications

· Year End audits and reviews.



Qualifications:

Education and Training

· Accounting Designation (CPA, CMA preferred)

· Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business Management or Finance (minimum)

· MBA (Accounting or Business Administration would be an asset)

· Strong Proficiency with Accounting/Financial Management Software

· Proficient with Microsoft Excel, Office Word, Teams and Outlook

· Outstanding knowledge and understanding of applicable laws and regulations

Knowledge and Experience

· Experience in management accounting and financial administration and reporting, including internal control, accounting, budgeting, and cash flow (5+ years)

· Full cycle Accounting for multiple entities

· Corporate Accounting and Auditing experience

· Significant experience in managing all aspects of AR, AP and GL reconciliation

· Successful experience planning, organizing, managing, and communicating financial management activities

· Demonstrated ability to secure funding and establish strategic partnerships in support of program objectives

· Leading teams (Coaching/Mentoring/Training staff)

· Understanding of both Tla'amin Nation's and TMLSP's purpose and goals

Competencies

· Demonstrated ability to think strategically and be effective in both written and verbal communication

· Proven ability to effectively communicate financial information and be an influence for positive changes

· Excellent analytical skills with a solid understanding of accounting and business concepts

· Strong Collaboration skills to build relationships at all levels of the organization

· Ability to work under pressure and meet reporting deadlines

· Ability to be creative and think outside the box for idea generation in the support of the Management team

· Must be willing to roll up their sleeves and take a hands-on approach both withing the TMSLP management team and in the support of other business

  • · A high degree of satisfactory cultural competency and knowledge of First Nations communities

title: Controller
description:
Job Description:

Modpools, North America’s only patented container pool company, is looking for a highly motivated and career-oriented Controller to join our team!


This is a permanent position based out of Abbotsford BC and you would be responsible for the Abbotsford and Texas facilities.


As our new Controller and reporting directly to the President and General Manager, you are an impact player: people-focused and detail-oriented. You enjoy problem solving and thinking outside the box, but you understand the importance of good processes and you enjoy helping build and refine them. You are committed, tenacious, curious, and conscientious but most of all, you love to win as part of a team. You have a CPA designation in good standing and a minimum of 5 years of progressive accounting experience. You have strong knowledge of accounting principles and concepts, and experience with accounting systems and internal controls.


Requirements:

· CPA designation is a must

· Experience within the Manufacturing industry is a considerable asset

· Minimum 3 years of experience in a Controller role

· Proven experience building out accounting controls/processes

· Progressive mindset with respect to using technology to manage finance

· Solid technical accounting skills, advanced in Excel knowledge

· Attention to detail and commitment to follow-up

· Experience with US taxes and requirements

· Experience in a high-growth company is a considerable asset


Role Duties:

· Full cycle accounting, ensuring all accounting deadlines are met for all entities.

· Reconciling bank accounts on a weekly basis.

· Completing monthly Balance Sheet Reconciliations including related journal entries for each legal entity.

· Building and customizing management reports.

· Inter-company accounts reconciliation and maintenance.

· Preparing monthly financial statements for the group of companies

· Assisting with A/P, invoicing and A/R

· Prepare, input GST/PST/HST and overall compliance for the group of companies.

· Cash Flow Forecast (weekly basis)

· Fixed Asset / Inventory maintenance

· Gross Margin review for business segments

· Manage the overall data migration, rules and policies set up, development and implementation of the standard processes for all user groups.

· Lead the annual budgeting process, carry out spending against budget analysis, and update monthly and rest of the year forecast.


Why you should join us:

· Coaching and professional development opportunities

· Growth and the opportunity to help build an ever-evolving brand

· Competitive Wage



Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $120,000.00-$160,000.00 per year

title: Controller
description:
Introduction


Established in 1989, Terlin has become a leader and innovator in full-service general contracting and project management for retail, commercial, infrastructure security, and institutional clients. Distinguished by their end-to-end approach and unparalleled reputation for quality and reliability, Terlin’s state-of-the-art facility houses their custom millwork shop which provides an exclusive focus on the specialized needs of their clients. From design through construction and service, Terlin handles every aspect of construction and delivers outstanding and consistent results.


About the role


This is an exciting opportunity to leverage your technical and leadership expertise to take ownership of a finance department inside of a high-growth organization. This is a hands-on role that is truly meant for an entrepreneurial finance leader that doesn’t stray away from a challenge and takes pride in doing good work.


Reporting directly to the President and working in conjunction with the vCFO, the Controller is an integral member of the Finance team that is responsible for undertaking all aspects of financial management for the organization. As the Controller, you will be a critical leader in corporate accounting, regulatory and financial reporting, budget and forecast preparation, as well as the development of integral control policies and procedures.


You will have a clear focus on producing thorough, comprehensive and timely financial-status reports for senior management in both a routine and ad hoc manner to help improve operational efficiency and aid in continued growth. You will plan, direct and coordinate all accounting functions which include accounts receivable, accounts payable, inventory, job cost accounting, and close-out processes. You will analyze and manage Work-In-Progress reporting and perform margin analysis on projects for improved cost management and increased profitability, cash flow management and forecasting.


Is this for you?


You bring a minimum of 7 years’ experience as a senior-level accounting or finance leader with proven experience within an industry where you’ve gained an expertise in project accounting. You will bring a strong technical background in full-cycle and multi-entity accounting that is backed by a strong understanding of the nuances of finance, accounting, budgeting and forecasting, as well as cash flow management.


You believe that the finance and accounting function is not to simply keep record of financial transactions but can be a valuable partner to the business and help shape decisions in the path forward. You have an analytical mind that sees the value in systems and procedures and have proven success in both optimizing and implementing them within an organization. Your time management and administration skills are at a superior level which allow you to achieve results despite a large workload that is frequently evolving and in competition for your attention.


You have proven success in leading small teams that is complemented by a genuine passion for coaching and mentorship. You are a strong communicator that is trustworthy, honest and can make decisions with a superior and influential level of integrity.

title: Controller - Canada
description:
Company Description

Technicolor Creative Studios (TCS) is a creative technology company driven by one purpose: The realisation of ambitious and extraordinary ideas. We inspire creative companies across the world to produce their most iconic work.

Our award-winning teams of artists and technologists’ partner with the creative community across film, television, animation, gaming, brand experience and advertising to bring the universal art of storytelling to audiences everywhere.

Job Description

The Role

Reporting to the CAO - TCS, the Legal Entity Controller Canada (LE) will manage the financial control and accounting function including the production of management and financial accounts; records and associated controls; business partnering with multiple stakeholders and continuous finance transformation projects.

The primary responsibility of the role is to deliver consolidated view of the Canada legal entity’s accounting figures, in respect of compliance and accounting standards.

You will be supported by finance professionals from our Global Business Services (GBS) teams, who are responsible for the execution of our end-to-end transactional processes. In addition, you will partner with our divisional FP&A, Commercial Finance and RCC (Revenue and Cost Control) teams.

The role interacts with colleagues across European, Asian, and North American territories. Therefore, flexibility is required as the role will often require calls outside of normal working hours.

You will ensure co-ordination of all legal entity activity with key internal experts, such as tax, legal, treasury etc. and external providers.

Role Responsibility

Reporting
  • Improve and standardise management reporting processes within the legal entities/service line.
  • Legal entity controller ownership.
  • Closing sign-off, produce all management accounts actuals (P&L, Balance sheet & Cash flow) including variance commentary with support/input from GBS teams.
  • Report on balance sheet, working capital variance and provide detailed review and analysis of accruals, deferred income, and other key balance sheet accounts.
  • Ensure all IFRS 16 lease information and schedules are populated appropriately within the group lease management system.
Financial Compliance and Control
  • Support Finance transformation initiatives to deliver process standardisation/systemisation of revenue recognition, billing, reporting, and month end close processes.
  • Drive continuous improvements/simplification to processes and internal controls.
  • Ensure IFRS and Group Accounting Policies are implemented and maintained (Revenue Recognition, IFRS16, Intangible assets etc.) into each entity and line of business within your remit.
  • Constantly evaluate the period end process to ensure adherence to financial controls are achieved, and efficiencies are identified.
  • Ensure figures are reviewed with Business, Controlling and GBS.
  • Validate monthly/quarterly reconciliation of all balance sheet accounts and ensure proper documentation and follow up of all accounts based on risk-based procedure (including tax receivables/payables) in Blackline.
  • Request and approve intercompany flows (amount, assignment, …) for all non-goods flows.
  • Review and challenge most significant accounting journal entries with Commercial Finance, RCC, business and GBS and ensure proper application of local rules.
  • Provide technical accounting/policy guidance and write position papers.
  • Document and write procedures for all month end and other tasks.
Systems
  • Drive and align global trial balances to ensure all GL account/cost centre codes are used for the same nature of activities.
  • Ensure alignment of reporting in Group Reporting Systems.
  • Assume project management ownership of the TCS finance transformation initiatives and workstreams.
Tax & Treasury
  • Support the in-house tax team and external tax providers in relation to local tax compliance including transfer pricing reporting (computation and reporting).
  • Support the computation and completion of Deferred tax packages in collaboration with the tax team and GBS team.
  • Support the identification and proactively resolve issues that could result in tax misstatements and classification errors.
  • Monitor correct submission of all relevant tax declarations (CIT, VAT, other taxes, tax forms...) to local authorities by the Tax team and ensure payments are processed (GBS).
  • Report to Group Treasury requirements of FX exposures for all legal entities within your scope.
Other Controls/projects
  • Support internal/external audit management actions ensuring all reporting units in your scope comply with the requirements.
  • Prepare and coordinate external auditor review and monitor with the necessary escalation points to CAO then CFO then Corporate.
  • Support and lead 8Tics review and filing (Internal Audit controls).
  • Undertake any other reasonable task as requested.
  • Work in collaboration and support other TCS LE Controllers as and when required.
Qualifications
  • A qualified accountant ideally ACA/ACCA/CIMA/CPA/CA or other equivalent accounting qualification, with several years PQE.
  • An excellent communicator with the gravitas to manage both up and down.
  • Able to express complex / technical concepts to people from all backgrounds and levels.
  • Calm & organised; someone who thrives in a fast-paced world where priorities change.
Additional Information

Please click here to review our privacy notices for job applicants.

If you require assistance applying, please reach out to talent@thefocus.com and we'll be happy to assist.

title: Controller/Contrôleur
description:
Company Overview

Founded in 2002, Longbow Advantage is a leading Supply Chain Technology Company built to provide best-in-class WMS, EWM, WM, LMS, and TMS implementation and integration services. Our team of supply chain professionals have experience and expertise that is unmatched throughout the industry. We have a 20-year track record of delivering successful logistics execution solutions and delivering on the commitments we make to customers. All of this has resulted in customer satisfaction scores that are world class.

The ideal candidate for this role will primarily be responsible for overseeing the full accounting cycle and financial reporting, ensuring the financial control environment, maintaining our ERP system, and handling regular tax filings. We are looking for someone who is passionate about technology and numbers, with the ability to prioritize tasks, to be result driven and be an outstanding team player.

This is a fulltime position based in Montreal.

What’s in it for you?
  • Be part of a growing organization that values initiative
  • Room to grow, and expand your knowledge
  • Competitive compensation based on experience
  • 4 weeks of vacation + personal and sick days
  • Healthcare Benefits (health, drugs, vision, dental)
  • Opportunity to share your knowledge and learn from the team
  • Hybrid work environment – we have brand new office in MTL!
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Diverse, inclusive and environmentally friendly work environment

As a Controller at Longbow, some of your main responsibilities will include
  • Leading the production of monthly financial statements and other reports
  • Overseeing all month end and year end closing processes
  • Acting as the main point of contact for our annual audit
  • Managing cash flow and ensuring that bank accounts are adequately funded to meet disbursement requirements
  • Working with the team to optimize our internal processes and our various tools
  • Ensuring compliance with all government, legal, tax regulatory requirements
  • Producing annual budgets, quarterly forecasts, estimates, and other reports requested
  • Assisting management with other financial and operation projects as needed

The Skills And Experience You Bring
  • Minimum 3 years of experience (open to accounting firm candidate)
  • CPA designation or late stages of the CPA program
  • Solid knowledge of the accounting standards for private enterprises (ASPE)
  • Experience with Netsuite and highly proficient in Excel
  • Experience in multi-companies, multi-currencies & multi-countries organization
  • Experience in a fast-paced environment like start-ups
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in French and English
  • Outstanding at prioritizing and results driven
  • You love technology, innovation & you are a team player
  • Ability to handle data with a high-level of confidentiality
  • Open-minded - open to thoughts and ideas which are different from your own
  • Go-getter - no task is beneath you if it means achieving the desired result.

Controleur

Survol de la compagnie

Fondée en 2002, Longbow Advantage est une société spécialisée en technologie de chaîne d'approvisionnement qui fournis des services de premiers plans de mise en œuvre et d'intégration de WMS, EWM, WM, LMS et TMS. Notre équipe de professionnels de la chaîne d'approvisionnement possède une expérience et une expertise inégalées dans l'industrie. En plus d'avoir notre propre logiciel propriétaire, Rebus©, nous avons plus 20 ans d'expérience dans l’exécution de solutions logistique et dans le respect des engagements que nous prenons envers nos clients. Tout cela a permis à Longbow Advantage d’obtenir des scores de satisfaction de sa clientèle qui lui permet de se classer parmi les meilleurs de l’industrie.

Le candidat idéal pour ce poste sera principalement chargé de superviser le cycle comptable complet de l’entreprise et la production de rapports financiers, d'assurer le maintien d’un l'environnement de contrôle optimal, de maintenir notre système ERP et de gérer nos obligations fiscales. Nous recherchons une personne passionnée par la technologie et les chiffres, capable de prioriser ses tâches, d'être axée sur les résultats et d'être un joueur d'équipe exceptionnel.

Le poste est à temps plein et basé à Montréal.

Qu'y a-t-il pour vous dans cette proposition?
  • Faire partie d'une organisation en pleine croissance qui valorise l'initiative
  • Espace pour grandir et développer vos connaissances
  • Une rémunération compétitive basée sur l'expérience
  • 4 semaines de vacances + autres congés à votre disposition
  • Prestations de soins de santé, incluant médicaments, vision, dentaire
  • Possibilité de partager vos connaissances et d'apprendre de l'équipe
  • Environnement de travail hybride - nous avons un tout nouveau bureau à MTL
  • Horaire de travail flexible
  • Travailler dans un environnement diversifié et inclusif et respectueux de l'environnement

En tant que Contrôleur chez Longbow, certaines de vos principales responsabilités comprendront :
  • Diriger la production des états financiers mensuels, annuels et autres rapports divers
  • Superviser le processus de clôture de fin de mois et de fin d'année
  • Être le principal point de contact pour notre audit annuel
  • Gérer les flux de trésorerie et s'assurer que les comptes bancaires sont correctement financés pour répondre aux exigences de décaissement
  • Travailler avec l'équipe pour optimiser nos processus internes et nos différents outils
  • Assurer la conformité avec toutes les exigences réglementaires gouvernementales, légales et fiscales
  • Produire des budgets annuels, des prévisions trimestrielles, des estimations et d'autres rapports demandés
  • Assister la direction avec tout autres projets financiers et opérationnels au besoin

Les compétences et l'expérience que vous apportez
  • Minimum 3 ans d'expérience (ouvert aux candidats en cabinet comptable)
  • Désignation CPA ou à un stade avancé du programme CPA
  • Solide connaissance des normes comptables pour les entreprises privées (NCECF)
  • Expérience avec Netsuite et grande maîtrise d'Excel
  • Expérience dans une organisation multi-sociétés, multidevises et multi-pays
  • Expérience dans un environnement en évolution rapide
  • Compétences exceptionnelles en communication et en relations interpersonnelles en français et en anglais
  • Être excellent pour prioriser et être axé sur les résultats
  • Vous aimez la technologie, l'innovation et vous êtes un joueur d'équipe
  • Capacité à traiter les données avec un haut niveau de confidentialité
  • Vous êtes ouvert aux pensées et aux idées qui sont différentes des vôtres
  • Aucun travail n'est trop anodin pour vous lorsqu’il s'il s'agit d'obtenir le résultat souhaité.

title: Controller
description:
About Our Client: Confidential


Position Scope:

This position manages the overall finance and accounting activities of the company and works in close cooperation with the Global Corporate Controller and other department heads. This individual will be responsible for the timely and accurate reporting on the financial operations of the company. Duties will include month-end, quarter-end, and year-end financial reporting, including general ledger account analysis and reconciliation.


Responsibilities:

  • Establish and maintain all financial controls for accounting, compliance, and financial reporting
  • Financial budgeting and forecasting
  • Proactively communicates with corporate finance as required
  • Complete month and year-end financial reporting, including general ledger account analysis and reconciliation
  • Ensuring accuracy of invoicing and journal entries
  • Oversee budgets for core operations
  • Oversee the cost accounting department for facility
  • Conduct financial analysis and be a key asset in processes improvements and identifying discrepancies or imbalances in financial records
  • Maintain unit costs and inventory value
  • Complete customer billing and tax documentation preparation
  • Work closely with internal and external audit teams to effectively complete financial quarterly and year-end audit


Required Skills and Knowledge:

  • Strong communication, interpersonal, organizational, time management and analytical skills.
  • Must be highly computer literate, ERP systems
  • The individual will be expected to be familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within the accounting and finance field - cost accounting.
  • Proficient in MS Excel, Word, and Outlook, Teams, presentation development, and spreadsheet management.


Education and Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance or equivalent
  • 7+ years of accounting/ financial analysis experience
  • 2-3 years experience preferably in the manufacturing industry
  • ERP experience
  • Ability to travel within North America – 5%


Application Instructions:

To apply, please send a resume to Amal El-Rifai at Amal.Elrifai@summitsearchgroup.com or Aman Sodi at Aman.Sodi@summitsearchgroup.com


Summit Search Group is a fair and equitable search firm. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

title: Controller
description:
Who We Are

Copperfin is Northwestern Ontario’s largest locally owned credit union, with locations in Kenora and Thunder Bay. Our number one priority is to advance the lives of the people and communities we serve. We have a desire to improve the lives of the people who live in our community. We invest in our Members’ financial health and strive to ensure we are offering them the best financial tools to reach their goals.


About This Opportunity

We are looking for a responsible, motivated individual for the full-time position of Controller. This full-time position will be located in either Kenora or Thunder Bay, dependent upon the successful candidate.


Reporting to the VP, Finance and Treasury, the Controller has immediate responsibility for accounting practices, the maintenance of fiscal records and the preparation of financial reports. The Controller has specific responsibility for developing and coordinating necessary accounting and statistical data for all functional areas, with duties to include:


  • Maintaining direct accountabilities for all financial statements and reports generated by the organization.
  • Managing processes for financial forecasting, budgeting, reporting and variance analysis.
  • Establishing and maintaining contact with regulatory agencies and external auditors.
  • Revising systems when necessary to maintain integrity and improve efficiency.
  • Leading and supervising the budgetary process and assisting departmental managers in the development of budgets for their respective areas.
  • Monitoring and managing accounts payable, payroll, purchasing and budgetary controls.
  • Training and performance management of the team members reporting to this position.
  • Ensuring internal control systems and control framework are consistent with policies, recommending new and enhanced processes as the need and opportunity arises.
  • Supporting the culture, mission and values of Copperfin Credit Union, while creating an environment conducive to team achievement, productivity and professionalism.


What We Are Looking For

  • Post-secondary education in Accounting, Finance or related field, CPA designation completed or in progress, with experience in an accounting role with financial planning and analysis.
  • Knowledge of finance, accounting, budgeting principles with an understanding of credit union regulatory requirements.
  • Excellent skills in Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint, advanced spreadsheet and graphic skills.
  • Asset liability management, forecasting and budgeting experience.
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills are essential.
  • Ability to analyze and interpret complex financial data; detail-orientated and demonstration of a high level of accuracy.
  • Human resource management skills; previous experience managing people an asset.
  • Experience with policy and procedure development.


Why Choose Copperfin

We invest in our people so that you’re able to learn, develop and are well prepared to support the ever-changing needs of our Members while working towards advancing your career and expanding your skillset. We care about each other and believe in making a difference in the communities we live, play and work in.


  • We encourage the growth and advancement of our Team Members. Our Leaders support your development to advance and grow through managing opportunities and coaching.
  • We empower our Team Members to be decision makers while providing opportunities to work on unique projects from time to time.
  • We offer a competitive health benefits plan including employee pricing and rewards.


To learn more about why our Team Members love working at Copperfin and to get a glimpse of the exciting opportunities we’re a part of, watch this short video or check out our Facebook or Instagram.


About The Salary

The salary for this position will commensurate with the skills and experience of the successful candidate.


Please submit your cover letter and resume by Friday, April 29, 2022, to:


People and Culture Team

recruitment@copperfin.ca

Copperfin Credit Union

346 Second Street South

Kenora, ON. P9N 1G5


We thank all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Successful candidates must be fully vaccinated against infection by COVID-19. Candidates who are unable to be vaccinated due to a personal characteristic protected under applicable human rights legislation may request to be exempt from this requirement. We will do our best to accommodate those who are unable to be vaccinated.


Upon request, accommodations are available for all parts of the recruitment process

title: Gate Controller
description:
At Lowe’s Canada, over 26,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.

We operate or service some 450 corporate and affiliated dealer stores. With a distinctive product and service offering and complementary store formats ranging from neighbourhood hardware stores to big box stores, our Lowe’s, RONA, Reno-Depot, and Dick’s Lumber banners are always looking for dedicated employees to help meet the needs of all DIYers and contractors.

You’ve got the talent? We’ve got the tools! Here, your work and ideas will contribute to building a flourishing organization. Your voice will always be heard and valued. You’ll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills.

So if you’re looking to do what you love, and to grow and evolve within our family—one of the best employers in Canada according to a recent Forbes survey—we could be perfect for each other.

Your role:
  • Maintains Gate Person Systems and the overall appearance and standards of the yard and warehouse;
  • Verifies all items leaving the yard;
  • Performs routine re-stocking and housekeeping of yard and warehouse while providing exceptional customer service;
  • Operates the gate in an efficient and friendly manner;
  • Provides an exceptional level of customer service, internally and externally;
  • Communicates in a professional manner with all yard staff;
  • Directs customers to location of material, notifies Order Builders of customers requiring additional assistance;
  • Maintains quality assurance and inspects all products prior to loading
  • Assists with the loading of customer vehicles
  • Upon customer’s exit, ensures customer’s paperwork is complete and quantities match receipt;
  • Maintains quality assurance and inspects all products prior to loading;
  • Monitors customer returns coming into yard, checking condition, ensuring payment and completing "return through warehouse" form in absence of Order Picker;
  • Maintains warehouse, ensures area is well stocked, tidy and kept free of debris.

The qualifications we are looking for :
  • Position requires good communication skills to deal effectively with customers
  • Good physical condition.
  • Ability to work in a team.
  • Ability to work outdoors, tolerance to cold and heat.

Your benefits of working for Lowe’s Canada:

By joining the Lowe’s Canada family, you’ll enjoy many benefits, such as:
  • An inclusive and safe working environment
  • Promotion of work-life balance
  • Exclusive employee discounts
  • Benefits: insurance (certain conditions apply), annual salary review, etc.
  • Opportunities for advancement within the company
  • An employer that’s involved in the community
  • Teamwork and ongoing training
  • A comprehensive training program for all new hires
  • A company discount on store merchandise
  • A student incentive program
  • And much more!

The masculine generic is used without discrimination and only in order to simplify the text. Lowe’s Canada is committed to encouraging diversity and inclusion. We are pleased to consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, colour, religion, sexual orientation, gender, nationality, age, disability, or any other status protected by law.

title: Section controller
description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours.

You will perform detailed finance work, transactions and data structuring under the guidance of the Finance Manager. You will collect data, be responsible for maintaining information integrity, monitor reconciliations and conduct basic checks and controls.

How You Will Contribute

You will:
  • Execute aspects of finance planning and performance management process and related financial decisions potentially including Annual Contract planning/forecasting, target development, financial performance reporting/analysis, financial modeling and decision support for a focused scope within a region, business unit, country, Supply Chain, Mondelēz International Business Services or Corporate Finance team. You will also execute data collection and data integrity checks
  • Contribute to a strong controls and compliance environment in area of scope and ensure full compliance with our policies
  • Execute ad hoc analyses and projects as requested by the Senior Finance Manager (or Director)
  • Support projects to improve efficiencies and improvements to ways of working and embrace a mindset of continuous improvement
  • Contribute to a high-performing Finance team. You will also invest in personal development and the development of your Finance peers

What You Will Bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:
  • TECHNICAL EXPERTISE in financial analysis and data collection/structuring
  • BUSINESS ACUMEN and a basic understanding of our business, consumer packaged goods industry, and local snacking market. Relevant experience in a regional (or sizeable local) business
  • LEADERSHIP SKILLS including collaboration and communication skills within a larger Finance team. Team player with can do mentality to deliver results
  • GROWTH/DIGITAL MINDSET and the ability to execute opportunities and leverage technology to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness
  • INTEGRITY and sound judgement in all decisions and interactions aligned with our values and policies and external regulations

More About This Role

SAP Experience Preferred With Knowledge Of SAP MTI

Our community of over 2,600 employees is based across Canada, with our head office on Bloor Street West in Toronto. Canada plays a strategic role for Mondelēz North America and globally. title: Corporate Controller
description:
Description

The Company

Our Niagara area client has been in business for almost 100 years. They are a publicly traded corporation headquartered in the US with operations across the globe. They boast customers in over 100 countries across various industries.

The Role

The Corporate Controller reports to the CFO in the Canadian head office. The Corporate Controller has 9 direct reports and is responsible for all accounting, financial reporting, treasury, tax, payroll and cash management. You will have responsibility for the organization’s operations across the country including several distribution centres in Western, Central and Eastern Canada.

About You

You are a designated CPA CA with a minimum of 7-10 years’ experience in publicly traded companies with 7+ years in progressively senior management roles. Your background is predominately in global public distribution companies where you had responsibility for 200,000+ SKU’s. In this role, since you will interface with colleagues at all levels including the Canadian leadership team and executives in the US head office, exceptional written and verbal communication skills are mandatory.

Your Skills & Experience
  • CPA CA designation
  • Large public company experience
  • Previous experience managing a busy Finance team and overall oversight for the month-end close and financial reporting process
  • Past responsibility for accounting, reporting, tax, treasury, cash management and payroll
  • Past distribution experience, preferably in a multi-location environment with thousands of different product SKU's
  • Large ERP experience and advanced Excel skills
  • Knowledge of US GAAP
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
What’s in it for You?
  • Generous base salary
  • Annual bonus
  • Long term incentive plan
  • Full health and dental benefits
  • Healthcare spending account
  • Defined contribution pension plan
  • Company-paid CPA dues and tuition reimbursement plan
  • Team-oriented collaborative culture where hard work and excellence is always rewarded
  • Opportunity to be an integral member of the Canadian leadership team for a global multi-billion dollar publicly traded organization
  • Exciting opportunity with an established, financially stable, and profitable company with decades of market leadership in their industry
Requirements
  • Overall management, coaching and development of Finance team including 9 direct reports
  • Responsible for monitoring, and documenting all accounting policies and procedures
  • Oversee the accounting cycle of month-end, quarter-end and year-end financial reports and accurate close processes
  • Manages recording of fixed assets and depreciation in accordance with Company policy
  • Ensure all balance sheet accounts are reconciled on a monthly basis
  • Responsible for research, interpretation, and recommendations on complex/escalated accounting issues in collaboration with the CFO
  • Responsible for internal management reporting of all cost centers, branches, zones, and the Company overall
  • Responsible of all government and statutory reporting
  • Responsible for maintaining all banking relationships and treasury responsibilities including cash flow analysis and hedging requirements
  • Primary liaison with the Company’s internal audit department and independent auditors as required
  • Process improvements to improve profits and increase efficiencies
  • Regular collaboration with different departments across the organization
  • Primarily responsible for the establishment and monitoring of adequate internal controls to safeguard Company assets in compliance with corporate policy and adherence to Sarbanes Oxley requirements.
  • Provides leadership and oversight for day-to-day management of payroll, including employee benefits, wage and salary administration, policies and procedures, records maintenance, employee benefits, workers’ compensation, and employment law
  • Develops, interprets, and maintains all payroll policies and procedures, and ensures that all payroll practices are fully compliant

title: Gate Controller
description: Dreaming big is in our DNA. Brewing the world’s most loved beers and creating meaningful experiences is what inspires us. We are owners, empowered to lead real change, deliver on tough challenges, and take accountability for the results. We are looking for talent that shares these values, that is ambitious, bold & resilient. We want talent that is looking for fast career growth, cross-functional experiences, global exposure and robust training & development.

title: Controller
description:
Employment Opportunity: Controller

Status: Full-time

Do you want to work in an innovative and fast paced environment?

Do you aspire and have the initiative to grow with a company and achieve career success?

Are you a self-motivated individual with a can-do attitude?

If you answered YES to all the above, we want YOU!

Preciseley Microtechnology Corporation is immediately hiring a full-time Controller to join our growing team in Burnaby, BC.

What We Offer

  • Competitive compensation with annual bonuses
  • Company matched RRSP contributions
  • Stock options plans
  • Relocation assistance within Canada
  • Comprehensive extended health benefits
  • Flexible work environment
  • Work with an inclusive supportive team environment
  • Training and development opportunities in a growing company
  • Reporting directly to the VP Finance, the successful induvial will be responsible for all day to day accounting including payroll. This will include building processes, policy and systems.

Responsibilities

  • Perform and manage day to day accounting including payroll, accounts payable and accounts receivable. This position will be hands on with regular accounting activity
  • General cash management
  • Month end process and creating financial reports for management and board
  • Develop, improve, implement and document accounting policies and processes
  • Year end audit preparation and management.
  • Research and implement technology to improve and automate processes.
  • Assist with management of IT systems. Be the point person with the Managed Services Partner
  • Be responsible for tracking, monitoring, analyzing, and reporting on key performance indicators.
  • Maintain any procurement, contract, and other records.
  • Be responsible for managing and maintaining all sales data using the Hubspot.
  • Prepare business review presentations, reports and KPIs on a monthly and quarterly basis.
  • Develop, update and maintain sales policies and procedures.

Qualifications

  • CPA designation or relevant experience.
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role.
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite programs including advanced Excel skills.
  • A strong understanding of ERP and apps used to optimize processes.
  • Strong attention to detail with the ability to work fast and accurately.
  • Strong technical accounting knowledge.
  • A strong sense of problem-solving proven experience in developing efficient solutions.
  • A result and success-oriented mentality, conveying a sense of urgency and driving issues to closure.
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to develop lasting relationships with people.
  • An ability to utilize resources to improve upon inefficiencies.
  • Comfortable with handling multiple demands, shifting priorities, adjusting to adhoc requests, working with ambiguous situations, and adapting to rapid change.

About Us

Founded in 2006, Preciseley Microtechnology Corporation is a rapidly growing leader in providing optical MEMS solutions globally through designing and supplying a range of products, including mirror devices used for laser beam steering, switching, and manipulation, with diverse applications across optical systems, telecommunications, sensors, and other fields.

COVID-19

Our company is committed to taking every reasonable precaution to protect the health and safety of our people, volunteers, communities, and clients from the spread of adverse health consequences of COVID-19. With this commitment in mind, we comply with all public health mandates (locally, provincially and/or federally, as applicable) and have implemented various safety measures in accordance.

Preciseley Microtechnology Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from all qualified and aspired individuals. We thank you for your interest. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Controller
description:
Venor is proud to partner with our client, Mernova Medicinal Inc., in their search for a Controller. Mernova is on the leading edge of innovation with an international scope and is a place where every employee’s contribution is valued and can have a definite impact on the business. They offer a collaborative and engaging work environment. Employees are provided with growth and development opportunities, and the chance to work alongside dedicated and skilled team members.


The Controller’s principal purpose is to protect and create value in Mernova through understanding, recording, analysing, interpreting, and communicating all relevant financial data. Together with the CFO, the Controller is to run Mernova’s managerial and financial accounting controls, compliance, and reporting according to Creso Group policies and reporting requirements. The Controller is also responsible for financial accounting, compliance, and reporting for other Canadian subsidiary companies in the Creso Group, as directed by the CFO.


This opportunity will appeal to a CPA interested in having a broad range of responsibilities, reporting directly to the local Managing Director of Mernova, based in Windsor, Nova Scotia, and secondly to the CFO of Creso Pharma Limited, based in Sydney, Australia.


As the ideal candidate, you possess a CPA designation along with a minimum of 5 years’ experience at a Controller level. You are technically proficient, have exceptional analytical and communication skills, and experience in a manufacturing environment. You are a highly determined individual and are confident in your ability to work effectively within an executive team. Strong management reporting experience is considered an asset for this position.


Mernova offers an attractive remuneration package including participation in an employee equity plan.


This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a growth company with an international Head Office. To learn more, contact Ian Sullivan at ian@venor.ca

title: Controller
description:
Purpose and Scope:

This position is a key leader on the plant leadership team. Contributes to all areas of plant management and provide strong financial leadership. Provides financial direction to the plant and recommendations to improve plant performance.


Responsible for the maintenance and analysis of plant financial records required for monthly financial statement preparation, coordinate audits with internal and external auditors, prepare audit packages and prepare budgets and forecasts in accordance with IFRS and company policies and practices.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

§ Ensuring that the adherence to ISO 45001, ISO 14001, IATF 16949, ISO 9001 all Stackpole International policies and any other industry standards in all activities.

§ Accurate and timely financial reporting relating to the internal operation of the division

§ Organized and accurate financial records

§ Work in compliance with Safety, Environmental, Quality and Production Systems


Management Reporting & Control Systems

§ Overseeing the preparation of regular and requested financial reports and analysis for plant and senior management as well as for other appropriate parties

§ Report the monthly consolidated financial results to the shareholder using Hyperion

§ Work closely with the Divisional Controller to establish, implement and monitor accounting systems, policies and procedures for the Company

§ Prepare management reporting that contains analysis, recommendations for the future as well as identifying strategic opportunities to improve the operating performance of the entities

§ Prepare quarterly reports and analysis to the shareholder to meet external reporting requirements and participate in SOX audits as requested

§ Evaluate, develop and improve any operational accounting procedures and internal controls that are lacking

§ Assist in the development and maintenance of performance metrics for the Gates Production System “Lean” implementation and other continuous improvements principles throughout the organization

§ Financially model the businesses with a particular focus on EBITDA and cash flow

§ Maintain transfer pricing documentation in accordance with the CRA regulations

§ Access leading financial and I.T. systems information and practices (i.e. corporate governance, risk management, tax and SOX policies) to ensure best in class reporting

§ Communicate and build relationships by instilling internal and external stakeholder confidence by demonstrating global awareness, multi-cultural understanding and adaptability

§ Ensuring compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley internal controls

§ Financial performance, risk analysis and preventative/corrective action recommendations for the protection of Gates Canada Inc. and its stakeholders

§ Implement cost reduction strategies which fit the business objectives

§ Manage the reduction of physical inventory variances

§ Track plant performance KPI’s and report to management team

§ Monitor capital expenditure budgets and commitments

§ Perform post-expenditure reviews on significant capital projects and report to division

§ Track plant working capital performance to budget and follow up issues

§ Liaise with internal and external auditors and corporate officers


Accounting Processes

§ Assisting the Divisional Controller to ensure accurate and timely A/P & A/R processing

§ Monthly closing of G/L

§ Assisting staff responsible for the maintenance of complete records supporting G/L entries including sub-ledgers and reconciliation’s

§ Performing accruals and maintain cut-off procedures

§ Co-ordinate physical inventory and reconcile with book amounts

§ Prepare financial statements and analyze significant variances

§ Prepare year-end audit file and assist external audit process

§ Maintain A/P and A/R sub ledgers regarding fixed assets


Costing and Quoting Systems

§ Maintain project costing systems for control of tooling, capital, and SRED projects

§ Ensure SRED project costs are properly documented and are consistent with SRED guidelines

§ Maintain inventory valuation and analysis

§ Assist and coordinate customer tooling audit review.


Cash Management

§ Assist in processing of invoices for payment.

§ Follow up on outstanding receivables, claims, and other customer issues


Budgets and Forecasts

§ Develop budgets, forecasts and the strategic plan business model for both reporting entities and coordinating the activities with the management teams.

§ Assist with the preparation of monthly and yearly forecasts and budgets

§ Prepare analysis of future projects and programs

§ Track and maintain capital projects

§ Coordinate continuous improvement initiatives

§ Perform other related duties as required


Qualifications, Education And / or Experience:

§ Must have a University degree in Business/Accounting/Finance

§ Minimum of 5 years progressive senior accounting experience

§ Should have completed or be working towards a professional accounting designation

§ A strong attention to detail couples with strategic thinking and highly developed methodological, analytical, creative, and conceptual skills

§ Should have the ability to work in a fast-paced environment and have excellent organizational skills

§ Must have excellent applied knowledge of an integrated ERP system and have advanced knowledge of Windows, Excel and Word

§ Ability to work across cultures in gathering, consolidating, and presenting information

§ Experience related to steel and aluminum components would be a benefit

§ The incumbent should be a “self-starter” who functions well in a team environment and possesses a “can do” attitude

§ Able to communicate effectively, both written and verbally, at all levels of the organization

§ High level of integrity and dependability with a strong sense of urgency and results orientation

description:

Notre client, une compagnie reconnue, recherche un(e) contrôleur pour prendre en charge l'ensemble de la comtabilité et suivre l'avancement des coûts des projets.

Avantages
  • Tâches variées

Responsabilités
  • Assurer la fin de mois et la fin d'année comptable
  • Enregistrer et contrôler les comptes-clients et les comptes-fournisseurs;
  • Balancer des soldes de bilan inter-compagnie

Si ce poste de contrôleur près de Sherbrooke vous intéresse, contactez-moi - nicolas.graham@randstad.ca

title: Flow Controller
description:
The Flow Controller will be responsible of defining and update the supply and stock management parameters.

He/She will insure needs/resources balance for raw material, components, sub-assemblies and finished products by managing the customer's needs and the replenishment backlog.

He/She will insure products availabilities by taking actions to solve backorders and shortages.

Main Responsibilities:
  • Define and update the parameters of supply and stock management including ramp-up to achieve the target service level while reducing stock / SIOP (Master Production Schedule)
  • Ensure the quality and consistency of key data: Lead Time, Quantity, Stocking policy
  • Manage the continuous needs/resources balance (MRP, Kanban…) for raw material, components and sub-assemblies
  • Manage the replenishment backlog (creation and rescheduling of the manufacturing and purchase orders)
  • Manage the backorder portfolio (BOL), the shortage and to take actions to insure the availability of product
  • This position will support the Short Interval Management (SIM) process in accordance with the Schneider Production System (SPS). This requires daily participation in SIM meetings, documentation of barriers as well as barrier resolution.
  • The individual may be required to participate in daily operations meetings with various other functions of the manufacturing team.
  • The individual will work with Engineering and Manufacturing to provide value added lean solutions for material flow and material providing and handling.

Qualifications & Skilled required:
  • DCS (diploma of college studies in Supply Chain Management or Business Administration with Supply Chain is an asset
  • 3-5 years’ experience in Supply Chain Management in a manufacturing setting
  • Proficient with using computers and advanced knowledge with applications (access, excel)
  • Effective communication, facilitation, and strong negotiation skills
  • Problem-solving skills are required
  • Ability to plan and organize effectively and has strong decision-making skills
  • Experience with conflict management and resolution
  • Must be detail-oriented with the ability to multi-task

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

Why us?

Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

€25.7bn global revenue

137 000+ employees in 100+ countries

45% of revenue from IoT

5% of revenue devoted for R&D

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

If you are looking for a challenging and a rewarding career with a stable and reputable organization, this may be the ideal opportunity for you. This position is located at the Sonoco Canada Head Office in the City of Brantford, founded on the Grand River in South Western Ontario. As the Corporate Controller – Canada, you will be responsible for coordinating and maintaining the accounting and financial control system for all manufacturing and sales operations for nine (9) plants located across four (4) provinces. The Controller is a key financial resource and advisor supporting various Operating Divisions and oversees a team of two (2) members. The Controller contributes to an effective and profitable operation by supervising, designing, implementing, and assuring compliance with appropriate accounting and reporting procedures.

Specifically, What You'll Be Doing
  • Oversee and/or assist with corporate accounting and financial reporting activities such as Treasury functions, budgeting, re-forecasts, variance analyses, the intercompany reporting and settlement process, SEC reporting, and tax filings
  • Gain a thorough understanding of federal/provincial/municipal tax and other statutory reporting requirements and assist in ensuring proper compliance
  • Manage and monitor all internal and external audit requests
  • Provide guidance to Canada Divisions on matters related to accounting, ensuring Sonoco’s accounting and reporting standards and deadlines are met
  • Work with other members of Sonoco’s global finance team as well as outside advisors to coordinate intercompany transactions that impact the Canadian legal entities, such as receipt and payment of dividends and similar transactions
  • Manage a team of two (2) Accountants ensuring effective management and employee relations
  • Act as member of the Sonoco Canada Management Pension Committee and Board Member of Sonoco Canada Corporation, Sonoco Flexible Packaging Canada Corporation and Sonoco Plastics Canada ULC
  • As an officer/Board member of the Canadian legal entities, you will represent the companies in interactions with third party service provides, advisors, and banks and execute properly authorized contracts and other documents on behalf of the Canadian legal entities, such as corporate resolutions, tax returns, and other documents
We'd Love To Hear From You If You Have
  • A Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
  • CA/CMA/CPA/CGA designation
  • A minimum of 7-10 years progressive financial experience, preferably as a Controller or Financial Manager, in a multi-site manufacturing environment ideally with US/Canada cross-border operations
  • Exceptional planning and reporting skills with sound professional judgement and strong critical thinking
  • Strong ability to resolve issues and work well in a deadline-driven environment
  • Strong oral and written communication skills, initiative, and ability to multi-task
  • Experience coaching, mentoring and motivating staff and leading a finance team
  • Effective interpersonal skills to build solid working relationships with stakeholders
  • Extensive experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems such as Oracle, Coupa, Kronos and Workday would be an asset. Strong Microsoft Office Suite skills are required.

description:
Position: Controller

Location: Pointe-Claire

Our client, located in Pointe-Claire, invites a Controller to join their administration department team.

As a Controller you are responsible for the financial management of a division through the administration of accounting systems, preparation of reports, and maintenance of accounting records. You are a proactive individual who is the main support to the President and other executive team. Your main challenge will be to ensure accuracy and implementation of processes and streamlining and automated reports.

Reporting directly to the Vice President your responsibilities, among others, will be to:
  • Provide support to the president in the accomplishment of all his responsibilities
  • Recommend and participate in the implementation of improvement measures where necessary (this includes being a key participant in computer system troubleshooting, improvements and conversions)
  • Review the monthly and annual financial statements and supporting schedules to be submitted to the corporate accounting team
  • Control accuracy of inventory volume and costing
  • Prepare payables, receivable and reporting
  • Provide meaningful analysis of both direct and indirect production costs to management
  • Provide analysis of regular operating costs on a monthly basis
  • Provide a variety of ad-hoc financial reports, as requested
  • Do government filings, as required
  • Handle year-end audit

Qualification Criteria
  • Have an accounting designation such as a CPA and at least five years’ experience in a similar role; experience in a manufacturing environment would be an asset
  • Must be attentive to details, have a strong ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Must have an analytical mind, be a self-starter and have the ability to function with minimal supervision
  • Must have a hands-on approach, autonomy, diplomacy, tenacity, rigor, and flexibility
  • Must be comfortable using computer systems and quickly become familiar with the software in use in the organization
  • Must be fluently bilingual in French and English

title: Flow Controller
description:

  • Ensure the quality and consistency of key data: Lead Time, Quantity, Stocking policy
  • Manage the continuous needs/resources balance (MRP, Kanban…) for raw material, components and sub-assemblies
  • Manage the replenishment backlog (creation and rescheduling of the manufacturing and purchase orders)
  • Manage the backorder portfolio (BOL), the shortage and to take actions to insure the availability of product
  • This position will support the Short Interval Management (SIM) process in accordance with the Schneider Production System (SPS). This requires daily participation in SIM meetings, documentation of barriers as well as barrier resolution.
  • The individual may be required to participate in daily operations meetings with various other functions of the manufacturing team.
  • The individual will work with Engineering and Manufacturing to provide value added lean solutions for material flow and material providing and handling.

  • Proficient with using computers and advanced knowledge with applications (access, excel)
  • Effective communication, facilitation, and strong negotiation skills
  • Problem-solving skills are required
  • Ability to plan and organize effectively and has strong decision-making skills

45% of revenue from IoT
