title: Controller
description:
Controller, Penguin Random House Canada


As a team of dedicated book-loving professionals, we discover, shape, and share content that nurtures thoughts, dreams, and conversations around the globe, ensuring that new and established voices are heard.


We respect and value each individual and their lived experiences and commit to creating a more diverse team and establishing a culture of belonging. If you self-identify as Black, Indigenous, a person of colour, a member of the LGBTQIA2S+ community, or part of another marginalized group we strongly encourage you to apply.


We’re looking for a motivated Controller to join our finance team.


Do you enjoy working with and preparing financial information? Are you excited to understand all facets of a company through a financial lens? Are you passionate about books and reading, and curious about the opportunity to work for the largest publisher in Canada? If so, consider joining us on an exciting journey as we write new chapters of Penguin Random House Canada’s culture and employee experience story together.


Your contribution to the story:

Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, you will play a critical role in contributing to our Finance team’s complex and dynamic work. Not only will you ensure that our recorded financial information is accurate, timely, and consistent with internal and external accounting policies., but you will also be able to communicate our information to leaders across the company.


What you'll do:

  • Plan, direct, and coordinate accounting operational functions specifically: general ledger, taxation, payroll, and royalty accounting.
  • Manage the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data necessary for an accurate accounting of overall business results.
  • Oversee regulatory reporting, frequently including tax planning and compliance.
  • Organize and prepare internal and external financial statements.
  • Coordinate activities of external auditors.
  • Collect and assess financial information necessary for the budget and forecast process.
  • Oversee cash flow management and monitor foreign exchange transactions.
  • Evaluate accounting and internal control systems.
  • Work closely with the Chief Financial Officer to assess current accounting operations, offer recommendations for improvement, and implement new processes.
  • Hire, train, and retain skilled accounting staff.


Experience and knowledge you'll bring (qualifications):

  • At least five years of education or related experience and a bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS), accounting standards for private enterprises (ASPE) and/or US generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP).
  • Outstanding interpersonal relationship-building and employee coaching and development skills supported by a demonstrated ability to lead and develop a department and department staff members.
  • Well-developed written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent time management, organization, and prioritization skills that position you to successfully deliver against tight, competing deadlines.
  • A solution-focused mindset coupled with a drive to identify opportunities for continuous improvement and follow through to implement them.
  • Demonstrated proficiency using Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and experience with business intelligence software such as PowerBI and Business Objects.
  • Experience with SAP is not required but is considered an asset.
  • An inclusive approach supported by cultural competency and a proven ability to collaborate with people from across a wide range of diverse backgrounds.
  • Enhanced knowledge, awareness, and experience with the culture and history of any community that has faced marginalization are considered a plus.
  • Interest in or knowledge of media or publishing is considered a plus.
  • And of course, a love of books!


We currently are permitting most employees to work from home; however, applicants within commuting distance of our Toronto office will be granted preference in anticipation of our eventual return to the workplace.


In order to ensure the safety of our colleagues and guests we currently have a mandatory vaccination policy in place. If the successful applicant, you would be expected to comply with this policy, including any amendments made to this policy. For those who qualify for an exemption applicable by human rights legislation, we will work together to provide an appropriate accommodation.


Interested candidates should apply with their cover letter and resume, by May 15, 2022. We appreciate the interest of all applicants; however, we will only be contacting candidates selected for an interview.


Please contact Human Resources at hrcanada@penguinrandomhouse.com or 416-364-4449 if you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies.

title: Section Controller
description:
Job Description

Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?

Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Uniquely Yours.

You will work under the guidance of the Finance Manager and Ops Manager to maintain finance transactions, data, systems and reporting. You will also collect data and perform detailed checks/controls.

How You Will Contribute

You will:
  • Execute aspects of finance planning and performance management process and related financial decisions potentially including Annual Contract planning/forecasting, target development, financial performance reporting/analysis, financial modeling and decision support for a focused scope within a region, business unit, country, Supply Chain, Mondelēz International Business Services or Corporate Finance team. You will also execute data collection and prepare data integrity checks
  • Contribute to a strong controls and compliance environment in your area of scope and ensure full compliance with our policies
  • Execute ad hoc analyses and projects as requested by the Finance Manager or Senior Analyst
  • Support projects to improve efficiencies and improvements to ways of working and embrace a mindset of continuous improvement
  • Contribute to a high-performing Finance team. You will also invest in personal development and the development of your Finance peers

What You Will Bring

A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career. You will bring experience and knowledge in:
  • TECHNICAL EXPERTISE in financial analysis and data collection/structuring
  • BUSINESS ACUMEN and relevant experience in a local or regional business
  • LEADERSHIP SKILLS including collaboration and communication skills within a Finance team. Team player with can do mentality to deliver results
  • GROWTH/DIGITAL MINDSET and the ability to execute opportunities and leverage technology to improve operational efficiency and effectiveness
  • INTEGRITY and in all decisions and interactions aligned with our values and policies and external regulations

More About This Role

What you need to know about this position:

Responsibilities include:

Build strong governance on manufacturing KPI and cost deliverables, creating transparency, awareness, driving resolution of the gaps. Drive analytical insights with plant personnel in order to prepare the variable conversion cost and specific fixed cost budget and forecasts. Ensure regular tracking of it, adherence to budget figures and reporting of deviations. Track actual performance against relevant KPI’s, production standard of the conversion process including material, Direct Variable Labour (DVL), Direct Variable Exp. (DVE) consumption. Support timely and accurate new product development and costing. Help to identify cost drivers at the site for further productivity potential savings, business partnering with R&D and BD. teams. Support productivity project savings with plant personnel and Engineering to build savings funnel to meet plant financial goals. Lead Plant Loss analysis and Gross Productivity Planning cycle. Guarantee strict compliance with relevant financial policies and procedures related to internal controls, bin counts, cycle counts, and MRO counts. Ensure all bin counts completed quarterly.

What extra ingredients you will bring:

Education / Certifications:

Undergraduate Degree In Finance, CPA Preferred.

Minimum 3 Years of Experience in Finance and Manufacturing.

Job specific requirements:

SAP Experience Preferred With Knowledge Of SAP MTI

Travel requirements:

Work schedule:

 Business Unit Summary We are the second-largest snacking company in Canada and in the top 10 food companies in North America. We make and distribute delicious household favorites including Cadbury, Oreo, Mr. Christie and Maynards. We are an ambitious business—in the past few years alone, we have invested $250 million in our Ontario-based factories. Our community of over 2,600 employees is based across Canada, with our head office on Bloor Street West in Toronto. Canada plays a strategic role for Mondelēz North America and globally. We are proud of our “local-first” commercial focus that enables us to take ownership of our own market and make more, faster decisions closer to our consumers. We are also proud of our top 100 position on Forbes magazine’s 2019 Canada’s Best Employers list.

For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process please contact 847-943-5460 for assistance/support.

title: Controller
description:
Overview

The Controller will provide efficient and effective accounting leadership to all Steel River Solutions and Steel River Equipment companies.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Manage the accounting team, including Assistant Controller, A/R, A/P, Payroll and Financial Analysis staff
  • Participate on and provide support to the company’s Management team
  • Ensure accounting policies, procedures, and controls are in place and accordance with GAAP, applicable regulations and laws, and best practices are followed
  • Oversee monthly, quarterly, and year-end journal entries and supporting documentation, including analysis of final posted balances
  • Oversee A/P, A/R, Cash & Credit Management, Project Finance & Payroll activities of all Steel River Solutions and Steel River Equipment
  • Be the primary Banking contact
  • Oversee monthly reconciliations of the cash, equity, debt, and intercompany account balances and periodic reconciliation of other general ledger account balances
  • Responsible for/Oversee the preparation of monthly/annual financial statements
  • Oversee daily/monthly ERP entries
  • Responsible for oversight of monthly bank reconciliations and investigation of reconciling items for various legal entities
  • Responsible for monthly/quarterly GST/WCB/QST analysis and filings
  • Propose recommendations for process improvements to support efficiency and effectiveness of day-to-day activities
  • Support month-end and year-end close process

  • Contribute to other special projects as assigned

  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field

Experience:
  • Minimum of 7 - 10 years related work experience in senior accounting or controller related role

  • Excellent computer skills, specifically in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint)
  • A high degree of initiative and the ability to work independently or collaboratively in a team environment

Working Conditions
  • General office environment

title: Corporate Controller
description:

Geneviève au 418.572.2460

title: Controller
description:
Reporting to the VP, Finance & Accounting, and working closely with the CFO and VP, Treasury & Tax, the Corporate Controller is responsible for the accuracy and timeliness of the corporate accounting and reporting function to support the Company’s internal and external reporting requirements and strategic growth plans. In this role, you will be accountable for the institutional financial reporting requirements, the audits of the Company financial statements, the development of strong corporate reporting processes and procedures, and management of 4 to 6 team members.


Key responsibilities and accountabilities:


  • Accountability for institutional reporting requirements.
  • Responsible for managing the external financial audits and liaising with internal and external auditors / advisors.
  • Complete the annual and forecasted corporate entity budgets.
  • Detailed reviews of monthly corporate financial statements packages on both legal entity and consolidated levels including variance analysis, and balance sheet account reconciliations.
  • Assist in the design and preparation of monthly and quarterly strategic meeting presentations and materials by the finance team.
  • Management of the production of finance team corporate accounting reports, analysis and audits.
  • Development, implementation and communication of corporate accounting policies and procedures.
  • Monitoring and assessing accounting pronouncements, legislative changes, and regulatory announcements.
  • Leading, managing and develop accounting & finance staff.
  • Investigation and resolution of variances in reporting, internal controls, and general accounting.
  • Manage the year-end process including co-ordination with external accounting firms, preparation of working papers, tax workbooks, and other requirements.
  • Review banking transactions prepared by the corporate accounting team.
  • Analyze business processes and identify weaknesses and opportunities for improvement. Provide and implement recommendations.
  • Act as a key resource to the business and deliver value to stakeholders, including understanding and explaining key performance metrics for the corporate entities for the senior leadership team.
  • Treasury management for the corporate entities.
  • Review quarterly lender reporting for the corporate entities and assist with the management of the property level lender compliance.
  • Prepare, analyze, and report financial data analysis to support senior management’s decision-making process.
  • Achieve budget objectives by scheduling expenditures, analyzing variances, and initiating corrective actions.
  • Collaborate with other departments to understand new transactions impacting the corporate entities.
  • Prepare special reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information.
  • Supervision of direct reports
  • Managing the workflows and the workloads of direct reports
  • Collaboratively setting the individuals’ performance objectives, goals and providing performance reviews and ongoing feedback.
  • Encourage learning and growth and foster a fun and engaging work environment.
  • Assist with accounting research and issue resolution of corporate and operations complex accounting issues to determine the accounting and disclosure implications of significant transactions as well as the implementation thereof.

Key Skills, Knowledge & experience & Qualifications:


  • Must have obtained a CPA designation and have completed a university degree in accounting or a related field.
  • At least 6 years’ industry or public firm experience.
  • Experience in the commercial real estate, residential real estate, or property management sectors or experience auditing these sectors with a public firm would be preferred.
  • Well-rounded technical knowledge and experience working with IFRS and US GAAP.
  • Accounting and financial reporting process design and development experience is required.
  • Strong analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Strong leadership and people management skills.
  • Excellent time management and organizational skills. Ability to allocate one's time effectively, work under pressure, and manage tight deadlines.
  • Possess a good sense of urgency and the ability to handle and adapt to multiple demands, competing priorities, and constant changes with structured deadlines and deliverables.
  • Ability to work at a detailed level as well as at a higher and conceptual level.
  • Willingness to learn and work in a dynamic environment.
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and can collaborate with individuals across departments and countries.


Why Join WWC?


Western Wealth Capital is a rapidly growing real estate investment and property management business. People that thrive here are curious builders – much of learning is done on the fly, since we are growing so quickly. With that spirit of ‘doing it while we’re building it’, we also believe in supporting people on this great adventure of ‘doing real estate investing differently.’ In addition to great career growth potential in a high-energy environment, some of the benefits we offer at Western Wealth Capital are:


  • Flexible work hours and place – $500 to set up your WFH space, and $200 annually towards home office expenses for all team members
  • RRSP Matching up to 4%
  • 100% of premiums employer paid for Extended Health, Dental, and disability leave programs
  • An annual health spending account – to support you health and wellbeing
  • An employee and family assistance program to support mental, financial, and relationship wellbeing
  • Support for new parents – maternity and parental leave financial support for leaves
  • Paid vacation, personal care days, and office closure for a December holiday break
  • Development programs and tuition support
  • A ‘wow’ fridge in our collaboration-focused, shared office space … including snacks, espresso machine, beverages, and ‘all the milks’!


Equal Opportunities

WWC is proud that all applicable human rights laws will be followed in our hiring, compensation, benefits, discipline and termination practices and in all other aspects of the employment relationship. We do not unlawfully discriminate based on race, colour, ancestry, place of origin, religion, marital or family status, sex, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other classification protected under the applicable law. Our decisions are based on merit, business needs and bona fide occupational requirements. While management is primarily responsible for seeing that human rights protection is implemented, you share in the responsibility for assuring that, by your personal actions, the policies are effective.

title: Controller
description:
mCloud Technologies Corp. (“mCloud”) is one of Canada’s fastest growing tech companies, most recently ranking #57 on the Deloitte Fast 500 List and #2 on the Canada Clean Technology Fast 50 list. As a global provider, mCloud is committed to solving the worlds most challenging energy problems with AI and its proprietary solution AssetCareTM. In November 2021, mCloud successfully up listed to the Nasdaq, positioning the company to accelerate R&D, take new solutions to market, and expand its presence internationally. The Company currently reports in Canada on the TSX.V and in the USA on the Nasdaq.


The Controller will oversee mCloud’s accounting operations. The successful candidate will be a versatile professional with excellent communication skills. You’re motivated to achieve efficiencies through continuous improvement and systemization. The Controller plays a key role in partnering with the business and finance leadership team, informing leadership of actual and projected performance. Furthermore, the Controller will analyze business trends, changes, and new initiatives in a fast paced, dynamic, and highly collaborative, cross-functional environment. The successful candidate will be self-motivated, driven, have strong business acumen, and will enjoy diving into the details.


This position can be based out of Calgary, Alberta or Vancouver, British Columbia.


Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:


  • Planning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functions reporting to the Director, Finance
  • Maintain, review, and complete all general ledger reconciliations and financial report analysis, investigating and resolving account discrepancies
  • Responsible for ensuring accounting software is maintained current, accurate and used to its most effective capabilities by all level users
  • Review working papers for quarterly and year-end reporting
  • Preparation of annual/monthly budgets and forecasts as required
  • Ensure accounting entries are made promptly, accurately and supported including reconciling accounts on a monthly basis
  • Daily cash management and forecasting processes
  • Ownership of the accounts receivable and accounts payable functions and related accounting processes, including receivable collections
  • Oversee filing of GST/PST returns
  • Review bank reconciliations
  • Wires and online banking
  • Review, analyze and implement internal controls/business policies and procedures
  • Responsible for HR and employee management including hiring, training, supervising and resourcing accounting staff
  • Special projects on an individual or team basis as assigned.


Must Have Experience, Education, and Designations:


  • Professional Accounting Designation (CPA preferred) with 5+ years of experience
  • Knowledge of finance, accounting, IFRS, budgeting, forecasting, risk management, operational finance
  • Excellent critical thinking, analytical and problem-solving skills including the ability to think outside the box, and see the “big picture”
  • Strong relationship builder and collaborative team player with ability to influence stakeholders
  • Excellent team leader with the ability to motivate, coach and develop upcoming talent
  • Passion for continuous improvement


About you:


You are approachable, confident, forward-thinking, and have a winning teamwork attitude. As a self-starter, you multitask and adapt to changing priorities. You are creative in problem-solving and excel in a dynamic work environment. Overall, you navigate and act inclusively and collaboratively in an organization that brings together many different perspectives and skill sets from all over the world.


About us:


mCloud is unlocking the untapped potential of energy-intensive assets using IoT, AI, and the cloud. We operate three lines of business, connecting and optimizing assets like HVAC units in commercial buildings, wind turbines in renewable energy, and the control systems at process industry facilities. We’re a global company, headquartered in Calgary with a presence across North America, the UK and continental Europe, the Middle East, Southeast Asia, and China.

Today, we connect and manage over 59,000 energy assets through our AssetCare™️ platform. We help our customers double asset productivity, reduce their asset energy consumption by up to 25%, and triple the speed at which they are able to respond to the unexpected. mCloud helps eliminate about 80,000 tons in greenhouse gas emissions every year – or the same amount of GHG emitted by 18,000 passenger cars on the road.


Solving the world’s most challenging energy problems is hard work – it takes dedicated, talented, and innovative people working together as one team to make it all happen. We are a team, which means "we" comes before "me." And we are driven to deliver measurable, bottom-line results for our customers everywhere through our technology. We get stuff done and we have fun doing it!


Why you want to join our team:


If you want to be part of an elite team with the ambition to become Canada’s next big unicorn tech company, mCloud is the place for you. We are a team that helps one another succeed and thrive – you will get the autonomy, support, and flexibility you need to be successful from every part of our business.


Why you shouldn't join our team:


We are busy and fast-paced! We work hard. We are a global company, so our hours are not standard. Sometimes you might be up early or work late to meet with people in different time zones, but with that comes flexibility.


Our expectations are high. This is not an organization where you can hide or not constantly be driving for results.


No day is ever the same, and most days, you come in with a list of things to do, and then something happens, and you need to pivot.


We do not tolerate people who are only in it for themselves. We are a team, and we are all in the business of helping those around us succeed. We expect and demand nothing less.

title: Controller
description:
Pinnacle is an industrial wood pellet manufacturer and distributor and the third largest producer in the world with close to $500 million in revenue and over 500 employees. The Company produces sustainable fuel for renewable electricity generation in the form of industrial wood pellets. This fuel is used by large-scale thermal power generators as a greener alternative to produce reliable baseload renewable power. Pinnacle is a trusted supplier to its customers, who require reliable, high-quality fuel supply to maximize utilization of their facilities. Pinnacle takes pride in its industry-leading safety practices.


Pinnacle was acquired by British energy company Drax Group plc in April 2021. This was a major acquisition for Drax and expands their North American presence, providing a foundation for further growth. The acquisition makes Drax the world’s leading sustainable bioenergy generation and supply business.


To support the company’s forecasted growth and lead the financial integration into the Drax organization the company has launched a search to recruit a Controller who, reporting to the Director, Finance, will oversee a team responsible for financial accounting, financial statement preparation, cash management, and payroll. With a focus on change management, the Controller will be given the mandate to drive process, system and policy improvement. Automating and streamlining processes that drive efficiency, accuracy and timely reporting will be a key focus. Building an engaged finance team that interfaces with the business and is considered best in class is the strategic objective.


The ideal candidate is a CPA whose career encompasses time in a ‘big four’ accounting firm combined with a track record of success as an Assistant Controller, Accounting Manager or Controller responsible for monthly and annual financial reporting, cash management, payroll, internal controls and process and systems improvement in a complex operating business. They have a reputation for being a change agent who delivers sustainable process improvement. They are a strong communicator, engaged leader and team player who is willing to support their team and roll up their sleeves to get things done.


To explore this opportunity further, please click Apply.


We thank all applicants for their interest in this position. Please note that we will only be in contact with those individuals moving forward with our client.

title: Controller
description:
JNE Consulting is a full-service, multi-disciplinary engineering services firm with its headquarters in Hamilton, ON with offices in Pittsburgh, PA, Livonia, MI, and Auburn, AL. Our experienced and specialized teams work globally with a diverse client base, from concept through to engineering and procurement, as well as construction and project management services.


JNE Consulting is currently looking for a Controller (CPA) for our Hamilton location, servicing the JNE Group of Companies. www.jnegroup.com


Job Requirements:

 

Review and complete financial reporting to various third parties (i.e. financial institutions)

Interact with third parties for various purposes including financial audit and tax returns

Review and assess risk management / contracts / insurance /legal matters – terms and conditions

Support executive team with business planning

Report quarterly financial results of group

Oversee cash management / treasuring

Continuously review, maintain and improve internal controls

Complete special reports and projects as required

Manage accounting team including hiring, termination and performance reviews

 

The following skill and abilities are required:

Strong knowledge of financial and ERP Systems (Deltek Vantagepoint and SAGE Construction 300 preferred)

Excellent written and oral communication skills

Ability to make complex decisions in an effective and efficient manner

Ability to effectively coordinate and manage resources

Ability to provide strong and effective leadership

Strong customer service mindset

Commitment to confidentiality

Continuous improvement mindset

Ability to maintain a positive, proactive and collaborative work environment

 

 

Education and Experience Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or related discipline

Accounting designation CPA

Minimum of 5 years project accounting experience

Experience with Deltek Vantagepoint and SAGE Construction 300 (asset)

 

 

JNE is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive, barrier free workplace. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require an accommodation, please contact our HR team.

title: Controller
description:
As the Corporate Controller of this robust organization, you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment with like-minded professionals! Your primary focus is to plan, implement, manage, and control all financial accounting and reporting activities. The selected incumbent will provide meaningful financial expertise across the organization and act as a trusted finance business partner. Reporting to the Managing Director, you will have full oversight of the finance function and will work closely with the leadership team and CFO of the parent company on various operational and strategic initiatives. Main responsibilities include:


  • Oversee the monthly financial close process and provide monthly consolidated statements
  • Provide accurate and timely information, as required, for the auditors of the majority shareholder
  • Direct and coordinate financial planning and budget management functions including analyzing and reporting on variances
  • Establish and maintain standardization of financial procedures and policies
  • Contribute to the strategic planning process including annual operating plans and cost management strategies, etc.
  • Coordinate financial audits and maintain relationships with banks
  • Demonstrate strong supervisory and leadership skills
  • Ad hoc projects as required


This is a fantastic opportunity to work with a strong leadership team who will encourage you to step out of your comfort zone and grow professionally as you continue to take on increasing responsibility!


Qualifications


Mandatory:


The main qualifications for this role include:


  • Completed CPA designation
  • A minimum of 8-10 years of progressive work experience
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain the numbers in a clear and concise manner
  • Previous supervisory experience
  • High energy level and aptitude for problem solving
  • Strong Excel skills


Definite Assets:


  • Good knowledge of ASPE
  • Previous experience in the construction and/or real estate industry
  • Previous experience in a project environment – able to deal with different project managers
  • Track record of driving successful continuous improvement initiatives


Compensation Package:


  • $120,000 – $135,000 annual salary
  • Generous bonus
  • 4 weeks of vacation
  • Great benefits package
  • Free on-site parking


Location: Ottawa – South


Internal Job ID#: 4192


Recruiter Name: Matt Stevenson

title: New - Controller
description:
Overview

Virtek Vision is a leading provider of precision laser-based templating and inspection solutions based in Waterloo, Ontario. We serve customers worldwide in the aerospace, prefabricated construction, transportation and manufacturing industries. Our solutions enable customers to produce their products better, faster and at a lower cost.

As an integral member of the Finance team, reporting to the Senior Director, Finance, this role has both hands-on accounting duties and supervisory duties. The successful candidate must have solid communication, technology, analytical and management skills. This role is responsible for planning, directing and coordinating all accounting operational functions.

Functions will include, but not be limited to:
  • Manage the accounting operations (cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable, general accounting and payroll).
  • Direct responsibilities for inventory, intangible assets and taxation accounting (income & sales tax); review of working papers and journal entries; and completion of month end reporting supporting schedules
  • Weekly selection for vendor payments, electronic authorization of vendor payments
  • Assessing current accounting operations, offering recommendations for improvement and implementing new processes in adherence to company policies
  • Supporting adoption of new US GAAP pronouncements
  • Provide solutions to internal staff on accounting issues
  • Mentoring and supervision of four direct reports
  • Project lead for replacement ERP implementation
  • Coordinating activities of external auditors, regulatory audits, Statistics Canada and global tax compliance

Skills and Expertise required:
  • CPA designation is required for this role with a solid understanding of US GAAP, with a minimum of five years post qualification experience, five years employee management experience,
  • Understanding of US sales tax would be an asset
  • Experience with ERP/MRP and CRM systems is an asset
  • Impeccable attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple competing priorities
  • Ability to be a committed team player and provide exceptional internal and external customer service

We Offer
  • Great team members!
  • Competitive wages & benefits
  • RSP Program
  • Training Support

Virtek encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Accommodations are available upon request. Should you need an accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process please contact us at 519-746-7190 ext. 202.

title: Controller, Montreal
description:
dormakaba: ranked in the top 100 global tech leaders by Thomson Reuters!

https://www.thomsonreuters.com/en/products-services/technology/top-100.html

Company

The dormakaba Group is one of the top three companies in the global market for access and security solutions. The company is a single source provider of products, solutions and services related to doors and secure access to buildings and rooms. No matter where you are, if you need reliable and innovative access and security solutions, we will provide you high quality service – in hotels, shops, sports facilities, airports, hospitals, at home or in the office. Around the globe.

With over 16,000 employees worldwide (over 500 in Montreal), dormakaba is present in over 130 countries and has more than 150 years of experience. The dormakaba Group is headquartered in Rümlang, Switzerland, and generates annual revenues of over 3 billion dollars CAD.

dormakaba offers you a career not a job. Join us now and make a real difference in creating the next generation of products and services. Visit our website www.dormakaba.com

Position Summary

The Financial Planning and Analysis Manager, LGS AMER (FP&A) reports to the Canada Controller and is a key contributor to the Montreal Finance team, leading all monthly site reporting requirements, driving the budgeting and forecast process, and partnering cross functionally with senior leadership. The ideal candidate will have previous Finance and FP&A experience. The individual must possess excellent analytical and communication skills and be able to build strong working relationships with senior operating leaders.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
  • Provide detailed recurring analysis of spend (forecast & actual) and initiatives including ROI modeling and variance explanations.
  • Prepare reporting, oversee forecasting rhythms, and complete any ad hoc analysis required by local management.
  • Manage head count and associated costs for the site and ensure that changes follow the proper delegation of authority process.
  • Lead annual budget and planning processes for functional teams. Partner with operating leaders to develop realistic financial plans aligned to operational goals.
  • Establish operating routines with partners including standard reporting, metrics, and rhythms. Actively pulse business partners to monitor progress to monthly objectives.
  • Participate in process improvement projects to gain efficiencies in reporting and forecasting cycles.
  • Provide financial support for new initiatives and ad hoc data requests.
  • Participate and lead strategic projects aligned to our business and finance goals driving continuous improvement.

Qualifications
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks and projects simultaneously and deliver results
  • Understand macroeconomic context and be able to identify impact on the course of business
  • Accounting principles (IFRS)
  • Demonstrated project management skills; ability to apply sound business judgment and analytical skills
  • Ability to communicate at all levels with self-confidence (Executive Management), advanced presentation skills
  • Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work cross functionally and across business boundaries to solve issues and drive projects to completion
  • Ability to work independently and to work with and support senior leaders
  • Hyperion HFM and SAP (and/or similar ERP system)
  • Database knowledge is an asset
  • Working knowledge in Business Intelligence (BI) report writing
  • Knowledge of capital investment activities and return on investment capabilities
  • Experience in multinational environment
  • Operational experience and costing background
  • Experience with Canada / Quebec income tax
  • Treasury exposure
  • Communicates easily, both orally and in writing, in both French and English.

Education And/or Experience
  • University degree in accounting or finance, with CPA designation
  • Minimum of seven (7) years of relevant experience, in a manufacturing company (preferred)
  • Demonstrated business partnering

We offer
  • A fast-growing international company
  • A stimulating, fast and friendly work environment
  • An opportunity to highly contribute to the success of the company
  • Competitive global compensation
  • Free parking and on-site cafeteria
  • A 3-minute walk from Namur metro station.

title: Controller
description:
At Think Shift, we believe in building jobs around people. Our talented team of multi-disciplined creators and strategists have one thing in common: the desire to realize their potential and to help other team members grow as well. We help our clients do the same.

As one of the largest ag-focused agencies in North America, we help agriculture and agri-food organizations imagine their future — then re-invent themselves accordingly. Our people have a head for logic and a heart for magic, and our clients engage us to help them think strategically and craft the stories that will propel them forward. Through our progressive approach to leadership development, strategic planning, corporate culture, brand development and marketing, we help ag leaders see their true potential and leverage change to bring their traditional brands into the new world.

We’re looking for creative and strategic minds who share our desire to find and realize potential — for ourselves and for our clients. Let’s get in touch.

Summary

The Controller is a senior member of the shared services team who works very closely with senior leadership and our accounts team ensuring the company’s finance function is organized, effective, and efficient. They organize, produce, and communicate a detailed record of the company’s operations. The Controller oversees and organizes the system that produces timely and accurate financial reporting and forecasting.

Reports To: CEO

Direct Reports: Accounting Coordinators & Financial Specialist

We are Looking for:
  • A person looking to grow into a C-suite role.
  • Post-Secondary Degree and Accounting Designation
  • 7 + years' experience in a workplace setting, with preference for experience in a job cost setting.
  • Experience in multi entity and multi-currency accounting.
  • Thorough understanding of financial statement preparation and analysis.
  • Thorough understanding accounting processes and procedures
  • Advanced MS Excel skills
  • Developing ability in presentations including use of associated applications including business reporting and data management, and presentation software
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Well-developed communication skills
  • Highly organized with strong attention to detail
  • Ability and desire to manage and grow a team
  • Understanding of and ability to manage and oversee data in a multi-application ERP environment.

You get to:
  • Oversee organizational accounting and reporting
  • Communicate and collaborate regularly with the senior leadership team.
  • Create quarterly Board reports and lead financial presentations to the board.
  • Lead relationships with banks, auditors, tax advisors and authorities
  • Be a critical part of a highly functioning team charged with building a growing and successful marketing agency.

Benefits

Think Shift provides an attractive, market-researched comprehensive compensation plan, which includes base salary and company bonus. Employees enjoy a range of benefits, some of which include:
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits coverage
  • Semi-annual bonuses (based on Company performance)
  • Flexible work arrangements (work from anywhere)
  • Year-round opportunities for internal and external training and development programs

Think Shift is transitioning to a remote-only work environment on August 1, 2022.

Please note accepted applicants must provide satisfactory proof of vaccination at the time of offer. Lack of documentation will result in the withdrawal of the application.

title: Controller
description:
Headquartered in Montreal, Reflector is a new breed of studio working with top talents to create high-quality, compelling content for global audiences. By employing a true transmedia approach, where content is built outwards from fully fleshed “Storyworlds”, the company is able to tell richer, deeper stories that connect with fans everywhere.

Summary

Under the supervision of the CFO and with the support of the Accounting Clerk and Payroll and Benefit Specialist, the Controller is responsible for the complete accounting cycle of the company.

Responsabilities
  • Ensure the maintenance and optimization of all accounting and payroll processes;
  • Prepare or validate end-of-period entries and ensure month-end closings within a limited time frame;
  • Ensure the accuracy of various financial reports;
  • Analyze and present complete financial statements,
  • Support the CFO on ad hoc projects;
  • Collaborate with the members of the head office in Europe;
  • Manage annual internal and external audit processes;
  • Serve as the main point of contact with government authorities and the bank;
  • Ensure compliance with corporate tax obligations;
  • Contribute to compliance with the continuous improvement of accounting policies;
  • Participate in the development of the finance function within a growing company.

Qualifications
  • University degree in accounting;
  • CPA designation;
  • Minimum of seven (7) years of relevant experience;
  • Thoroughness and attention to detail;
  • Ability to lead several projects simultaneously while managing time and priorities;
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines;
  • High level of autonomie and organizational capacity;
  • Excellent mastery of Excel, PowerPoint and other office suite tools;
  • Strong communication skills in French and English, both oral and written.

title: Controller
description:
Le contrôleur aura la responsabilité de superviser le département de finance et comptabilité incluant la production de rapports financiers mensuels, trimestriels et annuels et d'assurer le maintien de contrôles internes rigoureux au sein du groupe d'entreprise.

Informations sur l'entreprise

Notre client est un acteur en forte croissance sur son marché

Missions

Superviser le cycle comptables des entités du groupe
Produire les états financiers consolidés mensuels, trimestriel et annuel pour le CA et les investisseurs externes
Analyser les États financier et participer activement au reporting
Évaluer les systèmes, processus et outils comptables, ainsi que les systèmes de contrôle interne de l'entreprise, et recommander des améliorations, au besoin
Assurer la préparation et la coordination des budgets, des prévisions et des projections de trésorerie
Superviser les opérations quotidiennes du service de comptabilité y compris les comptes à recevables et payables, ainsi que la paie
Gestion de la trésorerie
Assurer la préparation des documents relatifs aux rondes de financement et autres rapports spéciaux
Préparer les dossiers d'audit et assister les auditeurs externes dans l'exécution de leur mandat

Profil du candidat

Une expérience de 3 à 5 ans comme contrôleur ou poste similaire
Idéalement titulaire du CPA
excellente maîtrise des outils Microsoft
Un très bon esprit d'analyse et de synthèse
Capacité à gérer les priorités et travailler dans un environnement agile
Bilingue (Français & Anglais)
Vous êtes reconnu pour votre sens de l'initiative et vos compétences interpersonnelles

Conditions et Avantages

Rémunération et package attractif

Assurances & REER au dessus du marché

Autres avantages



MPI ne fait pas de discrimination fondée sur la race, la religion, le sexe, l'orientation sexuelle, l'identité ou l'expression du genre, l'âge, le handicap, l'état civil, ou sur le statut d'un individu dans un groupe ou une classe quelconque autrement protégé par la législation applicable en matière de droits de l'homme. MPI encourage les candidatures des minorités, des femmes, des personnes handicapées et de tous les autres candidats qualifiés.

title: Controller
description:
What are we looking for in a Controller?

The Ideal Candidate Will Have a Broad Range Of Experience In All Areas Of Finance And Accounting Management, We Are Looking For a Financial Leader Who Can Also Demonstrate In Depth Experience In Two (2) Or More Of The Following Areas
  • Financial forecasting and annual budgeting
  • Reporting, including preparing year end for external audit
  • Business and financial analysis to drive decision making
  • High volume accounts payable - both Canadian and USA
  • Accounts receivable - both Canadian and USA
  • Policy development and governance
  • Customer pricing and / or procurement
  • System development / implementation
  • Continuous process improvement
  • Team building & mentorship.
Additional Qualifications & Competencies
  • CPA designation with 5 plus years of successful financial roles within industry.
  • Knowledge of the trucking industry a plus
  • Supervisory and employee development experience with team members of various skill levels and abilities.
  • Ability to manage, assess and track business priorities for self and other team members
  • Solutions-focused, with a demonstrated ability to problem solve.
  • Being able to influence without authority and collaborate with all functions in a business.
  • Ability to explain financial information to all functions within the business / adapt information to suite the end user, taking into consideration they may not be familiar or comfortable with accounting terminology.
  • Extensive experience with a variety of ERP systems.
  • Microsoft Office with proficiency in Excel.
  • High level of integrity, with all levels of an organization.
  • Excellent customer service and communication skills (verbal, written, and interpersonal).
  • Seek to continuously look to review and improve across all aspects of the finance function.
About Bevertec

For 35 plus years Bevertec has been at the forefront of providing top level technology professionals to our clients across Canada and beyond. Bevertec specializes in technology professionals but looks to fill all professional roles that help expand and grow our client’s business and advance our candidates careers.

Remaining at the forefront of providing staffing solutions has been no easy task for us, that is why we depend on top-caliber candidates like yourself and our team of business development managers to provide you with the opportunities to work with leaders within the IT realm to meet your aspirations. As proof of our continued success Bevertec places candidates with leaders in the public and private sector and continuous remains a vendor of record with large organizations across the country.

Lean more at www.bevertec.com

How To Apply

Click the “Apply to Job” button and follow the instructions to submit your resume or contact the lead recruiter, Prishni Barkakati at pbarkakati@bevertec.com

Thank you for your interest in your next great opportunity with Bevertec

Only those selected for an interview will be contacted, Bevertec is committed to Employment Equity and encourages applications from all qualified candidates. title: Vault Controller (Afternoon)
description:
VAULT CONTROLLER (AFTERNOON)

Job location: Bradford, ON

Employment type: Fill-time Permanent Employment
Hours: 40 Hours per week

A Little About Us

Hi, we’re Aurora Cannabis, and we’re so excited to meet you!

We’re a global cannabis company driven by our passion to help people improve their lives. We have a diverse team who bring their best every day so Aurora can be the cannabis provider of choice for patients and consumers. We love our work, and we especially love our high quality, innovative brands that make up the Aurora family – from Aurora, Aurora Drift, San Rafael ’71 and Whistler.

Our people combined with our collective passion for the industry is what makes Aurora a special place to work and defines what we call our “A-Team”. We are a high-performing team of cannabis experts, innovators, and champions, that work, learn and win together. We think BIG, act BOLD and execute with PURPOSE in all that we do, and will stop at nothing to cultivate the ultimate cannabis experience for our community.

Job Summary

Are you a cannabis enthusiast with an energetic spirit? Are you looking to work with a fun group of people? If so, we would love to meet you!

We’re looking for an ambitious and hard-working professional to join our Supply Chain Team in the role of Vault Controller!

As a Vault Controller, you will….
  • Package bulk/packaged products into storage totes and label accordingly
  • Retrieve product required for all manufacturing departments
  • Organize and arrange the vault contents in an efficient manner
  • Prioritize and manage requests from various departments
  • Coordinate with Quality Assurance to facilitate release of product
  • Maintain an accurate and current vault inventory
  • Verify product inventory count in the vault on a scheduled basis
  • Complete vault documentation to track incoming and outgoing product
  • Facilitate, document, and communicate outgoing shipments
  • Receive and verify incoming shipments
  • Where applicable, must adhere to Aurora's SOPs and comply with Health Canada’s Cannabis Act. In addition, must adhere to all ISO requirements and the Occupational Health and Safety Act (OHSA)
  • Where applicable, promote and maintain GMP requirements.
  • Complete all required documentation using good documentations practices
  • Attend meetings as required
  • Other duties as required

You would be the best fit for this role if you have…
  • Comfortable working with Cannabis
  • Physical effort is required, lifting, pushing, and pulling up to 30 lbs
  • Ability to work weekends, holidays and after hours as required
  • Repetitive use of hands, wrists and forearms
  • Comfortable working with step ladders (i.e. step ladder/single sided step ladder)
  • Must be able to wear proper PPE (jump suits, safety glasses, hair nets, etc.)

Bonus points if you have…
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to achieve objectives, as well as prioritize tasks
  • Strong communication and problem-solving skills.
  • Intermediate to excellent computer skills in Excel, Outlook, S.A.P. and Biotrack

Why you’ll love working at Aurora

Our people are at the heart of everything we do here at Aurora, and we take pride in fostering an inclusive space that inspires our team to love where they work! From rewarding career opportunities to flexible work environments to team activities, we go above and beyond to prioritize your success and here’s how we do it…
  • Flexibility: you will enjoy a flexible work environment that is the perfect blend of work and fun! With flexible working hours to compressed work weeks to paid sick and vacation time, you will be empowered to achieve work-life balance.
  • Total rewards: we will motivate you to go above and beyond with a competitive salary or hourly wage (with shift premiums), stock options, an RRSP program, annual bonuses, and a health and personal care spending account for you to use for gym memberships, ski passes or staycations.
  • Benefits: we will foster your health and wellness (and your dependents) with our employee benefits package including, employer-paid health and dentalcare premiums, life insurance and LTD policies and a medical cannabis coverage program, designed exclusively for our A-Team, that will provide you with $3,000 of coverage each year (because we truly believe cannabis is the best medicine).
  • Life-long learning: we’re lifelong learners here at Aurora and will invest in your professional development throughout all aspects of your career! You will have access to a tuition assistance program, virtual learning activities and annual performance reviews, to ensure you are provided with the toolkit and support you need to succeed.
  • Perks: we love to celebrate our people by providing corporate perks including employee discounts, perkopolis memberships, company SWAG, paid volunteer time, modern technology and snacks and beverages at all our office locations.
  • Team: we are a diverse and global team of cannabis enthusiasts, energetic innovators, fitness gurus, caring parents, foodies and more, with a collective passion to nurture an inclusive environment that helps you grow and provide people better days with medical cannabis.

Next steps

Think you have what it takes to join our team? So do we!

Apply today by submitting your resume along with salary expectations through our website. You can expect your application to be reviewed by a human recruiter (not a robot) shortly after you apply, and our team will contact you via email if we see a fit.

Think you’re the ideal candidate but you don’t meet all the requirements? Apply anyways! We would love to review your application to see if you’re the right fit or find you an alternative opportunity!

Not the role for you? That’s okay! Visit our careers page to find the perfect opportunity for you or share this posting with a friend or colleague that you think would be a great fit (hot tip: if you are already an Aurora employee, take advantage of the employee referral program by referring this posting to a friend! If they are successful, you will receive a bonus!)

Diversity and inclusion

At Aurora, we are proud to foster and celebrate a diverse community of professionals! We take pride in nurturing an inclusive culture that empowers our people to be their authentic selves, celebrate their differences and love where they work.

Our diverse community combined with our inclusive culture, is what sets us apart in the industry and equips our A-Team with superpowers – and this is why, we encourage all candidates to apply for job opportunities regardless of race, national origin, colour, religion, age, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital and family status, disability, or any other identifying characteristic. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site or alternate format of job posting) during the recruitment and selection process, please do not hesitate to let our team know! We are here to help.

Health and safety

Our mission at Aurora has always been to improve the health and wellness of our core community. We strive to create a safe, healthy, and inclusive environment for our team and strongly believe introducing a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy will help us achieve this.

As of February 2022, Aurora has introduced a mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy for all employees and as a condition of employment, all candidates must provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19 or receive an approved medical or human rights accommodation prior to commencing employment with Aurora. If proof of vaccination is not provided or a request for accommodation is not approved, the offer of employment will be rescinded.

If applicable, Aurora Human Resources will contact you via your email address provided. We do not contact candidates over Facebook or other Social Media apps. You will never be requested to provide confidential information such as banking information or your Social Insurance Number in the interview process.

title: Controller
company: Tinnerman, A. Raymond Manufacturing Hamilton, Inc
description:
CONTROLLER – Hamilton, ON


SUMMARY:

Plans, coordinates and directs all accounting and financial activities of the plant in accordance with company policy and procedures personally or through subordinate employees.


REPORTING LINE:

  • Direct – Plant Manager
  • Dotted Line – Finance Director, ARaymond Corporate North America


POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Directs all functions of the general ledger, accounts payable, payroll, cost accounting, capital assets and cash management at the plant.
  • Ensures that all required month end activities are completed accurately and on schedule
  • Directs the completion of all Plant, Divisional and Corporate financial reports accurately and on schedule
  • Reviews all balance sheet accounts monthly to ensure accuracy and reasonableness
  • Coordinates the development of monthly/quarterly forecasts, along with annual operating plan
  • Directs the monitoring and control of standard costs
  • Analyze variances and communicates explanations to management with recommended actions
  • Coordinates the reporting of Cost of Quality information
  • Coordinates the annual physical inventory
  • Provides plant liaison with internal, external and government auditors
  • Oversees and owns legal entity tax reporting process and works with external accounting firms on entity tax obligations
  • Understands the treasury (cash management) functions at the plant including reconciliation to the bank statements, cash management and control.
  • Actively monitors the plant accounting systems and internal controls.
  • Supervises accounting staff to achieve the above
  • Partners with the Plant Manager to facilitate continuous improvement initiatives and to ensure monthly, quarterly & annual budget & forecasting targets are achieved/exceeded.
  • Works closely with all Staff level department Managers to understand the financial impact from their respective areas and to work in concert with them to facilitate continuous improvement.
  • Provides proactive consultation, interpretation and education of complex financial and operational matters to various departmental leaders used to drive business decisions
  • Provides data, analysis and advice to management in assessing and evaluating CAPEX, business opportunities, and strategic plans.
  • Communicates consistently & clearly with the Corporate Finance & Operations team to clearly explain the day-to-day financial details as necessary.
  • Encourages the development of accounting staff
  • Other duties as assigned.


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

  • Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting program required. Professional accounting designation (CPA) preferred.
  • Strong background in cost accounting, CMA certification preferred
  • SAP experience is strongly desired. Working knowledge of modules F.I. and C.O. would be a definite asset.
  • 6-10 years of progressive accounting and financial experience preferably with a sizable manufacturing company. Experience in a Controller role is desired


SKILLS REQUIRED:

  • Thorough knowledge and understanding of accounting principles and concepts with 6-10 years of progressive experience
  • Experience in driving improved operating performance throughout the plant utilizing fact-based data and root cause analysis in a collaborative manner
  • Familiarity with ERP information systems, SAP preferred, and solid experience with Excel and other Microsoft desktop systems
  • Understanding of all government financial reporting requirements affecting the plant
  • Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles, standard accounting methods and procedures, and continuing developments in accounting concepts
  • Demonstrate the highest standards of personal and professional integrity and character and promote ethical business behavior throughout the organization consistent with the ARaymond Code of Conduct and other policies.
  • Highly motivated with excellent interpersonal skills in a team-based atmosphere
  • Have strong organizational skills with a proven ability to multi-task
  • Unrivaled commitment to initiate & work with others to facilitate continuous improvement
  • Strong Leadership skills for supervising the accounting staff
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to interface effectively with all levels of the organization.
  • Able to explain basic financial concepts to assist non-financial Managers.


LANGUAGES REQUIREMENT:

  • Fluent in English


REPORTING TO THIS POSITION:

  • Staff Accountant, Accounts Payable, IT Specialist.

title: Controller
description:
The Opportunity

The Controller is responsible for the overall management of the accounting and finance function including month-end / year-end reporting and financial audits. The Controller is responsible for the implementation and management of the internal control environment and will continuously seek out areas for improvement. The Controller is the owner of the local treasury function, generating a meaningful cash flow forecast to assist Corporate Treasury in making key decisions. The Controller is also responsible for managing transfer price changes in line with NNCI transfer pricing strategy.

Overview

Key Areas of Responsibility:
  • Financial Process, Financial Reporting and Audits (30%)
  • Internal Controls / Compliance (20%)
  • Treasury (15%)
  • Transfer Pricing (10%)
  • Contract & Insurance Review (10%)
  • Digitalization and Other Projects (15%)
Financial Process, Financial Reporting and Audits: 30%
  • Manage month-end / year-end financial closing process and provide guidance and direction to the line of business and other finance personnel.
  • Knowledge of the operation of the general ledger system ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of financial results and reporting requirements.
  • Review monthly reconciliations to ensure accurate and in accordance with IFRS and Global requirements.
  • Approve line of business accruals on a monthly basis ensuring liabilities are in accordance with IFRS and sufficient supporting documentation is attached.
  • Manage and establish KPIs for the Global Business Services team as it relates to financial reporting ensuring consistent and regular communications are established and guidance is provided. Ensure adherence to KPIs.
  • Lead responsibility in preparing financial reporting for local and global requirements, and ensuring financial records are maintained in compliance with accepted policies and practices.
  • Jointly responsible for review and validation of Product Listing Agreement (PLA) accruals with Revenue & Trade Manager.
  • Management of internal and external audits, and collaborating cross-functionally to ensure all audit requirements are being fulfilled.
  • Cost center owner for NNCI head office cost budget, including preparation, reconciliation to actuals and providing commentary to FP&A team.
  • Proactively identifies, assesses and recommends improvements in financial processes including operations with shared services looking for further efficiencies and streamlining processes.
  • Cultivate a thorough understanding of key functions of North American businesses to identify best practices for standardization.
Internal Controls / Compliance: 20%
  • Responsible for finance internal control environment in line with internal control reporting framework.
  • Responsible for the design, implementation and compliance of NNCI SARBOX scope.
  • Responsible for ensuring existence and completeness of controls, and providing sufficient supporting documentation for SARBOX testing by internal and external auditors.
  • Partners with line of business to develop, implement and maintain an adequate system of internal controls throughout the Company, continuously identifying opportunities to strengthen internal financial controls while maintaining efficiencies in processes.
  • Monitors internal controls system for NNCI identifying immediate actions to mitigate internal control weaknesses / noncompliance, reporting any areas of concern or noncompliance to the Director, Financial Operations.
  • Ensures documentation is at reperformance standard and in line with retention requirements.
Treasury: 15%
  • Responsible for the monthly cash flow forecast preparation, analysis and submission to Corporate Treasury.
  • Management of the internal and external banking relationships to ensure NNCI receives appropriate level of required service.
  • Manage the execution of annual dividend plans to ensure repatriation to NNAS within Corporate Treasury requirements or other treasury transactions as required.
  • Analysis of long-term treasury implications to provide input on NNCI’s cash management strategies
Transfer Pricing: 10%
  • Owner of the preparation and presentation of therapy profit and loss “P&L” statements ensuring required annual return on sales are achieved.
  • Preparation of transfer pricing adjustment calculations.
  • Responsible for managing transfer price changes and reporting requirements in line with NNCI transfer pricing strategy set by the AD, Tax.
  • Maintaining transfer pricing documentation and reporting in accordance with headquarter and external requirements.
Contract & Insurance Review: 10%
  • Review and negotiate contracts on behalf of finance considering all accounting implications and ensure sufficient insurance requirements are met.
  • Manage the insurance covering Novo Nordisk Canada in accordance with Global and Local coverage requirements.
  • Development of contract insurance clause templates for NNCI that are in line with risk requirements to be used by cross-functional teams.
Projects & Other: 15%
  • Develop digitalization framework and implement automation workflows (i.e. Alteryx) to improve efficiencies within the finance department in line with Global Finance Strategy, engaging external partners where necessary. Providing guidance and training on digitalization initiatives to members of the finance team
  • Provide guidance and coaching to Finance Associate on day-to-day tasks
  • Other ad hoc tasks as required by the Director, Financial Operations
Skills And Qualifications
  • Business/Accounting/Commerce Degree
  • Designation (CPA, CA)
  • Proven success and minimum of 5 years related work experience
  • In-depth Knowledge of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) and Internal Controls
  • Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Applications (Excel, Word etc)
  • Takes ownership, assumes accountability and demonstrates leadership potential
  • Strong attention to detail
  • Proven ability to proactively identify and manage risks and issues and follow-up in a timely manner
  • Ability to work in demanding and changing environments, managing projects and deadlines with minimal supervision
  • Advanced knowledge in finance processes
  • High integrity and trust
  • Continuous improvement mindset
  • Develops and maintains strong internal relationships
Preferred Experience Requirement
  • Experience with SAP and SAP Business Warehouse preferred
  • Knowledge and experience in pharmaceutical industry preferred
  • Experience in external audit and internal controls preferred
  • Experience with Alteryx, Tableau, and other digitalization tools is preferred
Internal Application Deadline: March 30, 2022

Novo Nordisk Canada Inc. requires all employees, both Field and Office-Based, to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine by November 15, 2021. Please confirm that you are fully vaccinated, are willing to be fully vaccinated prior to starting employment.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

title: Gate Controller
description:
At Lowe’s Canada, over 26,000 employees let their passion blossom every day. Our teams are driven by the desire to help people bring their projects to life and are committed to making a difference in the communities we serve.

We operate or service some 450 corporate and affiliated dealer stores. With a distinctive product and service offering and complementary store formats ranging from neighbourhood hardware stores to big box stores, our Lowe’s, RONA, Reno-Depot, and Dick’s Lumber banners are always looking for dedicated employees to help meet the needs of all DIYers and contractors.

You’ve got the talent? We’ve got the tools! Here, your work and ideas will contribute to building a flourishing organization. Your voice will always be heard and valued. You’ll find career opportunities that live up to your ambitions and be able to further develop your unique set of skills.

So if you’re looking to do what you love, and to grow and evolve within our family—one of the best employers in Canada according to a recent Forbes survey—we could be perfect for each other.

Your Role
  • Maintains Gate Person Systems and the overall appearance and standards of the yard and warehouse;
  • Verifies all items leaving the yard;

Your Benefits Of Working For Lowe’s Canada

title: Director Of Finance And Accounting
description:
Reporting directly to the President & COO, the Finance Director will provide coverage for a maternity leave for the current Head of Finance over a 13-month contract. The chosen candidate will lead the accounting and finance functions for the Canadian organization, managing a team of 5 and working cross-functionally with Commercial, Marketing, Innovation, HR and Operations. This role wears a lot of different hats and has a lot of Executive exposure, so you’ll need an entrepreneurial spirit with no hesitation to “roll up your sleeves” and dive into something new. It’s a lot of work, but the reward is being part of our amazing culture: fast-paced, employee-focused, and always exciting.

 

The contract will begin in July 2022 and end in September 2023.

 

Responsibilities:


General:

  • Responsible and accountable for financial results, reporting directly to the President & COO and Board of Directors on a monthly basis
  • Manage team of 5 (2 direct reports), providing coaching and development to help achieve their annual KPI’s, expand their capabilities, and grow their careers
  • Assist as needed in HR, Legal and IT functions

Accounting & Finance:

  • Oversee month- and year-end close proceedings, completing deliverables within deadlines and ensuring a high level of accuracy
  • Working with FP&A Manager on monthly P&L, Balance Sheet and Cash flow forecasting, gross margin and variance analysis, providing results to Executive Management. Actively measure results against business plan/forecast and last year, proactively calling attention to risk areas and mitigation opportunities
  • Oversee annual budgeting process (2023), participate in long-range planning updates
  • Work with Accounting Manager and FP&A Manager to implement AP (Accounting) and Planning (FP&A) systems
  • Actively manage credit facilities, ensuring compliance with bank covenants and seasonal cash flow constraints
  • Administer customer pricing functions
  • Represent Finance in monthly S&OP Meetings
  • Propose and/or assist with assessing and implementing cost-savings initiatives
  • Coordinate and be accountable for indirect tax compliance, oversee submission of all tax filings including annual corporate tax return
  • Coordinate year-end review engagement with Accounting Manager and external auditors
  • Oversee and implement necessary internal control measures, ensure effectiveness

Qualifications:

  • CPA (or equivalent) designation is an asset
  • Bachelor’s degree in business, accounting, or finance
  • 5+ years direct experience in hands-on accounting operations (ERP system usage)
  • CPG industry experience required, beverage alcohol experience is an advantage
  • Strong demonstrable skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
  • Critical thinker with strong problem-solving skills
  • Excellent communication skills, able to explain financial concepts to non-finance people
  • An entrepreneurial spirit – strong desire to “roll up your sleeves” and get involved
  • Comfortable with a constantly changing, high-growth culture
  • Excellent time-management skills: able to multi-task, manage multiple projects and deadlines, and re-prioritize as things change


Our Ideal Candidate:


  • Culture fit is key, so we hope this job description appeals to you. If it doesn’t, that’s probably a red flag. Maybe this isn’t for you
  • Master multi-tasker – flexible and able to prioritize
  • Acts as a brand ambassador; we don’t have a large sales team, so you’ll need to tell all your friends & friends of friends about us
  • Friendly, outgoing, enjoys a casual work environment & fits in with a small team
