title: Director, Carbon Accounting & Finance
description:
The Organization

Wolf Midstream is an Alberta-based private company backed by CPP Investments. Wolf was formed in 2015 to focus on the acquisition and construction of high-quality midstream infrastructure assets in Western Canada. Wolf has grown through a series of acquisitions resulting in 100% ownership of the Access Pipeline System and the recent greenfield construction of the Alberta Carbon Trunk Line, a CO2 capture and transportation system. It is currently constructing the NGL North project, a fully integrated natural gas liquids recovery, transportation, and separation system. Wolf, with its team of nearly 200 employees, is committed to developing innovative, sustainable midstream solutions and transforming the future of carbon reduction through the development of world-scale CO2 infrastructure in both Canada and abroad.

Wolf’s mission is to maintain operational excellence, foster strong relationships with customers and stakeholders, and enrich communities while generating returns on investment. Wolf has an uncompromising commitment and respect for health, safety, and the environment. Based on a strong set of core values, Wolf’s defining behaviors are Act Like Shareholders, Be Customer Focused, Be Courageous, Do the Right Thing and Own It!”

The Opportunity

Wolf Carbon, a division of Wolf, is focused on constructing, owning, and operating Carbon Capture, Utilization and Storage CCUS infrastructure in Canada. Wolf’s initial carbon asset is the ACTL which Wolf operates and is the world’s largest capacity CO2 pipeline focused on man-made CO2. Wolf is currently developing a permanent storage solution that will be connected to the ACTL and seeking additional growth areas in CO2 infrastructure.

This role provides senior level leadership for Wolf Carbon’s accounting and financial functions. It is an excellent opportunity for a high energy individual to be integrally involved in the business operations, business growth initiatives, and other strategic initiatives which extend Wolf Carbon’s expanding business.

Key Responsibilities

The successful candidate’s duties will involve finance, treasury, and operations accounting. In addition, you will support the Wolf Carbon new deal team with financial modeling and analysis and structuring.
  • Reports to the Wolf Carbon President and will manage, coach, and provide professional mentoring to one professional senior accountant.
  • Oversee timeliness and integrity of all accounting, accounts payable, tax, and financial reporting functions.
  • Monitor revenue, operating costs, G&A, and capital budgets.
  • Provides senior leadership for budget and forecasting processes.
  • Review day-to-day accounting vouchers, cash ledger, bank reconciliations, and GST filings.
  • Review month-end close including general ledger analysis and reconciliations.
  • Review monthly revenue and operating accruals, invoices, management reports and cash forecast.
  • Accountable for financial risk management for Wolf Carbon and act as a key liaison with external broker for insurance products.
  • Provides senior leadership to supporting staff that liaise directly with auditors for commercial audits and annual financial audits.
  • Oversee, implement jointly with others, and monitor internal controls for financial reporting.
  • Represent Wolf Carbon on strategic finance initiatives at the Wolf platform level.
  • Provide financial modeling support for new opportunity analysis working closely with the Wolf Carbon Business Development team and Wolf platform.
  • Provides guidance on modelling and forecasting for new opportunities into existing Wolf Carbon financial model.
  • Contribute to the new opportunity investment materials for Wolf leadership and the Board.

Qualifications And Experience

Skills:
  • Self-starter with the ability to contribute at both a strategic and a detailed operational level in a lean organization.
  • Strong understanding of the utility or midstream energy industry in Western Canada.
  • Solid IFRS financial reporting skills and proficient in accounting practices, procedures, and systems.
  • Robust problem solving and decision-making skills.
  • Critical thinking skills to support the development and implementation of key accounting and finance processes.
  • Proficiency in excel including financial modeling.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Attention to detail, organization, and desired accuracy.

Education:
  • Professional accounting or finance designation
  • MBA, CFA or CBV designation a bonus

Experience:
  • Minimum of 10 years related experience in senior financial roles within the energy industry.
  • A proven track record successfully meeting commitments in a deadline-driven, fast paced environment.
  • Experience in interpreting, operationalizing, and administering terms and conditions of complex contracts.

Rewards:
  • Competitive compensation and bonus program
  • Comprehensive benefits
  • Employer matched savings plan
  • Hybrid remote work model
  • Parental leave top-up
  • Flex time

Wolf Midstream is an equal opportunity employer.

Wolf acknowledges that our operations are within the traditional territories of the Indigenous peoples of the Treaty 6, Treaty 7, and Treaty 8 regions and the Métis Settlements and Métis Nation of Alberta, Regions 1, 2, 3 and 4. We respect the histories, languages, and cultures of First Nations, Metis, Inuit, and all First Peoples of Canada, whose presence continues to enrich our company and the greater community.

Interested candidates should apply at www.wolfmidstream.com by May 16, 2022. We thank all for their interest; however, only those considered for an interview will be contacted.

Apply Now

title: Controller - (Langley)
location: City of Langley, British Columbia, Canada
description:
Otter Co-op is now accepting applications for a Controller at our Administration Office located in Langley, BC.

Who we are:

Otter Co-op is a $350 million dollar retail co-operative with a diverse portfolio of commodities which includes liquor, petroleum, food, feed, pharmacy, hardware, family fashions and hospitality. Co-op does business differently. As a co-operative, we believe in working together to serve Western Canadians, delivering profits back to our communities and investing in sustainable growth. To learn more about who we are and how you can help bring our brand to life, visit us at www.otterco-op.crs.

What you’ll do:
  • Coordinate an effective, efficient, and timely period-end close process, including ownership of the general ledger and preparation of financial statements.
  • Contribute to the annual budget process, including any necessary maintenance and re-forecasts during the fiscal year.
  • Identifies potential financial risks and recommends corrective actions.
  • Regulatory compliance and understanding of Federal and Provincial tax applications in a retail & petroleum environment.
  • The role will assist in the management of the treasury function, as it relates to bank accounts, monitoring and adjusting foreign exchange rates.
  • Directs the training and mentorship of a team of 11 in their job responsibilities.
  • Fixed asset/depreciation/disposal calculations and reporting.
  • Review and approve monthly reconciliations (banks, prepaid, receivables, etc.).
  • Improve and implement financial policies, systems, and processes.
  • Directs the development and administration of accounting policies and operational procedures to ensure effective accounting and internal controls.
  • The Controller supports any accounting software projects.
  • Must work within strict confidential guidelines and with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to deal with a diverse and fast-paced work schedule and to work with a sense of urgency in a changing environment.
  • Strong organizational and interpersonal skills, with a positive attitude and the ability to work as part of a Team.
  • Contribute to the Team in living the Corporate Values of Integrity, Community and Excellence
  • Perform other duties as assigned

Why it matters:

Our team provides a range of products and services to support our member-owners. Through the work that we do, we help to build, fuel, feed and grow Western Canadian communities together.

Who you are:

You are looking for a career in Finance and:
  • Minimum 10 years of accounting experience and 3 years of Controller experience
  • Post-secondary undergraduate or technical degree in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance; CPA (CA, CMA, CGA) designation is required
  • Proficient in a variety of computer applications including MS Office Suite and advanced knowledge of excel (VLookup, Sumif, left-mid-right, formatting, creating charts, pivot tables)
  • Must have a pragmatic and diplomatic approach to managing people through change management and projects
  • Excellent organizational, planning and time management skills
  • Experience with credit management
  • Superior attention to detail
  • Must be committed to a SAFE working environment

What’s in in for you:
  • Competitive wage
  • Qualify for wage increase based on the number of hours worked & meeting expectations in the position
  • Team discount on Liquor, Food, Gas, Fashion, Hardware, Feed & Restaurant purchases
  • Co-op Membership with an annual dividend payment on qualified purchases
  • Annual bonus program for all team members
  • For eligible positions: comprehensive benefits package and an employer matched pension plan
  • Learning opportunities, to grow and develop and to foster a culture of teamwork and innovation
  • Team Events, community volunteering opportunities

Otter Co-op is committed to a diverse and supportive working environment based on our Core Company Values of Integrity, Community and Excellence. We are committed to giving back to our communities through our Corporate Social Responsibility Program.

At Co-op, we embrace diversity and inclusion, and we are working to create a workplace that is as diverse as the communities we serve. We support and provide an environment that allows all to bring their whole selves to work.

All successful candidates will be required to undergo a background check.

We would like to thank everyone for their application, however only candidates that will be moving forward in the interview process will be contacted.

title: Controller
location: City of Langley, British Columbia, Canada
description:
Our Client

Our client is a leading-edge commercial Construction Management group that champions the philosophy that construction project work has a deeper purpose than just creating spaces, and that through strong partnerships, they can bring transformation to the industry, their customers, and the communities they serve. They’re passionate in their belief that the future of construction will be one where everyone is aligned with the mission, working shoulder to shoulder, solving problems, and understanding issues and challenges from each other's perspectives. Their consistent drive in this direction continues to propel their successful growth in the markets they serve.

Our clients’ current services range from commercial site assessment to pre-con and construction management all of which are approached and completed with the highest degree of mutual respect, value, and fairness. The end goal is that aside from creating beautiful and functional spaces with purpose, they aim to build solid professional relationships based on positive and successful project experiences.

The Opportunity

Exclusive Opportunity! Peeple Inc. is excited to assist our client in their search for a strong Controller to help grow their business in 2022 & beyond! You will roll up your sleeves and be responsible for everything GL, financial reporting, and payroll-related. You will be managing and mentoring a small team that supports you on the day-to-day accounting work. This is an amazing opportunity to partner with the business and helps them understand the numbers through your expertise with analytics, financial reporting, budgets, and forecasts. Project and/or construction accounting experience is a must and will help get you up to speed quickly as you learn about all the exciting projects being worked on! This is your chance to roll up your sleeves and take this challenge head-on with enthusiasm and accountability!

Key Responsibilities
  • Oversee and lead all finance operations
  • Mentor and manage a small accounting team
  • Direct all financial reporting & analysis, month-end close, and reconciliations
  • Partner with the Project Managers & their teams to streamline financial tracking and process of ongoing projects
  • Manage and oversee project accounting and AP
  • Supervise full-cycle payroll systems
Education/Experience
  • 3+ years of accounting experience at the Controller level
  • CPA designation
  • MUST have project accounting/construction experience
  • Strong leader with excellent management & mentorship skills
  • Experienced in financial reporting, full-cycle accounting, payroll, and process improvement
  • Solid ERP experience, Sage 300/Timberline an asset
Who You Are
  • Exceptional ability to communicate with all levels of the organization + external stakeholders
  • Bring a positive attitude and outlook
  • Independent and practice a hands-on approach to your role
  • Excellent time management skills and ability to handle multiple & changing priorities
  • Ability to communicate financials to operational and non-financial teams
About Peeple Inc.

Peeple Inc is a Vancouver-based People Development firm specializing in Management Search and Executive Coaching and development. We’re focused on helping companies build and develop world-class teams and assisting jobseekers to find incredible employers. Applicants can expect thorough communication, an in-depth evaluation of their background and abilities, complete confidentiality, and our continuing care and expertise in matching candidates to roles that provide the best fit possible.

Peeple Inc and the clients we represent are committed to an inclusive and discrimination-free workplace, as well as complete compliance with the B.C. Human Rights Code, Canadian Human Rights Act, and the Employment Equity Act.

Application and Timeline

We encourage interested applicants to apply as soon as possible as our client is keen to welcome their newest team member. Interviews will take place as resumes are submitted through the Peeple Inc website.

title: Controller
description:
About The Opportunity

Rohit Group is expanding! We are currently looking for a full-time Controller to join our team from our office in Edmonton, Alberta. The Controller is a mid-senior position who acts as the head of accounting, and oversees the preparation of financial reports, such as balance sheets and income statements.

Your key responsibilities include but are not limited to:

What will you do in this role?
  • Overseeing the operations of the transactional accounting department, including the design of an organizational structure adequate for achieving the company’s goals and objectives.
  • Managing the accumulation and consolidation of all financial data necessary for an accurate accounting of consolidated business results.
  • Coordinating and preparing internal and external financial statements.
  • Coordinating activities of external auditors.
  • Providing management with information vital to the decision-making process.
  • Evolving current accounting operations to manage the growth of the organization in an efficient and effective manner.
  • Maintaining the chart of accounts and internal control systems over accounting transactions.
  • Evaluating the effectiveness of accounting software and supporting database, as needed.
  • Overseeing regulatory reporting, frequently, including tax planning and compliance.
  • Staying abreast of financial related practices, trends, political/regulatory activities, and competitive economic changes which may affect the ability of the team to meet objectives.
  • Overseeing the payroll functions including all related regulatory tax compliance.
  • Managing the Corporate and real estate insurance risks.
  • Monitoring the treasury daily and maximizing the efficient use or allocation of cash.
  • Developing the team and improving their performance through coaching and feedback loop.
  • Hiring, training, and retaining skilled accounting staff.

What do we look for?
  • 5+ years in a management role and a CPA designation.
  • Possess deep knowledge of accounting principles.
  • Possess broad knowledge of income and excise tax rules
  • Exposure to end-to-end Finance function.
  • Strong analytical skills, problem-solving and critical thinking
  • Demonstrated leadership skills across large and diverse business and ability to recruit and develop high-performing team.
  • Influential personality to drive results and facilitate the growth of a profitable business.
  • Proven track record in project cost accounting and reporting.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in internal controls and processes is required.
  • Effective time management and prioritization skills in managing multiple projects.
  • Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Exposure to different styles and personalities of business unit leaders.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, a self-starter, and driver of change.

Assets
  • Experience in managing a multi-level and multi-companies in different jurisdictions.
  • Experience in change management.
  • Working experience in a Shared Services environment.
  • Working experience as a controller.
  • Working experience in Power BI, Synapse and/or Power Query.
  • Working experience in Microsoft Dynamics 365.

Who are we ?

Rooted in family values and entrepreneurial spirit, Rohit Group of Companies was founded in 1986 by Radhe Gupta. Together with his wife Krishna and son Rohit, Radhe grew the company from a small home builder to a diversified organization with operations in home building, residential and land development, residential rentals, commercial assets, and real estate lending.

This vertical integration has positioned Rohit Group as an award-winning industry leader in Canada with operations in Edmonton, Calgary, Regina, Saskatoon, and Ottawa.

For more information, please visit our

Grow with us

As a valued member of our team, you will be awarded a competitive salary evaluated on knowledge, skills and experience, plus:

title: Controller, Canada
description:
About JLL –

We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 98,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.

If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!

The Canada Controller is a critical role that will be responsible for the accounting and financial reporting activities, governance and compliance, and policy for Canada, reporting directly to the Americas Controller – Markets Advisory.

In a high-powered team environment, the successful candidate will apply accounting & compliance theory to real world commercial real estate leasing, capital markets, property management and project & development services engagements at clients with varying degrees of contractual and service delivery complexity. This out of the box thinking professional will also help us to define what duties should shift to a shared services center while retaining ownership of the accuracy of the financial results and help us execute that strategy. Routine duties will include analyzing and reviewing higher-risk financial accounts, balance sheets, income statements, financial statements, records, and reports that ultimately feed into our SEC-reported results. Additionally, this role will help maintain the accuracy of our financial systems, assist in the preparation and development of leading Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) supporting workpapers, support external and internal audits as required; deliver the year end closing with zero surprises; and assist across a variety of global segment specific business related activities.

Responsibilities
  • Oversee and maintain accounting and financial reporting function for our Canadian business, including monthly, quarterly and annual financial close processes
  • Primarily responsible for the preparation of consolidated Canada financial results and Sox compliance
  • Accounting process standardization and oversight/approval
  • Oversee and maintain an internal control environment compliant with SOX requirements; assist in resolution of any accounting and internal control issues
  • Coordinate with global business line and consolidation teams
  • Play a lead role in the internal and external audit processes
  • Support the management of the Canada controllership team

Reporting and Analysis
  • Lead the workday 1-5 close calls and workday 5 controlling close meetings to present Canada results and to provide commentary on period over periodic changes
  • Maintains an open issues list of critical close items throughout close and ensures their timely resolution
  • Perform periodic and ad-hoc value-added analysis of results against prior period performance; investigate changes or trends and document the results of investigation
  • Review key balance sheet reconciliations with an eye for process improvement and/or consistency across accounts/clients
  • Partner with Tableau reporting team to enhance existing reports/dashboards and build new ones that enable better and faster controllership analysis

Accounting and Auditing
  • In partnership with the Global Technical Accounting team, conduct technical accounting research, including support of consolidation and revenue recognition, compensation arrangements, and leases
  • Partner with Finance, Tax, and Legal to understand and document issues relevant to Canadian business lines
  • Coordinate risk management and analysis, ensuring compliance with SOX requirements
  • Partner directly with Global Accounting Compliance, Technical Accounting, and external audit teams

Leadership/Team Management
  • Collaborate with Americas and Global Markets Advisory Controllers to lead initiatives and drive consistency across Controllership teams
  • Serve as champion of new accounting guidance and new Global initiatives as they pertain to Canada
  • Establish and maintain relationships within the Americas Markets Advisory controllership team, as well across the broader Markets Advisory Finance team (Business Partnering, FP&A)
  • Provide career guidance to direct reports; prepare and communicate performance reviews

Qualifications

Functional Competencies:
  • Fluent in French, a plus
  • Deep understanding of US GAAP and ability to effectively communicate key issues to finance and business leadership
  • Strong understanding and experience with Canadian tax code and provencial requirements for statuatory audits
  • Expert in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Power Point
  • Excellent in financial process management and best practice influencer
  • Experience in or familiarity with financial system implementations a plus

Interpersonal Competencies:
  • High level of energy, enthusiasm and passion for controllership
  • Strong interpersonal and multi-tasking skills
  • High comfort level with executive-level professionals
  • Creative problem solver that can analyze and synthesize information from disparate sources and deliver comprehensive, balanced and actionable analysis
  • Ability to mentor others
  • Adept at forging strong relationships within a matrix environment
  • Collaborative work style

Leadership Competencies:
  • Provide opinions and develop creative solutions to complex business issues
  • Ability to lead complex projects, including managing expectations of multiple constituents along the way
  • Ability to provide clear sense of direction

Education & Experience
  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting or related field with 10+ years of experience CPA, MBA/MSA preferred
  • Experience in performing in-depth accounting research and translating that research into analytical, logical, and coherent written communications
  • Experience working and communicating within multi-national corporations and/or SEC registrants a plus

JLL is an Equal Opportunity Employer

JLL is an equal opportunity employer and committed to recruiting, developing and maintaining a diverse workforce in compliance with all applicable Human Rights legislation. The Company will endeavour to make reasonable accommodations up to the point of undue hardship, for disabilities made known to it by its employees and applicants.

If you are applying to a position in Canada, accommodations for applicants with disabilities or other grounds protected by human rights legislation are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the employment selection process. For all internal and external applicants who require accommodation in the recruitment and selection process please contact Careers.Canada@am.jll.com for assistance/support. Applicants must complete all required steps in the application process, including providing a Resume/CV, in order to be considered for this position.

What You Can Expect From Us

We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay.

We can’t wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!

JLL Privacy Notice

Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. We take our responsibility to protect the personal information provided to us seriously. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL’s recruitment process. We endeavour to keep your personal information secure with appropriate level of security and keep for as long as we need it for legitimate business or legal reasons. We will then delete it safely and securely.

For more information about how JLL processes your personal data, please view our Candidate Privacy Statement.

For additional details please see our career site pages for each country.

For employees in the United States, please see a fully copy of our Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action policy here.

Jones Lang LaSalle (“JLL”) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process – including the online application and/or overall selection process – you may email us at AccomodationRequest@am.jll.com. This email is only to request an accommodation. Please direct any other general recruiting inquiries to our Contact Us page > I want to work for JLL.

title: Controller-SAAS Company
description:
Job Description

Our client is a rapidly growing SAAS company that is looking to add a strong hands-on Controller to their team. The Controller will be instrumental to the organization’s success and will be responsible for managing and developing the accounting practice. This person will lead accounting and financial reporting packages for the business and will report to the Director of Business Operations.

What You’ll Do
  • Work closely with the executive team, presenting monthly financial analysis
  • Collaborate closely with Sales, BizOps, Ops, as well as other departments
  • Research, prepare and execute initiatives such as software/system implementation, policy implementation, and other company-wide improvements
  • Manage the month-end close process and day-to-day accounting functions, including revenue recognition, deferred revenue, AP, AR, etc.
  • Process payroll, commission, etc.
  • Handle new state setups, annual report filings, and coordination with tax accountants
  • Develop, standardize, and automate reports, metrics, and dashboards for monthly and quarterly reporting and analysis
  • Manage and report sales and use taxes, payroll taxes, and applicable city taxes
  • Review vendor contracts, payments, and vendor management
  • Analyze customer contracts, ensure timely billing, follow up on collections as needed

What Makes a Great Candidate
  • 7+ years of experience in public and private accounting
  • Experience at a high growth software startup
  • Excellent leadership, management, communication, and teamwork skills
  • Deep problem solving and analytical ability
  • Self-starter with efficient time management and organizational skills
*Candidates must be USA citizens*

Valued But Not Required
  • CPA or MBA
  • Experience at a B2B SaaS company

title: Controller
description:
About the Position:

The Controller will be responsible for the Property Accounting of a portfolio of over 22,000 suites across Canada and managing property accounting, revenue accounting and Accounts Payable functions in Finance department. The Controller will be accountable for coaching and developing his/her managers and setting direction while ensuring the timely and accurate completion of monthly financial reporting.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage all aspects of property accounting, including reporting, treasury, and auditing of real estate portfolio.
  • Maintaining the accounting principles, practices, procedures, and initiatives, preparing financial reports and presenting findings and recommendations to management
  • Ensure financial reports are in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standard (IFRS) and company accounting policies and procedures.
  • Oversee and review the internal monthly consolidated and property results package, to ensure its complete, accurate and timely release to internal departments and external investors.
  • Review monthly portfolio level financial results and periodic management reports for various stakeholders
  • Support in the timely and accurate completion of annual operating and capital budgets and quarterly property forecasts.
  • Support acquisition / disposition of the properties in the real estate portfolio and resolve finance related tasks.
  • Continually reviews existing processes procedures and reporting systems to improve on the quality and/or effectiveness of the accounting environment
  • Identify and implement best practices in accounting processes and procedures
  • Assist in developing and implementing effective controls and processes to ensure the integrity of financial information, including detailed documentation of existing processes
  • Accomplish accounting human resource objectives by recruiting, orientating, training, coaching, accounting staff; communicating job expectations; monitoring and reviewing performance; enforcing policies and procedures
  • Co-ordinate and review external compliance including lenders, investors and CRA.
  • Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to exchange and deliver property financial information.
  • Develop, report and manage various KPIs for Finance team, including accounts payable on an ongoing basis.
  • Lead the implementation of various Yardi Modules and responsible for the integrity of the data input in to Yardi.
  • Work on special projects as assigned by Senior Management.


Job Requirements:


Education and Experience:

  • Accounting designation (CA, CMA, CGA, or finalist)
  • Degree in Accounting/Finance/Business Administration
  • Minimum 5 yrs of relevant experience in financial reporting and/or public accounting
  • Advanced computer skills (Excel, Power Point, Word) a must
  • Systems proficiency with property management and accounting software (experience with Yardi is an asset)


Qualifications:

  • A professional demeanor and coupled with strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Demonstrates a high degree of integrity, diplomacy, discretion and confidentiality.
  • Ability to accurately listen, understand and respond appropriately.
  • Ability to work and act independently using good judgment when assessing difficult situations.
  • Ability to remain calm and focused in high pressure situations.
  • Self-motivated individual who is proactive, takes initiative, goal and results oriented and work independently without a lot of direction.
  • Superior organizational and time management skills in order to multi-task/prioritize and work under tight timelines and meet multiple deadlines.
  • Flexible with a “can-do” and “no task is too big or too small” attitude.
  • Excellent problem solving capabilities.
  • Superior attention to detail and accuracy and excellent follow-up skills.
  • Excellent communication is required. Ability to speak other languages is considered an asset
  • Actively championing diversity and inclusion

Hazelview Property Services Inc. is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer. If you require an accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please let us know. We will accommodate your needs as required under applicable legislation. Information related to accommodation requirements will be addressed confidentially.

About Us:


Hazelview Properties we believe that apartments are more than bricks and mortar - they are an experience.

Started in 1999 with one small building in Oakville Ontario, we now manage a portfolio of over

multi-family residential buildings throughout Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, Ontario, Quebec and Nova Scotia.

Hazelview Properties takes pride in ownership and an active hands-on approach to how we manage our communities. We are committed to fostering the long-term growth of our employees, communities and the investments we make for our clients. It’s one of the things we’ve always believed in, creating value for people and places.

We are committed to a diverse and sustainable future.


Our Vision: “We create value for people and places”.


Our Core Values:

  • Trust
  • Ambition
  • Collaboration
  • Ownership Mindset

title: Controller
location: Corner Brook, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada
description:
About the Position:

The Controller will be responsible for the Property Accounting of a portfolio of over 22,000 suites across Canada and managing property accounting, revenue accounting and Accounts Payable functions in Finance department. The Controller will be accountable for coaching and developing his/her managers and setting direction while ensuring the timely and accurate completion of monthly financial reporting.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage all aspects of property accounting, including reporting, treasury, and auditing of real estate portfolio.
  • Maintaining the accounting principles, practices, procedures, and initiatives, preparing financial reports and presenting findings and recommendations to management
  • Ensure financial reports are in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standard (IFRS) and company accounting policies and procedures.
  • Oversee and review the internal monthly consolidated and property results package, to ensure its complete, accurate and timely release to internal departments and external investors.
  • Review monthly portfolio level financial results and periodic management reports for various stakeholders
  • Support in the timely and accurate completion of annual operating and capital budgets and quarterly property forecasts.
  • Support acquisition / disposition of the properties in the real estate portfolio and resolve finance related tasks.
  • Continually reviews existing processes procedures and reporting systems to improve on the quality and/or effectiveness of the accounting environment
  • Identify and implement best practices in accounting processes and procedures
  • Assist in developing and implementing effective controls and processes to ensure the integrity of financial information, including detailed documentation of existing processes
  • Accomplish accounting human resource objectives by recruiting, orientating, training, coaching, accounting staff; communicating job expectations; monitoring and reviewing performance; enforcing policies and procedures
  • Co-ordinate and review external compliance including lenders, investors and CRA.
  • Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to exchange and deliver property financial information.
  • Develop, report and manage various KPIs for Finance team, including accounts payable on an ongoing basis.
  • Lead the implementation of various Yardi Modules and responsible for the integrity of the data input in to Yardi.
  • Work on special projects as assigned by Senior Management.


Job Requirements:


Education and Experience:

  • Accounting designation (CA, CMA, CGA, or finalist)
  • Degree in Accounting/Finance/Business Administration
  • Minimum 5 yrs of relevant experience in financial reporting and/or public accounting
  • Advanced computer skills (Excel, Power Point, Word) a must
  • Systems proficiency with property management and accounting software (experience with Yardi is an asset)


Qualifications:

  • A professional demeanor and coupled with strong communication skills both written and verbal.
  • Demonstrates a high degree of integrity, diplomacy, discretion and confidentiality.
  • Ability to accurately listen, understand and respond appropriately.
  • Ability to work and act independently using good judgment when assessing difficult situations.
  • Ability to remain calm and focused in high pressure situations.
  • Self-motivated individual who is proactive, takes initiative, goal and results oriented and work independently without a lot of direction.
  • Superior organizational and time management skills in order to multi-task/prioritize and work under tight timelines and meet multiple deadlines.
  • Flexible with a “can-do” and “no task is too big or too small” attitude.
  • Excellent problem solving capabilities.
  • Superior attention to detail and accuracy and excellent follow-up skills.
  • Excellent communication is required. Ability to speak other languages is considered an asset
  • Actively championing diversity and inclusion

Hazelview Property Services Inc. is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer. If you require an accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please let us know. We will accommodate your needs as required under applicable legislation. Information related to accommodation requirements will be addressed confidentially.

About Us:


Hazelview Properties we believe that apartments are more than bricks and mortar - they are an experience.

Started in 1999 with one small building in Oakville Ontario, we now manage a portfolio of over

multi-family residential buildings throughout Alberta, Saskatchewan, Manitoba, Ontario, Quebec and Nova Scotia.

Hazelview Properties takes pride in ownership and an active hands-on approach to how we manage our communities. We are committed to fostering the long-term growth of our employees, communities and the investments we make for our clients. It’s one of the things we’ve always believed in, creating value for people and places.

We are committed to a diverse and sustainable future.


Our Vision: “We create value for people and places”.


Our Core Values:

  • Trust
  • Ambition
  • Collaboration
  • Ownership Mindset
  • Having Fun

title: Director Of Finance And Accounting
description:
DIRECTOR OF FINANCE

The Toronto Lawn Tennis Club

The Club

The Toronto Lawn Tennis Club is a private members' club in the heart of Rosedale, Toronto, and is conveniently located on the Yonge Street subway line. The Club has a long history, since 1876, of providing excellent tennis courts, coaching and programming for players of all ages and has built its reputation as the premier tennis club in Canada

In addition to 18 tennis courts (four indoors) the Club has four squash courts, a Fitness Centre, a seasonal pool, a Wellness Centre, and food and beverage outlets. The Club has 3,000 members, including family members of all ages; annual revenues are approximately $14 million. From high-caliber tennis, to all-around athletics and exceptional social scene, membership is about belonging to a uniquely warm community located right in the heart of Rosedale.

The Toronto Lawn Tennis Club is a historic facility that has been witness to the best tennis since the 19th century. Legends like Borg, Navratilova, Connors and Evert have all graced the club’s Har-Tru courts.


The Position

We are recruiting an accomplished full time Director of Finance to take charge of the Club's accounting and finance functions. Reporting to the General Manager/Chief Operating Officer (GM/COO), the Director of Finance is an integral member of the Senior Management Team and will lead an accounting team of three people.  The Director of Finance is a contributing team manager to the overall Club operation, and manages the financial operations of the Club, supervises the accounting functions, and provides analytical support to the GM/COO, Finance Committee, Board of Directors and others for planning, budgets, and solutions to business problems. This includes recommendations on the implementation and maintenance of the Club's financial plans and policies, its accounting practices, fiscal records, and the preparation of financial reports. The Director of Finance is a strong Club business partner, and makes decisions in accordance with Club policy on administrative or operational matters, ensuring the effective achievement of objectives.

The Director of Finance will be responsible for the following:

  • Recommend and implement policies to control and coordinate accounting, auditing, budgets, taxes and related activities and records; develop, establish, and administer procedures and systems pertaining to financial matters. Responsible for the Club’s internal controls and compliance to same.
  • Prepare financial statements, forecasts, and analysis for all administrative and managerial functions. Maintain all accounting records; develop, analyze, and interpret statistical and accounting information.
  • Manage the annual audit.
  • Evaluates and recommends insurance coverage for protection against property losses and potential liabilities.
  • Coordinates and directs the preparation of the annual operating and capital budgets, business plan, and financial forecasts; institutes and maintains other planning and control procedures; and analyzes and reports variances. The Club performs in a fiscal year beginning January 1 of each year.
  • Development, analysis, and interpretation of statistical and accounting information in order to appraise operating results in terms of profitability, performance against budget, and other matters bearing on the fiscal soundness and operating effectiveness of the organization.
  • Responsible for evaluating the performance of several personnel in the Administration department. This individual recommends training requirements, has the duty to keep the staff at the highest level of skill necessary to meet Club needs and objectives.
  • Responsible for the development, implementation, and operation of all accounting and information systems support; for the administration, management, and maintenance of the equipment systems employed in the collection of information and for the training and supervision of staff related, but not limited, to the Administration department.
  • Establishes major economic objectives and policies for the Club and prepares reports that outline the Club's financial position in the areas of receivables, payables, payroll, purchasing, fixed asset accounting, cash flow management and banking arrangements.
  • Furnishes internal reports, revises, and updates reports to be more useful and efficient, and furnishes external reports, including for tax and other government reporting, as necessary.


Candidate Profile:

  • ﻿ Professional Accounting designation (CPA);
  • Ten years of professional accounting experience with at least two years as Controller;
  • Experience working with Not-for-profit Organizations, the private club industry, and volunteer committees;
  • Excellent management, leadership, analytical and interpersonal skills
  • Strong communication and presentation skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities.
  • Ability to read, analyze and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures or governmental regulations.
  • Knowledge of pertinent Ontario and federal employment laws and practices.


Compensation:

The Club will offer an attractive compensation package, commensurate with experience, which will include a competitive base salary, bonus, and benefits.


Note:

The position is currently vacant.

 

Inquiries:

 

IMPORTANT: Interested candidates should submit resumes along with a detailed cover letter which addresses the qualifications and describes your alignment/experience with the prescribed position by Friday, May 13th at 5:00pm EDT. If you require any accommodations to be considered for this position please include that information in your submission. Those documents must be saved and emailed in Word or PDF format (save as “Last Name, First Name, Toronto Lawn Finance Cover Letter” and “Last Name, First Name, Toronto Lawn Finance Resume”) respectively to: execsearch@globalgolfadvisors.com  

 

We thank all applicants for their interest but will only contact those selected for an interview. Please email resume with references.

 

 

Lead Search Consultants:

 

 

Michael Gregory

Partner

GGA Partners™

michael.gregory@ggapartners.com

 

Liz McDowell, CPA, CA, CCM

Director                                  

GGA Partners™

Liz.mcdowell@ggapartners.com

 

For more information on Toronto Lawn Tennis Club: https://www.torontolawn.com/

title: Controller
description:
Position Overview

NCSG Crane & Heavy Haul Services Ltd. is looking for a dynamic individual to step into the role of Controller. This position is ideal for someone who is driven by high expectations. Reporting to the CFO you will be a good fit for this position if you can plan and direct all accounting operational functions, handle the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluate accounting and internal control systems, and lead five departmental staff. You will succeed in this position if you can effectively manage self and others within strict time constraints, lead while also being a team player, generate innovative ideas, and challenge the status quo. You're a good fit for this position if you want a challenging, yet stable role.

The Successful Candidate Will Possess The Following Qualities
  • Comprehensive understanding of accounting standards, specifically Canadian ASPE.
  • Established management and leadership skills, including the ability to lead, mentor and develop operational and corporate staff.
  • Detail-oriented, proactive, and motivated self-starter.
  • Well-organized with excellent time management skills including the ability to meet deadlines, which may require the flexibility to work the hours required to get the job done during peak times.
  • Strong analytical skills and knowledge combined with the ability to effectively communicate the knowledge across the organization.
  • Identifying short and long-term goals and objectives, contributing to the overall strategic plan of the department and the company.
  • Strong computer literacy including effective working skills of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • University degree with a professional accounting designation.
  • Five plus years of experience in a challenging finance function, including at least two years of supervisory experience in a similar role.
  • Position Description and Responsibilities:
    Finance Focused
    • Overseeing daily operations of the accounting department (Billing, Accounts Payable, Payroll, and Divisional Controller).
    • Responsible for all accounting procedures and functions, internal controls and accounting records (excluding credit, treasury, and financial reporting).
    • Financial reporting and analysis - monitoring and analyzing monthly operating results against budget and prior year and working with operations to understand and analyze these results to drive improvements.
    • Directing and managing financial audits for the operating entities the role oversees.
    • Review and ensure the accuracy and timeliness of all operational reporting and tax requirements
    • Foster new accounting procedures to streamline processes where possible.
    • Oversight of direct and indirect reports, including regular meetings and formal annual performance evaluations.
    • Staying current with financial related practices, trends, political/regulatory activities, and competitive economic changes.
    • Perform related tasks and duties as requested by the CFO such as assisting with acquisitions, major capital expenditures and internal controls.
    Operations Focused
    • Improve the operational systems, processes, and policies in support of organizations mission -- specifically, support better management reporting, information flow and management, business process and organizational planning.
    • Integrate Support Services (HR, IT and Finance), through improvements to each function as well as coordination and communication between support and business functions.
    • Working with department managers and staff to develop business plans, goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures. Includes the production of, and monthly monitoring of, the annual budget and forecasts by branch.
    • Recommending and implementing benchmarks for measuring the financial and operating performance of divisions and departments.
    With approximately 350 employees in nine branch locations throughout the energy corridor of Canada, NCSG provides crane and heavy haul services to various industries such as refining, upgrading, upstream oil & gas, utilities, forestry, mining, and wind energy. NCSG is headquartered in Acheson, Alberta and is proud to be one of the top fully operated and maintained crane companies in North America. We can provide local content to the project, as we have a large labor force based in western Canada from which to draw. NCSG is a privately-owned company. For further information please see our website:

    www.ncsg.com

title: Controller
description:
We are looking for a Controller to build our accounting team as Mercury grows rapidly. In this role you will help us transition our accounting functions in-house and build a world-class team that’ll scale with the company. You will be responsible for leading all aspects of the accounting function including monthly close, audits, reporting, finance operations, and tax compliance. This is your chance to build a team and processes in the way you’ve always wanted to.

What You’ll Do:
  • Build, manage, and develop our accounting team. You’ll plan how to do in-house accounting and strategically execute step by step.
  • Lead the monthly close process and ensure timely and accurate financial reporting. This will directly impact Mercury’s ability to make sound financial decisions.
  • Ensure proper GAAP accounting as we launch and scale new products.
  • Drive our annual audit process and proactively identify and address areas of audit risk.
  • Evaluate material risk areas in the company’s control environment and implement controls to mitigate appropriately for the company’s stage and scale.
  • Own financial audit, banking, tax, 409A, and other finance related advisory relationships
  • Evaluate Mercury’s ERP stack and implement other systems and tools to uplevel the accounting function.
  • Longer term, set the roadmap for public company accounting readiness.

You Should:
  • Have 10+ years of progressive accounting experience with a mix in public accounting and industry. Having both startup and public company experience is a huge plus, even better if in fintech.
  • Have big 4 public accounting experience with a detailed understanding of GAAP
  • Have a BA/BS or equivalent in accounting or related field; Certified Public Accountant (CPA) required
  • Have a history of scaling and process improvement for finance and accounting operations
  • Be good with numbers but more importantly with people and can lead others and work cross-functionally effectively.
  • Have a high bar of excellence. You strive to continuously improve processes and results but also know how to prioritize. You own your work completely and with pride.
  • Have the utmost integrity and zero compromise in values.
  • Be a self-starter and first principles thinker. You grasp problems and how to handle them quickly with little direction required. You enjoy tackling new problems and don’t need a prior mental model to think through them.

title: Controller - Barrie, ON
description:
IKON Complete Inc. is a Recruitment & Search Firm specializing in identifying, & sourcing top performers for our clientele. Our clients include industry leading organizations who partner with us to be an extension of their HR & Recruitment function.

Position: Senior Controller

Location: Barrie, ON

Salary: $85,000 - $105,000 per year

Status: Permanent Full-Time

Industry: Industrial/ Accounting/ Finance

Responsibilities
  • Responsible for supervising the accounting procedures of the company
  • Analyze and assess the financial performance of the business
  • Responsible for the development of policies, systems, special financial studies, etc. of major importance
  • Advise management on matters of fiscal procedure and importance for the organization
  • Manage and oversee the daily finance and accounting operations of the business including but not limited to Accounts payable/receivable, General ledger accounting, Cash forecasting etc.
  • Improve systems and procedures and initiate corrective actions
  • Assign projects and direct staff to ensure compliance and accuracy
  • Provide leadership in understanding the manufacturing operations of the business units and helping to develop relevant KPIs to drive operational excellence
  • Other duties may be assigned
Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Accounting Required
  • Master’s Degree Preferred
  • CPA or CMA a plus
  • 15+ years of financial and accounting related experience
  • 10+ years of controllership experience
  • Previous working experience in manufacturing setting with emphasis on cost accounting principles and practices
  • Proven track record of driving financial results
  • Knowledge of conflict resolution techniques at an expert level
  • Knowledge of AS400, NetSuite, SQL
IKON Complete Inc. is committed to providing accessibility to qualified candidates with disabilities. Requests for accommodation can be made at any time at ikoncomplete.com/accessibility-policy-aoda/

title: Controller
description:
Description

Water Made Exciting!

At SodaStream, we are growing fast and looking for problem-solvers and thought leaders that are ready to grow with us. If you have the energy and determination, then we'll provide the tools you need for success. We have fantastic benefits and a variety of perks that create an outstanding work environment for all our employees.

Benefits
  • Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.
  • Basic life insurance, disability, and wellness programs.
  • RRSP with Employer match.
  • Paid holidays and generous paid time off.
Job Summary:

The Controller is responsible for providing leadership and coordination of the company’s financial and accounting management. The Controller oversees company accounting receivables, payables, taxes and Internal Controls functions. The incumbent also performs the review and analysis of all month end, and year end and financial statements along with a number of other financial areas including cash flow, banking, credit analysis and HQ reporting requirements. This person will be responsible for developing policies, procedures for areas of their responsibility as well as ensuring compliance.

Responsibilities:
  • Analyze complex financial information and reports to provide accurate and timely financial recommendations to management
  • Develop, implement and oversee accounting processes and controls
  • Monitor performance indicators, highlighting trends and analyzing causes of unexpected variance
  • Manage the team through month-end, year-end and and support forecast cycle processes
  • Prepare and analyze budget and cashflow forecasts
  • Prepare financial statements and reports, including presentation materials for HQ meetings
  • Support the acquisition of capital assets and ensure that assets are properly recorded, amortized, and disposed of as appropriate
  • Lead annual review of internal controls for the Canadian operation to ensure adherence; responsible to implement remediation to address any control issues
  • Provide direction and oversight to Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable
  • Ensure compliance with all accounting policies and procedures, as well as government reporting requirements/ payments
Requirements
  • University Degree/ College Diploma in Accounting, Finance or other related discipline
  • CPA designation
  • 7-10 years of experience in a management capacity, specifically in a general accounting position overseeing statement preparation and analysis
  • Prior experience using and ERP system, analytical software, reporting software, and Microsoft Office Suite. Net Suite and TM1 an asset.
  • Experience in the CPG industry preferred
  • Strong people leadership and development abilities; ability to accomplish tasks and projects through engaging others
  • Strong business acumen; ability to effectively partner with and advise business groups to achieve desired results (Supply Chain, IT, Sales, Marketing, HR, HQ)
  • Excellent communication, organization and planning skills; able to meet tight deadlines
  • Proactive self-starter
  • Strong attention to detail and desire to define clear processes
  • Strong analytical and reporting skills
  • GAAP
SodaStream Canada is committed to an inclusive, recruitment and selection processes. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005, and the Ontario Human Rights Code, SodaStream Canada will provide accommodation throughout the recruitment and selection process to applicants with disabilities. If you require accommodation, please advise the Human Resources Department

title: Controller - Permanent - 14920
description:
LROACC

About The Opportunity

Our client in Ottawa west is looking for a Controller to join their fast-paced, growing team on a full-time, permanent basis.

Duties Include But Are Not Limited To
  • Full-cycle accounting including reconciling complex accounts, working closely with the General Ledger
  • Oversee and provide support to Accounting team
  • Production of financial statements
  • Financial analysis, reporting, ad hoc analysis as needed
  • Costing and inventory analysis, cash flow management
  • Submission of tax remittances
  • Assisting in the coordination and preparation of budget and financial forecasts, institute and maintain planning and control procedures and analyze report variances
  • Preparing Month and Year End close
  • Liaising with external auditors
  • Communicating with Senior Management on financial variances and strategies
About You

The successful candidate will have the following:
  • Strong oral, written, and communication skills (English mandatory)
  • 5+ years of experience in Accounting & Finance
  • Experience in the construction industry
  • Designation (CPA) is an asset
  • 3+ years of leadership of an accounting team
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Highly organized, strong attention to detail
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, self-starter, collaborative
How To Apply

Please apply by clicking the “Apply Now” button below and follow the instructions to submit your résumé. If you are already registered with us, please contact your Senior Recruiter. Please quote job 14920.

Thank you for your interest in this role. One of our Recruiters will be in touch with you if your profile meets the requirements for the role and the expectations of our clients. Please note that all candidates must be permitted to work in Canada to be considered for this opportunity.

title: Controller
description:
Agfa Graphics is looking for a Plant Controller to join our Mississauga team. You will be part of the management team supporting the financial for plant operations. You will work closely with the senior leadership team in Mississauga and help drive the company’s growth in both top and bottom line.

You will act as a Business Leader for the Agfa Digital Printing Solutions Group and closely and support the North America commercial organizations.

Responsibilities But Not Limited To The Following

  • Oversee and manage the preparation and presentation of daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly and annual financial information for management and commercial management for North America
  • Ensure controls are in place, general ledger accounts are reconciled on a periodic basis and that overall data and system integrity as it relates to financial data is in compliance with GAAP and Company policies
  • Prepare and monitor financial forecast and budgets.
  • Coordinate review of inventory balances and inventory monitoring programs
  • Act as financial business partner to the management team in Mississauga and to the Commercial management for North America
  • Manage the follow up with cost pricing for the assembled products and follow up on manufacturing variances, the evolution of the working capital, the business cases for CAPEX requests or investment
  • You will be part of the Mississauga management team
  • You will be transferring the ERP system to a more up to date system, you will be responsible for the financial impacts of the ERP system
  • You will support the North American commercial organization within Digital Printing Solutions and assist the current regional responsible for the analysis of his performance

Educations

  • Bachelors of Finance & Accounting
  • Master degree in Finance or Accounting would be preferred
  • CPA Designation required

Experiences

  • 5 years of experience in a finance environment with preference as a Plant Controller
  • Experiences or interested in the commercial side of driving the business
  • Experience working within ERP systems (SAP)

Specific Skills

  • Advanced knowledge of Excel
  • Experiences working and communicating with all levels of the organization
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Ability to work within a changing environment
  • Driven by ethical standards and you act accordingly
  • Strong communication skill both written and verbal
  • Willingness to Travel (10-30%)

What We Offer Now And In The Future

  • Dynamic global organization with a history of innovation and strong product portfolio.
  • Challenging environment combined with a supportive management structure.
  • Career development and growth.
  • Competitive salary and benefit package.
  • Friendly work environment surrounded by dedicated and professional colleagues.

Curious about this opportunity? We also know that a job contains more than just bullets! Apply! We love to tell you more about our company, the content of the function, responsibilities and possibilities. Just apply! Talk Soon.

Agfa Graphics is committed to workplace diversity and provides accommodations, whenever possible, to applicants with disabilities throughout our hiring process. If you require an accommodation, please contact the Human Resources Department.

title: Controller
description:
Location: Calgary, AB, Canada Job Type: Permanent Date: 4/19/2022 Job ID: DL60368419 Category: Accounting & Finance

If you are a talented and experienced Controller Drea Larson, Senior Consultant at David Aplin Group has the right opportunity for you! Our client, a leader in their field, has partnered with David Aplin Group to grow their team in Calgary.

The Controller is responsible for the overall functions of accounting and financial operations. You will lead the provision and delivery of sound financial structures, controls, processes, and procedures.

Responsibilities:
  • Prepare year-end working papers for external review
  • Month-end Financial Statement preparation for management review
  • Bi-weekly payroll processing requires a good understanding of payroll and labor laws
  • Administration of employee benefit program
  • Monthly, quarterly, and annual compliance reporting and remittances to CRA, CBSA, Statistics Canada, and WCB
  • Recommend benchmarks for measuring the financial and operating performance of the company
  • Oversee the finance team, providing continuous coaching, mentorship, and career development support

Qualifications:
  • Accounting designation (CPA) preferred, and 5+ years of accounting and financial reporting experience at a senior management level
  • Prior responsibility for full-cycle accounting and finance functions, including reporting, analysis, and issues resolution
  • Full cycle accounting knowledge including knowledge of GAAP
  • Knowledge of foreign currency trading would be considered an asset
  • Willingness to be hands-on in all aspects of accounting
  • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Suite, specifically Excel
  • Experience with P21 Software and experience with distribution and inventory is considered an asset

Job ID: DL60368419

If you are interested in this position and meet the qualifications, apply today! We thank all applicants; however, only those who are authorized to work in Canada or are selected for an interview will be contacted.

David Aplin Group, one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, is an employment agency specializing in finding top talent for exceptional organizations across North America. There are no fees to apply to our jobs or engage with our recruiters to find a new career. Companies hire us to help them grow their teams. Visit our website to learn more: www.aplin.com

title: Controller
description:
Haldimand Motors Ltd.

Cayuga, On

If you are interested or know someone who is, reach out to careers@autocan.ca now!

Who We Want

We are looking for a Controller who will manage the accounting and reporting functions as well as the accounting processes and procedures at Haldimand Motors Ltd. You will report directly and work in partnership with the Dealer Principal, John Edelman.

This pivotal role is an integral member of Haldimand Motors’ senior management team and will participate actively in the both the financial and operational functions of the dealership.

It is our goal to be the destination for top talent and we are committed to providing our team members with meaningful and challenging work, an engaging and collaborative environment, recognition for performance, and opportunities for growth and advancement by cultivating a culture of excellence and aspiring to be best-in-class in the industry.

Why This is the Perfect Opportunity For You

AutoCanada is a CADA Laureate Winner in Business Innovation and a TXS30 Winner , with no small part due to our cutting-edge operational analytics. Join this enthusiastic and highly effective team that has no end to challenging and interesting work. We are growing, and our mindset is expansionary, with so much potential for the right person!

Culture at AutoCanada is everything! Our greatest accomplishment is having a productive culture.

Our Culture Is Based On
  • Drive for Performance
  • Trust & Transparency
  • People Development
  • Promoting from Within
  • Accountability to Ourselves & to Each Other
PROFIT IS THE RESULT – NOT THE VISION. That’s why we are looking for a Controller who is passionate about automotive and who is genuinely motivated by leading and coaching a team to success!

What We Offer
  • Industry-leading Pay Plan
  • Paid vacation
  • Health and Dental Benefits (of course)
  • A team full of GRIT – passion & perseverance
  • An opportunity to be part of an exciting, GROWING BUSINESS
The Role
  • Provide support and supervision to the Finance Department composed of three people.
  • Meet all monthly, quarterly, and annual deadlines as required by Home Office and the Dealer Principal including monthly reconciliations, monthly and quarterly reporting, covenant calculations, financial analysis, year-end reporting, budget preparation, etc.
  • Coordinate all activities within the Finance Department including accounts payable, accounts receivable, general accounting, payroll, special projects accounting, financial planning and reporting.
  • Participate in scheduled departmental Managers' meetings.
  • Perform all duties and responsibilities in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles.
  • Working with IT department to assist in integration of company’s data and program development.
  • Supervise and assist with recording all business transactions, process accruals and adjustments, reconcile accounts and payroll activities and prepare monthly accounting statements
  • Advise management in financial planning activities, revenue generation and cost control opportunities, efficiency improvements.
  • Coordinate the development of the operating and capital budgets.
  • Ensure the maintenance of the fixed asset inventory control system.
  • Keep abreast of federal, provincial and municipal developments, laws and policies that may affect the financial operations of the organization.
  • Review and maintain all dealership contracts
  • Coach, mentor, lead, and train accounting team members at the dealership
What You Bring to the Table but we’re totally flexible for the right person
  • Completion of post-secondary education in accounting or a related field
  • A minimum of 5 years or more of relevant work experience
  • Experience working in a dealership would be considered an asset
  • Prior experience in an accounting oversight role is required
  • A well-defined sense of diplomacy, including negotiation and conflict resolution skills
  • Excellent verbal/written communication combined with the ability to interact and gain the support of senior leadership and other decision-makers
  • Ability to manage priorities, perform a variety of tasks and meet required deadlines and targets
  • Excellent skills in Word and Excel.
  • Knowledge of Sage and Payworks systems would be considered an asset
  • Experience managing large corporate sales accounts would be considered an asset
If for some reason you don’t know Who We Are…

AutoCanada is a publicly traded multi-location automotive dealership group operating in both Canada and the United States with a home base in Edmonton, AB. Founded in 2006, AutoCanada has expanded significantly and continues to grow.  For more information about AutoCanada, check out https://www.autocan.ca/ , Instagram , Facebook .

title: Controls Manager
description:
Job Description

The main requirements of the role are to;

 Work onsite with the Veolia Team

 Review of Contractor Monthly Progress Estimates and Monthly Schedule submission review

 Manage the Consulting contract for Risk and Contract Claims.

 Aid in the development and execution of the Readiness Plan for the SEWPCC Upgrade

 Provide support to the City Project Managers within the Winnipeg Sewage Treatment Program (WSTP).

 Provide a Primavera Schedule for the WSTP projects to the completion of the Program.

Primary Responsibilities / Job Duties

 Support the WSTP as an integral player by:
  • Review and prepare progress estimates and monthly reports.
  • Conduct detailed project schedule analysis and monitoring. Provide report monthly to City
Project Manager.
  • Coordination of various external parties to support Contractor schedule (e.x. outage
coordination, LOTO).
  • Maintain estimate of project costs at completion.
  • Review of Contract Change Notifictions/Orders, RFIs, NCRs etc to evaluate risks inclusing
claims risks. Make recomendations to the Lead Contract Administrator for areas requiring

intervention.
  • Prepare claims/appeals files for known claims/appeals and for risks translating into
issues/claims.
  • Execute contract with risk and contract claims consultant.
  • Administer the contract for the project document platform, Aconex. Arrange training for new
users.
  • Prepare readiness scope documents as well as update the readiness schedule based on
Contractor schedule.
  • Support multiple projects aligning with the goals of the WSTP.
  • Assist with day to day contract administration duties as required.
Qualifications

Educational Background
  • Bachelors Degree in Business Administration or Engineering preferred or
equivalent experience
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification desired
Job Skills / Characteristics
  • Capable to play a central role in coordinating and integrating progress across
internal and external program team member
  • Process improvement and re-engineering, balancing efficiency and effectiveness
  • Must have the capability to conduct analyses on complex data sets
  • Must demonstrate ability to pay close attention to details, and present good
planning, organization, and time management skills.
  • Must have the ability to handle diverse tasks simultaneously and be able to work
effectively with interruptions. Ability to handle confidential or sensitive

information or issues.
  • Must demonstrate ability to work in a team environment and willingness to
Assume Additional Or New Responsibilities
  • Must demonstrate effective oral and written communication skills and the ability
to independently compose routine written communications.

Experience / Knowledge
  • Must have previous experience with engineering or construction project
management processes including good knowledge of earned value calculation

and scheduling of design activities, design documents cycle
  • Must have previous experience with Project Management and business process
quality control.
  • Good understanding of progress monitoring and controlling in project
management frame work
  • PC skills with expert working knowledge of MS Excel and Share-Point. Ability to
develop spreadsheets and modify formats in order to complete assignments.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

100% at site/office.

Possible Work Hazards

Must take care in moving or lifting office supplies. Infrequent exposure to plant hazards including noise, heavy equipment, fumes and chemicals.

Physical Demands

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; and stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, and ability to adjust focus.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

As an inclusive company, Veolia is committed to diversity and gives equal consideration to all applications, without discrimination.

Veolia North America is committed to the principle of equal employment and advancement opportunity for all employees and potential employees, along with a discrimination- and harassment-free workplace environment.

description:
Salary Mid-Point: $110,000

$110,000

Location: Mississauga ON

Mississauga ON

Job Type: Permanent

Permanent

We have partnered with a west end based client on a search for a Controller. This role is open due to the current Controller retiring, however they will stay on as a part time consultant during the transition. The Controller will be a key member of the team and be responsible for the overall financial oversight of the company.

The main responsibilities for this role include the following;
  • Manage the day to day accounting including a/p, a/r, fixed assets and banking
  • Lead the Accounting and Finance functions which includes managing four staff
  • Be in charge of the month end close process
  • Working very closely with the owner with preparing timely and accurate financial statements
  • Manage the daily cash flow
To be considered for the role, our client is looking for someone with the following skills/qualifications;
  • 5+ years experience as a Controller in a small company
  • Solid experience with month end accounting
  • Experience managing/mentoring/leading staff
  • Outstanding analytical, interpersonal and communication skills
If this role is of interest to you and you feel you have the skills required to be successful, please send your updated resume in MS Word format to Scott Allen at scottallen@ifgpr.com.

Other opportunities can be viewed at www.ifg-global.com. #FS
