title: Controller
description:
A dynamic team in a very exciting start-up environment is seeking a Controller to join them! The ideal candidate is a highly capable individual with a positive attitude and a strong accounting skillset. This position will be suited to a high energy person who is able to wear multiple hats and who enjoys working in a fast-paced environment where there is constant challenge and lots of opportunities for you to use your initiative. As the only accounting employee and reporting to the founders, the main responsibilities include:


  • Oversee all accounting duties, from full cycle data entry, AP, AR and bank reconciliations to analysis and preparation of consolidated financial statements
  • Manage cashflow, bank accounts, credit cards and loans
  • Process payroll
  • Ensure regulatory compliance, coordinate year end audit papers, remit HST and apply for government subsidies
  • Produce ad hoc modelling, marketing analysis and oversee lease management
  • Take ownership of IT


This role is well suited to an individual who enjoys being part of a growing organization where you have to switch gears at a moments’ notice. The owners of this company have high expectations and require someone extremely competent, professional and deadline oriented. If you can rise to the occasion, please apply today!


Qualifications


Mandatory:


The main qualifications for this role include:


  • Post-Secondary education in accounting
  • 3 + years’ experience with full cycle accounting
  • Excellent interpersonal skills


If you have previous experience in a start-up environment, you will know that this type of company is ever-changing and evolving and requires someone flexible and able to adapt quickly.


What’s the Bottom Line:


  • $70,000 – $80,000 annual salary
  • Group insurance benefits
  • 3 weeks’ vacation


Location: Ottawa – Remote


Internal Job ID#: 4119

title: CONTROLLER
description:
Job description:

GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible and accountable to lead, manage, support and provide direction to all staff within the department through effective goals/objectives setting, performance monitoring and reviews, communication, and the execution of on-the-job training and development plans.
  • Ensures a robust department structure by maintaining effective staffing levels and creating succession plans and related employee development plans to support current and future needs. 
  • Develops and executes an annual strategic plan for the department supporting company performance objectives and industry/field related benchmarking and trends.
  • Collects, measures and monitors data related to the overall effectiveness of the department; benchmarking and analyzing these trends to establish action plans for continuous improvement (QOS process).
  • Develops and implements new processes and procedures, as needed to support changing business demands.
  • Facilitates effective two-way communication through department meetings (minimum monthly) and an Open-Door philosophy
  • Accountable for department budget preparation, approval and attainment.
  • Ensure all departmental requirements are met on a timely basis, specifically buy not limited to the following:
  •    Monthly reporting requirements (internal and corporate)
  •    Year-end reporting and audit requirements
  •    Annual budget requirements
  •    Capital acquisition process requirements
  •    Bi-weekly payroll requirements
  •    Other management reporting requirements
  •    Regular forecasting
  •    Hedging Analysis
  •   Ensures compliance with GAAP, and Sarbanes-Oxley policies and requirements.
  •    Ensures confidentiality of all proprietary and human resources related information.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  •     Leads by Example
  •     Makes Decisions
  •     Excellent ability to persuade, influence and motivate others
  •     Communicates Effectively
  •     Negotiates
  •     Strong time management and organization skills
  •     Strong computer skills, especially MS Excel
  •     Decisive
  •     Ability to work overtime to complete projects by the required deadline

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

  • Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or related field of study
  • Accounting Designation (CPA) required
  • Post-secondary Degree in a related field preferred (business)

WORK EXPERIENCE:

  • 7 or more years of work-related experience
  • Minimum 5 years related experience
  • Minimum 3 years supervisory experience preferred
  • Experience in the automotive industry preferred

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:

PERFORMANCE MEASURES:

•   Budget Attainment

•   Budgeting/forecasting accuracy

•   Departmental Strategic Plan Execution

•   Departmental Succession Plan and Employee development plans.

•   Detailed forecasting methodology

•   EOS Metrics

•   On-time month-end reporting

•   On-time quote capitals

•   QOS Measurables

•   Year-end audit binder submission for external auditor's - timely completion and management of audit staff

 

Physical Demands – Normal amount of sitting and standing; Ability to move around an office environment and on the production floor;  Ability to work at a computer workstation; Ability to bend, twist, lift, reach.  Required to carry out job duties and responsibilities in a work environment that may include, but is not limited to, varying levels of noise and/or temperature. Ability to lift max. 50lbs periodically.



We offer:

Competive wages and benefits.  Diverse and inclusive work environment.

title: Autonomous Command Pit Controller
description:
Description

Improve today. Define tomorrow.

At Côté Gold, we focus on what we contribute, not just what we extract. We believe that in order for prosperity to be sustained, it must be shared, it must support the well-being of our employees and our communities, and it must be achieved with minimal impact to the environment.

Côté Gold is being developed in partnership with the Mattagami First Nation, Flying Post First Nation and Métis Nation of Ontario, Region 3.

The open-pit gold mine is a joint venture between IAMGOLD and Sumitomo Metal Mining Co. Ltd. and is operated by IAMGOLD. We are located near Gogama, Ontario, with access to stable infrastructure and strong connections with our local communities.

Accessing Opportunities at Côté Gold

IAMGOLD is committed to treating all people in a way that respects their dignity and independence. Should you require any support or accommodation during the recruitment process or otherwise, please notify us when you apply and we will work to meet your accessibility needs.

Autonomous Command Pit Controller

The Autonomous Command Pit Controller is responsible for coordinating all field aspects of Autonomous Operations Reliability. Advises the control centre on operational changes that should be made to optimize the autonomous operations as well as the individual truck operations within the mine.

Area 1

Key Responsibilities

Pit operations efficiency.
  • Coordinate and direct operations team members to ensure safe and production operations.
  • Perform regular survey and validation activities of the Autonomous Operating Zone (AOZ)
  • Conduct pit inspections and area surveys.
  • Conduct field interactions and incident investigations. Create safe zones for others to work.
  • Ensure all Autonomous Haulage System (AHS) activities are carried out in compliance with regulations and mine guidelines.
  • Identify truck behaviors that requires maintenance or optimization and inform appropriate personnel.
  • Interact with the AHS system as needed for manual interventions.
Area 2

Safe and reliable equipment operation and troubleshooting.
  • Troubleshoot autonomous equipment, run recovery scripts and manually reset equipment as required.
  • Ensure all equipment is maintained and used in accordance with company health and safety standards.
  • Responsible for ensuring system configuration is optimal for Autonomous Mine Truck (AMT) performance.
  • Responsible for truck recovery and intervention.
  • Responsible for investigating any occurrences that cause AMTs to stop.
  • Accurate completion of documentation and data entry where necessary.
  • Monitor field operations and truck performance to ensure key performance indicators are met
  • Identify faults and troubleshoot equipment as required.
  • Responsible for ensuring the truck is available in the correct mode as required.
Area 3

Improve autonomous operations reliability.
  • Commit to continuous learning and improvement.
  • Continually seek to improve your team's skill set.
  • Watch for inefficiencies or problems.
  • Ensure problems and inefficiencies are shared with others.
  • Work collaboratively to troubleshoot and resolve problems.
  • Consider risk along the five dimensions (throughput, time, quality, sustainability and cost).
Area 4

Work collaboratively with others to deliver operational reliability.
  • Coordinate with other team members on site to meet shift deliverables.
  • Mentor and train new team members.
  • Participate in and lend your expertise to the team.
  • Communicate clearly and effectively using the tools provided.
  • Ensure equipment logs and shift logs are accurate and complete.
  • Ensure any deficiencies are communicated to the appropriate team members for follow up.
  • Participate in multi-disciplinary teams to deliver on our commitment to our team, our communities, the environment, and our shareholders.
Job Qualifications

Minimum Requirements And Nice To Haves

Minimum Qualifications, Formal Education, Certifications or Equivalents
  • Grade 12 or equivalent.
  • College diplomas or university degrees in a related field such as mine engineering, robotics, or autonomous systems is considered an asset.
Work Experience – Nature & Length
  • 5 or more years of experience in an open pit mining environment or autonomous operations environment.
  • Previous exposure to Autonomous Mining Systems is highly desirable, but not essential.
Additional Qualifications – Competency Requirements
  • Advanced computer literacy.
  • Excellent communication skills (both verbal and written)
  • Ability to work under pressure.
  • Sound knowledge of open pit mining fundamentals and autonomous mining operations.
What We Offer

IAMGOLD believes in rewarding outstanding performance with an equally outstanding total rewards package. Our attractive offerings include:
  • Competitive Salary and Bonus
  • Extended Health, Dental and Insurance Benefit Coverage
  • Health Spending Account
  • Fitness & Wellness Subsidy
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program
  • Registered Pension Plan with Company Match
  • Employee Share Purchase Plan with Company Match
  • TFSA & RRSP
  • Electric Vehicle Subsidy
Empowering People – Extraordinary Performance

IAMGOLD is a leading mid-tier Canadian gold producer with operating gold mines on three continents. We are in growth-mode, with a robust pipeline of development and exploration projects in Canada, South America and Africa. Throughout our 30 year history, we have demonstrated our commitment to responsible and sustainable mining practices, and our Zero Harm® commitment ensures that we continually strive to reach the highest standards in human health and safety, minimize our impact on the environment and support the development of the local communities in which we proudly operate. IAMGOLD was recently recognized by the Corporate Knights magazine on its Top 50 Corporate Citizens in Canada list.

Primary Location

Canada

Work Locations

06 - Cote Gold Mine Site

Job

Operations

Organization

Cote Gold

title: Controller
description:
Job Description

We are hiring a Controller in our Mississauga, ON or St. Thomas, ON locations!

As a Controller, you will be responsible for the day to day operations of the Finance Department and the timely & accurate reporting of all financial information including reports required by Company management, Masco Corporation and regulatory agencies.

You will provide leadership and coordination of Company reporting, compliance, internal control, and budget management functions.

In this role, you will ensure Company accounting procedures conform with both Canadian and U.S generally accepted accounting principles and consistent with Masco Accounting Policy.

What You Will Do
  • Plan, coordinate and advise the activities of General Accounting, AR, AP and Costing
  • Responsible for all monthly, quarterly and year-end closings and financial reporting
  • Ensure that all established policies, rules, regulations and agreements are followed
  • Ensure that all department processes and procedures are appropriately documented and followed
  • Maintain an adequate system of accounting records and set of controls
  • Keep abreast of current accounting trends, practices and regulations
  • Supervise and analyze monthly operating results against budget, forecast and prior year
  • Ensure compliance with local, provincial, and federal reporting requirements
  • Coordinate & supervise various transfer pricing relationships/reporting
  • Establish, implement and monitor short- and long-range departmental goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures
  • Manage and direct the performance, recruitment, retention and development of staff to effectively accomplish the department's goals and objectives
  • Recommend and monitor benchmarks for measuring financial and operating performance
  • Coordinate the various tax compliance reporting including statutory financial statements and act as Company representative for any financial and taxation audits, both internal and external
  • Assist VP Finance/CFO with administration of the various company pension plans

title: Contrôleur | Controller
description:
Job Description

We are hiring a Controller in our Mississauga, ON or St. Thomas, ON locations!

As a Controller, you will be responsible for the day to day operations of the Finance Department and the timely & accurate reporting of all financial information including reports required by Company management, Masco Corporation and regulatory agencies.

You will provide leadership and coordination of Company reporting, compliance, internal control, and budget management functions.

In this role, you will ensure Company accounting procedures conform with both Canadian and U.S generally accepted accounting principles and consistent with Masco Accounting Policy.

What You Will Do
  • Plan, coordinate and advise the activities of General Accounting, AR, AP and Costing
  • Responsible for all monthly, quarterly and year-end closings and financial reporting
  • Ensure that all established policies, rules, regulations and agreements are followed
  • Ensure that all department processes and procedures are appropriately documented and followed
  • Maintain an adequate system of accounting records and set of controls
  • Keep abreast of current accounting trends, practices and regulations
  • Supervise and analyze monthly operating results against budget, forecast and prior year
  • Ensure compliance with local, provincial, and federal reporting requirements
  • Coordinate & supervise various transfer pricing relationships/reporting
  • Establish, implement and monitor short- and long-range departmental goals, objectives, policies, and operating procedures
  • Manage and direct the performance, recruitment, retention and development of staff to effectively accomplish the department's goals and objectives
  • Recommend and monitor benchmarks for measuring financial and operating performance
  • Coordinate the various tax compliance reporting including statutory financial statements and act as Company representative for any financial and taxation audits, both internal and external
  • Assist VP Finance/CFO with administration of the various company pension plans
  • Advise VP Finance/CFO of significant matters within the financial reporting & the department
Who You Are
  • Detailed knowledge of finance, accounting, internal audit, budgeting, and cost control principles including Canadian and U.S. Generally Accepted Accounting Principles
  • Knowledge of automated financial and accounting reporting systems

  • Highly developed problem solving and analytical skills
  • Ability to analyze financial data and prepare financial reports, statements and projections

  • Ability to participate in and facilitate group meetings

title: Controller
description:
RESPONSIBILITES

Financial and management statements – quarterly and annual preparation/presentation.

Ensure accounts payable, accounts receivable and payroll functions are managed in an efficient and accurate way.

Provide senior management with analysis of results including development of cost and reporting models that support a growing business.

Drafting and implementation of accounting policies to safeguard company assets and ensure accounting rules are followed.

Aid with yearly external audit/reviews.

Ensure the Inventory system is accurate, review inventory levels, stock held is at required levels.

Management of accounting staff members.

Preparation of yearly plan in collaboration with President and Chief Revenue Officer.

Presentation of yearly plan to shareholders.

Preparation and presentation of monthly and yearly cash flow budgets based on current sales and production schedules.

Continued updating and development of Cost Drivers to support profitable growth.

Enforcement and updating of company credit policy.

Work with the Group CFO to develop short- and long-term corporate tax planning to ensure compliance and an efficient tax program.

Qualifications

University Degree specializing in accounting or business, preference given to those with an accounting designation along with a minimum of 5 years of progressive accounting experience.

Experience In Construction And Manufacturing Preferred.

Ability to understand and utilize advanced technologies.

Excellent communication skills – both written and oral.

Strong Organizational And Administrative Skills DURATION

Permanent

title: Controller
description:
What's Bench? Check us out in Medium, Betakit, Financial Post, Perkins + Will, our Instagram, and our Blog.

We acknowledge that Bench headquarters is located on the traditional, ancestral, and unceded territory of the Coast Salish Peoples, including the territories of the xʷməθkwəy̓əm (Musqueam), Skwxwú7mesh (Squamish), and Səl̓ílwətaʔ/Selilwitulh (Tsleil-Waututh) Nations.

Businesses need to understand their financial performance, but for many smaller ones, this means a trade-off between managing their books and running their businesses.

Our mission is to make a profound difference in the quality of life of one million people. From creatives to chiropractors, Bench helps thousands of small business owners and entrepreneurs master their financial lives. Because understanding your finances should be three things: simple, effortless, and affordable.

We're growing fast, and we're looking for exceptional people to join us on this incredible journey. Check out our culture guide to learn more about what it's like to work at Bench and read more about our business here!

What does the Finance department look like?

We're a close-knit team of scrappy, driven folks that is committed to making sure Bench has what it needs to succeed. From accounting, treasury and legal, to strategy, financial planning and analysis, we have a broad portfolio that lets us engage with every part of the business. We enjoy solving problems together through open communication and collaboration while respecting each other's ideas.

You will be responsible for scaling up our accounting function to meet the needs of our growing company. The challenges of growth at scale are exciting, and you'll be at the forefront of our plans to solve them.

What You'll Get Up To:
  • Oversee all accounting operations teams including:
    • GL accounting
    • Accounts payable
    • US, Canada and International payroll
    • Billing, revenue and accounts receivable
    • Equity accounting and administration
  • Oversee all accounting and reporting related to the balance sheet, including:
    • Leases, subleases and lease liabilities
    • Long-term assets
    • Accounts receivable and other current assets
    • Accounts Payable and other current liabilities
  • Develop and manage financial controls in accordance with the company's procedures
  • Develop and maintain accounting policies and procedures
  • Coordinate and manage the external audit
  • Support internal audits
  • Support corporate and sales tax
  • Help scale accounting operations
  • Drive accounting-wide efficiencies and value-added improvements
  • Support executive initiatives
  • Help grow, develop, and empower a world-class team

What You'll Need:
  • A professional accounting designation (CA, CMA, CGA, CPA)
  • 5+ years of experience in financial reporting, including 2+ years in a managerial role
  • Experience managing a team of accounting professionals
  • Strong knowledge of US GAAP (ASC 606 experience preferred)
  • Ability to develop and maintain strong internal and external working relationships
  • Experience working at a multinational company
  • Strong analytical, decision making, planning, and organizational skills
  • Strong project management skills, including ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, changing environment
  • ERP experience preferred (i.e. Netsuite, Intacct, SAP, etc)
  • Public practice experience at a top 10 national firm or publicly-traded tech/SaaS company preferred.

It could be an even better fit if you:
  • Have a well-developed equity lens. You actively engage in leadership of teams and of strategic-level work with an equity lens and an eye for inclusivity. You don't just accept equitable practices, you model and advocate for them on your teams and in your work.

What You'll Get:
  • At Bench, we share information freely and openly whenever possible. The salary range for this role is $163,920 - $204,900 with a component of these earnings made up of variable pay
  • In addition, we offer an extended benefits package that includes paid vacation, unlimited paid flex days, stock options, and full health, dental, and vision.
  • You'll get unlimited access to Inkblot Therapy, our virtual counselling service to support mental wellbeing, and Bravely, our confidential, on-demand, 1:1 professional coaching service.
  • Bench has a number of Affinity Groups - groups of people who have shared identities and experiences! The purpose of these groups is to support underrepresented Benchmates and amplify their voices.
  • Bench is moving towards being a fully remote organization, and we're in the process of closing our Vancouver HQ. We are looking at alternative solutions to bring teams together for collaboration and connection.
  • We currently focus our hiring efforts in the following provinces: British Columbia, Alberta, Ontario, New Brunswick, and Nova Scotia.
  • You'll have access to our Home Office Setup Fund, to ensure that you have everything you need to work comfortably from home, from day one.

Everyone has their own unique talents. Even if you don't meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why you'd be a great fit for this role in your application.

We believe that unchecked biases disproportionately impact the most marginalized people in society—including but not limited to BIPOC, LGBTQ2S+ people, immigrants, and people with disabilities. We strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or other marginalized communities because we believe that without you, we are all less. At Bench, we don't stand for tokenism. We stand for representation.

title: Contrôleur / Controller
description:
Contrôleur

Le contrôleur est responsable de toutes les activités de comptabilité, de paie et de fiscalité de lentreprise. Il veille à ce que les registres financiers soient bien tenus, à lexactitude de la paie, au respect de la législation fiscale et en assurant en permanence des contrôles internes solides.Le rôle de contrôleur relève directement du Vice-Président Finances et travaille en collaboration avec le Directeur de FP&A.

Ce Que Tu Feras
  • Gérer le processus de fin de mois ainsi que la production des états financiers
  • S’assurer que toutes les conciliations sont effectuées de façon régulière
  • Fournir des informations financières à valeur ajoutée (Opex, Capex, détails de fournisseurs) aux gestionnaires des départements et les assister dans l’optimisation de la performance budgétaire
  • Gérer le «Vendor Master» ainsi que le cycle des comptes payables
  • Superviser le processus de paie, soccuper de générer les reçus fiscaux annuels ainsi que toute documentation requise par les employés
  • Effectuer les déclarations et remises mensuelles des taxes à la consommation et effectuer les calculs d’impôts corporatifs
  • Diriger la prise d’information afin d’effectuer les calculs liés aux crédits d’impôts
  • Effectuer des analyses financières et jouer un rôle clé dans lamélioration des processus
  • Gérer le processus d’audit annuel ainsi que toute autre vérification requise
  • Superviser l’équipe des comptes payables
Ce Que Tu As Besoin D’avoir
  • 6 à 8 years dexpérience en comptabilité financière ou en audit
  • Fortes connaissances des systèmes comptables connaissance de NetSuite et des outils danalytique comme Alteryx
  • la préparation des états financiers avec un minimum de retard et de retouches
  • Fortes connaissances dans le «reporting by channel» ou par segment incluant la façon de structurer l’information pour atteindre ce but
  • Expérience requise avec les achats, les inventaires, l’établissement des coûts (costing), les provisions et ses déclinaisons
  • Bonnes connaissances des lois et règlements en lien avec la taxation en Amérique du Nord - taxes de ventes, impôt des sociétés et crédits d’impôts
Ce Que Tu y Gagneras
  • Gros rabais sur des marques de plein air et de mode pour vous et votre famille
  • Ensemble complet davantages médicaux et dentaires
  • Accès complet aux services de télémédecine via lapplication Dialogue
  • Budget dapprentissage et de développement
  • Options de travail flexibles
  • Un espace de travail moderne au cœur de la Petite Italie à Montréal
  • Possibilité de faire partie d’équipes sportives, de participer à des sorties de groupe et des concours, grâce à notre incroyable comité social.
Altitude Sports est le leader de la vente en ligne au Canada, et se spécialise dans la rencontre de la mode avec le plein air. Fondée en 1984, l’entreprise offre des conseils de premier plan en matière d’équipement et de vêtements techniques haut de gamme, en plus d’un programme d’avantages destinés à ses membres et d’une multitude de produits soigneusement sélectionnés pour les aventures urbaines et en plein air.

___________________________________________________________

Controller

The Controller is responsible for all accounting, payroll and tax activities of the company ensuring that financial records are well maintained, payroll accuracy, compliance with tax legislation and ensuring strong internal controls. The Controller role reports directly to the Vice President Finance and works in conjunction with the Director of FP&A.

What You Will Do
  • Manage the month-end process and production of the financial statements
  • Ensure all account reconciliations are performed routinely
  • Provide value-added financial information (Opex, Capex, Vendor details) to department leaders and budget owners to assist them in optimizing performance
  • Manage the Vendor Master and Accounts Payables cycles for the company
  • Manage the processing of Payroll along with the generation of annual tax receipts and other required employee payroll documentation
  • Ensure compliance with sales tax filings and perform corporate tax calculations
  • Lead the accumulation of input information and estimates for tax credits
  • Conduct financial analysis and be a key assets in processes improvements
  • Supervise the Accounts Payable department
  • Manage the annual financial audit and any other audit request
What You Need To Have
  • 6 to 8 years of experience in financial accounting or audit
  • Strong knowledge in Financial applications such as NetSuite and analytics tools such as Alteryx
  • Experience establishing clear month-end procedures, structuring chart of accounts and generating financial statements with minimal delays and rework
  • Strong understanding of channel or segmented financial reporting including how to structure input information to achieve this goal
  • Experience with purchasing, inventory flows, costing, provisions and component break-downs
  • Good knowledge of taxation rules within North America - sales, corporate and tax credits
What’s In It For You
  • Discounts on outdoor and fashion brands for you and your family
  • Comprehensive health and dental benefits package
  • Full access to Telemedicine services through the Dialogue app
  • Learning and Development Budget
  • Flexible working options
  • A modern workspace in the heart of Montreal’s Little Italy
  • Opportunity to participate in sport teams, group outings and contests
Altitude Sports is Canadas ecommerce leader, working and playing at the intersection of fashion and the outdoors. Founded in 1984, the company offers best-in-class advice on premium gear and technical apparel, a members-only benefits program and a curated selection of products for outdoor adventures and urban pursuits.

If you are a talented and experienced Controller, David Aplin Group has the right opportunity for you! Our Edmonton-based client has partnered with Drea Larson, Senior Consultant, to lead their next search for the permanent position of Controller, based in Edmonton, Alberta.

description:

  • Coordinating and preparing internal and external consolidated financial statements

  • Preparation and assistance in financially related regulatory reporting, including quarterly Management Discussion and Analysis
  • Assessing current accounting and internal control systems, offering recommendations for improvement and implementing new processes

  • Demonstrated ability to manage projects with multiple priorities and timelines

Evertz Microsystems (TSX:ET) is a leading global manufacturer of broadcast equipment and solutions that deliver content to television sets, on-demand services, WebTV, IPTV, and mobile devices (like phones and tablets). title: Retail Accounting Manager
description:
THE OPPORTUNITY:

 

RETAIL ACCOUNTING MANAGER

REPORTING TO DIRECTOR OF RETAIL ACCOUNTING

 

LOCATION:

 

MARKHAM, ON

 

ABOUT THE COMPANY:  

 

Greenergy International is the second largest privately-owned company in the UK who is owned by Brookfield Asset Management. Established in 1992, with global offices in Canada, the USA, Brazil and Dubai that delivers low-cost fuels to customers.  

 

In Canada, the company operates a national gas and convenience retail network of over 230 locations, with a vast portfolio of brands as well as a strategic fuel supply network. Greenergy is the exclusive Mobil branded wholesaler and offers the leading PC Optimum loyalty program at these locations. It also wholly owns and manages the Mr. Gas and Waypoint Convenience brands, as well as Inver and Breakaway offers with independent retailers.  

 

Each employee adds value to the business and the expectations are high. Greenergy International is a big organization with a small company mind-set. The work is diverse and interesting; we are constantly evolving and improving. 

 

ABOUT THE ROLE:


Greenergy continues to grow in the retail business. This role is to support the business growth and to manage inventory accounting transactions. 

 

KEY ACTIVITIES:


Fuel and Convenience store (C-store) Inventory

  • Oversee and manage inventory transactions and balances in related G/L accounts.
  • Review and post manual inventory invoices and adjustments.
  • Handle fuel and c-store inventory inquiries.
  • Support in inventory-related projects.


Freight

  • Review and post freight charge invoices.
  • Update freight rates in back-office system.
  • Handle freight-related inquiries.
  • Support in fuel inventory-related projects.


System and Process

  • Assist in ERP system maintenance.
  • Coordinate and participate in User Acceptance Tests.
  • Track system and process documentation.


Other

  • Manage a small team.
  • Participate in month-end/year-end close processes.
  • Participate in ad-hoc projects.
  • Assist with audit requests.


SKILLS/ATTRIBUTES REQUIRED:


  • University degree or diploma in Accounting or Business.
  • CPA designation required.
  • Minimum 8 to 10 years of progressive accounting experience, preferably in the retail industry.
  • Previous supervisory experience preferred.
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities.
  • Strong English communication skills (verbal and written) required.
  • Strong organization, analytical, communication and time management skills.
  • Able to connect with peers from varied backgrounds.

 

SKILLS/ATTRIUTES DESIRED:


  •  Knowledge of and experience with Microsoft NAV or other ERP systems an asset.

 

Greenergy is an inclusive employer. As such, we welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We appreciate all applications, however only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Controller
description:
Fantastic opportunity for an experienced Controller with a diverse skillset to join a well-respected international organization right here in Ottawa! The successful candidate will be expected to provide financial counsel and support throughout the organization and must have a strong finance business partnering and financial reporting background. Reporting to the VP of Finance, and working closely alongside the senior management team, the selected incumbent will be given ample opportunity to flex their FP&A muscles while also providing support in the areas of financial reporting, general accounting, and internal controls. This is a rare opportunity to join a booming organization which believes in empowering their employees and provides a flexible work arrangement and an excellent work-life balance! Main duties include:


  • Responsible for the full scope of financial disciplines impacting the financial reporting, planning and financial consolidation process
  • Act as a key financial business partner and provide financial advice to various senior managers
  • Ensure a sustainable process is in place to support actuals reporting, program forecast and variance analysis
  • Develop and maintain dynamic financial forecasts to support monthly, annual and long-range forecasts
  • Ensure compliance with financial policies/procedures and adequate internal controls are in place
  • Provide ongoing financial support for division business cases for new and current portfolios and investment decisions


This is a great opportunity to work for a stable and globally recognized organization which benefits from a very low turnover! If you’ve been considering making a move recently but have been waiting for that perfect opportunity – the wait is over! Apply now!


Qualifications:


The main qualifications for this role include:


  • Completed CPA designation is strongly preferred
  • Minimum 7+ years of diverse financial accounting experience in the areas of FP&A, operations support, general accounting, and internal controls
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Strong business acumen and strategic thinking skills
  • Advanced Excel skills


What’s the Bottom Line:


  • $135,000 – $165,000 annual salary
  • Generous vacation policy
  • Lucrative bonus structure
  • Defined benefit pension plan plus stock units!
  • Excellent benefits package
  • Flexible hybrid work schedule


Location: Ottawa

title: Controller
description:
Description

Do you like being a transformational leader? Be a key team member as a Controller for a Company that embraces collaboration, success and a positive impact on the environment.

As a key member of the BC Management Team, the Controller position is a hands-on role responsible for ensuring that the Accounting and Finance team provides the services necessary to support the operational and financial success of the organization. Reporting directly to the CEO, the successful candidate will be an articulated and motivated experienced professional, filled with passion and commitment to help us grow and succeed for the future. The Controller is an expert at building relationships with stakeholders at all levels – both internally and externally and your career demonstrates entrepreneurial achievements.

What will you do?
  • Oversee the preparation of monthly consolidated financial statements for the company and coordinate external year-end review;
  • Manage multi-location financial reporting, including standardization of reporting and review processes;
  • Manage Accounting Services (payroll, AP, AR and general accounting) and organize department assignment;
  • Analyze and interpret accounting and operational data to forecast profitability and performance against budget;
  • Coach, train and evaluate performance of direct reports;
  • Identify new opportunities that drive financial success;
  • Ensure the timely preparation of month-end financial statements;
  • Lead month-end close for all divisions and maintain various schedules such as fixed assets, amortization schedules, month-end adjusting entries;
  • Assist in reconciliations as required for audited financial statements;
  • Provide commentary on monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements and insight on individual operations across the region;
  • Initiate and implement process improvement and accounting control measures;
  • Assume responsibility for the coordination and submission of annual budget preparation; and
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
Requirements

What will you bring?
  • Completion of relevant post-secondary education (minimum Bachelor’s degree in related field);
  • Professional designation (CA, CGA or CMA);
  • Minimum of 5 years experience in a Controller role within a large private organization;
  • Experience in the waste/recycling, manufacturing, and/or transportation industry considered an asset;
  • Demonstrated business acumen, strategic thinking and an ability to execute against formulated strategy;
  • Strong leadership skills, able to effect positive change through structured training, coaching and engagement initiatives;
  • Prior experience managing a team of both direct and indirect reports in a multi-site operating environment;
  • Process-oriented thinking with strong analytical skills and a detail-oriented commitment to excellence;
  • Exceptional customer service skills with both internal and external stakeholders;
  • Excellent command of the English language and strong presentation skills;
  • Proficient with MS Office Suite along with experience in or the willingness/capacity to learn industry-specific programs; and
  • Experience with Microsoft Dynamic – Business Central considered an asset.
What do we have to offer you?
  • Excellent total compensation package which includes but is not limited to a competitive salary, participation in an incentive plan, and a comprehensive Group Insurance Plan;
  • A solid organization within which you are able to showcase your talents towards the future growth of the company
  • Ongoing support and resources to ensure your success in this role;
  • Training and development opportunities supplemented with a generous Tuition Assistance Program
  • A family-oriented culture with an entrepreneurial mind-set that encourages you to take ownership of your role and effect change.
If this sounds like the role for you, please apply today! We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Controller
description:
Description

One of the Lower Mainland’s unique industrial manufacturers / fabricators is looking for a Controller to help lead the organization through a period of growth and transformation. Located in the TriCities and working closely with the incumbent accounting team, the Controller will lead the organization through a major ERP implementation, provide management reporting to the leadership team, establish effective budgeting and forecasting, and be a “thinking partner” to the General Manager of the business.

Additionally, The Controller Will Be Responsible For
  • Oversight of the full cycle of accounting including cash management
  • Budgeting, forecasting, planning
  • Project costing and oversight
  • Management of credit applications
  • Payroll management
  • Maintenance of inventory including annual inventory counts
  • Manage supplier relationships
  • Financial statement preparation
  • Engage with external stakeholders (bank, tax/audit partners etc.)
  • Team leadership
Requirements

This is an ideal role for a designated CPA with significant exposure to the full cycle of accounting in a privately held, inventory driven business and experience leading an organization through a full ERP implementation. A strong technical foundation that allows the successful candidate to seamlessly move from the tactical day-to-day to strategic management reporting and multi-year planning is critical. Additionally, high emotional intelligence and low ego are necessary.

If this sounds like the role for you, please apply today! We look forward to hearing from you.

Reporting to the Director of Finance, the successful candidate will lead an existing team of finance professionals while overseeing the month, quarter and year-end close process. In addition to working closely with the senior management team in each Business Unit as their trusted business advisor.

What will be your impact?

Review complex revenue recognition for software contracts which are accounted for under IFRS 15, including regular review of WIP schedules

Assist with the implementation of new accounting standards (e.g. IFRS 16 Leases) and resolve accounting matters through independent research, discussion, and collaboration in areas such as revenue recognition and acquisition accounting

Review account reconciliations, analyze results, and prepare reporting to senior management on a monthly and quarterly basis

Assist the business and operational leaders with monthly forecasting

Become a business partner by providing support and analysis to the business and operational leaders

Manage, coach and mentor a team of finance professionals

Ensure internal controls are in place and identify potential risks and controls to mitigate them

Identify, improve and standardize finance processes

Prepare audit requests and respond to queries during reviews and the interim and year-end audit

Special projects and ad hoc reports (ex: due diligence)

What are we looking for?

5+ years of work experience within a large accounting firm, combined with experience in industry

Certified CPA

Bilingual (French & English)

Experience with complex revenue recognition (Project accounting, software accounting)

Experience with IFRS reporting framework

Experience with Microsoft Dynamics AX, a plus

Intermediate to advanced skills with Excel, and good practical knowledge of Microsoft Office

What we offer?

Opportunities to grow your career

3 weeks' vacation when starting, 4 weeks after 3 years, and 5 weeks after 7 years of service

5 personal days per year

Flexible work options

Group insurance paid 100% by the employer starting from your first day of employment

Employee stock ownership and RRSP/401k programs

Lifestyle rewards

Fun and collaborative work environment

And more!

  • Support the development and implementation of the Strategic Plan
  • Lead and implement all financial activities to support the achievement of the organization's Strategic Objectives
  • Work collaboratively with other employees to implement projects and initiatives that advance the organization’s Strategic Priorities
  • Lead and manage human resources initiatives and activities for direct reports including coaching, recruitment, onboarding, performance management, employee development, employee recognition and general support
  • Ad hoc responsibilities include occasional and one time responsibilities as needed and identifying any work, issue or task that does not appear to be under the care of any particular Job Description, and proactively resolving the work, issue or task or flagging it to the appropriate co-worker for their attention

Qualifications
  • Demonstrated ability to work with highly sensitive and confidential information
  • Well-developed interpersonal skills; ability to work well in a team environment that promotes inclusiveness and proactive communication among team members
  • Excellent communication skills with strong, written, verbal and presentation skills
  • Well-developed listening, coaching, delegating, training and mentoring skills; advocates a team approach
  • Ability to work independently under pressure
  • Excellent analytical and organizational skills; the ability to think and plan ahead and manage multiple projects, prioritize and meet deadlines
  • Excellent decision-making and time-management skills
  • Strong attention to detail to maintain organizational systems
  • Valid CPA designation preferred with demonstrated technical accounting knowledge and experience
  • 3 - 8 years of experience in financial management including a strong background in finance, accounting, budgeting and cost control principles including GAAP
  • Knowledge of financial and accounting computer software; experience with construction software as an asset
  • Experience in the construction and/or residential/commercial rental and leasing industries

title: Controller
description:
Are you a CPA-designated, hands-on Controller who has experience in a start-up environment with IFRS experience, and open to new opportunities in Toronto? Do you have experience implementing internal controls, strong technical accounting knowledge and comfort overseeing the month-end process?

Do you have proven experience leading and motivating a team, diverse experience in a smaller-company environment, being involved with HR, payroll, and other departments?

If this role describes you and your experience well, this may be a great Controller ole for you to consider!

Advantages
  • Excellent base salary offering
  • The opportunity to work for a fast-growing start-up
  • On-site parking
  • Hybrid model

Responsibilities

Reporting to the CFO, your duties and responsibilities will include;
  • Establishing, monitoring, and enforcing policies and procedures as well as internal controls
  • Oversee all accounts, ledgers, and reporting systems ensuring compliance with appropriate IFRS standards and regulatory requirements
  • Monitor and confirm financial condition by conducting audits; providing information to external auditors
  • Consistently analyze financial data and present financial reports in an accurate and timely manner
  • Monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statement preparation
  • Assist leadership in the annual budgeting and planning process; administer and review all financial plans and compare to actual results with a view to identify, explain, and correct variances as appropriate
  • Prepare and manage organizational cash flow on a daily basis
  • Prepare budgets by establishing schedules; collecting, analyzing, and consolidating financial data; recommending plans
  • Prepare and submit Executive payroll, remittances, etc. for Canada and U.S.
  • Complete operational requirements for planning, monitoring, and appraising job results assigned to staff; coaching, counseling, and disciplining staff

Qualifications
  • CPA designated
  • Big 4 audit experience is highly desired
  • Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills
  • Strength with MS Excel and financial modeling
  • M&A experience is an asset

title: Controller
description:
Company Bio

Entrepreneurial Leader

Heroux-Devtek, the world’s 3rd largest producer of landing gear, serves the civil and military aerospace markets from production facilities in North America and Europe. The Company’s longevity, flexibility, and track record for the development and implementation of innovative production systems have distinguished it as a leader in the domain. With its most recent acquisitions, Heroux-Devtek is bolstering its status as one of the foremost landing gear, actuation and hydraulic system designers and manufacturers in the global aerospace industry.

Division Info

The Aerostructure Market of Héroux-Devtek focuses on a complete line of precision machined structural components and assemblies, from simple aluminum parts to large monolithic five-axis complex components.

Summary Of Position

Acts as controller for the Toronto facility, with overall responsibility for all matters relating to finance and accounting at the Magtron site. This includes creating and managing all policies and procedures related to accounting; reviewing and updating standard costs (inventory valuation) for all items; safe guarding of all assets; produce and analyze monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements; coordinate budgeting process and manage and create financial budgets and forecasts; oversee all financial audits for Toronto; coordinate rate audit information with customer; review all bids submitted to our customers, collaborate with the HR department on health insurance, payroll, and pension and help analyze annual pay increases, and BAAN support for operations.

Main Responsibilities
  • Prepare reports that summarize and forecast company business activity and financial position in areas of income, expenses, and earnings based on past, present, and expected operations.
  • Direct preparation of budgets.
  • Review profitability of new (bids) and existing parts – changes in COGS
  • Advise management about insurance coverage for protection against property losses and potential liabilities. Direct determination of depreciation rates to apply to capital assets.
  • Advise management on desirable operational adjustments due to tax code revisions.
  • Arrange for audits of company’s accounts.
  • Prepare reports required by regulatory agencies.
  • Coordinate the month-end, quarter-end and year-end closing process.
  • Review company financial statements for accuracy and clarity.
  • Adherence to all company policies, procedures and health and safety requirements.
  • Any other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
  • CPA, CA, CMA or CGA designation
  • 5+ years senior accounting management experience in a manufacturing environment.
  • Strong general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll, income tax and banking working knowledge.
  • Supervisory experience.
  • Proficient knowledge of Excel, problem solving and analytical skills required.
  • Detailed oriented.
  • Solid oral and written communications skills.

title: REAL ESTATE CONTROLLER
description:
Company Bio

Entrepreneurial Leader

Heroux-Devtek, the world’s 3rd largest producer of landing gear, serves the civil and military aerospace markets from production facilities in North America and Europe. The Company’s longevity, flexibility, and track record for the development and implementation of innovative production systems have distinguished it as a leader in the domain. With its most recent acquisitions, Heroux-Devtek is bolstering its status as one of the foremost landing gear, actuation and hydraulic system designers and manufacturers in the global aerospace industry.

Division Info

The Aerostructure Market of Héroux-Devtek focuses on a complete line of precision machined structural components and assemblies, from simple aluminum parts to large monolithic five-axis complex components.

Summary Of Position

Acts as controller for the Toronto facility, with overall responsibility for all matters relating to finance and accounting at the Magtron site. This includes creating and managing all policies and procedures related to accounting; reviewing and updating standard costs (inventory valuation) for all items; safe guarding of all assets; produce and analyze monthly, quarterly and annual financial statements; coordinate budgeting process and manage and create financial budgets and forecasts; oversee all financial audits for Toronto; coordinate rate audit information with customer; review all bids submitted to our customers, collaborate with the HR department on health insurance, payroll, and pension and help analyze annual pay increases, and BAAN support for operations.

Main Responsibilities
  • Prepare reports that summarize and forecast company business activity and financial position in areas of income, expenses, and earnings based on past, present, and expected operations.
  • Direct preparation of budgets.
  • Review profitability of new (bids) and existing parts – changes in COGS
  • Advise management about insurance coverage for protection against property losses and potential liabilities. Direct determination of depreciation rates to apply to capital assets.
  • Advise management on desirable operational adjustments due to tax code revisions.
  • Arrange for audits of company’s accounts.
  • Prepare reports required by regulatory agencies.
  • Coordinate the month-end, quarter-end and year-end closing process.
  • Review company financial statements for accuracy and clarity.
  • Adherence to all company policies, procedures and health and safety requirements.
  • Any other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
  • CPA, CA, CMA or CGA designation
  • 5+ years senior accounting management experience in a manufacturing environment.
  • Strong general ledger, accounts payable, accounts receivable, payroll, income tax and banking working knowledge.
  • Supervisory experience.

title: Manager, OTC Confirmation Control Reports & Analytics
description:
Requisition ID: 141033

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Why work for Scotiabank?

Scotiabank is among the largest banks in the world and the most international bank in Canada. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services. Together with our Digital Factories around the world, we are dedicated to helping our 25 million customers become better-off.

This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy. Say hello to a career at Scotiabank!

Global Banking and Markets

Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange, and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

Purpose

The Global Wholesale Operations (“GWO”) confirmation process is a key control within Scotiabank’s derivative products trading environment. The GWO Confirmations department’s primary responsibilities are to affirm transactions, prepare and issue ISDA confirmations that accurately reflect the trade booking of the transaction, examine and verify ISDA confirmations received from issuing counterparties ensuring details accurately reflect the trade booking of the transaction, follow-up on unexecuted confirmations, and to reconcile the Bank’s positions to external electronic trade execution and affirmation/confirmation platforms and to Central Counterparty Clearing Houses.

The GWO Confirmations Manager is responsible for managing the GWO Confirmations team. This includes managing the reporting and analytics operations, as well as the identification and incorporation of changes required to support new regulations, business, products, and Senior Management’s strategies and goals.

The GWO Confirmations Manager is required to coordinate work and manage relationships with external clients and counterparties, as well as manage relationships with key internal partners including Operations, Legal Counsel, Global Risk Management, Compliance, Regulations, Technology, and the Front Office both locally and internationally. Derivative transactions conducted by the Front Office can be complex and include products such as Interest Rate Swaps, Credit Default Swaps, Total Return Swaps on debt and equities, Equity Options and Bond Forwards. Trades are executed bilaterally or through Brokers or Swap Execution Facilities, and are affirmed and confirmed either directly with clients and trade counterparties or through middleware such as MarkitWire, DS Match, etc.

Key Accountabilities

The GWO Confirmations Manager is responsible for:
  • Manage existing OTC Confirmation Reporting framework by:
  • By ensuring all data within OTC Conformation reports across products are operationally accurate and appropriate for distribution to stakeholders.
  • By always ensuring reporting timeliness, coverage and responsiveness to queries relating to OTC Confirmations reports.
  • By ensuring Standard Operating Procedures are in place and up to date for all processes.
  • Propose enhancements to the OTC confirmations reporting framework and work with business and technology stakeholders to improve metrics and analytics required to adhere to the regulatory, control and business requirements.
  • Conceptualize and prepare ad hoc and key action reports as requested by senior management, audit compliance and regulators from time to time.
  • Review on an ongoing basis departmentwide management and work in progress reports and highlight risks associated with OTC Confirmations trades to relevant stakeholders.
  • Ensure a high degree of processing accuracy, customer service, operational efficiency, and conformity to Bank policies and external regulations by:
  • By training, developing, and supervising staff and the work they perform, ensuring reporting issues are identified and rectified in a in a timely manner.
  • By actively identifying and implementing process enhancements and improvements in controls, client service, productivity, and cost effectiveness.
  • Manage resolution of operational issues, ensuring appropriate action is taken for remediation and to prevent future recurrences.
  • Set and maintain customer service standards ensuring internal and external stakeholders needs are understood and met.
  • Ensure operational issues are identified, reported, escalated, and resolution is coordinated with internal stakeholders and relationship owners. Develop and maintain relationships with stakeholders across operations and management.
  • Coordinate management of significant internally and externally initiated change by:
  • Staying abreast of OTC Confirmations regulatory, industry and/or internal initiatives and changes in order to forecast and prepare in advance
  • Define operational and technology requirements especially around analytics, metrics and reporting, coordinating with multiple stakeholders to ensure requirements are met
  • Manage change, seeking input and ensuring buy in from staff and internal partners, and successful controlled implementations of new processes and applications.
  • Interact with Senior Management to provide operational input and recommendations
  • Assist with ad hoc projects as directed by Senior Management – ensure all timelines are met
  • Ensure potential control and risk inherent in the OTC Confirmation process and its reporting are identified, understood and controlled by:
  • Ensuring all OTC derivatives trades are recognized by trade counterparties, economic terms of all transactions are affirmed, and all breaks are identified through accurate and timely reporting.
  • Generate, review, and prepare reports and metrics in accordance with Bank policy and industry standards
  • Ensuring the reporting control framework identifies any gaps in confirmation processing functions prior to execution
  • Ensuring the OTC Confirmations team is reconciled with external electronic trade execution and affirmation/confirmation platforms and Central Counterparty Clearing Houses.
  • Ensuring a clear understanding of and adherence to all OTC related regulations.
  • Providing support to other operations groups with reports, metrics or OTC confirmation details in carrying out their routine operations.
  • Coordinate resolution of long outstanding trades with Legal counsel and Front office.
  • Manage and develop staff to ensure efficient operations, quality of work, attainment of objectives, and creation of a highly trained and motivated set of employees:
  • By setting attainable goals, performance expectations and providing on-going performance feedback and coaching.
  • Cross train staff to dynamically manage workloads across the operation.
  • Ensure the department is appropriately staffed, with sufficient coverage maintained across key positions.
  • Train staff to minimize errors and maximize quality and adherence to policies and standards
  • Ensure proper escalation process is in place to resolve potential issues
  • Assign and prioritize work, while balancing the workload and dynamically shifting cross trained staff to minimize risk and ensure top notch customer service
Requirements
  • Extensive data skills (mining, analysis & visualization) required to drive critical OTC Confirmations business decisions by analyzing metrics, designing and generating relevant reports.
  • Prior experience working with Business Intelligence Dashboards to track metrics, understand data trends and create reports and visualizations.
  • Strong analytical skills to identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns.
  • Advanced expertise in MS Excel, working knowledge or prior experience using Business Intelligence tools would be asset
  • Minimum three (3) years leading and managing an operations team.
  • Excellent attention to detail, maintaining a high degree of accuracy while handling complex derivative products and reports.
  • Excellent time management skills and the ability to work towards meeting multiple deadlines simultaneously. Key attribute is the ability to prioritize and multitask effectively.
  • Strong leadership and managerial background with ability to define new process improvement opportunities including process automation in reporting and metrics.
  • Prior experience effectively managing operational team procedures and processes to improve governance, productivity, control and client service.
  • Excellent oral and written communication and documentation skills. Effective client service skills, interpersonal relations, including excellent teamwork/partnerships and relationship building
  • Excellent problem solving and proven analytical skills with ability to detect, solve and effectively escalate issues.
  • Knowledge of OTC derivative products, structure of derivative transactions and the finance principles that underlie them
  • Knowledge of ISDA Definitions, related templates and the ability to interpret and apply them to transactions.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Corporate Controller
description:
Description

You're a good fit for Robert Half's Corporate Controller position with a reputable business services company, if you have a knack for leading with high standards, positively motivating others, and making critical decisions and have experience taking charge of an accounting and clerical department. In this role, you will be planning and directing all accounting operational functions, handling the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluating accounting and internal control systems, and leading departmental staff. Leading with integrity and reliability and having the ability to manage self and others with urgency, practicality and accountability when providing client services will be essential for this role. Candidates who are creative team players with a talent for challenging the status quo, coming up with unique ideas, negotiating and influencing will be preferred for this position. If it's time to advance your career, find out more about this opportunity and take the next steps toward a very competitive and generous compensation and benefits package. Based in the Nisku, Alberta area, this opening for a Corporate Controller is a permanent position.

How you will make an impact
  • Manage the timing for monthly billing and other cash management techniques to make sure cash collection is on time
  • Capable of handling responsibilities beyond formal job duties
  • Analyze, apply and improve policies, procedures, controls and most methodologies
  • Manage finance department operations, including accounts payable, billings & collections, and payroll
  • Backup the CFO when required
  • Present executive committee and partners with monthly financial reports
  • Manage the production of and monthly monitoring of the annual budget and forecasts
  • Reviews deliverables of self and team to ensure that they meet client expectations
  • Handle daily cash management and produce cash-flow reports, calculating cash needs at weekly and monthly intervals
  • Research, prepare and execute Finance Department initiatives such as software and systems implementation and other departmental or firm-wide improvements, as required
  • Work closely with executive team and partners to ensure efficient and successful firm-wide operation
  • Complete month-end and year-end close of income statement and balance sheet, reconcile accounts, and handle G/L analysis
Requirements
  • CPA or MBA preferred
  • Ability to work in a dynamic and changing environment
  • Ability to prioritize work and balance multiple projects and deadlines
  • Self-starter with efficient time management and organizational skills
  • Foundational knowledge in financial reporting
  • Acquisitions experience
  • Deep understanding of Annual Financial Reporting
  • Month end closings experience desired
  • Progressive accounting experience, including as a Controller preferred

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Accounting Manager

Toronto, Ontario – 5 days per week in the office

$80,000-$95,000 base plus bonus, excellent benefits and vacation


Our client is a growing Real Estate company in mid-town Toronto. They are looking for a Senior Accountant or Accounting Manager to join the small and growing team. Previous real estate accounting experience is definitely a nice to have. You must come with experience preparing financial statements and working papers.

The Accounting Manager will report directly to the Controller and will assist with handling the senior level accounting work in the department while supervising a few individuals. The company does five days per week in the office, located mid-town Toronto. Looking for individuals who don’t take themselves too seriously.


Responsibilities:

  • Develop, review and deliver monthly accounting reports to management, external partners and financial institutions
  • Prepare detailed year-end working papers up to draft financial statements, including costs to complete analysis and cost share reconciliations for active long-lived land development projects and for projects in pre-development and wrap-up stages
  • Act as main point of contact with CRA on behalf of the company. Maintain relationships with external auditors
  • Provide monthly financial analysis of projects and operations to the Controller with a goal to seek improvements and compliance with project/partnership goals and continuously seek financial improvement and efficiency for all project and operations
  • Prepare quarterly reports on projects with financial statements to be distributed to investors and partners and financiers
  • Direct, monitor and manage invoice payables of projects while reconciling with the contracts to ensure accurate and consistent procedure and payment
  • Manage the monthly construction draw process with the project cost consultant and construction lender
  • File monthly HST input tax credits on projects

Requirements:

  • University degree or College diploma
  • 5+ years experience in finance/accounting ideally in real estate
  • Some mentorship or supervisory experience
  • Must have financial statement and working paper preparation experience
  • Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Working knowledge of EXCEL
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Positive and professional demeanor

If you are interested in learning more about this opportunity, please apply now. Unfortunately, due to the high volume of applicants, only those individuals chosen for interview will be contacted.

title: Controller
description:
Location: Vaughan Compensation: $100-120,000 + bonus Job Number: 2005 About This Job:
  • Accounting Designation (CA, CGA, CMA), or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 5-10 years of progressive accounting experience in a manufacturing environment
  • Computer literate with excellent knowledge of Accounting Software (AccPac), Microsoft Office, and MRP systems in general
  • Experience with, and excellent knowledge of TS16949 and ISO14001 systems
  • Excellent documentation and organizational skills
  • Excellent initiative, leadership and problem solving skills
  • Excellent English language communication skills (both written and verbal)
The Controller is accountable for the administration of Accounting and financial policies, procedures and practices to ensure adequate control, recording and analysis of the Division’s business transactions, operating results, assets and liabilities.

Key Responsibilities
  • Provide financial analysis, statements and report according to established procedures and format to Management Team and Corporate
  • Compare, analyze and communicate monthly financial results
  • Prepare and report supplemental financial information to head office
  • Prepare and report quarterly presentation to head office
  • Oversee, prepare, submit annual business plan and or subsequent re-forecasts to General Manager and Corporate
  • Oversee, prepare, submit year end working papers for audit (int. & ext.)
  • Review and asses all quotes; review and approve all disbursements
  • Provide leadership in plant-wide improvement activities driven by key performance indicators (KPI)
  • Maintain integrity of key business activities inside TS16949
  • Work in compliance with and prepare audit for SOX 404
  • Initiate and complete special projects
  • Ensure confidentiality of financial and office reports
  • Manage the payables and receivables functions
  • Manage the cost systems for production, tooling, prototypes and R&D
  • Manage the capital asset system of approvals, purchases and continuity schedules
  • Meet departmental budget
  • Manage the activities of employees in the department and distributes their work as necessary
  • Resolve work problems and recommend work measures to improve productivity
  • Control working hours of employees within department through EZLM system; ensure attendance is monitored and approve vacation, floaters, birthdays, etc.
  • Review work performance of employees within department and make recommendations regarding future work assignments and merit increases
  • Perform interviews and orientations as required
  • Ensure employees within department receive the proper training to complete their job expectations; update technical training checklists in a timely manner (if applicable)
  • Ensure all workers are trained on and abide by related TS16949 and ISO 14001 work instructions at all times
  • Conduct regular departmental team meetings

title: Controller
description:
Description

Our client, a mining company with international presence, is looking to hire a Controller on a permanent basis. The ideal candidate will be responsible for the day-to-day accounting operations of the company, which include the production of periodic consolidated financial reports, maintenance of accounting records, and a comprehensive set of controls and budgets. The Controller will be reporting to the CFO of the organization and his/her duties will include, but will not be limited to:

Responsibilities
  • General accounting operations function including financial reporting under IFRS
  • Ensure month-end process is accurate and completed within timeframe.
  • Prepare journal entries, accruals, and review reconciliations
  • Monthly and annual consolidated financial statements and reporting package for MD& A
  • Prepare budgets, forecasts, cash flow and variance analysis
  • Oversee payroll through Ceridian and prepare payroll journal entries
  • Assess, evaluate, maintain and document internal control system, processes and policies
  • Oversee regulatory reporting, tax planning and compliance
  • Serve as the main point of contact with external auditors
  • Identify opportunities to improve financial and operational systems and cost effectiveness
Requirements

Qualifications
  • CPA designation is a must. CPA, CA preferred
  • 5+ years of progressive experience in technical accounting
  • Consolidated financial reporting under IFRS
  • Solid knowledge of budgets, forecasts and variance analysis
  • Experience supervising A/R, A/P, billing, and payroll activities
  • Experience with SunSystems, CaseWare or CaseView would be preferred
  • Ability to lead staff in meeting tight and ongoing deadlines
  • Above average communication and problem-solving skills
