title: Director, Financial Accounting
description:
The University of Ottawa—A crossroads of cultures and ideas

The University of Ottawa is home to a dynamic community of over 50,000 students, faculty and staff, who live, work and study in both French and English. Our campus is a crossroad of cultures and ideas, where bold minds come together to inspire game-changing ideas. We believe in the power of representation, and that increasing the diversity of our faculty and staff supports this objective. Our goal is to provide students with the best possible learning experience, in an environment that reflects the diversity of its people, their ideas, and their identities.

We are one of Canada’s top 10 research universities—our professors and researchers explore new approaches to today’s challenges. One of a handful of Canadian universities ranked among the top 200 in the world, we attract exceptional thinkers and welcome diverse perspectives from across the globe. Our employees come together around the shared purpose of constant improvement, personal development, service excellence, teamwork and a passion for learning with a desire to make uOttawa and the world a better place. Everyone's contributions are valued, we all play a part in making uOttawa a world-class institution. Most importantly, we make it possible for you to achieve your full potential. Because at uOttawa, you belong!

Position Purpose

Reporting to the Associate Vice-President, Finance and Administration, the incumbent plans, organizes, directs and controls the accounting operations of all University funds related to the functions of accounting for revenues and expenses, vendor payments and customer receipts in a highly decentralized environment. Proposes and implements strategies for financing and accounting for complex financial transactions. Provides budgetary management and control for the capital fund.

In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Include
  • Directs the preparation of the annual audited financial statements of the University, the two pension plans and the consolidated companies of the University in accordance with Canadian accounting standards and submits them to the various bodies (Administration Committee, Audit Committee and Board of Governors) for approval.
  • Directs the preparation of various financial reports and surveys for legal, governmental, granting and other funding entities. Ensures that mechanisms are in place for the University to meet accountability requirements.
  • Implements adequate internal controls to ensure the quality, accuracy, and completeness of information that is reported to the general ledger and the demarcation of year-end transactions, to ensure the integrity of the University's financial activities while keeping in mind administrative simplification and while minimizing the risk of error and fraud.
  • Provides leadership in the development and implementation of policies and procedures that promote sound and effective financial management in collaboration with faculties and departments, including the funding and accounting treatment of complex financial transactions; consults and advises faculties and departments in the implementation of policies and procedures.
  • Directs and oversees the financial management of the capital fund and the financing of renovation/construction projects (through internal debt, grants, reserves, etc.) to ensure the integrity of the financial and accounting treatment. Directs the preparation of the capital fund budget, establishing assumptions and budgetary objectives for the fund.
  • Provides leadership in the evaluation and implementation of modernization initiatives for processes and systems related to financial systems and affecting the University's accounting operations.
  • Oversees the management of commodity taxes (federal and provincial) and acts as a consultant to faculties and departments in the application of taxes. Manages the HST for the UO pension plan according to the specific rules pertaining to it.
  • Directs operations related to the timely payment of vendors, as well as the collection of outstanding tuition fees.
  • Manages and develops team members while maintaining strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
What You Will Bring
  • University degree in accounting or finance and CPA designation
  • At least ten years’ experience in the education sector or with a large corporation, including at least six years in a financial management position
  • Four years' experience in human resources management
  • In-depth knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP)
  • In-depth knowledge of, and experience in, financial management
  • In-depth knowledge of both federal and provincial commodity tax regulation
  • Experience in drafting, interpreting and applying policies and procedures
  • Ability to develop key performance indicators and new projects, to conduct short-, medium- and long-term planning, and take appropriate action to meet targets
  • Excellent ability to exercise professional judgment when explaining, interpreting and applying policies and procedures and when evaluating business risks
  • Skilled in interpersonal relations, communications, leadership, change management and negotiations
  • Strong ability to focus on customer relationship
  • Excellent ability to analyze, synthesize and solve complex problems
  • Organizational, time management and multitasking skills in order to meet tight deadlines
  • Experience in using complex financial systems, along with software such as spreadsheets, word processors, databases, email and the Internet
  • Bilingualism – French and English (spoken and written)
Key Competencies At UOttawa

Here are the required competencies for all or our employees at uOttawa:

Planning: Organize in time a series of actions or events in order to realise an objective or a project. Plan and organize own work and priorities in regular daily activities.

Initiative: Demonstrate creativity and initiative to suggest improvements and encourage positive results. Is proactive and self-starting. Show availability and willingness to go above and beyond whenever it is possible.

Client Service Orientation: Help or serve others to meet their needs. This implies anticipating and identifying the needs of internal and external clients and finding solutions on how to meet them.

Teamwork and Cooperation: Cooperate and work well with other members of the team to reach common goal(s). Accept and give constructive feedback. Able to adjust own behaviour to reach the goals of the team.

The University of Ottawa embraces diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We are passionate about our people and committed to employment equity. We are at our best when everyone has a seat at the table, and when we are made to feel like we belong. We foster a culture of respect, teamwork and inclusion, where collaboration, innovation, and creativity fuel our quest for research and teaching excellence. While all qualified persons are invited to apply, we welcome applications from Indigenous persons, racialized persons, persons with disabilities, women and LGBTQIA2S+ persons. The University is committed to creating and maintaining an accessible, barrier-free work environment. The University is also committed to working with applicants with disabilities requesting accommodation during the recruitment, assessment and selection processes. Applicants with disabilities may contact hrtalentmanagement@uottawa.ca to communicate the accommodation need. All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply; however, Canadians and permanent residents will be given priority.

Note: if this is a union position: The hiring process will be governed by the current collective agreement related to the union affiliation noted above; you can click here to find out more.

title: Controller
description:
Description

Robert Half Management Resources est le leader mondial des services de conseil et de dotation spécialisés pour les professionnels de la comptabilité, des finances et des systèmes d’affaires de haut niveau.

Notre client basé dans la région de Ouatouais est actuellement à la recherche d’un Contrôleur Financier parfaitement bilingue pour un contrat de 3 mois avec une forte possibilité de permanence. La personne idéale sera responsable de la préparation des rapports financiers, de l’assurance de l’intégrité des données et des systèmes financiers, de l’élaboration et de la surveillance des budgets et des prévisions, ainsi que d’autres tâches financières qui sont conformes et conformes aux principes comptables généralement reconnus.

Les Fonctions Du Contrôleur Financier Comprendront
  • Examen régulier des contrôles et des systèmes financiers
  • Examiner et exécuter l’opération comptable, la fin du mois et la fin de l’exercice
  • Exécution des budgets, des prévisions et du dépôt de la loi
  • Superviser l’équipe du personnel subaltern
  • Compréhension stratégique et analyse de la stratégie de l’organisation
  • Autres tâches requises
Requirements

Le Contrôleur idéal aura les compétences et l’expérience suivantes:
  • Une désignation comptable reconnue (CGA, CMA ou CA) avec un minimum de cinq ans d’expérience en comptabilité
  • Expérience dans les entreprises gérées par le propriétaire (actif)
  • Expérience avec les systèmes ERP et/ou comptables
  • Compétences supérieures en communication orale et écrite (le bilinguisme serait considéré comme un atout)
  • Niveau avancé Microsoft Excel
  • Solides compétences analytiques pour la résolution de problèmes, le leadership et les compétences organisationnelles
Robert Half est la première et la plus grande firme de solutions de gestion des talents spécialisées au monde, qui met en relation des chercheurs d'emploi hautement qualifiés avec des opportunités au sein de grandes entreprises. Nous offrons des solutions de placement contractuel, temporaire et permanent dans les domaines de la finance et de la comptabilité, des technologies, du marketing et de la création, et du soutien administratif et à la clientèle.

Robert Half vous met dans la meilleure position pour réussir en défendant vos intérêts et en faisant la promotion de votre profil auprès des employeurs. Nous vous donnons accès aux meilleurs emplois, à une rémunération et à des avantages sociaux compétitifs, ainsi qu'à des formations en ligne gratuites. Restez au courant de toutes les opportunités, même en déplacement.

Des questions? Communiquez avec le bureau de votre région au 1.888.490.3198. Tous les candidats répondant à des offres d’emploi au Canada doivent être autorisés à y travailler.

title: Manager of Accounting
description:
The Manager of Accounting is part of the administration team and is responsible for the oversight of the accounting and reporting functions of Shalom Manor Long Term Care Home, Shalom Manor Non-Profit Seniors Assisted Living Apartments and Mount Nemo Christian Nursing Home. The manager will oversee the work of 3 staff and provide guidance on duties and manage workload responsibilities as they assist the manager with the accounting functions. The position will be required to liaise with resident families in support of billing, accommodation fees and trust transactions. The manager will be led by the Director of Finance & Administration whom will provide guidance, mentorship and growth opportunities. The manager will be expected to work in accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values of Shalom, applicable legislation and regulations, corporate policies and procedures and collective agreements. The position is seen as an integral part of the growth of Shalom Manor Long Term Care Home as we look to expand our services to Hamilton with the planned new campus build at Upper Wellington Street. 


Duties will include:

  • Preparation of monthly financial reporting including recurring journal entries
  • Oversight and preparation of government reporting to various ministries including the Canada Revenue Agency, Ministry of Long Term Care, Minister of Finance, etc.
  • Supervision of accounts payable, accounts receivable and bank reconciliation processes.
  • Oversight of payroll systems in accordance with the payroll administrator.
  • Management of promissory note renewals, payouts and interest payments.
  • Monthly billing support to third parties and resident accounts

title: Accounting Manager
description:
WHO WE ARE?

Tennis Canada is a mission driven, high profile, not-for-profit Registered Canadian Amateur Athletic Association (RCAAA) with offices in Toronto and Montreal. Tennis Canada’s mission is to lead the growth of tennis in Canada and its vision is to become a world-leading tennis nation. Tennis Canada also owns and operates the world-class National Bank Open presented by Rogers tournaments in Toronto and Montreal, two of the best-run sporting events on the planet which annually bring the globe’s best tennis players to Canada and continue to break attendance records year on year. Tennis Canada also owns and operates world class tennis facilities in Toronto and Montreal.


WHAT ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

Reporting to the Senior Director of Finance, the Accounting Manager is an integral member of the Tennis Canada Finance Team. This is a fast-paced and very hands-on role that will be responsible for budgeting/ forecasting and also support and coordinate the the day-to-day accounting function of the organization. The Accounting Manager will assist with the full accounting cycle for multiple ledgers, ensuring application of sound accounting principles/practices. The Accounting Manager will also play a key role with some special projects, notably the successful implementation of an ERP/Accounting system within the organization. The Accounting Manager is located in the Toronto office with Finance staff in both Toronto and Montreal. Some travel to the Montreal office will be required.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Lead and coordinate financial planning and analysis, budgeting, and forecasting for the business. Monitor monthly processes against targets and work with business leads to ensure accountability and prepare Reviews monthly reports for budget and forecast variance analysis
  • Key role to support and coordinate Manages the accounting operations including the review of journal entries, accounts payable, accounts receivable. le, and statutory reporting
  • Conducts monthly reviews of all balance sheet reconciliations with respect to scheduling, grants, and restricted funds
  • Coordinates and prepares all financial statements for the annual audit and other special audits
  • Review and ensures accounts receivable and payable subledgers are fully reconciled
  • Reviews monthly reports for budget and forecast variance analysis
  • Prepares, distributes, and advises on the monthly reports for department managers
  • Approves month end bank reconciliations
  • Prepares and reviews all reporting documents for government reporting such as Sports Canada and other special reports
  • Prepares annual taxes and monthly HST/GST/QST filings
  • Plays a lead role with the implementation of new ERP/Accounting and Procurement systems at Tennis Canada
  • Collaborates with HR to build and review payroll processes
  • Collaborates with members of the Finance Team to develop accounting policies, procedures, and controls and ensure their compliance
  • Conducts payroll data analysis for payroll processes
  • Researches and proposes accounting treatment for complex transactions, where required
  • Provides back-up administrative functions for accounts receivable and payable
  • Assists with special projects, as assigned


WHO YOU ARE?

  • CPA Designation;
  • Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience, of which at least two years were in an auditing firm; Ideally already have experience related to budgeting and forecasting
  • Supervision or team lead experience preferred
  • Advanced working knowledge of Excel and strong database skills;
  • Strong financial acumen and analytical agility;
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills and ability to build lasting relationships;
  • Detail-oriented, organized, and able to meet tight deadlines;
  • Self-motivated, results driven, prefers to work in a fast-paced dynamic environment;
  • Proven prioritization, time management, and project management skills;
  • Experience with Microsoft Dynamics GP is an asset;
  • Ability to converse in basic French. The candidate is not required to be Bilingual however it is considered an asset.


WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Be part of a dynamic organization that makes a difference across Canada;
  • Get in the game! Join the National Bank Cup team;
  • Be part of an innovative, vibrant, and passionate team.


Tennis Canada is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to Diversity and Inclusion. We are committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where every team member feels valued, respected, and supported. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. Accommodations are available at all stages of the recruitment process, at the candidate’s request.

title: Controller
description:
This is your chance to join a fast-paced organization with a large, stable and continuously growing presence in the vertical market software industry! As Controller, you will be a part of Harris Healthcare Groups finance management team and will be looked upon to provide financial support and analysis that will have a direct impact on the success of the Business Units you will support.

Reporting to the VP, Finance, the successful candidate will lead an existing team of finance professionals while overseeing the month, quarter and year-end close process. Additionally, the Controller will work closely with the senior management operations teams in the Business Unit they will support as their trusted business advisor.

What will be your impact?

Review complex revenue recognition for software contracts which are accounted for under IFRS 15, including regular review of WIP schedules

Review account reconciliations, analyze results, and prepare reporting to senior management on a monthly and quarterly basis

Assist the business and operational leaders with monthly forecasting

Become a business partner by providing support and analysis to the business and operational leaders

Manage, coach and mentor a team of finance professionals

Ensure internal controls are in place and identify potential risks and controls to mitigate them

Identify, improve and standardize finance processes

Prepare audit requests and respond to queries during reviews and the interim and year-end audit

Special projects and ad hoc reports (ex: due diligence and integration of new acquisitions)

What are we looking for?

5+ years of work experience within a large accounting firm and/or experience in industry

CPA

Experience with complex revenue recognition (project accounting, software accounting)

Experience with IFRS

Intermediate to advanced skills with Excel, and good practical knowledge of Microsoft Office

What We Offer

Opportunities to grow your career

3 weeks' vacation when starting, 4 weeks after 3 years, and 5 weeks after 7 years of service

5 personal days per year

Lifestyle rewards

Flexible work options (office, remote, hybrid)

Group insurance paid 100% by the employer starting from your first day of employment

Employee stock ownership and RRSP/401k programs

Lifestyle rewards

Fun and collaborative work environment

title: Responsable Comptabilité / Accounting Manager
description:
Directement rattaché(e) à la Directrice administrative et financière, vous serez en charge de superviser et coordonner toutes les tâches relatives à la comptabilité et la paie. Vous aurez sous votre responsabilité 2 personnes qui vous reporteront directement. Vous serez également en étroite collaboration avec le responsable du contrôle de gestion.


MISSIONS :


Missions comptables :

  • S’assurer de la bonne tenue comptable des entités de la Division en contribuant plus particulièrement aux activités suivantes :
  • Superviser l’enregistrement des opérations comptables ;
  • Planifier et contrôler les règlement fournisseurs ;
  • Coordonner l’émission des factures clients et assurer un suivi des encaissements ;
  • Planifier les tâches associées et la production des états financiers.
  • Suivre les réalisations de trésorerie, préparer le reporting mensuel siège et établir les prévisions.
  • Préparer et traiter les déclarations de TPS et TVQ.
  • Préparer les états financiers internes trimestriels et en diffuser la diffusion au siège en France :
  • Vérifier la cohérence des postes de bilan et des comptes courants ;
  • Valider la bonne comptabilisation des écarts de change ;
  • Saisir dans le logiciel VISION les liasses fiscales.
  • Coordonner les activités avec les vérificateurs externes.
  • Préparer les informations et documents nécessaires à la préparation des déclarations fiscales.
  • Fournir à la Direction de l’information essentielle à la prise de décision.
  • Analyser les activités de comptabilité actuelles, offrir des recommandations afin de les améliorer et mettre en place de nouveaux processus.
  • Suivre les obligations réglementaires.


Missions paie :

  • Superviser les activités reliées au traitement de la paie pour tous les collaborateurs locaux et expatriés de nos filiales au Canada selon le calendrier de paie :
  • Actualisation et suivi des différentes banques (vacances, maladie, temps cumulé, etc.) et assurer leur intégrité dans le système de paie ;
  • Vérifier les déductions de paie et avantages sociaux ;
  • Valider les terminaisons d’employés tout en assurant leur conformité avec les législations fédérales et provinciales applicables ;
  • Les opérations relatives à la fermeture des dossiers du collaborateur en matière de rémunération (relevés d'emplois, versements de vacances et vérifications des derniers paiements).
  • Assurer la clôture mensuelle et annuelle du cycle comptable concernant la paie.
  • Agir à titre de personne-ressource pour toute question relative à la paie.
  • Produire des T4 et relevés 1 des collaborateurs.
  • Produire divers rapports requis (loi sur la formation au Québec, CCQ, REER, etc.).



FORMATION ET EXPERIENCE PROFESSIONNELLE :

  • Titulaire d’un baccalauréat (BAC) en comptabilité (comptabilité, contrôle), vous maitrisez parfaitement les principes comptables et de la paie Canadienne ;
  • Vous disposez d’au moins 10 ans d’expérience en comptabilité et au moins 7 ans d’expérience en paie ;
  • Expérience dans un rôle similaire avec gestion d’une équipe ;
  • Expérience dans le milieu de la construction/ingénierie, un fort atout ;
  • Expérience dans la gestion de plusieurs entités légales, des opérations inter-compagnies et multidevises.


COMPETENCES :

Compétences requises :

  • Sens de la rigueur et de l’analyse ;
  • Sens de l'organisation et de la gestion des priorités dans le respect des plannings qui vous sont imposés ;
  • Vous aimez travailler en équipe et communiquer ;
  • Vous aimez le contact avec l'opérationnel et faîtes preuve de dynamisme ;
  • Bonne maîtrise de la Suite Office (Word. PowerPoint et Excel) ;
  • Intérêt pour les systèmes d’Information.

Compétences recommandées :

  • Français courant et Anglais professionnel ;
  • Certification de l’Association canadienne de la paie, un fort atout ;
  • Connaissance de ADP, un fort atout.

title: Manager Passenger Modeling and Crowd Control Plan, Toronto/Canada
description:
Deutsche Bahn International Operations and Aecon Concessions have formed a partnership to operate and maintain the Regional Express Rail (RER) network in the Greater Hamilton and Toronto Area (GHTA), Canada.

Deutsche Bahn International Operations GmbH is part of the Berlin headquartered DB group, a world-leading global railway engineering and infrastructure construction and operating business with an extensive international reputation for delivering successful rail development projects globally. This brownfield project will significantly enhance the service delivery proposition for riders across Toronto and surrounding areas and will ensure a long-lasting sustainable economic, environmental and lifestyle contribution to its current and longer-term society needs.

  • Perform visits to Union Station and Line stations on a regular basis

  • 5+ years of experience in managing passenger models and crowd plans in a large and complex facility (examples: industry, production, airports, hospitals, construction, railways, etc.)
  • Ability to be the champion for Dynamic Passenger Modeling and Crowd Management across different stakeholders and operators
  • Sound interpersonal and influencing skills
  • Track record of achieving results to deadline in an environment in which there are multiple stakeholders
  • Sound knowledge of the standards for passenger flows, densities, and comfort levels for circulation of passengers.
  • Preferably knowledge of key technical characteristics for vertical circulation elements like escalators, elevators and stairwells
  • Preferably knowledge of procuring contracted services in this industry
  • Ability to complete projects from concept to implementation
  • Proficient in the use of Microsoft software applications

title: Controller
description:
Description

You could become a Controller with a reputable healthcare provider if you have a knack for leading with high standards, positively motivating others, experience in making critical decisions and have experience taking charge of an accounting and finance department. You might be a good fit for this position if you can plan and direct all accounting operational functions, handle the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluate accounting and internal control systems, and lead departmental staff. You might be a good fit for this position if you can lead with integrity and reliability and have the ability to manage self and others with urgency, practicality and accountability when providing client services. This is a great opportunity for a creative team player with a talent for challenging the status quo, coming up with unique ideas, negotiating and influencing. Is it time to advance your career? Find out more about this opportunity and take the next steps toward a very competitive compensation and benefits package. The permanent Controller position is situated in the Edmonton, Alberta area.

What you get to do every single day
  • Oversee the activities of the finance department, such as accounts payable, billings & collections, and payroll
  • Analyze deliverables of self and team to confirm they meet organizational expectations
  • Flexible in completing tasks beyond formal job responsibilities
  • Manage the production of and monthly monitoring of financial reporting, budgeting and forecasts
  • Analyze, apply and improve policies, procedures, controls and most methodologies
  • Work closely with executive team and partners to ensure that organization-wide operation is efficient and effective
  • Advance initiatives, such as software and systems implementation and other departmental or organization-wide improvements, as needed, with research, planning and implementation
  • Produce cash-flow reports, calculating cash needs at weekly and monthly intervals, and manage daily cash
  • Present executive team with monthly financial reports
Requirements

  • Remarkable analytical, quantitative and social skills
  • Vow to meet business deadlines
  • Strong communication and social skills
  • Self-driven motivator who takes initiative on projects with a strong ability to understand and solve creative challenges
  • CPA designation is required
  • Proven knowledge of Audited Financial Statements
  • General familiarity with Corporate Financial Planning
  • Deep understanding of Ad Hoc Financial Analysis
  • Detailed and have the ability work independently
  • Ability to work in a dynamic and changing environment

title: Accounting Manager
description:
WP Osborne Executive Search is partnered with Starlight Investments in a search for an Accounting Manager.


The Company

Starlight Investments is a privately held Toronto-based, full service, multi-family and commercial real estate investment and asset management company driven by an experienced team of 350 professionals. The company currently manages over $25 billion of direct real estate as well as real estate investment securities. Investment vehicles include institutional joint ventures, True North Commercial REIT, Starlight U.S. Multi-Family Funds, Starlight Western Canada Multi-Family Funds, Northview Fund and Starlight Capital Funds. Starlight Investment’s portfolio consists of approximately 73,000 multi-residential units across Canada and the U.S. and over 9 million square feet of commercial properties.


To supports the company’s continued growth, a new position is available within Starlight’s Finance team.


The Opportunity


Accounting Manager


Reporting to the Director of Finance, the Accounting Manager is responsible for managing the month-end close process, various accounting reconciliations, preparation of financial statement and note disclosures, and detailed review of the property manager (PM) cash calls.


Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Review property managers reports, including bank reconciliations and account reconciliations;
  • Communication with property managers to ensure accurate and timely reporting;
  • Book month/year-end journal entries;
  • Compilation and first review of monthly cash calls and setting up wires as required;
  • Perform transfers between the PM accounts as required;
  • Analyze the profit and loss statements for assigned portfolios;
  • Liaise with Asset Management to complete the month-end process and ensure finance has complete and accurate information;
  • Review and reconcile monthly property management fees calculations;
  • Provide accurate and timely completion of assigned account reconciliations;
  • Complete covenant reporting to lenders;
  • Perform variance analysis for various items in the income statement, and provide detailed justification for variances;
  • Prepare year-end working papers and assist in interim and year-end audits with external firms;
  • Prepare HST returns;
  • Perform special projects as required.


Qualifications

The successful candidate will possess a University Degree in accounting, finance or related field, and a CPA-CA or CPA designation with 5 plus years of public accounting or industry experience; thorough understanding of accounting principles and advanced Excel skills. The successful candidate must be hands-on, detail oriented, self-motivated and resourceful; have strong interpersonal, organizational, communication and time management skills with the ability to prioritize, multi-task and work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment.


Application

Qualified candidates can submit their resume to hr@wposborne.com referencing “#1231 – Accounting Manager” in the subject line. In accordance with the company’s mandatory vaccination policy, only qualified applicants who have been fully vaccinated, or who are unable to vaccinate due to valid medical or religious reasons will be considered for an interview.

title: Manager of Accounting
description:
Swish Maintenance Limited is a leading national distributor of cleaning products and solutions to institutional, maintenance and facility professionals. Since 1956 Swish has expanded to currently include more than 16 locations across Canada and into the United States. As a proud Canadian family-owned and operated company, we are looking for an experienced and dynamic individual to join our team as Manager of Accounting.


This is a temporary opportunity for 15 months, with the possibility of a permanent position.


Opportunity Overview


Reporting directly to the Chief Financial Officer, the Manager of Accounting is responsible for the delivery of financial reporting, managing accounting processes and working closely with staff in areas of Accounts Payable, Cash Receipts, Inventory Control and Reception. This role will work closely with the Chief Financial Officer and other members of the Finance team and has opportunity for growth.


Location - Peterborough, ON


Key Responsibilities

  • Responsible for month end closing including, but not limited to the following:
  • Capital Asset Tracking: track additions, disposals, and depreciations
  • Prepaid Expense Tracking: track additions, monthly expense entry, and documentation
  • Maintenance and analysis of standard entries
  • Prepaid Dispenser Tracking: additions, amortizations posting
  • Calculating and processing Sales Taxes on a monthly and quarterly basis
  • Prepare and track accrued liabilities
  • Reconciliation of intercompany accounts
  • Responsible for the analysis of the financial statements.
  • Responsible for company financial audits and preparation of year-end activities.
  • Process external and intercompany transactions and reconcile balances including EFT’s.
  • Perform general accounting responsibilities including but not limited to general ledger, banking, accounts receivable, accounts payable and payroll postings.
  • Responsible for preparation of general ledger adjustments for all branch and company operations.
  • Prepare accounting estimates, accruals, etc.
  • Collaborate with inventory control on various inventory reviews and monthly reports.
  • Daily and monthly cash flow management and reporting.
  • Responsible for ensuring timely payment of Government remittances, EHT and WSIB and other government compliance requirements.
  • Bank account management, cash application and reconciliation.
  • Prepare for and assist with all external auditors.
  • Prepare ad-hoc reporting as requested.
  • Work closely with the accounts payable department. Ensure timely processing of employee expense claims, km reimbursements, vendor payments (ensuring maximum QPDs) and resolution of all AP matters.
  • Identify, monitor and resolve issues affecting non-payment of vendor invoices.
  • Provide guidance and expertise toward improving financial systems and processes.
  • Other duties as assigned.


Experience and Skills

  • Accounting designation (C.P.A-CA, CMA, CGA) would be considered an asset, but is not required
  • 5+ years of experience with accounting, financial analysis and operations work
  • 5+ years of experience and proficiency in financial statement preparation and analysis including interpreting financial information
  • Must have experience with computerized financial systems and advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Excellent analytical and critical thinking skills
  • Strong prioritizing skills and can easily manage multiple projects
  • Must be self-motivated, flexible, organized and possess good time management skills
  • Proven ability to work independently in a demanding, fast paced, constantly changing

title: Controller
description:
Automotive Dealership Controller

Windsor, Ontario

Craving a positive & lasting career change? You might be the perfect fit for the AutoCanada family!

AutoCanada is looking for an experienced full time Controller to join our growing team! You will manage accounting/reporting functions as well as accounting processes & procedures within the dealership. You will report directly to Head Office & work closely with the Dealer Principal. In this pivotal role, you will act as part of the senior management team & will participate actively in financial/operational functions.

AutoCanada Offers You
  • Industry-leading pay plan
  • Health & Dental
  • A team full of GRIT – passion & perseverance
  • Employee purchase program
  • Multiple opportunities for growth coast to coast
Your Day To Day
  • Financial planning, budgeting, & expense control
  • Attend senior management meetings related to forecasting/budgeting
  • Oversee or perform tasks to ensure financial functions are reconciled monthly such as: cash, accounts receivables, prepaid expenses, fixed assets, accounts payables, manufacturer statements, payroll administration, vehicle deal commissioning, intercompany accounts
  • Meet monthly/quarterly/annual deadlines as required by Head Office & Dealer Principal/GM’s such as: reconciliations, reporting, covenant calculations, financial analysis, year-end reporting
What You Bring To The Table
  • Completion of post-secondary education in accounting or a related field
  • Automotive dealership and/or CPA public accounting firm experience is required
  • Prior experience in an accounting oversight role is required
  • Knowledge of Reynolds & Reynolds, & Tableau is an asset
  • Strong knowledge of CDK and/or ADP is an asset
  • Experience with CaseWare is an asset
  • A valid driver's license & safe driving history is required
    Why This Is The Perfect Opportunity For You

    With 28 brands in 78 Dealerships, in two countries, AutoCanada is a 2008, 2013 & 2021 CADA Laureate Winner , a 2021 TXS30 Winner & currently holds 18 OEM Performance awards.

    Our Culture Is Based On
    • Performance
    • Trust & transparency
    • Promoting from within
    • Accountability to ourselves & each other
    For more info check out autocan.ca/ , Instagram , Facebook .

    If this position 'rev's your engine' apply today!

    careers@autocan.ca

title: Revenue Supervisor
description:
Revenue Supervisor


PLASP Child Care Services is a charitable organization operating on a not-for-profit basis, providing high quality early learning and child care, for children up to 12 years of age. PLASP operates programs in more than 240 schools providing before and after school care. PLASP also operates 30 full-day early learning and child care centres and six EarlyON locations for children from 0 – 6 years.


PLASP is committed to hiring, training, and fairly compensating staff. All Ontarians have the right to equal treatment with respect to employment without discrimination or harassment. We believe that everyone has worth and value, and that all staff are entitled to be respected, supported, and treated fairly by their co-workers and supervisors.


Reporting to the Controller, the Revenue Supervisor will provide supervision and guidance to a team within PLASP’s Accounting Department as it relates to subsidy, collections and PLASP fees.


THE POSITION INVOLVES…

The successful candidate will provide a full range of duties, including:

  • Providing leadership, direction, and support to a team within PLASP Accounting Department
  • Supervising and processing payment runs
  • Maintaining CRM information fees
  • Supervising subsidy applications and payments from various government agencies
  • Supervising the collection of outstanding payments from parents
  • Approving Bad Debt Write Offs
  • Assisting the Controller with Special Projects
  • Due to Covid-19, occasional remote work environment in place


THE PREFERRED CANDIDATE WILL…

  • Have a diploma in Accounting, Business Administration, or related field an asset
  • Minimum of five years’ experience in accounting
  • Possess extensive knowledge of accounting principles
  • Demonstrated supervisory and leadership skills
  • Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft CRM and NAV software
  • A strong problem solver and team player
  • Self-motivated, flexible and the ability to work effectively in a team environment
  • Excellent oral and written communication and interpersonal skills
  • Excellent customer service skills


PLASP OFFERS…

  • A positive and supportive working environment
  • Growth and learning opportunities
  • A competitive compensation package
  • An opportunity to make a difference in the lives of children


HOW TO APPLY…


To apply for this exciting opportunity, please apply directly to the PLASP careers website before May 10, 2022. PLASP invites all applicants to submit their resume and cover letter for consideration.


As part of PLASP’s ongoing commitment to Health and Safety and maintaining a safe learning environment for its staff, children and the larger PLASP community, PLASP has a Mandatory Covid-19 Vaccination Disclosure Policy. As part of a condition of employment, new employees will be required to disclose vaccination status and provide proof of full vaccination against Covid-19 prior to the start date of employment.


PLASP Child Care Services is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Human Resources will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process.


Please visit www.plasp.com for more employment information.

title: Controller
description:
This opening will support WFS Ltd. – A W.W. Grainger Company.


Primary Function: The Controller is responsible for overall corporate accounting, taxation, accounts payable, accounts receivable, cash processing, treasury and payroll functions for the WFS business unit of Grainger and is part of the WFS leadership team.

The location is flexible between Windsor, Ontario and the Greater Toronto Area, with limited travel.

Principal Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Ensure all accounting records are accurate, timely and are prepared in accordance with US GAAP and Company policy.
  • Establish financial controls to ensure safeguarding of corporate assets
  • Develop and mentor key finance talent; create a strong results-oriented, customer focused culture within WFS Finance team.
  • Work with the Grainger Finance Teams to develop management and month-end reporting in accordance with company requirements.
  • Work with the Financial Planning and Analysis Team (FP&A) to establish monthly and annual budgets and forecasts
  • Ensure all accounting practices, controls and procedures comply with Sarbanes Oxley and other regulatory reporting requirements.
  • Ensure compliance with all income and commodity tax laws, including tax filings, remittances and audits.
  • Work with business partners in WFS and Grainger Canada on key initiatives and special projects affecting finance teams.
  • Lead process improvement efforts to increase efficiencies and effectiveness across accounting and financial processing teams.


Required Education & Experience:

  • Proven Finance and Accounting professional with strong technical accounting skills
  • At least five years' post-graduate experience including people leadership
  • Familiarity with US GAAP, consolidation accounting, Sarbanes Oxley and SEC reporting requirements, and corporate financial reporting experience is desirable
  • Management experience of major accounting cycles including accounts payable / disbursements, cash processing and payroll is desirable
  • Familiarity with Canadian taxation is required
  • A solid academic background and an appropriate financial designation are expected including public accounting and audit; CPA is required.
  • Demonstrated leadership abilities and proven change management experience.
  • Self-confident and the ability to adapt to changing circumstances.
  • A person who is proactive and a "quick study", is attracted to challenge and brings an energetic and forward-thinking approach, along with high ethical standards.
  • Well-developed communication abilities with strong written and presentation skills as well as excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Solid technical skills and interests, and a commitment to resolving accounting issues and developments.
  • Disciplined, focused, well-organized, results driven.


Grainger strives to be an employer of choice, to attract and retain top diverse talent, and to provide a safe and positive work environment for all of its team members. As part of Grainger hiring process, pre-employment background checks will be required for all external candidates. Internal candidates will be required to undergo a pre-employment background check when they move from a non-driving role to a driving role and/or a director role and above position.

In accordance with Performance Excellence guidelines, team members are encouraged to apply for positions closely matching their experience/background and that are aligned with their Individual Development Plan. Grainger is committed to the principles and practices of employment equity. We invite all qualified women and men, including persons with disabilities, visible minorities, and Aboriginal Peoples to apply for our career opportunities. Accommodations are available on request for all persons with disabilities taking part in the selection process.

title: Controller
description:
Company Overview

Tiercon Corp. is an automotive supplier committed to the design, manufacture and assembly of quality exterior trim and assembled systems used as original equipment in the automotive market. Headquartered in Stoney Creek, the plants have design, mold, paint, assembly and testing capabilities. Tiercon manages 5 sites across 2 cities employing approximately 550 people throughout Canada. Tiercon is seeking knowledgeable, self-directed, experienced and hardworking individuals interested in the automotive industry as a Controller at our 591 Arvin Ave. facility.

Job Summary & Reporting Structure

Reports directly to the Director of Finance.

Responsibilities

ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL REPORTING & ANALYSIS
  • Responsible for the accuracy and maintenance of the General Ledger and accounting systems, including providing oversight of all day-to-day accounting transactions.
  • Preparation of timely and accurate monthly, quarterly and annual year-end financial statements plus other reporting and analysis for internal management and external financial stakeholders.
  • Provides a detailed review and analysis of monthly consolidated financial statements including analysis on sales, gross margins/program profitability, expenses and inventories.
  • Leadership in co-ordinating and managing all internal and external audits.
  • Plans and co-ordinates all aspects of the year-end audit to ensure a smooth audit process and clean audit results. Activities include: preparation of the audit package and schedules, review of tax and other provisions, preparation of the financial statements and notes to the financial statements, and interface with external auditors.
  • Prepares reports for regulatory agencies.
  • Responsible for preparing all schedules and information to support the completion of Corporate Income Tax Returns and Tax Planning.
  • Provides support to the Director of Taxes.
BANKING, CASH MANAGEMENT AND TREASURY
  • Prepares and submits reports to the bank and other external entities.
  • Responsible for cash flow management, processing and reporting of cash.
  • Responsible for the corporate accounts receivable and accounts payable operations and accounting processes.
  • Manages reporting to support insurance coverage, including reporting of Insurable Values to insurance providers on an annual basis.
INTERNAL CONTROLS AND SYSTEMS
  • Ensures compliance with accounting policies and procedures and generally accepted accounting principles.
  • Monitors, evaluates, enhances and maintains the internal controls to support the business.
  • Establishes and recommends to senior management objectives, policies and procedures for the safeguarding of corporate assets.
  • Responsible for the integrity and accuracy of the Fixed Asset Sub-ledger.
  • Senior leader in the deployment of upgrades to the ERP system and implementation of other new systems and software.
BUSINESS LEADERSHIP AND OPERATION SUPPORT
  • Leadership in managing direct reports, executing on people management best practices and fostering a culture of teamwork and operational excellence.
  • Key member of the Senior Finance Leadership team responsible for business simplification and process re-engineering of accounting and financial processes.
  • Participates as part of the company leadership team in supporting business activities and the achievement of corporate objectives.
  • Provide business advice, analysis and guidance to support Operations, Engineering, Quality, Sales, IT, Purchasing, HR and Legal.
  • Provides data, analysis and advice to ownership & senior management in assessing and evaluating business opportunities and strategic plans.
  • Supports and enforces the company priority of Safe Operations, assisting and managing others to perform work in a safe manner so that no work site accident or illness results from any operational activity.
Qualifications
  • Accounting designation, CPA/CA Preferred
  • University degree (Business Administration or Accounting/Finance)
  • At least 5 years' experience in Public Accounting (Audit) and/or related experience
  • Management experience leading teams
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  • Manufacturing experience is an asset
  • Experience in business process re-engineering and process simplification
  • Strong systems & computer skills (Knowledgeable in ERP/MRP, QAD experience is an asset: Microsoft Office, Excel, other accounting packages)
Tiercon Corp. is proud to be an inclusive and equal opportunity employer as set out in the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005. At Tiercon we are committed to ensuring the workplace is free from discrimination. Tiercon Corp. welcomes and encourages applications from everyone including persons with disabilities. During our hiring process, we will notify job applicants that accommodations are available upon request. If a selected job applicant requests accommodation, Tiercon will consult with the individual and provide or arrange for the appropriate accommodation taking into account the applicant's disability-related needs. Please contact Tiercon Human Resources at hr@tiercon.com.

title: Controller
description:
Description

Fantastic opportunity to join a growing and dynamic team - Controller $120k - $130k (US GAAP and Consolidations)

Contact this reputable company through Robert Half about their Controller position, if you have a knack for leading with high standards, positively motivating others, and making critical decisions and have experience taking charge of an accounting and clerical department. If you are good at planning and directing all accounting operational functions, handling the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluating accounting and internal control systems, and leading departmental staff, this role might be right for you. In this role, it will be critical for you to lead with integrity and reliability and have the ability to manage self and others with urgency, practicality and accountability when providing client services. We're looking for creative team players with a talent for challenging the status quo, coming up with unique ideas, negotiating and influencing. You could advance your career through this very competitive and generous compensation and benefits package. This permanent position is for a Controller who will work in the Ottawa, Ontario region.

Your responsibilities in this role
  • Evaluate, implement and streamline policies, procedures, controls and most methodologies
  • Work closely with executive team and partners to ensure efficient and successful firm-wide operation
  • Inspect deliverables of self and team to ensure that they meet client expectations
  • Manage the production of the annual budget and forecasts and monitor them monthly
  • Lead the operations of the finance department which includes accounts payable, billings & collections, and payroll
  • Handle monthly and annual close of income statement and balance sheet, account reconciliations & G/L analysis

  • Earlier experience in public accounting is highly valued
  • Strong communication skills, excellent interpersonal skills, both oral and written, and ability to build as well as deliver effective presentations
  • Comfortable working in a changing and dynamic environment
  • Detailed and have the ability work independently
  • Takes action on items beyond formal job responsibilities
  • Excellent analytical, quantitative and social skills
  • Strong communication and social skills and able to receive criticism well

title: Controller
description:
Description

Fantastic opportunity to join a growing and dynamic team - Controller $120k - $130k (US GAAP and Consolidations)

Contact this reputable company through Robert Half about their Controller position, if you have a knack for leading with high standards, positively motivating others, and making critical decisions and have experience taking charge of an accounting and clerical department. If you are good at planning and directing all accounting operational functions, handling the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluating accounting and internal control systems, and leading departmental staff, this role might be right for you. In this role, it will be critical for you to lead with integrity and reliability and have the ability to manage self and others with urgency, practicality and accountability when providing client services. We're looking for creative team players with a talent for challenging the status quo, coming up with unique ideas, negotiating and influencing. You could advance your career through this very competitive and generous compensation and benefits package. This permanent position is for a Controller who will work in the Ottawa, Ontario region.

Your responsibilities in this role
  • Evaluate, implement and streamline policies, procedures, controls and most methodologies
  • Work closely with executive team and partners to ensure efficient and successful firm-wide operation
  • Inspect deliverables of self and team to ensure that they meet client expectations
  • Manage the production of the annual budget and forecasts and monitor them monthly
  • Lead the operations of the finance department which includes accounts payable, billings & collections, and payroll
  • Handle monthly and annual close of income statement and balance sheet, account reconciliations & G/L analysis
  • Comfortable in taking on tasks beyond formal job responsibilities
  • Handle daily cash management and produce cash-flow reports, calculating cash needs at weekly and monthly intervals
  • Drive the timing for monthly billing and other cash management techniques to ensure the timely cash collection
  • Research, plan and implement Finance Department initiatives including software and systems implementation and other departmental or firm-wide improvements, as needed
Requirements
  • Progressive accounting experience, including as a Controller preferred
  • Earlier experience in public accounting is highly valued
  • Strong communication skills, excellent interpersonal skills, both oral and written, and ability to build as well as deliver effective presentations
  • Comfortable working in a changing and dynamic environment
  • Detailed and have the ability work independently
  • Takes action on items beyond formal job responsibilities
  • Excellent analytical, quantitative and social skills
  • Strong communication and social skills and able to receive criticism well
  • Prior work in technology, analytics and management experience desired
  • Account Setup experience preferred
  • Proven knowledge of month end closings
  • Expertise in financial analysis
  • Solid understanding of US GAAP
  • Solid understanding of Consolidation Processes
  • Hands-on experience with budgeting
  • Comprehension of Annual Operating Budget
  • Well-founded grasp of Acquisition Integration
  • Earlier work involving Analyze Variance
  • Account analysis experience
  • Practical knowledge of Analyze Financial Statements
  • Proven knowledge of Accounts Receivable (AR)
  • General familiarity with Actual Variance Analysis
  • Skills in Annual Forecasts
  • Foundational knowledge in risk management
  • Wide ranging experience with Analyze Trends
  • Accounts Payable (AP) experience
  • Strong familiarity with consolidations
  • Experience with Monthly Statements
  • Account Records experience
  • Command of account reconciliation
  • Previous experience working with Annual Financial Reporting
  • Experience with Budget Processes
  • Quality experience with Analyze Revenues
  • Prior experience with budget forecasting\
  • Ability and willingness to meet business critical deadlines
  • CPA/MBA preferred

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Russell Hendrix is looking for an experienced Accounting Manager join our Corporate Accounting team. You’ll be an integral part of the team’s operations, managing the AP department, and reporting directly to the Corporate Controller. This position requires a high attention to detail, the ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize, and experience in successfully leading teams.


What You’ll Do:

  • Manage AP department – ensure that invoices are entered on a timely basis, with proper approvals, and correctly coded; ensure that Russell Hendrix KPI’s are met as pertains to accuracy and processing time.
  • Manage COA’s for Traverse ERP platform.
  • Prepare weekly listing of outstanding Accounts Payable for CFO review.
  • Organize and prioritize weekly payment runs and assist in preparation of weekly and other periodic cash forecasts.
  • Analyze expenses and prepare accruals on a monthly basis.
  • Prepare monthly reconciliations of all intercompany transactions and resolve any discrepancies.
  • Prepare monthly reconciliations of balance sheet accounts for review by Corporate Controller.
  • Prepare monthly bank reconciliations for review by Corporate Controller.
  • Approve disbursements within the Russell Hendrix banking portals, ensuring compliance with Russell Hendrix internal control matrix; complete bank transfers on a weekly basis.
  • Handle all sales tax remittances and assist in streamlining current tax reporting structure.
  • Review and approve monthly commission and rebate journal entries; review and approve monthly and quarterly commission and rebate payments.
  • Work with AP team to document and automate tasks.
  • Assist with preparation of contractual reporting to lenders.
  • Administer all corporate credit cards; manage and review employee expense report submissions to ensure compliance with Russell Hendrix guidelines.
  • Support annual audit and bank audits as needed.
  • Ad hoc duties as required.


Required Skills/Experience:

  • You have at least 10 years of progressive, hands-on experience in a similar role.
  • You have at least 5 years experience supervising or managing transactional teams.
  • Successful completion of university or college degree with a focus on accounting.
  • You have distribution/manufacturing/logistics experience within a sales-driven organization.
  • You have intermediate Excel skills, comfortable with pivots, lookups, etc.
  • You have experience with banking portals.
  • You have experience with high volume of transactions.
  • You have experience with complex manual reconciliations.
  • You have experience with process improvements within a highly manual multi-entity environment with non-integrated ERP functionality.
  • You are a detail oriented and responsible individual with a proven track record of demonstrating initiative and proposing/implementing solutions to address issues.
  • You have demonstratable organizational and time management skills in dealing with changing priorities in a fast-paced environment while meeting reporting deadlines.
  • You have a proven ability to work with all levels of the organization to ensure that goals are met.
  • You are comfortable giving and receiving feedback.


What’s In It for You:

  • Extended health benefits
  • $400/year gym subsidy
  • Dynamic work environment
  • Excellent employee discount
  • Opportunity for growth


Get To Know Russell Hendrix!


With locations across Canada and over 70 years of experience, Russell Hendrix is the Leader in the commercial Food equipment industry. We are service focused Foodies who value integrity, teamwork, resourcefulness, and fairness. Check us out on Instagram: rhfoodequip or visit our website: www.russellhendrix.com.

Russell Hendrix is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Russell Hendrix is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Mega Group Inc. is Canada's largest retail buying and support group of independent furniture, appliance and consumer electronics retailers. We are dedicated to providing programs that stimulate growth and promote success. Our vision is to be the essential supplier of retail services ensuring the continued success of the Independent Home Goods retail channel in Canada. As a Platinum Member of Canada’s Best Managed Companies, we serve over 700 retail members across the country with offices located in Saskatoon and Boucherville.

 

We are proud to provide an employee-friendly work environment, where work-life balance is a priority. We value the talents and abilities of our employees and strive for an open, flexible, cooperative, and dynamic work environment.

 

We are seeking an Accounting Manager in our Saskatoon office. The incumbent’s primary responsibilities will be:

  • Design and deliver all financial reports required to evaluate achievement of corporate objectives and to evaluate corporate opportunities
  • Review and publish monthly financial statements, according to established timelines, including variance analysis to budget and prior year, and recommendations for corrective action
  • Assist in the development and implementation of policies and procedures (internal controls) relating to financial management, budgeting, and accounting
  • Oversee the daily functions of the accounting team including AP, AR, Payroll, Banking, Contract admin, GL maintenance, and promotional billings
  • Participate in the design of reporting tools and provide staff education on use of those tools
  • Understand the terms contained in vendor and all strategic partner agreements and ensures accurate system application
  • Coordinate the annual external audit, and any other audit engagements as required
  • Allocate the accounting team resources to best utilize the skills and competencies available to effectively complete functions/tasks required by the Company
  • Ensure the accounting system meets the department’s requirements/standards
  • Direct the timely distribution of supplier rebate programs
  • Support the Data Processing Team Lead in the development of the team ensuring high performance standards are met
  • Provides backup to the EDI Specialist, ensuring customer terms are accurately maintained in the system

 

Qualifications

  • A chartered professional accounting designation
  • A minimum of five (5) years supervisory experience in a senior accountancy role
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills
  • Strong leadership ability with the aptitude to share financial information with non-financial colleagues
  • Solid working knowledge of ASPE and relevant tax and regulatory laws
  • Ability to analyze complex data and reports
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong knowledge of Foreign Exchange transactions and available hedging tools
  • Builds collaborative relationships with internal and external customers
  • Financial reporting best practices acumen
  • Command of diverse accounting systems with proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (master of Excel)
  • Proven process improvement competency
  • Commitment to recruiting, mentoring, training, and engaging a diverse team; the ability to delegate to provide growth opportunities
  • Bilingualism (English/French) would be considered an asset

title: Communications Controller
description:
Why join us?

SNC-Lavalin provides cutting-edge engineering, procurement, construction and financing solutions to projects in more than 100 countries around the world. From the Canadian Arctic to the Southern African region and Australasia, our multicultural workforce is driven by a fierce pride in their work and a pioneering vision.

SNC-Lavalin is truly a global leader in its field and has been chosen to design and build some of the most prestigious projects in the world.

Reporting to the Duty Manager, the position of the Communications Controller is primarily focused on providing centralised information and assistance to Canada Line passengers and staff from the Control Room. This role is required to be very proactive by acting independently to situations as they arise, while remaining part of a team of staff who are responsible for service delivery.

The Communications Controller provides high quality passenger information using the Public Address (PA) and Passenger Information Displays (PIDS) and responds to alarms and requests for information or assistance from passengers and staff on the Canada Line. The incumbent also monitors and controls the CCTV system routinely and responds as required to any incidents that are observed or reported. The Communications Controller liaises with the Emergency Response Agencies when necessary in response to incidents on the Canada Line including calls for medical assistance and police assistance. Additionally, this position monitors and controls several E&M systems at stations including elevators, escalators, station grills and Fare Gates.

When on duty the Communications Controllers are assigned to either the Communications Workstation or the Fare Gate Workstation. When working at the Fare Gate Workstation the Communications Controller’s primary responsibility is the monitoring and control of the Fare Gate system and responding to passenger calls from the stations in relation to Fare Gates and the Compass Card.

Safety Critical Position

This position is safety critical. Fitness for duty is a requirement of the position.

How will you contribute to the team?

To perform this role successfully, the candidate will be responsible for but not limited to the following:
  • Provide high quality passenger information via Passenger Information Displays and public address announcements.
  • Respond to emergency calls generated from stations and trains.
  • Respond to passenger assistance and information requests from stations and trains.
  • Dispatching staff to assist passengers.
  • Transferring Fare Gate and Compass related card calls from passengers to the appropriate call center when required.
  • Monitor and operating the CCTV system.
  • Assist Duty Manager with response to Guideway and Walkway intrusion alarms by reviewing CCTV and identifying cause of the intrusion.
  • Monitor and operating SCADA E&M systems at stations (Escalators, elevators, station grills).
  • Monitor and operating Fare Gate system.
  • Reporting failed station and Communications workstation equipment.
  • Advise all staff of emergencies, failures and activities affecting the communications workstation.
  • Contact and liaison with Emergency Response Agencies including police, fire and ambulance.
  • Operate Central Emergency Stop Buttons when a trespasser is seen entering the Guideway.
  • Answer general telephone calls to the Control Room and directing them to the appropriate workstation.
  • Assist other work stations in emergency situations as required.
  • Maintain the technical knowledge necessary to execute all control functions that the incumbent has been trained in.
  • Maintain a current and thorough knowledge of and adhere to all Canada Line Rules and procedures.
  • All other related duties as directed by the Duty Manager.
Safety Responsibilities
  • Monitor stations via CCTV and respond to incidents.
  • Assist the Duty Manager with response to Guideway and Walkway intrusion alarms.
  • Operate the Central Emergency Stop Buttons if needed.
  • Respond to passenger alarms from stations and trains.
  • Respond to calls for assistances from passengers and staff on the Canada Line.
  • Abide and work to all Canada Line Rules, Procedures and operating restrictions at all times.
What will you contribute?
  • Have excellent literacy and verbal communications skills in English.
  • Be capable of learning and implementing operating procedures for normal, abnormal and emergency conditions of the railway.
  • Be capable of conducting a radio test.
  • Demonstrated ability to work well independently and as part of a team.
  • Ability to understand technical information and relay it in a manner that is clearly understood by others.
  • Ability to manage conflicting priorities, make sound decisions, and explain their decision making process.
  • Recognize levels of responsibility and accountability.
  • Understand the importance of a no blame culture.
  • Experience in a role that had a number of defined priorities and objectives.
  • Demonstrated ability to work well in a stressful environment.
  • Demonstrated attention to detail, and a willingness to follow policies and procedures.
  • Ability to impart knowledge on others including on the job training.
  • A combination of education and experience may also be considered.
Required
  • Ability to pass a company aptitude test and medical; colour perception, visual acuteness, hearing and impairment screening.
  • Ability to correctly analyze a situation and respond appropriately.
  • Ability to articulate clear public address announcements and radio calls.
  • Must be available to work 7 days per week, including weekends and holidays on a 24 hour shift basis.
Preferred
  • Previous exposure to a railway or control room operations.
  • Excellent report writing skills.
  • Public Address or public speaking experience.
  • Computer skills – able to work easily with the Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Experience working in a regulated environment.
  • Knowledge of other transport systems and the railways in the surrounding area.
  • Experience working shifts.
  • Previous education and leadership experience.
  • Experience working in a safety-critical environment.
Environment Aspects: This role has no Significant Environmental Aspects associated with it but the incumbent is expected to follow Company Policy relative to all matters pertaining to the environment.

What We Offer At SNC-Lavalin

At SNC-Lavalin, you will enjoy competitive compensation, a safe and healthy work environment, and a full range of benefits (ie.: group insurance, retirement savings plan, share purchase plan, continuing education program, etc.).

You think that a career in our team could match your profile, submit your application online now!

    • The masculine gender is used only to simplify the wording.

    At SNC-Lavalin, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds and perspectives. We strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.

    SNC-Lavalin cares about your privacy. SNC-Lavalin and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of SNC-Lavalin (referred to throughout as “SNC-Lavalin”) are committed to protecting your privacy. Please consult our Privacy Notice on our Careers site to know more about how we collect, use and transfer your Personal Data.

    By submitting your personal information to SNC-Lavalin, you confirm that you have read and accept our Privacy Notice.

    Founded in 1911, SNC-Lavalin is a fully integrated professional services and project management company with offices around the world dedicated to engineering a better future for our planet and its people. We create sustainable solutions that connect people, technology and data to design, deliver and operate the most complex projects. We deploy global capabilities locally to our clients and deliver unique end-to-end services across the whole life cycle of an asset including consulting, advisory & environmental services, intelligent networks & cybersecurity, design & engineering, procurement, project & construction management, operations & maintenance, decommissioning and capital. – and delivered to clients in key strategic sectors such as Engineering Services, Nuclear, Operations & Maintenance and Capital. News and information are available at snclavalin.com or follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

title: Controller
description:
Description

Robert Half is looking for a Controller on Vancouver Island, BC! If you are an experienced Sr Finance professional with hands-on experience in manufacturing/ construction or project-based environments and are looking to live in a beautiful part of BC’s West Coast while working for an exceptional & global organization, this could be an excellent position for you!

You will be part of a large accounting team and will specialize in areas including but not limited to financial reporting, consolidations, costing and inventory management, financial planning and analysis, operational reporting, budgeting/ forecasting, and system implementation. This position will play a key role in managing the financial cycle of the Canadian subsidiary, reporting to the international head office, identifying areas of opportunity, resolving any issues / errors, fostering positive & long-term working relationships with the operations staff, and providing strategic advice to the Director of Finance.

Your Day-to-day Job Responsibilities Will Include
  • Provide consolidated financial reports to the head office and Director of Finance for review
  • Assist with the budgeting & forecasting process for the Canadian subsidiary
  • Manage the month-end and year end period closing tasks
  • Oversee and manage the inventory and perform reconciliations, as required
  • Provide timely financial reporting to the finance & operations teams
  • Manage the financial planning and analysis process and make suggestions for improvement
  • Manage and improve the costing process for the group of companies
  • Liaise with the financial auditors and provide required documentation at year-end
  • Create financial models and provide project-based reports
  • Perform adhoc financial reporting functions
  • Manage/ oversee the finance department and provide necessary guidance
  • Assist the staff with performance measurement and management by setting KPI’s and goals
Requirements

What you will bring to the position:
  • Experience working in manufacturing, production, forestry, construction/other project-based environment is required
  • Strong hands-on experience with costing & inventory management is required
  • 3+ years of experience working in a Sr Finance role at a similar level, leading the finance functions for mid/large organization
  • Advanced Excel Skills are required and experience with ERP system and /or system implementations will be given preference
  • CPA Designation will be considered an asset
  • Excellent MS Excel skills
If this position sounds like a good fit for your skills and goals, we would love to hear from you! Job Reference Number: 05150-0011761305

title: Development Accounting Manager
description:
Inspired HR is recruiting for a Development Accounting Manager on behalf of our client, Porte Communities.


THE TEAM:

There are countless reasons to consider a career with Porte. For starters, you’ll be part of an encouraging, supportive team with plenty of room for growth. You’ll enjoy perks like training and team building events throughout the year. Plus, there’s our roof top patio, Friday happy hour, a weekly fitness workout and more!


You’ll be an integral part of a family company, building on over 50 years of success, amazingly generous charitable work and progressive leadership in the real estate industry. At all times guided by the Porte Promises of: People-Focused, Committed to Excellence, Trustworthy and Community Builders.


Porte manages 700 plus rental units and over a million sq. ft. of commercial space. In addition to the income portfolio Porte has a healthy development pipeline of sites across Metro Vancouver. Please visit www.porte.ca to see our properties and projects!


JOB SUMMARY:

Reporting to the VP Finance and Accounting, the Development Accounting Manager performs duties for Porte Development Corporation, including full cycle accounting for development projects, cash flow preparation, receivable, accounts payable, data entry, bank deposits and month-end reporting duties.


JOB DUTIES:

  • Deliver and complete accurate multi-year draw requests to support cash management objectives.
  • Complete all time-sensitive deliverables accurately, including draw processing and deposit and sales reconciliations
  • Ensure closings are accounted for to properly recognize revenues
  • Ensure regulatory filings happen on schedule
  • Complete full-cycle accounting and month-end close
  • Communicate effectively and professionally with the internal customer group (development, marketing, sales, legal, customer care, corporate accounting)
  • Assists with the preparation of finance proposals.
  • Produces cash flow proformas for the development projects
  • Working with managers and staff, prepares an annual budget and monitors the budget against actual revenues and expenditures on an ongoing basis.
  • Reports on the operating budget, and on overall project budgets, and tracks and reports on budget variances.
  • Assists the preparation of the draw (loan) requests and follows up to ensure funding, with the contractor, lender, quantity surveyor and others.
  • Monitors and follows up with return of letters of credit and deposits.
  • Liaises with development team on proforma inputs


TEAMWORK AND SUPERVISION:

  • Participates as a member of the Accounting team and the Development team


QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Required training, experience, knowledge, skills and abilities:
  • Minimum 5 - 7 years development accounting experience.
  • Experience in both commercial and residential is preferred.
  • Strong writing and self review skills.
  • Strong technical and administrative skills.
  • Strong knowledge of Yardi Job Cost.
  • Experience working in a fast-paced environment.
  • High level of organization and attention to detail.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work well individually and in teams.
  • Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
  • Technology savvy
  • Ability to write and communicate clear ideas


If you are interested in applying, please send us your cover letter and resume. No phone calls please. Due to the anticipated volume of applications, we will only be able to respond to those selected for an interview. Thank you for your interest in this opportunity with Porte Communities.
