title: Ad Controller (Abbotsford)
description:
Posted on April 20, 2022

Ad Controller (Abbotsford)

Black Press Media has an immediate opening for a full time Ad Controller, located in Abbotsford. This is an administration position, perfect for an organized individual with the ability to pay attention to details. This is an exciting fast-paced, team environment and the successful candidate must work well with others.

The position requires an individual that is flexible, can handle interruptions yet stay focused, works well under deadlines, and has a supportive nature. Problem-solving, decision-making, and strong communication abilities will be keys to success. Strong computer knowledge and the ability to learn new computer programs is essential.

Responsibilities include
  • Data entry of print and digital advertising campaigns
  • Processing cash, credit and debit cards, and cheque payments
  • Reconciling cash reports, bank deposits, account adjustments and coordinating with the corporate accounting department as needed.
  • This position is also responsible for laying out the newspaper, specialty publications, and features in consultation with Publishers, Advertising Managers, and Editors.
  • Reception duties including ordering supplies, sorting mail, shipping and receiving packages, and handling the main phone line are required.
This position is at the centre of the action, contributing to a team of dynamic marketing and editorial professionals. It is best suited to those who can offer our internal and external customers unparalleled gold standard service.

Black Press Media is Canada’s largest private community news media company with extensive digital and newspaper properties throughout B.C., Alberta, Washington, and Hawaii.

Black Press Media is a leading North American local news champion with operations across British Columbia, Alberta, Yukon, Northwest Territories, Nunavut, Washington State, Alaska, and Hawaii. Over 1,500 talented employees work with us to deliver unique community news and information across a full suite of traditional media channels and digital platforms. We value diverse viewpoints, new ways of thinking and a collaborative approach to delivering results.

If You Want To Be a Part Of Our Dynamic Team, Please Send Your Resume And Cover Letter By Monday April 25, 2022, To

Carly Ferguson, Group Publisher

carly.ferguson@blackpress.ca

Applications will be accepted until position is filled.

Only those selected for an interview will be contacted

title: Controller
description:
Description

Are you driven by high expectations? This position is ideal for someone who thrives in a role where integrity, reliability and leadership are valued. Robert Half's new Controller opening will give you the opportunity to take responsibility for an accounting and clerical department at a successful company. The permanent Controller position is situated in the New Hamburg, Ontario area. If you can plan and direct all accounting operational functions, handle the accumulation and consolidation of financial data for internal and external financial statements, evaluate accounting and internal control systems, and lead departmental staff, you might be right for this position. In this role, it will be critical for you to effectively manage self and others within strict time constraints when providing client services, lead while also being a team player, generate innovative ideas, and challenge the status quo. Do you want exceptional compensation and benefits and potential for career growth? This is a good position for you.

Major responsibilities
  • Support punctual cash collection by managing the timing for monthly billing and other cash management techniques
  • Present executive committee and partners with monthly financial reports
  • Manage the creation of the annual budget and forecasts and monitor them on a monthly basis
  • Produce cash-flow reports, calculating cash needs at weekly and monthly intervals, and manage daily cash
  • Meet client expectations by reviewing deliverables of self and team to make sure they meet client satisfaction
  • Guide all operations of the finance department, including accounts payable, billings & collections, and payroll
  • Advance Finance Department initiatives, such as software and systems implementation and other departmental or firm-wide improvements, as needed, with research, planning and implementation
  • Work closely with executive team and partners to ensure efficient and successful firm-wide operation
  • Flexible in completing tasks beyond formal job responsibilities
  • Manage monthly and annual close of income statement and balance sheet, the reconciliations of accounts, and G/L analysis
  • Assess, execute and streamline policies, procedures, controls and most methodologies
Requirements
  • BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, Economics or other business related field
  • Adeptness in cost accounting
  • General ledger experience
  • Expertise in Leadership
  • Journal entries experience
  • Deep understanding of Leadership
  • Month end closings experience
  • Prior work in technology, analytics and management experience desired
  • Experience working in a dynamic and changing company environment a plus
  • Extraordinary analytical, quantitative and social skills
  • Prior work done in public accounting is desired
  • Outstanding communication skills, excellent interpersonal skills, both oral and written, and ability to build as well as deliver effective presentations
  • Advanced credentials such as a Masters of Business Administration / MBA or Certified Public Accountant / CPA are preferred
  • Sound written and verbal communication skills
  • Seizes opportunities to produce results without direct supervision

title: Real Estate Controller - IPP
description:
Description

Our large downtown Real Estate client is looking to hire a Controller for their Income Producing Properties (Property Management) Group. The IPP Controller will be responsible for communicating with Property Management senior leadership, as well as the planning timing and accurate completion of all annual, quarterly, and monthly activities and cycles, including property month ends, annual property budgets, annual tenant operating cost adjustments, and property reporting. Preparation and maintenance of all procedural documentation relating to property accounting. Additional duties include managing staff workloads to ensure fairness, and responsiveness to internal and external clients, providing guidance and direction to the property accounting team; and being responsible for the team’s continuous improvement of departmental processes/procedures.

Identifying and analyzing issues; taking decisive action when required and taking on special projects as delegated including process improvements and senior management requests are all part and parcel of the IPP Controller's duties.

Requirements

The ideal IPP Controller will have 10 years of progressive hands on accounting experience, the last five of which should have been spent in a property management environment. You should have at least 2 years experience in a leadership role (ideally a Controllership). You must have an accounting designation and have experience working with and ERP system, ideally Yardi. company: The Mason Group - Strategic Search Partners
description:
Our client, a family office in the real estate industry is looking for an Accountant Manager for their fun, young and growing small office, located in central Toronto.

As an Accounting Manager for a small company, you are an organized self-starter, who enjoys working in a small team, including front office client services. Experience at a small company is helpful. Property accounting and/ or family office experience are assets.

The Accounting Manager will be responsible for accounting under ASPE. A system savvy mind who likes to find and implement process improvements will thrive in this environment. Full-cycle accounting oversight, transaction-level support across multiple investments, and overall accounting system experience are just a few of the day-to-day duties.

This Accounting Manager opportunity provides great balance and stability as a 9am–5pm job. With a nice work environment, while reporting directly to the Owners. This is a five day a week in the office job.


Requirements


  • Accounting / Finance/ BComm. or related degree,
  • CPA designation is an asset,
  • Strong knowledge of ASPE,
  • Lead effective month-end accounting close and assist with an efficient year-end process,
  • Excellent skills working with accounting, reporting, KPIs and data analytics software,
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills are required to manipulate large datasets and present information in a clean, organized way for decision making,
  • Strong systems knowledge,
  • Previous experience within property accounting, real estate, and/ or a family office environment, as well as well-honed project management skills,
  • Exemplary communication, presentation skills with a positive can-do client service attitude,
  • Confident, articulate, and reliable with great emotional maturity,
  • Ability to quickly problem-solve, with an inherent critical thinking mindset.

XTL Transport Inc., is looking for an Accounting Manager with a strong work ethic and a positive team attitude. The Accounting Manager is responsible for accurate and timely financial reporting, compliance, cash management and tax reporting. This position also requires occasional travel to Toronto and potentially other locations.


Qualifications:

·       Professional Accounting Designation (CPA) or working towards the CPA accounting designation is required

·       Accounting firm experience is an asset

·       Minimum of five years of progressive accounting experience, with a portion being at the supervisory level

·       Advanced Microsoft excel skills and experience/comfort in different ERP systems

·       A common knowledge of ASPE and IFRS is an asset

·       Experience with an asset heavy /Warehousing or Transport industry is an asset

·       Excellent time management, organizational and people skills

·       Basic knowledge of accounting systems, budgets, and internal control.


Responsibilities:

·       Managing period end and year-end accruals so that they accurately reflect the company’s position and trends

·       Maintaining a clean and functional general ledger system 

·       Assist in audits, assistance in preparation and review of audit work papers

·       Manage internal departmental relationships and external Audit relationships well

title: Global Manufacturing Accounting Manager
description:
About Sensei Ag

Sensei Ag is a market-changing AgTech company aiming to solve global gaps and inconsistencies in nutrition, food safety, and food security through the transformative power of data. Guided by the capabilities and insights of our founders, technology entrepreneur Larry Ellison and Dr. David Agus, we design, develop and deploy cutting-edge agricultural technologies to build a better, more stable food supply that is capable of feeding our entire world nutritionally-relevant, delicious, affordable meals.

Everything we do is evidence-led, radically transparent, always enriching. 

Learn more from our website or by following us on LinkedIn. If you'd like to see what we are doing with our consumer-facing brand Sensei Farms, please check our Instagram!

Position Description

Manufacturing Cost Accounting Director provides analysis and review of all the plants operational costs to Sensei leadership, financial planners and accounting management.

The Global Manufacturing Accounting Manager will help develop and manage the cost accounting team in completing gross margin analyses related to a company's products, inventory and its overall value. As an essential part of the accounting function, cost accountants calculate the costs of goods sold on the company's financial reports, which affects the company's bottom line. The Global Manufacturing Accounting Manager is also required to use BOM creation formulas, NetSuite software and spreadsheets to help management and business owners decide what prices to charge for products.

Responsibilities
  • Set up systems and processes for the costing function, this includes the full range of Cost Accounting activities.
  • Prepare and provide analysis of cost variance.
  • Work closely with Supply Chain to provide them with support relating to cost-related matters.
  • Forecast and budgeting for Product Managers and Sales Management.
  • Conduct Rotational Inventory Audit (physical stock count).
  • Ensure audit and internal compliance.
  • Assist each company with physical inventory counts and cycle counts.
  • Assists consolidated companies with month end close.
  • Participate in the preparation of the annual plant operating budget including standard product cost. development, budgeted variances, cost center budgeting, headcount requirements, volume analysis and raw material pricing analysis.
  • Participates in the coordination & preparation of plants' operating forecasts vs budget.

Required Skills, Abilities And Qualifications
  • Minimum of 5 years of accounting management experience in a manufacturing environment.
  • Need a working understanding of the different techniques used to evaluate a product's cost such as the standard and traditional methods.
  • Need to know how to design or create data collection systems and then analyze the data for operations team and senior management.
  • Require the ability to communicate with people from multiple layers of a company – that includes people from management to laborers.
  • Along with calculating direct labor, material and production costs, responsibilities include establishing the value of inventory as it changes with market fluctuations.
  • Establish cycle counts and wall-to-wall physical inventory counts, investigating variances that arise.

Preferred Skills, Abilities And Qualifications
  • Previous personnel management.
  • Agriculture industry.
  • CPA or GAAP knowledge.

Educational Requirements
  • Bachelor's in Accounting or Finance.

Traits We Value
  • Appreciation for transforming health and the future of food
  • Smart, not arrogant
  • Humble and hardworking
  • Entrepreneurial, not risk averse
  • Kind and genuine
  • Grit and lots of it

Compensation & Benefits
  • Prescription Drug Coverage
  • Paramedical Services
  • Medical Supplies & Equipment
  • Hospitalization
  • Out of Province Emergency Medical Assistance
  • Vision Care
  • Dental Care
  • Basic Life Insurance & AD&D
  • STD
  • LTD
  • Optional Voluntary Life, AD&D, Critical Illness

For the health and safety of all employees, Sensei Ag has a strict COVID-19 policy. All employees are required to wear a mask except when actively eating or drinking. Frequent hand washing, physical distancing, and use of job assigned PPE is required.

The statements above are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. This is not an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel in the job. Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the employer.

Sensei Ag is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Commission and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise People Operations if you require an accommodation.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Company Description

For more than 30 years, Lorex has been a leader in the marketplace when it comes to innovative security technology for both home and commercial use. We achieve this by continuing to produce innovative monitoring solutions, all backed by cutting-edge technology and a dedicated team of forward thinkers. Using the latest technology and innovations, Lorex strives to produce solutions to both enhance security and fit your lifestyle.

Job Summary

The Accounting Manager is responsible for all areas relating to financial reporting. This position will be responsible for developing and maintaining accounting principles, practices and procedures to ensure accurate and timely financial reporting and statements. This position addresses tight deadlines and a multitude of accounting activities including general ledger preparation, reporting (financial, compliance, regulatory, tax), year-end audit preparation, and the support of budget and forecast activities.


Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of the financial reporting and general ledger structure.
  • Ensure an accurate and timely monthly, quarterly and year end close.
  • Ensure the timely reporting of all monthly financial, compliance, regulatory and tax information.
  • Ensure all key financial reconciliation are performed in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Supports budget and forecasting activities.
  • Collaborates with the other finance department members to support overall department goals and objectives.
  • Valuating, developing, and improving department controls, ERP systems, and procedures increase accuracy and efficiency.
  • Work closely with Accounting Group in overseas HQ to streamline the financial reporting and GAAP conversion process.
  • Advises staff regarding the handling of non-routine reporting transactions.
  • Work with the team to ensure a clean and timely year end audit.
  • Assist in development and implementation of new procedures and features to enhance the workflow of the department.
  • Provide training to new and existing staff as needed.
  • Support CFO with special projects and workflow process improvements.


Requirements:

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities (KSAs)

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Accounting, Business, Finance or equivalent
  • Good knowledge of US / Canadian GAAP and IFRS
  • Knowledge or prior working experience with US tax including Federal, State & Sales tax is preferred
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills


Competency Profile

  • Self-motivated and ability to work to deadlines with good prioritization and time management skills
  • Ability to deliver high quality documentation paying attention to detail.


Background Experiences

  • 6+ years of progressive accounting experience with 3+ years being in a supervisory role
  • Prior working experience in public accounting firm or multinational companies is preferred
  • Qualified accountant (CPA / CA / CMA or equivalent) is preferred
  • Experience with SAP strongly preferred


Key Competencies:

Connects:

· Builds trust and establishes rapport with diverse colleagues and customers by listening, understanding their needs, and following through on commitments.

· Works effectively with people who have different perspectives, backgrounds and abilities while encouraging constructive dialogue and being sensitive and receptive to diverse views and opinions.

· Builds mutually beneficial working relationships to foster a positive and inclusive culture and engages with internal and external customers and stakeholders representing a variety of interests.


Teamwork:

· Works with others to share expertise and achieve outcomes that benefit the organization.

· Demonstrates strong communication skills to others on the team through active listening, summarizing, facilitating and "bridge building".


Inspires:

· Creates a shared vision by soliciting and valuing diverse input obtained from each team member on the vision of their work and the team.

· Uses a broad range of communication strategies and methods to communicate vision with enthusiasm and clarity, and to inspire confidence and generate commitment.

· Helps the team to embrace different perspectives, experiences and backgrounds by modeling positive leadership behavior and encouraging full participation.


Self-Awareness:

· Proactively seeks and obtains ongoing feedback to help understand ones' own strengths and development areas to work more effectively with team/department managers/clients.

· Understands and is aware of one’s emotions and the impact these emotions may have on others.

· Reflects on feedback and lessons learned and uses acquired knowledge in working with team members to achieve personal and professional growth.


Delivers:

· Ensures the timely delivery of programs, projects, and services, effectively adapting to tight deadlines and sudden changes in priorities to accomplish objectives.

· Plans for possibilities and contingencies, identifying opportunities and problems to ensure that best results are achieved.

· Recognizes and makes best use of the diverse skills, abilities, experiences of team members to achieve best outcomes.


Transforms:

· Takes initiative and sustained action to ensure the successful implementation of change by shifting strategic focus and embracing new ideas and building on past knowledge and success.

· Fosters a team environment where all are encouraged to think creatively and new and diverse ideas and approaches are heard, valued and considered for implementation.

· Seeks performance feedback and opportunities to invest time and effort to learn and expand knowledge to improve performance.


Accountability:

· Takes responsibility for clarifying the expectations of others

· Acknowledges how personal decisions, actions and standards of performance influence work accomplishments

· Accepts responsibility for work accomplishments

· Recognizes changes required to achieve better results going forward.


Creativity/Innovation:

· Identifies and evaluates unique ways to improve the organization (cost reductions, use of resources, policies/procedures, products), generating useful new ideas, approaches or techniques.


Integrity:

· Adheres to ethical standards and integrates Lorex values, principles and standards into practices and business transactions.

· Creates honest, trusting and successful working relationships with others inside and outside the organization and conducts all affairs with personal and professional integrity.

· Promptly addresses issues about discrimination, harassment, and unfair treatment and does not allow personal assumptions, biases and/or complaints to impact any work-related decisions in the team.

title: Controls Manager
description:
Job Description

Company Description

Job Description

The main requirements of the role are to;

 Work onsite with the Veolia Team

 Review of Contractor Monthly Progress Estimates and Monthly Schedule submission review

 Manage the Consulting contract for Risk and Contract Claims.

 Aid in the development and execution of the Readiness Plan for the SEWPCC Upgrade

 Provide support to the City Project Managers within the Winnipeg Sewage Treatment Program (WSTP).

 Provide a Primavera Schedule for the WSTP projects to the completion of the Program.

Primary Responsibilities / Job Duties

 Support the WSTP as an integral player by:
  • Review and prepare progress estimates and monthly reports.
  • Conduct detailed project schedule analysis and monitoring. Provide report monthly to City
Project Manager.
  • Coordination of various external parties to support Contractor schedule (e.x. outage
coordination, LOTO).
  • Maintain estimate of project costs at completion.
  • Review of Contract Change Notifictions/Orders, RFIs, NCRs etc to evaluate risks inclusing
claims risks. Make recomendations to the Lead Contract Administrator for areas requiring

intervention.
  • Prepare claims/appeals files for known claims/appeals and for risks translating into
issues/claims.
  • Execute contract with risk and contract claims consultant.
  • Administer the contract for the project document platform, Aconex. Arrange training for new
users.
  • Prepare readiness scope documents as well as update the readiness schedule based on
Contractor schedule.
  • Support multiple projects aligning with the goals of the WSTP.
  • Assist with day to day contract administration duties as required.
Qualifications

Educational Background
  • Bachelors Degree in Business Administration or Engineering preferred or
equivalent experience
  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification desired
Job Skills / Characteristics
  • Capable to play a central role in coordinating and integrating progress across
internal and external program team member
  • Process improvement and re-engineering, balancing efficiency and effectiveness
  • Must have the capability to conduct analyses on complex data sets
  • Must demonstrate ability to pay close attention to details, and present good
planning, organization, and time management skills.
  • Must have the ability to handle diverse tasks simultaneously and be able to work
effectively with interruptions. Ability to handle confidential or sensitive

information or issues.
  • Must demonstrate ability to work in a team environment and willingness to
Assume Additional Or New Responsibilities
  • Must demonstrate effective oral and written communication skills and the ability
to independently compose routine written communications.

Experience / Knowledge
  • Must have previous experience with engineering or construction project
management processes including good knowledge of earned value calculation

and scheduling of design activities, design documents cycle
  • Must have previous experience with Project Management and business process
quality control.
  • Good understanding of progress monitoring and controlling in project
management frame work
  • PC skills with expert working knowledge of MS Excel and Share-Point. Ability to
develop spreadsheets and modify formats in order to complete assignments.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

100% at site/office.

Possible Work Hazards

Must take care in moving or lifting office supplies. Infrequent exposure to plant hazards including noise, heavy equipment, fumes and chemicals.

Physical Demands

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; and stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, and ability to adjust focus.

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Controller Accounting Manager
description:
Blanchett Neon is currently seeking a Controller / Accounting Manager to join our industry-leading team of professionals in Edmonton, AB. This position will be ideally suited for a recently graduated CPA. In order to succeed in this role, the individual will need to display competence in finance, be a great operational communicator, and be able to achieve pre-determined goals and timelines (excellent time management skills are needed to meet weekly, monthly, and annual reporting deadlines). Initially the position will be reporting directly into the Vice President, and overtime will be part of the senior leadership team and oversee the accounting department.

Full Cycle Accounting

Key Responsibilities
  • Billing and collections (Production & Service)
  • Complex Unionized Payroll (Production & Service)
  • Familiar with Union Agreements and Remittances, Commission Sales, Taxable Benefits, CRA Remittances, Employee Benefits
  • Monthly Bank Reconciliation
  • Monthly Credit Card Reconciliation
  • Monthly WIP and COGs Reconciliation
  • Weekly, monthly, annual journal entries (recurring and complex)
  • Benefits administration
  • Accounts payable
  • Inventory & WIP
Management
  • Oversee the accounting department staff
  • Project based accounting
  • Management Reporting (Monthly and Yearly Financial Statements, Financial Modelling, Dashboards, as well as Internal Reporting)
  • Work with the President on corporate matters
  • Be the key banking contact
  • Work with the purchasing department on inventory controls and month end accounting
  • Work with the production department on scheduling and reporting
  • Ad-hoc requests as assigned
Education And Experience Needed To Succeed
  • Near completion, or completion of the CPA accounting designation
  • Sage 50 Premium Accounting Certification (would be an asset)
  • Sage 50 Premium Accounting Work Experience
  • Level 1 CPA - Certified Payroll Association (would be an Asset)
  • Payroll Experience, unionized payroll is an asset
  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
  • Manufacturing experience is an asset
  • Knowledge of MISys Manufacturing an asset
Salary range is at 70K to 80K + benefits

Why Work for Us?

Edmonton-based, family-owned and operated company with over 70 years of success.

Full Benefits Package and RRSP program after the probationary period.

Opportunities for Advancement and Personal Development.

Blanchett would like to thank all applicants for their interest, but only those chosen for an interview will be contacted.

Since 1947, Blanchett Neon is Western Canada’s premier supplier of quality business and custom signage products, from spectacular freestanding pylon signs to eye-catching store front channel letter displays; traditional neon signs to state-of-the-art LED Electronic Message Centres.

Whatever your signage requirements, Blanchett is the one-stop-shop. As a full-service Edmonton Sign Company, we offer innovative and creative design, quality manufacturing, COR status installations, and timely on-site service and maintenance, whether you are looking for a custom-designed one-of-a-kind display for a single location or a branding solution across provinces.

Our Edmonton Sign Company also offers additional business signage services including landlord signage criteria, tender assistance, signage legislation and permitting, and consulting to support our clients’ every needs.

title: Controller-Fiancial Manager
description:
IPG Photonics (Canada) Inc. designs, develops and manufactures a unique and rapidly growing laser welding process monitoring technology with significant importance to the electric vehicle revolution. We are the national subsidiary of IPG Photonics Corporation (NASDAQ:IPGP).


IPG Photonics Canada Inc. is growing rapidly and is seeking to hire a new Controller/Financial Manager. This hands-on position is responsible for overseeing the financial operations of the subsidiary (~30-50 employees), preparing intra-company reports and basic payroll/benefits administration through existing commercial software platforms.


The ideal candidate will have over 5 years of accounting and financial management experience; a CPA designation is preferred however, candidates with a solid track record of bookkeeping and payroll/benefits administration will be considered as well.


Detailed Responsibilities:

  • Directing all aspects of accounting operations, overseeing all transactions related to general ledger, receivables, payables, payroll and financial reporting.
  • Reconcile general ledger accounts, sub ledgers and prepare reconciliation entries.
  • Administer payroll and benefits specific to the Canadian subsidiary
  • Manage day-to-day banking operations, reconcile monthly bank statements.
  • Applying corporate finance policies.
  • Oversee Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Payroll and Human Resource operations with assistance from corporate headquarters.
  • Fulfill month-end closing requirements.
  • Ensuring that records are maintained in accordance with GAAP/ASPE standards.
  • Prepare documents and forms related to regulatory requirements (GST/HST, CRA, Ministry of Finance, WSIB, StatsCan etc.) and ensure accuracy and timely submission.
  • Work with corporate staff and local accounting firms to prepare tax submissions.
  • Analyze subsidiary and product line profitability and suggest improvements to transfer pricing and related policies.
  • Customized financial reporting as required by management.
  • Administer all payroll activities and benefits administration.
  • Managing all tax planning and compliance with all required federal, provincial, local, payroll, property and other applicable taxes.
  • Calculate royalty payments from sales documentation.

Qualifications:

  • A CPA designation with 5 years of Financial management experience or 10+ years of bookkeeping and payroll administration experience
  • Preference will be given to candidates who are familiar with reporting requirements of a publicly traded company with global subsidiaries, and experience with enterprise ERP software.
  • Meticulous level of detail, highly organized, business oriented, dependable and capable of supporting the rest of the team.
  • Experience working with a rapid growth company is preferred.
  • Self-motivated and interested in streamlining processes.
  • Demonstrated ability to work independently under minimal supervision.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Able to work with tight deadlines.
  • Strong computer skills. Ability to design/prepare reports and other appropriate documentation.

title: Bilingual Manager, Accounting (Position can be based anywhere in Canada)
company: Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation (CMHC) Société canadienne d'hypothèques et de logement(SCHL)
description:
Help make a difference for Canadians. CMHC’s aspiration is that by 2030, everyone in Canada has a home that they can afford and that meets their needs. All of our programs and activities support this singular goal.

Be part of an inclusive workplace. Diversity and Inclusion guides everything we do at CMHC. We’re taking  concrete actions to eradicate racism and advance equity within CMHC and the housing system.

Join the Accounting Operations Team under Andréane Rodrigue, where we support housing affordability through effective and efficient execution of financial transactions. Your skills and passion for leadership, accounting and process improvements will support the delivery of innovative solutions that enable better decision-making, financial performance and efficiently supports CMHC’s financial transactional needs.

Responsibilities
  • Manage invoicing, accounts receivables processing as well as customer and vendor set-up, updates and maintenance.
  • Manage daily bank reconciliation, electronic and cheque receipts and journal entries. Manage the preparation and reconciliation of lender reports. Manage inquiries related to lender reports and other transactions.
  • Manage timely invoice and payment processing, including payments to suppliers and employee reimbursement. Process refunds and other adjustments related to payments.
  • Coordinate and manage processes related to monthly closing of the general ledger. Oversee the reconciliation of several general ledger accounts.
  • Manage client expectations by providing excellent service and timely feedback.
  • Manage workflows to ensure process efficiency, service-level agreements are met and risks are mitigated.
  • Oversee accounting operations transformation by providing advice, guidance on potential solutions and improvements for CMHC's accounting practices, internal controls and business processes.
  • Align people, work and systems to achieve business process efficiencies and results.
Minimum Qualifications
  • Undergraduate degree in a related field such as accounting, finance, business administration, economics or commerce.
  • Minimum of seven years of experience in managing accounting functions and leader others through change.
  • Minimum of five years of supervisory experience.
  • Broad knowledge of financial legislation, accounting policies and procedures, internal controls and financial transaction processing best practices.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills, including the ability to explain financial information to a variety of audiences.
  • Ability to persuade and influence others and maintain effective working relationships.
  • Bilingualism (French and English).
Preferred Qualifications
  • Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation.

Vaccination against COVID-19 is mandatory for all CMHC employees, regardless of place of work (teleworking, working remotely or working on-site). CMHC’s vaccination measures, as updated from time to time, are a term and condition of employment.

CMHC requires all new employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. If you are the selected candidate, your vaccination status will be verified by an authorized CMHC third party as part of the offer process. If you wish to request an exemption from CMHC’s vaccination requirements on valid human rights-based grounds, you must do so at the offer stage as part of the recruitment process and be approved for an exemption before any offer of employment can be issued.

We are committed to employment equity and actively encourage applications from women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, veterans and persons of all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientations, and gender identities and expressions. We also welcome applications from non-Canadians who are eligible to work in Canada.

We sincerely thank all candidates for their interest, however, please note that only applicants selected for further consideration will be contacted. If selected for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Company presentation

VitalAire Canada is the Canadian home healthcare subsidiary of Air Liquide, the world leader in gases, medical technologies and services for Industry and Healthcare. VitalAire empowers patients who have sleep apnea or require home oxygen therapy through ongoing respiratory support and compliance.


Here’s what you will do

VitalAire is currently recruiting an energetic and motivated full-time Accounting Manager for our Mississauga, ON. The Accounting Manager is responsible for leading the month-end closing process and ensuring the financial results are reported accurately and timely for Vitalaire Canada, including its subsidiary healthcare group entities. The Accounting Manager, Healthcare will manage a team of professionals while designing and implementing best-in class accounting policies, procedures and internal controls.


  • Responsible for leading the full cycle month-end close for the healthcare group entities including the review and approval of month-end journal entries.
  • Responsible for the timely review and approval of monthly balance sheet account reconciliations for the healthcare group.
  • Ensures group financial reporting is delivered timely and accurately with strong attention to detail.
  • Performs monthly group P&L review of expenses and provides variance analysis.
  • Provides timely preparation of financial statements in accordance with IFRS and group accounting finance manual.
  • Guides, develops and motivates a team of accounting professionals.
  • Provides financial guidance, analysis and support throughout the healthcare organization acting as a finance business partner.
  • Ensures accounting practices and policies are appropriate, implemented, and comply with professional and Company directives.
  • Ensures company wide policy internal controls compliance and improves internal controls, risks, and governance policies, in collaboration with the internal controls audit team.
  • Primary liaison with the external financial statement group auditors and coordination for any local audits, as required.
  • Participates in the design, implementation, documentation and transformation of the accounting department while integrating the group entities to common, best in class practices and processes.
  • Participates in the financial accounting integration within the ERP system, ensuring internal controls are implemented and efficient processes are designed, documented and followed.
  • Participates in streamlining processes and month-end close for the healthcare group entities.
  • Participates with the review of income tax and sales tax accounts and related schedules on a monthly basis including the annual corporate income tax returns and working papers for accounting and tax compliance purposes. Assists the tax department with any tax audits.
  • Works in cooperation with his/her team and cross-functional teams to continuously improve work processes. Analyzes activities, identifies causes for problems and proposes sound recommendations
  • Participates in the budget process and ad hoc projects, as required.


Here’s what you will need

  • Bachelor's Degree in Accounting
  • Accounting Designation (CPA/CMA/CA/CGA)
  • Minimum 5 -7 years work experience and 2 -3 years managing teams
  • Strong understanding of IFRS accounting principles
  • Work experience in medium to large organization and public company environment
  • Good understanding of direct and indirect tax
  • Experience with internal controls
  • Proficiency with MS Office, and Advanced Excel skills and accounting programs


What’s in it for you

  • Competitive total rewards: Salary, bonus, flex benefits & pension plan
  • Growth opportunities: Upward mobility, career progression, and tuition reimbursement
  • Work/life integration: From standard hours to personal time off, we encourage life outside of work
  • Inclusive workplace: Bring your whole self to work as you learn and grow
  • Meaningful work: Do work that matters
  • Awesome team: Teamwork and connection power our business
  • Global collaboration: Collaborate near and far by being part of a global leader
  • Culture of safety: We weave safety and wellness into all that we do


Additional Information

At Air Liquide, we value the health and safety of our customers, patients and employees. As such, we strongly encourage everyone to get vaccinated against COVID-19 and all future employees will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to maintain such fully vaccinated status.


VitalAire provides equal opportunities for all applicants and is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Accounting Manager
description:
Valsoft Corporation is looking for an experienced and dynamic Accounting Manager reporting to the Head of Finance of one of the business units.


This individual will coordinate and manage period-end close and ensure accurate financial reporting and analysis for a portfolio of acquired companies, as well as lead projects impacting their accounting and handle the more complex accounting issues.


Here is a little window into our company: Valsoft’s focus is to acquire and grow vertical software businesses that provide mission-critical solutions in their respective niche or market. Since 2015, we have acquired over 50 businesses; today, Valsoft has over 2000 employees across 20+ countries. This business model creates a rapid growth environment allowing the acquisition of new companies based on profitable vertical performance. Our motto is Be Humble Stay Hungry!


What your day will look like:


  • Supervise and review the work of local and offshored accounting analysts – 3+ resources (journal entries, reconciliations, reports – including for AR, AP, billings and accounting transactions)
  • Supervise and implement appropriate application of GAAP accounting standards including more complex accounting situations such as percentage of completion
  • Coordinate the preparation of month-end financials for all the companies within the business unit (12+ subsidiaries in portfolio)
  • Supervise and lead the year-end closing for the business unit, as well as contribute in the audit process in support to the corporate accounting team
  • Prepare monthly financial analysis on key P&L items to better understand financial performance and variances between actual, forecast and budget, and support the reporting team during the month-end close
  • Review reporting needs and produce ad-hoc reports for the business, in collaboration with the FP&A team;
  • Build and review workflows, implement processes to optimize efficiency of reporting and put in place internal controls
  • Train, coach and provide support to the team
  • Collaborate with the integration team during the acquisition of a company to ensure the adequate setup of the accounting books
  • Contribute to the standardization of accounting processes with other business units and assist in the implementation of best practices
  • Strive for continuous improvement activities as part of day-to-day efforts
  • Support the Head of Finance of the business unit with special projects


About you:


  • 5+ years of experience in a similar role, including at least 2 in team management
  • CPA designation required
  • Fast-learner and adaptable – time management skills and ability to meet deadlines
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of French considered an asset
  • Advanced knowledge of MS Excel
  • Superior analytical skills, detail oriented
  • Excellent organizational skills and time management
  • Ability to manage risks by ensuring that effective and efficient internal controls are in place without compromising operational efficiency and flexibility
  • Working knowledge of Sage Intacct ERP (or similar) considered an asset
  • Must be a Canadian Citizen or Permanent Resident
  • Team player


Perks working at Valsoft include:


  • Attractive compensation package including potential bonus
  • Training /Tuition Reimbursement Program
  • Free catered daily lunches, unlimited fruit and snacks, coffee, tea, hot chocolate
  • Work-life balance with a flexible working schedule
  • Free parking for all employees
  • Ping Pong and Foosball
  • Room to grow based on performance
  • Unlimited vacation after 3 years
  • Annual gym discount
  • Monthly on-site barber
  • Lounging areas


At Valsoft there is room for career growth, and we want you to feel like part of the Valsoft family! Valsoft Is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of; disability, race, ancestry, place of origin, color, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status or family status. We thank all applicants for their interest however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Superintendent, Controls and Instrumentation
description:
Welcome to Vale in Canada. As a leader in the mining industry, our responsibility is to positively impact our people, communities and the environment. We value our workforce and offer continuous training and career development opportunities for our people.

Vale is a global leader in the production of iron ore and one of the largest producers of nickel. Active in Canada for over 100 years, Vale employs nearly 6,000 people across our corporate office in Toronto and sites in Manitoba, Ontario, Newfoundland and Labrador. Applying the latest technologies to sustainably produce nickel, copper, cobalt, platinum group metals, gold and silver is at the heart of what we do.

Our Sudbury Operations have been in existence for more than 100 years. With five mines, a mill, a smelter, a refinery and nearly 4,000 employees it is also one of the largest integrated mining complexes in the world. Sudbury is also home to several administrative sites serving both the Ontario Operations as well as all our North Atlantic Operations.

Port Colborne is home to our Refinery where raw materials from our Sudbury operations are processed into electrocobalt and precious metals and serves as a distribution centre for finished nickel products.

With our global headquarters in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, and approximately 125,000 employees in over 30 countries, Vale is constantly growing and changing. We invite you to be part of our evolution.

Our Team

The Controls and Instrumentation team is integral to employee’s safety and Vale’s long-term operating strategy. Members of this team work across different departments to ensure fixed assets and instrumentation are functioning per design criteria. Team members are involved in equipment maintenance plan creation and execution, as well as controls and automation strategy development and implementation.

The Opportunity

We are currently seeking a Superintendent, Controls and Instrumentation to join our Plant in Port Colborne, Ontario. In this role you will provide technical leadership and support to the Port Colborne Refinery (PCR) through the technical services teams consisting of Process Systems Engineering, Process Control/Network services and Instrumentation services. You will also supply direction for business/growth opportunities, participate in selecting evaluating and leading technical services personnel, and collaborate closely with other business units of the Vale family in general areas of production scenarios, process engineering design and standard methodologies. Another component of this job is to deliver cost effective, innovative process control and data management solutions to solve strategic and operational business needs and to lead all IT projects at the PCR. This is a permanent position reporting to the Manager, Port Colborne Refinery.

Additionally, In This Position You Will

Technical
  • Deliver cost effective, innovative process control, automation, and data management solutions to solve strategic and operational business needs.
  • Lead all PCR IT (local and Corporate generated) requests and projects as well as IT support and maintenance work, including network infrastructure, process automation infrastructure, phones, servers, lab equipment, security video system, gas emergency modelling system, plant access card system, phone system, truck scale system)
  • Develop the 3-5+ year plan for process control, instrumentation and process systems upgrade.
  • Direct/lead execution of the plan, including purchasing of equipment, development, installation, and documentation and commissioning.
  • Creates a vision for long-term sustainability of instrumentation and process control systems
  • Lead projects (capital, operating)
Commercial
  • Accountable to supervise compliance to schedules and plans and implement process improvement opportunities to contribute to the operations.
  • Management of project costs
  • Business case preparation for projects
Safety
  • Coordinate and promote group compliance with Vale policies, procedures, and standards.
  • Develop and maintain policies and procedures for PCR Process Systems and Instrumentation groups.
  • Perform contractor safety and plant inspections.
  • Delivers on personal safety plan, including supervisory activities (e.g. job observations)
Leadership
  • Supervise a team of Process Control engineers and Instrumentation technologists to deliver process automation solutions and support to PCR Operations
  • Provide plant on-call support
  • Collaborate closely with PCR management team to ensure Process Systems and Instrumentation projects are aligned with divisional needs
  • Collaborate closely with Sudbury and Corporate IT to ensure IT projects are aligned with Vale business requirements and PCR operation’s needs
Job Titles Reporting Into This Position
  • Systems Engineering Specialist
  • Instrumentation Technologists
  • Process Control Engineers and Full-time Equivalents
  • IT Specialist (FTE)
About You

Education
  • The ideal candidate will possess a Diploma - Electronics Engineering Technologist or Equivalent
  • CET or P. Eng. Certified applicants are preferred
Experience
  • A minimum of 8 years of experience working in a refinery is required.
  • Communication skills (oral/written)
  • Must demonstrate the ability to coach and mentor
  • Proficient in SAP work notifications and Incident Management
How Can Vale Grow Your Career?
  • In addition to the responsibilities and career opportunities this role will provide, Vale Canada offers a series of benefits including:
  • Competitive salary
  • Attractive pension and benefits (company paid core coverage, flex health and dental coverage, flex accounts, disability plans and optional insurances)
  • Leave for all of life’s reasons (vacation, flex, sick, top up for maternity/parental)
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Work culture dedicated to safety, diversity & inclusion and career growth
  • Grow your career in a large and global company, and mining industry leader
  • Employee Family Assistance Program
  • Online training and career development opportunities
Difference Makes All the Difference

At Vale, we are committed to ensuring an inclusive work environment where people feel comfortable to be themselves. Vale encourages everyone to express their ideas and opinions and values the plurality of individual profiles. We want our people to feel that all voices are heard, all cultures respected and that a variety of perspectives are not only welcome – they are essential to our success. We treat each other fairly and with dignity regardless of race, gender, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual orientation or any other personal consideration that makes us different.

Vale is an equal opportunity employer seeking to increase diversity across our operations and improve equal opportunity at Vale and in the mining industry.

In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, accommodation is available throughout our recruitment process for applicants with disabilities.

Apply By: Tuesday, May 10 th , 2022
